Title: Data Analyst
Description: YOUR ROLE You love working with data, learning from it, and applying what you learn to solve real business problems. You have the technical skills and the motivation to get at the data you need, wherever it is, and in whatever shape it is. You have a good statistical toolkit to solve problems, yet you are always looking to add to it. You keep your eye out for problems to solve, and you are ready to jump in to get the numbers to help understand and solve these problems. You are a champion for fact-based decision-making.As the first true online home insurance provider in North America, we are intensely data-driven. You will be working with the company’s management to support all aspects of operations, from product design and marketing to sales and claims. You will be responsible for making sense of the numbers, using your curiosity and excellent analytical skills to detect problems in time, and coming up with solid recommendations on how to make things better. You are comfortable working independently and switching quickly from one project to the next.YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES You’ll be responsible for constantly keeping an eye on the many metrics that need monitoring at Square One and coming up with new ones to understand our business better. You will spot trends and anomalies, dig into these to get to causes and potential solutions, and clearly communicate your findings. And, using your analytical skills, you will tell us things we did not know about our business.Since we are a small and flexible organization, you will see your answers to our questions make a big impact on our business. You’ll be who we go to when we have a question like “How much should we spend acquiring this type of customer, based on their likelihood of staying with us and their risk profile?” or “What are the characteristics or behaviors that lead to low retention rates?” or “How many agents should we hire in the next 6 months to make sure our call wait times stay within our standards?”YOUR QUALIFICATIONS As a member of the Square One team, you have a desire to contribute to the overall success of the company. You do this by becoming an expert at what you do, directing your own work, and working with a team that has a broader purpose than just making a profit. You and those who you work with would describe you as someone who:Possesses superior analytical and communication skills.Has a natural curiosity and enjoys learning.Uses creativity and resourcefulness to identify opportunities and overcome challenges. - Pays close attention to detail and has superior organizational skills.Has strong knowledge of statistics.Has excellent technical skills.Provides and receives constructive feedback.YOUR EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION Your experience and education help ensure your success at Square One. For this role, you have a master’s degree in statistics or equivalent experience in the field.You're a master at R for data extraction and preparation, analysis, and modeling. Some experience with SQL and Excel is also desirable. Candidates who can demonstrate proficiency in equivalent tools, and the ability to quickly learn new ones, will also be considered.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:Casual dressDental careDisability insuranceExtended health careFlexible scheduleLife insurancePaid time offProfit sharingTuition reimbursementVision careWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayNo weekendsEducation:Master's Degree (required)Experience:SQL: 1 year (preferred)Data & Technical Business Analysts: 1 year (required)R Programming Language: 1 year (preferred)Application deadline: 2022-04-29

Title: Data Analyst, HD Foundation
Description:
Position Purpose:
Reporting to the Sr. Manager Community Investment, the Data Analyst is responsible for the financial accountability, reporting and tracking for The Home Depot Canada Foundation. Managing the Foundation’s key data, the Analyst will be responsible to provide insights and metrics to increase the Foundation’s overall impact and fundraising capabilities. This role is also responsible for financial disbursements, accurate maintenance of financial records and leading the Home Depot Canada Foundation’s annual audit.


The Analyst will be responsible for the project management and system administration of the Foundation’s granting and CRM system.

Position Responsibilities:
Support monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reporting requirements to the Foundation’s treasurer and Board
Use superior Excel skills to analyze data and build insightful reports for senior leaders to identify greatest fundraising opportunities
Provide key business analysis and support ad-hoc reporting requests
Support budget planning and financial forecasting processes
Maintain data governance to ensure consistency and accuracy in reporting as well as to identify and solve any discrepancies that arise
Build strong working relationships with key stakeholders in order to understand the business and the business needs
SmartSimple system administration
Process financial requisitions, tracking and reconciliation of expenses. This includes processing all invoices, cheque requisitions, in-kind donations, wire transfers, expense forms, and grant allocations for external partners
Maintain accurate account payables and receivables ledger to ensure internal/external donations and invoices are accurately recorded
Support relationship with bookkeeper by providing information as it relates to payables/receivables, banking and monthly reconciliation
Process incoming donations, sorted by campaign, and prepare deposits
Run monthly reconciliation reports to verify with accounting records
Generate segmented tax receipts for processed donations
Maintain record-keeping procedures, returned mail/tax receipt coding and donor information
Supports other Foundation strategies and initiatives as required

Education and Professional Skills/Knowledge

Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, business management or other related field
3-4 years of experience in financial analysis & reporting
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
Strong data collection and analytical skills including the ability to manage, manipulate and streamline large volumes of data
Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Computer Science, Finance, Business or equivalent.
Accounting designation (CPA or CFA) is an asset but is not required
Working knowledge of SmartSimple granting system is an asset but is not required
Demonstrate expertise in business analysis and financial modeling
Excellent attention to detail is required
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Experience in corporate community relations and/or related non-profit experience is an asset
Highly organized with a proven ability to manage projects, multi-task and operate under pressure with competing deadlines
Ability to design and utilize diverse communications methods and tools to effectively target messages to key stakeholders and clearly convey thoughts, concepts and direction
Strong work ethic and sense of responsibility and confidentiality

and analytical problem-solving skills with the ability to resourcefully gather information, analyze critically, and communicate clearlyAbility to work independently & part of a team and show with SAS, R, or Python is an assetKnowledge of insurance industry and/or underwriting is an assetBilingualism (French and English) is an assetHere are a few reasons why others have joined our team: An Title: Data Analyst
Student - Data Analyst
Company: iA Financial Group / iA Groupe financier
Description:
Sales sector - iA Clarington/ Work-from-home environment/ Toronto/ Student opportunity
EIMS is an in-house client relationship management, CRM, tool that is used across several roles within iA Clarington. As part of an enterprise initiative to replace the current CRM with a more robust solution, Salesforce, we are looking to clean up the data within the current environment to ensure a seamless and stable migration to the new platform.
Responsibilities: 
Learn the basics of current CRM system 
Work with business stakeholders to identify and run reports that will help to identify records that require clean up. 
Eliminate duplicate or irrelevant records. 
Fix structural or formatting errors in data. 
Identify, prioritize, and locate appropriate updates for missing data. 
Review and cross reference existing records in multiple sources (IFDS, Excel, CRM system, Reports) 
Research multiple sources via Internet & Corporate Intranet and through internal contacts (via email) to obtain validated up-to-date information on multiple data points. 
Reconcile multiple sources of duplicate information with the objective of identifying the recommended data updates or highlighting conflicts for escalation to project team. 
Maintain proper data confidentiality procedures appropriate to the risk level of the information in use. 
Reporting to the Territory Sales Manager on daily efforts on updates to the CRM data. 
Maintain and measure progress through data clean-up efforts and project predicted completion of milestones as identified in sub-datasets. 
Assist teammates with reconciliation and collection efforts to provide a consistent and efficient data clean up effort.
Requirements: 
The successful candidate will possess the following qualifications and characteristics: 
Enrolled in a Post-Secondary Education Program. 
Effective organizational, administrative and time management skills, with ability to prioritize and manage a fast-paced workload of day-to-day. 
Excellent written and oral communication skills. 
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and investigative-thinking skills. 
Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment. 
Willingness to learn and a proactive nature are highly valued. 
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Word
Company Overview
About
iA Financial Group is the strength of a company with a human side, with its over 8,000 employees. Together, we have earned the trust of our more than four million clients and 25,000 advisors who have chosen us for their insurance, savings, and wealth management.

With over $200 billion in assets and half a billion invested in technological innovation, we’re a key player in the financial services industry in Canada and the United States. The secret to our success? Investing in you, one person at a time. Because, for over 125 years, we have believed that it’s by supporting our employees and surrounding ourselves with the most reputable leaders in the industry, we will continue to innovate.

At iA, we’re invested in you.
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
At iA Financial Group, we support and celebrate diversity. We strive to provide a workplace that is recognized as inclusive for all, regardless of ethnic origin, nationality, language, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, family situation, or physical or mental disability.

Title: Analyst, Data Strategy
Description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Analyst, Data Strategy
Job Description
The ultimate goal of Capital Market’s financial modelling initiative is develop a future state where business forecasts are supported by bottoms-up macroeconomic data and models, and where financial advice, assessment and tracking business results, competitive benchmarking, real-time decision support, detailed analytics, and scenario / what-if attribution analysis can be tied to macroeconomic indicators. Data strategy efforts that the team leads are also focused on driving forward the “Future of Finance” in efforts to enrich the existing data infrastructure to promote greater value-add insights and advice offered by the team to senior management, the CFO and the Capital Market’s front office.
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
Ability to convert financial data and knowledge into clear and concise messaging with actionable advice for business partners
Excellent problem solving and proven analytical skills, with a high degree of initiative
Cope with tight deadlines and occasionally long hours required
Ability to work under pressure and demonstrate multi-tasking skill
Advance knowledge of MS Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Nice-to-have
Programming experience in “R” or “Python” is an asset
Programming experience in SQL is an asset
Job Summary
This is an exciting opportunity in Financial Modeling and Data Strategy team under Capital Markets and Treasury Services Performance Management team. In this role, you will be at the forefront of delivering value-add inputs and support in developing model frameworks that enable our Finance leaders and advisory team to enhance the current forecasting and financial planning process as well as enrich the data strategy across the group and broader RBC enterprise.

Title: Analyst, Data Services
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Analyst, Data Services
  





































 Job Description





































 What is the opportunity?
 The Data Services group within Capital Markets is responsible for ensuring data is fit for purpose and accurate. As an Analyst, you will be responsible for data quality control implementation, centralized exception handling and data quality issue management. You will be a member of a dynamic, fast paced team, with a strong focus on data analysis coupled with effective written and verbal communication skills.

 What will you do?

 Develop data quality rules and controls
 Monitor data quality rules and controls
 Investigate data exceptions
 Identify the root cause of data issues
 Develop solutions to address data issues
 Work with various stakeholder teams to understand how data is being used to support the refinement of controls and remediation of data issues
 Build and maintain strong relationships with business users at both senior and junior levels


 What do you need to succeed?
 Must-have

 Strong communication skills
 Strong data analysis skills, including experience with SQL for analysis and leveraging Excel to analyze disparate data sets
 Post-secondary education in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math or a related field


 Nice to Have

 Understanding of data lifecycles and knowledge of Data Quality classification
 Knowledge of IBM Information Analyzer to build and manage Data Quality rules and reporting
 Experience with data science methodologies, including machine learning and advanced pattern recognition.
 Knowledge of global markets business processes and/or experience working with Market/Reference data


 What’s in it for you?
 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 Interaction with a wide variety of departments within Capital Markets
 The opportunity to work on projects relating to bank wide data initiatives
 Work collaboratively with business partners, IT and Data Management in order to deliver new capabilities effectively
 Stay close to industry best practices in account, client data and KYC management
 Apply interpersonal and influencing skills to develop strong relationships with the Data Management team, Data Management IT, stakeholders across RBC CM, and individuals participating in the various data project streams
 Communicate effectively with RBC CM professionals at varying levels of seniority, including applying insight to determine the business impact of data issues that may arise in the availability, integrity or completeness of data which can be supported through better governance


 RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Title: Associate Analyst Data Lineage & Control
Description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Associate Analyst Data Lineage & Control
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
Data Lineage is critical to understanding the data lifecycle. The Associate Analyst, Data Management & Control is responsible for documenting all aspects of the data lineage lifecycle from the original source of the data to the point of consumption of the data into a report, including any associated data transformations. This role will maintain relationships with various business & IT stakeholders to understand & communicate details of data lineage
What will you do?
Understand and document the lineage of CDEs from originating source to point of consumption of data into a report or other risk management activity. Data lineage includes:
Business process which capture, edit or otherwise amend the data
Systems that form part of the data flow
Filters and transformations implemented in systems as part of the data flow
Risks that may impact the data
Controls to mitigate identified risks
Collaborate with other Data Management Offices, Data Custodians and Data Stewards to understand data lineage reporting standards and best practices.
Leverage data lineage artifacts captured by other Data Management Offices and share artifacts captured by Risk Data Management Office to avoid duplication of effort.
Identify & communicate options to optimize the process of data lineage capture and documentation.
Assist in capturing data lineage for new CDEs as required, and validation of existing data lineage documentation annually.
Develop knowledge and become valuable team resource, supporting development of Data Lineage in general.
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
Post-Secondary education or equivalent
Prior School or Work experience analyzing data.
Strong written and verbal communication skills coupled with the ability to communicate effectively with both business and technology staff.
Basic knowledge of retail and commercial banking policies, processes and procedures.
Strong ability to utilize the Microsoft Suite of tools (PowerPoint, Word, Excel)
Nice-to-have
Familiarity with data manipulation and analysis tools such as Excel, Visio, SQL, Python, etc.
Familiarity with data governance and metadata management tools such as Collibra.
Familiarity with agile methodology and agility tools such as Jira.
Job Summary
Identifies and collects data sources, analyzes and extracts key data and information, evaluates and monitors data quality to meet the organization's information system needs and requirements. Applies basic theories, skills, and practices to accomplish assignments.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About SickKids

Dedicated exclusively to children and their families, The Hospital for Sick Children (SickKids) is one of the largest and most respected paediatric healthcare centres in the world. As innovators in child health, we lead and partner to improve the health of children through the integration of healthcare, leading-edge research and education. Our reputation would not have been built – nor could it be maintained – without the skills, knowledge and experience of the extraordinary people who come to work here every day. SickKids is committed to ongoing learning and development, and features a caring and supportive work environment that combines exceptionally high standards of practice.
When you join SickKids, you become part of our community. We share a commitment and determination to fulfill our vision of Healthier Children. A Better World.
Don’t miss out on the opportunity to work alongside the world’s best in paediatric healthcare.

Position Description

Data Analyst / Analytic Epidemiologist
The Data Analyst will work closely with Dr. Eric Benchimol’s research team at the Hospital for Sick Children (SickKids) and ICES (www.ices.on.ca) to assist with analysis of large datasets of health administrative data. Under direct supervision, the candidate will develop dataset creation plans (DCPs) and analytic plans following a research protocol, and carry out the plans using SAS, R and other languages. The successful candidate will be trained in use of health administrative data housed at ICES, as well as all privacy and regulatory requirements of using ICES data. The successful candidate will be employed by the SickKids Research Institute (with remote work possible), with VPN access to the ICES intranet and administrative datasets. If needed, space will be available to the analyst at ICES UofT. The analyst will ensure that the analytic plan is carried out, and that all ICES regulatory requirements are adhered to. In addition, the analyst will have the opportunity take a leadership role in studies, including presentation of analytic plans and code to a national network of analysts, authorship of manuscripts, and grant applications.
Responsibilities of the position may include, but may not be limited to:
Facilitate the analysis of health administrative data as part of the Canadian Gastro-Intestinal Epidemiology Consortium (www.cangiec.ca)Participate in the development of study design and analytical plans, including preparation of dataset creation plansDevelop SAS and/or R programs to extract and merge data from existing health administrative databases according to dataset creation plans to create study cohorts following analytic standards and guidelinesCarry out statistical analysis on developed study cohorts according to specifications of project analysis plansPrepare and review analytic output (e.g., tables and reports).Maintain and advocate for high standards of quality and integrity through code review, documentation, and reproducibility with data analysts at ICES and located in other Canadian provinces.Contribute to writing reports, abstracts, poster presentations, peer-reviewed publications, and other relevant deliverablesApply general project management principles including monitoring project timelines, risk, and deliverables in collaboration with other team membersConduct meta-analyses of multi-jurisdictional data using R SoftwareAttend relevant meetings, rounds, workshops and conferences to increase knowledge and skills
Knowledge, skills, and abilities required:
Essential: Background in epidemiology, biostatistics, statistics, computer science or equivalent with a strong understanding of statistics and scientific research (MSc or PhD in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Statistics preferred).Essential: At least two years of experience with SAS programming (including SQL, SAS macros), R Software, and other data management toolsEssential: Knowledge of study designs and biostatistical analytic techniques used in epidemiology and health services researchEssential: Knowledge of the principles of research design and analytic methods for large database research, in particular health administrative data such as those housed at ICES, BORN Ontario, Statistics Canada, etc.Experience conducting meta-analyses, preferably using R SoftwareAn aptitude for data management and research methodologyCreativity in developing data measures and imitative in resolving data anomaliesDemonstrated attention to detailAbility to interpret results and contribute to manuscripts and other deliverablesStrong English oral, written, and interpersonal communication skillsAbility to exercise discretion and good judgmentStrong presentation skillsStrong time management skills and proven ability to prioritize timelines and responsibilities, including working accurately and effectively under pressure to meet deadlinesOptional: Bilingual (French and English)Optional: Based in Toronto. Work model will be primarily virtual/hybrid.
Job Term: Full-time, 1-year contract, with possibility of renewal

Our Commitment to Diversity

The children and families we care for are from a variety of communities, and so are our employees. We welcome and encourage everyone to join our organization and be part of our team.
 When requested, SickKids will provide access and inclusion supports to eligible candidates to support their full engagement during the interview and assessment process. Information received related to access or inclusion will be addressed confidentially.
Thank you for your interest in joining SickKids. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. In accordance with our Hospital policy, employment at SickKids is conditional upon the Hospital’s receipt of all necessary documentation.
FOR EXTERNAL APPLICANTS ONLY: As a health care institution, our highest priority is the safety of patients, families and staff. As a result, we are adopting all prevention measures to ensure the safety of our patients, families and our staff. Therefore, any offer of employment is conditional upon you submitting proof that you have been fully vaccinated with a Health Canada or World Health Organization (WHO) approved COVID-19 vaccination as soon as possible and no later than fourteen (14) calendar days prior to the effective start date, in addition to satisfying any other condition(s) that may be set out in an offer. If a candidate fails to satisfy this condition (or any other condition(s) set out in an offer), any offer of employment shall be immediately rescinded.

Title: Data Analyst, Station Facilities, Asset Assurance
Description:
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario.
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you!
The Data Analyst, Station Facilities, Asset Management Assurance will provide expertise in and coordinate the development and implementation of data management strategies and data collection procedures for Station Facilities Asset Management Division. Identify, analyze and interpret data trends/issues and make recommendations for improvement to business, operations and system processes.
What will I be doing?
Develops and implements data management strategies and data collection systems including the design and development of relational databases for information management and retrieval that optimize statistical efficiency, data quality and supports evidence-informed decision making.
Imports, cleans, transforms, validates and models data to improve data quality and ensure data is accurate and relevant and fosters understanding of operational, business and system issues/trends while advising on data issues which includes quality, availability and usability.
Identifies, analyses and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets using Data Definition Language or Data Manipulation Language commands for data gathering and analysis activities; produces ongoing and ad hoc reports and dashboards that identify issues, provide insight into results and outline recommendations for process improvements to resolve operational, business and system issues.
Presents data in dashboards, charts, graphs and/or tables by building, designing and maintaining online applications such as data input/data collection screens to capture and present meaningful information/data for reporting, analysis and presentation purposes for use by management, internal business units and stakeholders in identifying and implementing process improvements.
Develops and maintains a comprehensive and up-to-date knowledge of internal and external data sources relevant to operational, business and systems data to design and build meaningful databases that centralizes data for internal stakeholders to access.
Liaises with internal stakeholders and business units to identify relevant data which can shared and will contribute to the data collection process as well as to determine stakeholder and business unit specific data/information needs.
Liaises with counterparts in other transit and enforcement agencies to gather and share information on data management and collection strategies, operational, business together with system issues and best practices.
Contributes to the identification and development of new process improvement opportunities for operational, business and systems activities through the development and implementation of data management and collection strategies as well as the analysis of data to support process improvements and evidence-informed decision making.
Imports, cleans, transforms, validates and models data to improve data quality and to ensure the accuracy, currency and integrity of data which is used to identify issues and provide insight into analysis results and recommendations for improvements.
Identifies and conducts analyses of data to interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets which contributes to the development and implementation of improvements, efficiencies, savings and cost avoidance in service delivery, business and operational processes.
Provides subject matter expertise to internal stakeholders and business units to provide technical advice, assist with data interpretation, needs analysis and provide insight and commentary for decision making purposes.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About SickKids

Dedicated exclusively to children and their families, The Hospital for Sick Children (SickKids) is one of the largest and most respected paediatric healthcare centres in the world. As innovators in child health, we lead and partner to improve the health of children through the integration of healthcare, leading-edge research and education. Our reputation would not have been built – nor could it be maintained – without the skills, knowledge and experience of the extraordinary people who come to work here every day. SickKids is committed to ongoing learning and development, and features a caring and supportive work environment that combines exceptionally high standards of practice.
When you join SickKids, you become part of our community. We share a commitment and determination to fulfill our vision of Healthier Children. A Better World.
Don’t miss out on the opportunity to work alongside the world’s best in paediatric healthcare.

Position Description

Data Analyst / Analytic Epidemiologist
The Data Analyst will work closely with Dr. Eric Benchimol’s research team at the Hospital for Sick Children (SickKids) and ICES (www.ices.on.ca) to assist with analysis of large datasets of health administrative data. Under direct supervision, the candidate will develop dataset creation plans (DCPs) and analytic plans following a research protocol, and carry out the plans using SAS, R and other languages. The successful candidate will be trained in use of health administrative data housed at ICES, as well as all privacy and regulatory requirements of using ICES data. The successful candidate will be employed by the SickKids Research Institute (with remote work possible), with VPN access to the ICES intranet and administrative datasets. If needed, space will be available to the analyst at ICES UofT. The analyst will ensure that the analytic plan is carried out, and that all ICES regulatory requirements are adhered to. In addition, the analyst will have the opportunity take a leadership role in studies, including presentation of analytic plans and code to a national network of analysts, authorship of manuscripts, and grant applications.
Responsibilities of the position may include, but may not be limited to:
Facilitate the analysis of health administrative data as part of the Canadian Gastro-Intestinal Epidemiology Consortium (www.cangiec.ca)Participate in the development of study design and analytical plans, including preparation of dataset creation plansDevelop SAS and/or R programs to extract and merge data from existing health administrative databases according to dataset creation plans to create study cohorts following analytic standards and guidelinesCarry out statistical analysis on developed study cohorts according to specifications of project analysis plansPrepare and review analytic output (e.g., tables and reports).Maintain and advocate for high standards of quality and integrity through code review, documentation, and reproducibility with data analysts at ICES and located in other Canadian provinces.Contribute to writing reports, abstracts, poster presentations, peer-reviewed publications, and other relevant deliverablesApply general project management principles including monitoring project timelines, risk, and deliverables in collaboration with other team membersConduct meta-analyses of multi-jurisdictional data using R SoftwareAttend relevant meetings, rounds, workshops and conferences to increase knowledge and skills
Knowledge, skills, and abilities required:
Essential: Background in epidemiology, biostatistics, statistics, computer science or equivalent with a strong understanding of statistics and scientific research (MSc or PhD in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Statistics preferred).Essential: At least two years of experience with SAS programming (including SQL, SAS macros), R Software, and other data management toolsEssential: Knowledge of study designs and biostatistical analytic techniques used in epidemiology and health services researchEssential: Knowledge of the principles of research design and analytic methods for large database research, in particular health administrative data such as those housed at ICES, BORN Ontario, Statistics Canada, etc.Experience conducting meta-analyses, preferably using R SoftwareAn aptitude for data management and research methodologyCreativity in developing data measures and imitative in resolving data anomaliesDemonstrated attention to detailAbility to interpret results and contribute to manuscripts and other deliverablesStrong English oral, written, and interpersonal communication skillsAbility to exercise discretion and good judgmentStrong presentation skillsStrong time management skills and proven ability to prioritize timelines and responsibilities, including working accurately and effectively under pressure to meet deadlinesOptional: Bilingual (French and English)Optional: Based in Toronto. Work model will be primarily virtual/hybrid.
Job Term: Full-time, 1-year contract, with possibility of renewal

Our Commitment to Diversity

The children and families we care for are from a variety of communities, and so are our employees. We welcome and encourage everyone to join our organization and be part of our team.
 When requested, SickKids will provide access and inclusion supports to eligible candidates to support their full engagement during the interview and assessment process. Information received related to access or inclusion will be addressed confidentially.
Thank you for your interest in joining SickKids. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. In accordance with our Hospital policy, employment at SickKids is conditional upon the Hospital’s receipt of all necessary documentation.
FOR EXTERNAL APPLICANTS ONLY: As a health care institution, our highest priority is the safety of patients, families and staff. As a result, we are adopting all prevention measures to ensure the safety of our patients, families and our staff. Therefore, any offer of employment is conditional upon you submitting proof that you have been fully vaccinated with a Health Canada or World Health Organization (WHO) approved COVID-19 vaccination as soon as possible and no later than fourteen (14) calendar days prior to the effective start date, in addition to satisfying any other condition(s) that may be set out in an offer. If a candidate fails to satisfy this condition (or any other condition(s) set out in an offer), any offer of employment shall be immediately rescinded.
How to Apply
Tip: Combine your cover letter and resume into ONE document of 20 pages or less as you cannot upload multiple documents as part of your application.
If you are still experiencing technical difficulties please email ask.hr@sickkids.ca to send us a short description of the issues you are experiencing. Please note that we will not accept resumes sent to this inbox but we are happy to respond to requests for technical assistance.

Title: Data Analyst
Description: DATA ANALYSTPlatform CalgaryCALGARY, ALBERTAWho is Platform?Platform Calgary is laser focused on making Calgary a global hub for startups and innovation. We believe that an inclusive, tech-led approach to economic growth and diversification will unlock new avenues of prosperity for current and future Calgarians. Already one of the world’s top 100 emerging innovation ecosystems, our goals are ambitious: over the next 10 years we want to see a 10x increase in the rate of startup creation and growth lead to the creation of 30,000 future proofed jobs.To make this vision a reality, we are opening the Platform Innovation Centre, Calgary’s Home for Innovators. With 60+ partner organizations already connected and aligned in vision under one roof, we are collectively what our name suggests: a platform upon which to build, with an expansive, efficient and well resourced network of support at its foundation. Along with our partners we offer innovators everything they need to get started and get growing: educational programming, community, advice and a globally-connected network of resources.At heart we are trusted collaborators with our partners that work alongside us, and are tireless champions for every innovator that comes through our doors.What’s it like to work at Platform?Yes, our goals are ambitious. Some might say aggressive. (Yes!) We’ve set the bar high for ourselves and for Calgary’s tech community. The only way we’ll get there is if a) the next 10 years in tech are the best in Calgary’s history (for everyone) and b) we are a catalytic organization that, at its core, is highly collaborative AND highly entrepreneurial.Our team is passionate about supporting startups and innovators no matter where they’re at, but is equally enthusiastic about seeing our partners thrive as they deliver on our shared vision for Calgary. At the end of the day, we’re all working together to empower the people building the next economy.We hire experts and generalists with complementary skills and a shared attitude: we value integrity, creativity and diversity, and we thrive as part of integrated teams that revel in delivering results. If you’re considering joining our team, it is important that you understand we are blazing new trails in our city. A lot of what we need to be able to do in the future is being built today. (Hint: look elsewhere for well-worn playbooks and a slow moving routine.) Read our Guiding Principles for the litmus test on how we determine and prioritize the work we do.Diversity in the people we hire is essential for truly collaborative work, and for the impact we are accountable for in the community we serve. We foster a workplace in which individual differences are recognized, appreciated, and respected to fully develop and utilize each person’s talents and strengths. We operate a hybrid and flexible work environment to support the best results from our highly collaborative teams.Our beliefs are the foundations of Platform’s growing culture. Written by all of us, we are each accountable to these beliefs and work to reinforce them in our daily work:- Ship It: I do what it takes to get work out the door even if it’s not perfect, and learn how to make it better.- Shout Out: I revel in my coworkers’ efforts and accomplishments.- Move the Needle: I drive transformational results by focusing on opportunities that create measurable impact at scale.- All Hands: I take initiative to listen, ask and contribute in whatever ways I can because I have experiences and knowledge that matter.- Build to Last: I make decisions today that create foundations for the future of Calgary.- Top Priority: I safeguard my health and wellness and know I am supported by the team to take care of myself.If you’re ready to be a part of a highly collaborative team that is making a difference in the future of Calgary, come talk to us.The Opportunity: Reporting to the Director of Academy, the successful candidate will be involved in the design, development, maintenance, and integration of metrics collection and reporting systems for Platform Calgary that characterize the business maturity of tech startups as required by Provincial, City, and Federal (future) grant agreements. This is a cross functional role that is critical in shaping and achieving Platform’s data and funding requirements. If you love numbers and narrative, are an excellent writer and a relationship builder, and don’t mind the occasional deadline, this role just might be for you!What you’ll be doing: Metric Design- Audit and improve longitudinal qualitative and quantitative data that track the progress of Platform’s clients in accordance with funder’s requirements.- Develop or maintain appropriate metrics collection mechanisms to assist with milestone deliverables and timeline tracking.- Drive the internal team and relevant partners to define, measure, and publish effectiveness metrics.Data Collection Methodology- Review and implement methods to collect client data in several avenues:- Annual client surveys.- Track outcomes for each client journey through multiple programs.- Implement HubSpot client record processes.- Process workflow and training of Platform Calgary staff.Analyze Data- Ensure data meeting funders requirements.- Identify issues where data suggests metrics are not being met and surface to relevant Platform teams.- Track and present on year over year trends.Reporting- Ability to interpret and ensure compliance to funding agreement terms and conditions, especially the creation and submission of timely and accurate reports.- Ensure that all required metrics as stipulated in funding contracts are being collected and consolidated in an appropriate manner.- Spearhead data driven insights across the organization.- Assist with metrics and data analysis required to support storytelling and promote success stories for all programs.- Create or maintain dashboards to visualize program/product metrics.What you will bring: - Clear and concise communications and presentations that employ metrics, insights derived from them, and storytelling to deliver messaging with intent.- Familiarity with qualitative and quantitative research methods.- Proficiency in G-Suite and other business productivity software are considered an asset.- Able to understand big picture problems and break them down.- Care about details and getting the numbers right.- Good communication and presentation skills.- Ability to work will independently, yet build relationships across teams.- Strong organizational skills to manage multiple priorities and deadlines concurrently.- Comfortable asking questions and a proactive self-starter.What you will receive: - Comprehensive health, vision and dental benefits including a Health Spending Account, Employee Assistance Programs.- Maple: Online Doctors, virtual help and prescriptions in Canada.- Up to 6% Group RRSP matching program & Group Life Insurance.- Fridays off during the months of July and August & three weeks paid vacation plus one week paid vacation in December/January.- Maternity/Parental leave top-up.- Aspirational Workspace - the Platform Innovation Centre is Calgary’s home for innovators.- Amenities - the Platform Innovation Centre includes a cafe, bike storage and shower facilities.Qualifications: - Bachelor’s Degree in a relevant discipline (social sciences, economics, etc.)- 3-5 years experience working in multi-stakeholder environments.- You must also be located in Calgary, or open to relocate for on-site work a few days a week.Platform Calgary is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates including aboriginal persons, members of sexual minority groups, persons with disabilities, visible minorities and women. We will provide any requested accommodation to candidates with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. Platform Calgary requires its team members to have up to date vaccinations to minimize risks associated with COVID-19.We wish to express our appreciation to all applicants for their interest and advise that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Any personal information submitted will be managed with the strictest confidentiality. This position will remain open until a suitable applicant is identified.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $55,000.00-$75,000.00 per year

Title: Flight Data Analyst
Description:
POSITION SUMMARY:

SKYTRAC provides Flight Data Monitoring, Flight Data Analysis services to fixed wing and rotary wing operators worldwide. As a key member of the team, you will report to the FDM Program Manager and provide industry leading support and insight to our existing and future FDM/FOA customers by implementing, reviewing, and validating flight data.

Ideally, we seek candidates who can work in-office in Kelowna. However, we are open to considering remote work with the requirement of a daily overlap within the pacific time zone.
A typical day includes:
Recommending & implementing appropriate analysis to meet customer business needs
Support basic file processing for a variety of configurations
Provide customers with training on our FDM software services
Responding to internal requests for support regarding flight data
Reviewing and validating clients flight data
Responding to clients’ requests for support regarding flight data
Provide industry standard advice and insight to clients
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
Customer first attitude
Positive, energetic go getter
Proven data analysis and analytical thinking
Excellent verbal and written English communication skills
Ability to think independently
Self-motivated

PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
Flight safety experience
Business/aviation related education
FDM/FOQA program implementation experience
Experience applying statistical analysis techniques
Programming experience an asset (xml, sql or javascript)
Position to remain open until filled.

Title: Data Analyst
Description: Position Overview: PACE Atlantic CIC is a Community Interest Corporation that operates with a mandate to provide a public good.We support Canadian Municipalities in the development and administration of clean, simple, and cost-effective energy financing programs. These programs offer homeowners a customer-friendly path toward energy efficiency and renewable upgrades.PACE Atlantic CIC is poised for significant growth, and the successful candidate will become part of a dynamic and resilient team that effectively responds to challenges to evolve and thrive.The Data Analyst role is key to our success. We must continuously improve our ability to record, analyze, and present information to support simple and impactful programming.The Ideal Candidate: · Is energized by the opportunity to play a key role in reducing carbon emissions· Is a problem solver who thrives on challenges related to supporting a growing business· Is fluent in all things data: extraction, quality, integration, analysis, visualization, etc.· Is tenacious when it comes to testing and troubleshooting· Brings a deep knowledge of the latest and greatest products and services· Is comfortable coordinating directly with third-party partners on a regular basis· Is responsive and understanding of shifting priorities· Has direct experience in: relational databases, data analysis, programming, system integrations, report writing, etc.· Is an expert in some or all of: SQL, Microsoft Access, Power BI, Microsoft Excel, WordPress, etc. (or similar)· Understands budding technologies and their potential use in real world scenarios e.g. artificial intelligence and machine learningPosition Duties: · Build reporting and analysis around key business processes and outputs· Manage the integration of business systems and data sources· Source relevant external datasets to enrich data analysis· Modify database and workflow designs as required to support process evolution· Identify and execute on opportunities to automate processes· Supervise data quality, develop and enforce optimal data generating processes, and correct errors and issues as required (manually or automatically)· Work with internal and external teams to enable file sharing with considerations for privacy· Develop and manage plans for data backup and recovery· Liaise with our technology partner(s) on: hardware, infrastructure, security and licenses· Coordinate with our marketing partner(s) on: websites, social media, and other services· Proactively contribute to operational and strategic plans through the lens of the latest technologies· Continuously work toward the improving the role of technology in the business· Support other departments as requiredJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: $20.00-$25.00 per hourBenefits:Casual dressDental careExtended health careFlexible schedulePaid time offVision careSchedule:Monday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:We take all the usual precautions. Employees work from home if there is any chance of illness.Expected start date: 2022-06-01

Title: Real World Data Business Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Business Analyst to work with a Director of Real-World Data (RWD) Solutions, focusing on several ongoing projects, productization of Clarivate’s RWD asset, and generating new revenue streams. Don’t be deterred if you do not have RWD experience! As a team of two, you have the opportunity for one-on-one coaching and mentoring to learn all things RWD. There is plenty of room for continued growth in the role and within Clarivate. We would love to speak with you if have business analysis experience with some familiarity with business intelligence platforms, relational databases, and data visualization platforms.
You will play a critical part in the process of identifying additional products and services, to be built upon our RWD and other Clarivate data assets. This role is pivotal to the organization, given its tight correlation to revenue generation and contribution to ongoing approved projects. As a Real World Data Business Analyst you will work closely with stakeholders to translate business requirements into user stories and technical requirements, while also evaluating business processes and requirements, identifying areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions. Your role will also include liaising with developers and UI/UX team regarding system design and providing internal process expertise, provide training and/or conduct presentations for stakeholders to introduce new processes and tools, and conduct testing to assess the readiness of deliverables for timely completion of projects. Other aspects related to business analysis include analyzing data and ensuring data integrity in all reporting, dashboards, and data applications, conducting research, and developing models to analyze, explain and forecast market changes and patterns. Also, support the development of specifications and system testing of new functionality within business applications. Your role will include project management responsibilities such as delivering projects on time and in line with key deliverables and Business Unit satisfaction and managing the change management process resulting from the introduction of new programs, systems, and/or contractual changes. A focus on providing customer service to our clients by identifying and reviewing customer touchpoints ensuring a seamless end-user experience, and initiating improvements based on end-user and customer satisfaction. Finally, you will maintain positive relationships with key stakeholders, share knowledge, and support project goals.
What you will need…
At least 3 years of experience in Business Analysis
At least 1 year of work or educational experience working with Business Intelligence platforms (example: PowerBI)
At least 1 year of work or educational experience working with Tableau and/or other data visualization platforms
Hands-on experience with Python, R, SQL, and relational databases
Advanced MS Office skills
It would be great if you also had…
Knowledge of Real World Data (RWD)
Experience working in healthcare or life sciences
Experience with Snowflake
It is the policy of Clarivate to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Clarivate will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Title: Data Analyst (12-month Contract)
Description:
Requisition ID: 148523

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
Purpose
The Data Analyst contributes to the overall success of the Goal Planning and Performance Department in Canada taking effective ownership on various reporting/ad-hoc requests and helps to generate value-added actionable insights pertaining to specific individual goals, plans, initiatives in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.
Goal Planning and Performance is responsible for providing high impact analysis to support decisions focused on driving Canadian Retail bank success. The Data Analyst, Goal Planning & Performance, will play a key role in expanding our reporting framework and improving our analytical processes. Improved analysis and reporting, driven primarily by initiatives contributed by this role, will be a critical part of supporting the bank’s focus on both performance and customer.
Key Accountabilities

Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledgeDesign and create reports, using data to analyze and improve our understanding of branch staff and customer behaviour, and monitoring the impact of strategic decisions and initiativesDesign and develop new reports to support management including but not limited to - visualization tools such as Tableau & PowerBI, complex data and logic tools, SAS, SQL, and self-service dashboardsAnalyze data and evaluate results, identify emerging business issues, and prepare recommendations for managementContinuously acquire and enhance knowledge of business/product strategies, portfolio management principles, branch processes and procedures, regulatory requirements, and advanced analytical tools/methodologies in order to best provide business solutionsValidate data extraction to ensure accuracy and accountability of reporting and insightsWork closely with other Goal Planning and Performance employees to support our goal planning, reporting, and business intelligence processesAutomate and increase efficiencies on data extraction, transformation and reporting processesUnderstand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisionsChampions a high performance environment and implements a people strategy that attracts, retains, develops and motivates their team by fostering an inclusive work environment; communicating vison/values/business strategy and managing succession and development planning for the team

Requirements

Required - University degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Mathematics, Database Marketing, Finance, Computer Science, Business Management or a related disciplineExcellent mathematical, analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to interpret complex data and conclude meaningful insightsSelf-starter, with the ability to work well both independently and with teams and must be comfortable working in an environment with tight deadlines and multiple prioritiesExpertise and experience in SAS and/or SQLPython and/or R experience an assetAnalytical, modelling, and automation experience an assetExpertise in data visualization tools including Tableau/PowerBI an assetExcellent business acumen and strategic thinking skillsExcellent communication (written and verbal) is essentialUnderstanding of Canadian retail bankingStrong Excel skillsFlexible, motivated, and results oriented
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Lab Data Exports Analyst (Homebased)
Description:
Job Overview
We are looking for applicants with varying levels of Data Management, Data Transfer and/or data programming experience. This role provides Data Management support as part of a team to perform delivery of data files through the full Laboratory Data Management (LDM) project life-cycle. They will serve as the point of contact for clients, communicate internally and externally to drive resolution of issues impacting the transfer of data files. We need detail-oriented candidates with solid skills to work independently with the ability to recognize when to seek assistance from others. They’ll be supporting other team members as needed by serving as back-up and through mentoring junior analysts. Candidates must be able to comprehend and comply with core standard operating procedures and work instructions.
We are currently looking for applicants with varying levels of Data Management, Laboratory or Data Transfer experience to join us in Q2 Lab Solutions, Marietta, GA.
This role provides Data Management support as part of a team to manage delivery of projects through the full Laboratory Data Management (LDM) project life-cycle.
Responsibilities
Serve as primary Laboratory Data Management (LDM) point of contact for clients of assigned projects.
Manage the development and delivery of data-transfers from the Laboratory Information Management System (LIMS), which meet client data reporting needs.
Understand and verify error-logs generated from Data Transfer programs and communicate effectively to the programming/support team to resolve issues.
Establish and maintain strong internal and external customer relationships.
Ensure service and quality meet agreed upon timelines and deliverables detailed in the Data Transmission Agreement.
Work with client data managers and internal team to project-manage: finances, processes, timelines, workload projection, resources, issue escalation and out-of-scope work.
Minimum required education and experienceBachelor of Science in Life Sciences or related fieldSAS Programmer certificate preferred1-year minimum experience with SAS Programming
Required knowledge, skills and abilities
Serve as back-up for other Data Managers where required.Understand and comply with core standard operating procedures and working instructions.Train and mentor junior DM staff where appropriate.Perform other duties as directed by the functional manager.
Q² Solutions is a leading clinical trial laboratory services organization with end-to-end laboratory services and secure, enterprise-wide biospecimen and consent management solutions. https://q2labsolutions.com/careers

Title: Analyst Data & Analytics
Description:
Job Description:

We are Canada Life
Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.
You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.
Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.
Be your best at Canada Life.
We are looking for an Analyst, Data & Analytics
Given the size and scope of our organization, we have the flexibility for this position to be located in the following head office locations: Toronto or London.
As an important part of the Strategic data team, this role will support initiatives and projects as they pertain to the data warehouse environments and Cloud Azure platforms, it will assist with managing client and advisor transactional data to ensure there is a ‘single version of the truth’ for Individual Customer.
The Analyst, Data & Analytics is a data subject matter expert able to translate reporting and analysis needs into data, work on data projects while collaborating closely with IC tech teams and Canada data to create data structures for use in analysis and BI reporting.
This role will also be responsible to collaborate closely with other Finance teams and Advisory Network Analysis teams to understand analysis/analytics and BI reporting requirements.
They will support projects throughout the entire data lifecycle. An outward focus and ability to translate complex problems into simple concepts will be important to this role’s success.
What you will do
Build, implement and maintain data models for use in custom reports and dashboards
Work with large data-sets that are not consistent, clean or fully modelled
Become intimately familiar with data-sets stored across several different systems
Ensure data consistency and accuracy.
Collaborate with the IC Technical team and Canada data team in strategic data initiatives as well as improve the quality of the IC data
Ensure best practices are followed with respect to data governance and structure
What you will bring
1-3 years of relevant experience and a degree in related field of study, or an equivalent combination of bachelor’s degree and extensive related experience
Strong experience in working with data analytics tools (SQL, Python, R), Databases (SQL Server), Cloud (Azure), data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI)
Proficiency in Databricks and/or Azure synapse is an asset
Good presentation & communication skills
Strong experience working with raw data and manipulating large datasets
Knowledge of our organization, distribution channels, products, systems, and data is an asset
Think outside the box and identify solution to overcome obstacles
Experience working on project teams to analyze business needs
Ability to work with little, to no documentation or instructions
Ability to think outside the box and identify solutions to overcome obstacles
Able to manage many complicated tasks at one time while prioritizing and managing to deadlines in a challenging work environment
Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today
We are one of Canada's top 100 employers!
Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.
We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.
Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted

Title: Data and Reporting Analyst Co-op/Intern
Description:
Position: Data and Reporting Analyst Co-op/Intern Duration: 4 Months Date: Sep - Dec 2022 Location: Virtual






Come create the technology that helps the world act together


Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world. We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.


The team you'll be part of


Network Infrastructure


The pandemic has highlighted how important telecoms networks are to society. Nokia’s Network Infrastructure group is at the heart of a revolution to bring more and faster network capacity to people worldwide through our ambition, innovation, and technical expertise.


Education Recommendations


Currently a candidate for bachelor’s degree or diploma in Computer Science, Computer Systems Engineering, etc. or related field with an accredited school in Canada.


What you will learn and contribute to


As part of our team, you will:



Develop visual reports dashboards and KPI scorecards using Power BI desktop
Conduct unit testing and troubleshooting
Evaluate and improve existing BI reports
Develop and execute database queries and conduct analysis



What is Nokia looking for from me
We’re looking for passionate, original thinkers who want to drive progress, grow their network, and further their careers. If you see yourself as someone who never stops learnin
You have



Initiative to continually learn, adapt, and grow.
Have an inherent interest in being involved and helping others
Interested in determining the source of a problem and find an effective solution
Ability to active listen and communicate ideas with confidence



It would be nice if you also had:

SQL Develpment experience
MS Power BI knowledge



Why we're awesome


Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.


Company Culture: We believe our people are our greatest asset and we aim to foster a fun, challenging, positive, and inclusive work environment. We offer 1-on-1 mentorship, learning and development opportunities, global impact and interaction, and flexible work/life balance.


Meaningful Co-op Term: During your co-op term, you will have the opportunity to test out the latest technologies and work on innovative projects that could leave a global impact. You get to use skills learned in the classroom and apply it to real work situations while gaining professional hands-on experience.


Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer


Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:


One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark
LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation


At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people.


Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.


Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.


See you this Fall 2022!


“My experience at Nokia has been amazing, one of the best learning experiences I ever had in my life. As Co-op student, it was an honor to be treated as any other full-time employee at Nokia. I got the freedom to design & implement my ideas. Working at Nokia as a Co-op student was the best thing that ever happened, it was a life changing opportunity.” – Ummar Tantray, Former Nokia Co-op student, Fall 2020


Follow and engage with us on social media: LinkedIn | Facebook | Instagram | Twitter @NokiaCareers Chat with our Nokia insiders to ask questions and learn more about us!

Title: Business Analyst 3
Description:
Affiliation: MoveUP
Employment Status: Full-Time Temporary
Salary: $42.91 Hourly
Temp Duration: Approximately 1 year

We’re looking for new talent to join us as we reinvent the future of energy. Across BC, we have a diverse team of more than 2,500 employees we can’t do without, yet we’re growing as fast as ever.

You may think we’re your standard utility that delivers natural gas and electricity, but we’re also into cool, innovative energy solutions. Think carbon capture, renewable energies and lower-carbon transportation for a start. We believe in creating a cleaner, healthier tomorrow.

If you like meaningful work, a dynamic environment and forward-thinking colleagues, build your career with us. You’ll get opportunities to grow, lead, solve, and create. So what are you waiting for? Let’s rethink energy together. Responsibilities
The Business Analyst is accountable for the elicitation/documentation of requirements, analyzing and improving business and system processes. The position is responsible for system design, developing and maintaining functional, integration/regression test plans; and identifying issues or enhancements that focus on the improved efficiency and success of the business.

Performs all of the duties of a Business Analyst 1 and 2 plus the following:
Perform a wide range of complex technical and statistics functions. This includes risk evaluation of various alternatives and interpreting result of the analysis.
Technical lead on medium-large sized projects, such as hardware or software upgrades, including the development of business cases and project charters, and the evaluation of Requests for Proposal. Able to estimate the effort, set priorities, breakdown tasks, delegation and meet agreed upon milestones and customer expectations.
Manages capacity planning and resources when acting as Business lead of medium to large projects, and supports with testing and documentation as needed.
Provide leadership and technical guidance to other business analysts and serves as a functional expert to share technical knowledge and training to team.
Performs duties of a minor nature related to the above duties, which do not affect the rating of the job. Requirements
Technical diploma in computer engineering, computer science or related field from an accredited post-secondary institution.
6 years of directly related work experience.
CBAP certification an asset.
Demonstrated advanced understand of requirements elicitation, use case development and design review.
Advanced knowledge of business specification documents, business cases, proof-of-concepts, data flow diagrams, workflow process models, as-is and to-be models and industry best practices.
Superior analytical and problem solving skills and critical thinking skills in the problem resolution process.
Excellent knowledge of project management, workflow analysis, and system development life cycle.
Understanding in the following: Customer relationship Management tools, field tools, bill design software.
Understanding of the Business Analyst Body of Knowledge (BABOK), change control and auditing standards.
Experience with FortisBC applications such as SharePoint, SAP, CRM, Customer Information Systems (CIS), Geographical Information Systems (GIS), Mobile Workforce Management (MWFM) and Automated Metering Infrastructure (AMI).
Advanced proficiency with computer systems and related programs including Microsoft Office, Access, SharePoint, and Visio.
Superior written and oral communications, negotiation, and presentation skills; including the ability to write comprehensive technical documentation, present analyses and recommendations for management consideration, and ability to train, coach and influence others.
Superior understanding in managing functional business analysis on medium to large sized projects and knowledge of project management methodologies.
Advanced organizational and analytical skills, including ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously, and to cope with diversity and complexity in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Superior interpersonal and customer service skills.
Excellent leadership competency to lead, motivate and coach teams on best practices, systems, policies, procedures, and core processes.
Our engaging workplace offers a wide range of challenging opportunities, while being safe, inclusive and diverse. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, while supporting life-long career development. We also encourage volunteerism and nourish the need to give back to your community.

Safety is our number one priority, and to maintain the health and safety of our employees and broader communities, we have a number of COVID-19 safety measures in place. This includes a requirement for all new employees to provide proof of full vaccination, prior to their first day of work or the start of their employment. And of course, we will consider an accommodation for anyone who’s unable to be vaccinated due to a protected ground as defined by the Human Rights Code.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Posted Date: April 13, 2022

Job Type: Not Indicated

Req #: JR6405

Location: Mississauga

Job Category: Information Technology

CHEP helps move more goods to more people, in more places than any other organization on earth via our 300 million pallets, crates and containers. We employ 11,000 people and operate in more than 55 countries. Through our pioneering and sustainable share-and-reuse business model, the world’s biggest brands trust us to help them transport their goods more efficiently, safely and with less environmental impact.

What does that mean for you? You’ll join an international organization big enough to take you anywhere, and small enough to get you there sooner. You’ll help change how goods get to market and contribute to global sustainability. You’ll be empowered to bring your authentic self to work and be surrounded by diverse and driven professionals. And you can maximize your work-life balance and flexibility through our Hybrid Work Model.

Business Analyst – SOW attached

Bachelors

3 – 5 years

CHEP Canada invites applications from all qualified individuals. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and we are committed to developing a diverse workforce in which everyone is treated fairly, with respect, and has the opportunity to contribute to business success while realizing his or her potential. This means harnessing the unique skills and experience that each individual brings and we do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state, or local protected class.
