Title: Financial Data Analyst
Description:
About the job

A Financial Data Analyst leverages and manages data that is consumed by world's most elite financial institutions by applying structured thinking and leveraging technology. The scope ranges across the full data lifecycle, from acquisition, normalization, consolidation, validation, remediation, preparation and distribution of data about instruments, legal entities, corporate actions, prices, quantitative data structures (curves, volatility surfaces, correlation matrixes, etc.) and common reference data such as calendars, countries, etc.

Who will love this job

A proud advocate – you enjoy scrubbing and automating compelling data that engages all parts of the business. You are the voice of our customers
A teacher and learner – you like investigating and troubleshooting data related issues across all dimensions of data quality
A helper – you relish acting as the front-line support resource, handling client requests related to TS Imagine's data offering
A trusted subject matter specialist – you own contributing to the constant evolution of our data management maturity and data management capabilities in metadata management, data quality management and data governance
An excellent teammate – you appreciate the daily operations of a global, highly distributed team that delivers mission critical data services

What you'll do

Manage data about financial products, corporate actions, prices, legal entities, valuation data structures and common reference data that is consumed by 500+ clients of TS Imagine around the world
Ensure and enhance the integrity of our mission-critical data offering
Learn finance from the data up
Make and implement recommendations to prevent reoccurring issues and automate manual processes
Automate processes and enhance data with Basic SQL, Python, and JavaScript

You should have

Robust knowledge of pricing models for financial instruments and OTC deals
Familiarity with financial products
Experience in trading, portfolio management, risk management or margin management
A Master's degree in a quantitative field such as financial engineering, physics or mathematics from a reputable university
A good understanding of risk management methodologies such as VaR and stress testing
Familiarity with the terms and conditions of instruments in fixed income, commodities, FX, crypto, equity and their derivatives
Basic SQL, Python and JavaScript
Knowledge of Data Vendors, such as Bloomberg, Refinitiv, ICE or FactSet
A CFA and/or FRM or be a candidate pursuing one
Relevant financial internship experience
Master data management (instruments, corporate actions and valuation data), metadata management, data quality management or data governance

Why TS Imagine / Benefits

Currently hybrid home-office
Vacation and Personal days
Annual bonus and salary review
Training budget $1,500
RRSP with 3% company matching
Health insurance
Subvention for public transportation

About TS Imagine

Created out of the combination of two best-in-class SaaS platforms, TradingScreen and Imagine Software, TS Imagine delivers integrated trading, portfolio and real-time risk solutions for capital markets. The platform is uniquely positioned to streamline complex and time-consuming workflows across front, middle, and back office functions. TS Imagine has close to 400 employees in 10 offices worldwide, serving approximately 500 global buy-side and sell-side institutions across North and South America, EMEA, and Asia Pacific including hedge funds, traditional asset managers, pension funds, mutual funds, and financial institutions.

We challenge our employees every day to think creatively and innovate across silos and across platforms.

Join us!

We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .

Title: Cyber Security Analyst
Description:
Job Posting
Non-Union

Date Posted: April 13, 2022
Posting #: 22-0667
Position: Cyber Security Analyst
Status: Permanent Full-Time
Program: Information Technology and Privacy
Department: Information Security
Site: Sudbury Outpatient Centre (SOC)

KEY FUNCTION:

Provide leadership in the continuous improvement of HSN’s resiliency to cyber security threats. Advance

HSN’s cyber security capabilities through the development of cyber security strategies, implementation

and audit of cyber security controls and the development of monitoring and incident response procedures.
REPORTING:

Under the direction of the Manager, Information Security.
DUTIES:

1. Identify new and emerging cyber risks and prepare recommendations for appropriate
countermeasures, such as: new technology investments, new standards, changes in policy or

reconfiguration of existing systems or business processes.
2. Perform active security monitoring of the environment in an effort to detect, analyze, and limit

intrusions and security events.
3. Lead incident and data breach response and provide cyber risk/security assessments, including

penetration testing and vulnerability scanning.
4. Perform computer forensic imaging and data analysis using industry standards and best practices.

5. Perform application security risk assessments of third-party vendors as well as new or updated
internal or third-party applications.

6. Identify, analyze, and manage risks and issues that may compromise security and compliance.

7. Maintain accurate reporting of key risk metrics and associated measurements.

8. Prepare and present cyber risk management reports to all levels of the organization and the region.

9. Create and maintain enterprise security documents (e.g. policies, standards, baselines, guidelines
and procedures).

10. Engage in ongoing communications with peers in the information technology department, regional
partners/customers and other business areas to ensure an enterprise wide understanding of security

goals, solicit feedback and foster co-operation.
11. Maintain the enterprise wide Cyber Security Awareness Training Program.

12. Maintain up-to-date knowledge of the Information Technology security industry: awareness of new or
revised security standards, improved security processes and new and emerging threats and attacks.

13. Determine and align improvement projects with HSN’s Strategic Plan; monitor and adjust to achieve
goal outcomes.

14. Participate in education and training specific to current, relevant federal and provincial health and
safety legislation, standards and guidelines.

15. Educate and promote health, safety and wellness in the work place.

16. Represent the department or program on various committees and in meetings as required.

17. Perform other duties as required.
QUALIFICATIONS
EDUCATION AND TRAINING:

1. Minimum of a four (4) year Bachelor’s Degree in Cyber Security, Computer Science, Information
Security and Assurance, Information Technology, or related field, from an accredited university.

2. Current certification as an Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) or a related
information security designation is preferred.

3. Ministry of Labour “Worker Health and Safety Awareness in 4 Steps” training certificate is
required.
EXPERIENCE:

1. Minimum of five (5) years’ experience working in an IT Cyber Security or IT Infrastructure analyst
role.
KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES:

1. Demonstrated strong understanding of an in depth security strategy to build, strengthen, and
enhance security policies and procedures.

2. Demonstrated knowledge of IT controls and information security standards such as International
Organization for Standardization (ISO) 27002, National Institute of Standards and Technology

(NIST), SANS, and Center for Internet Security (CIS) Top 20.
3. Demonstrated knowledge of cybersecurity risk management frameworks and best practices.

4. Demonstrated ability to assess and audit cyber security risk.

5. Demonstrated knowledge of application and infrastructure security solutions (Firewalls, Intrusion
Detection Systems (IDS)/ Intrusion Prevention System (IPS), Security Information and Event

Management (SIEM), Network Security, Password Management, Data Encryption, Access

Control, End-Point Security, etc.).
6. Demonstrated broad knowledge of advance IT concepts (e.g. Networking, Servers, End Points,

Active Directory, Domain Name System (DNS) etc.).
7. Demonstrated ability of conducting security risk/vulnerability assessments and penetration

testing.
8. Demonstrated ability to communicate complex and technical issues to diverse audiences, orally

and in writing, in an easily-understood manner.
9. Demonstrated strong situational analysis and decision-making abilities.

10. Demonstrated excellent judgment and proven analytical and investigative skills.

11. Demonstrated training, experience or utilization of lean methodology for process improvement.

12. Demonstrated ability to independently identify issues, plan improvements, measure success and
continue improvement.

13. Demonstrated excellent computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Office software (e.g. Word,
Excel, Power Point and Outlook) and patient information systems.

14. Demonstrated superior interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.

15. Demonstrated strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize workload.

16. Demonstrated discretion and maturity when handling confidential information.

17. Demonstrated commitment to the safety of co-workers and patients.
PERSONAL SUITABILITY:

1. Successful criminal reference check is required.

2. Proven ability to work independently and in a team environment.

3. Demonstrated commitment to ongoing professional development.

4. Demonstrated professionalism in dealing with confidential and sensitive issues.

5. Demonstrated positive work record and excellent attendance record.

6. Ability to meet the physical and sensory demands of the job.

7. Ability to travel between local sites.

8. Demonstrated ability to work outside regular work hours as required.
Selection Process: Candidates will be selected for this position on the basis of their skill, ability,

experience and qualifications as identified in the resume and completed

Application Form submitted. The Hospital reserves the right to conduct a

formal interview where required.
Shift: Days
French Language

Service Designation:
Bilingualism is an Asset
Salary: $82,368.00$96,895.50/Annum
Note: Applications for this position must be submitted to the Human Resources Department before 1600

hours on April 20, 2022.
HSN thanks all applicants.

Only those selected for interviews will be contacted.
We will not accept applications after the closing date and time.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
E INC is the parent company of EBlock and EDealer, unifying our approach to products, services, and strategies under one Vision and one Mission: to create the best digital auction and retailing platform in the world by connecting the automotive wholesale and retail experiences. Our brands and their technologies make it easy for a vehicle to move between buyers and sellers throughout its entire ownership lifecycle. https://e.inc/
Role Summary

E INC is seeking Sr. Data Analyst to join our Data & Analytics team to build and manage BI reporting. The role with work with stakeholders from various sides of the business to pull data and perform analyses to drive business decision making. Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, anomalies, and other helpful information and at times, be prepared to present findings and discuss trends and insights. Review and improve data and analytics processes, methods, and tools to increase efficiency and accuracy. The candidate will also be an active contributor to the Data & Analytics team policy committee to establish and implement standards across the company.


What You Will Do:

Solve data questions requiring advanced transforms, custom queries, statistical analyses, or other related tasks outside the realm of possibility for a self-service tool.
Create ad hoc scripts to extract meaning from the underlying data and answer relevant business questions.
Develop and maintain predictive modeling and forecasting to help key stakeholders build a proactive strategy.
Convey results that speak to the requester’s core business questions and provide key insights and relevant action items.
Clearly communicate nuanced and complex analytical concepts, often translating meaning to impact on the business.
Sustain a comprehensive knowledge of analytics tools (such as Power BI, SQL, JupyterLab, Tableau, statistical languages/packages, or other tools to easily analyze and visualize data) and apply knowledge to help build out more dynamic, automated, and easy to consume reporting for key stakeholders.
Build reporting dashboards from start to finish, including identification of strategic key performance indicators (KPIs), queries to obtain the data, visualizations, and dashboard maintenance.
Educate team members on data literacy to promote proper and relevant usage of dashboards and reporting while also maintaining a general understanding of team and project priorities.
Collaborate with internal partners to identify and understand key data sources for analytics.


What You Will Need:

MBA or Master’s degree in field related to statistics, data analytics, programming, Information Systems, Data Science or Computer Science.
5+ years of experience in the following:
Advanced and experienced in SQL and SQL Server.
Advanced and experienced in building complex dashboards for variety of audiences with advanced BI tools such as Tableau, Google Analytics or PowerBI.
Experience utilizing databases and warehouses for analysis.
Experience with infrastructure tools (e.g., Transactional Systems knowledge, data repositories, data catalogues)
Experience with data management tools (e.g., integrations – structured/rectangular and non-structured data/excel, external, APIs)
Programming background, specifically in statistical languages and packages such as Python.
Experience with forecasting, statistical analysis, predictive algorithms, clustering, and segmentation.
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and interfacing with a broad set of stakeholders across various functions (i.e., Business, IT, Operations).
Excellent verbal and written communication skills presenting complex analytical results to both technical and non-technical audiences.


Why work with us? E INC is a growing company that is continuing to evaluate our ongoing commitment and investment in our team members with:

Competitive pay
Medical, Dental & Vision
401k/RSP with Match
Paid time off
Flexible working environment
Continuous Learning
And an amazing culture to top it all off!


E INC. is an equal opportunity employer and affirmatively seeks diversity in its workforce. E INC. recruits qualified applicants and advances in employment its employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age disability, genetic information, ethnic or national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other protected by law. Title: Product Data Analyst- Remote- Ontario
Description:
At Mitel, you will have the opportunity to help businesses connect, collaborate and provide better experiences for our customers. You will deliver valuable contributions in creating business success within our global organization utilizing your unique attributes, skills and experience.
Please take a moment to look over this opportunity and if interested, feel free to send us your application. If this is not the right opportunity for you, you can also sign up for Job Alerts by creating an account. This will give you a profile that you can use for all future applications, and you will be notified whenever a new position that matches your criteria becomes available.
Overview:
Do you consider yourself an expert with master data, engineering changes, gathering requirements and documenting with enhanced focus on process improvement? If so, the Product Data Analyst might be the role for you.
This role is considered a Remote role in Canada. Come join us!
Responsibilities:
Owns the process from leading requirements working sessions for projects with stakeholders to draw out the business needs and to ensure requirements are aligned with the business objectives
Prepare business requirements documentation, develop process flow models and user cases
Imports large amount of data (product part numbers) from SAP into Excel
Deep dive analysis of Product Master data
Validate that the proposed solutions meet the business requirements
Support by conducting business impact and root cause analysis encountered in SAP Master Data
Analyze data to identify opportunities and suggest improvements
Preparing and presenting project proposals and engagement documents
Detailed -oriented to catch potential typos and grammatical errors
Prioritizing tasks in order of importance and planning out processes for the department to follow
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree preferred; or high school diploma + equivalent work experience
2 to 4 years' experience in data analytics, preferably in Supply Chain Management and Product Master Data
Manufacturing experience (data entry for Bills of Materials, creation of part numbers, working with suppliers, etc)
Interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques. Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources and maintaining data within these databases
Data collection from Mitel’s operations systems that optimize and streamline efficiencies with quality value
Skilled in Microsoft Office, to include expert level skillset with Excel
Ability to consolidate diverse business requirements and facilitate realistic, common sense solutions
Ability to perform repetitive tasks with a high degree of accuracy
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

#LI-MW1

Title: Business Analyst, Supplier Inclusion and Diversity - IDEA
Description:
Who We Are

lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people.

ABOUT THE TEAM
Supplier Inclusion & Diversity's objective is play a critical role in creating an inclusive, diverse, and equitable lululemon through our sourcing and procurement practices. Supplier Inclusion and Diversity focuses on creating inclusive policies and practices that support the inclusion of diverse suppliers and business growth through supplier development. Our key objective is to impact our community by supporting diverse business growth, job creation and wealth creation.

A DAY IN THE LIFE
The Analyst will be responsible for lululemon's Supplier Inclusion and Diversity data. The Analyst's responsibilities include data tools management, multiple source data gathering and analytics, data scrubs, Supplier Inclusion and Diversity key performance indicators, and stakeholder reports. The Analyst will partner with internal and external stakeholders to provide data and tools in support of the growth of the Supplier Inclusion and Diversity program. The Business Analyst has experience with data analytics, building customer facing dashboards, project management and can work in a high-growth vertically integrated global company.

Reporting directly to the Supplier Inclusion and Diversity Program Manager, the Business Analyst will be responsible for Supplier Inclusion and Diversity program data. The Analyst's focus will be to:


Maintain complex supplier diversity data for the Supplier Inclusion and Diversity program.
Act as the primary resource for supplier diversity data requests including diverse supplier certifications and spend reports.
Provide data in support of global procurement sourcing events.
Create and/or manage data tools for collecting and tracking supplier reported diversity spend, third party certifications and compliance.

QUALIFICATIONS


Bachelor's degree in computer science, math, statistics, engineering, business administration or related fields.
3+ years experience in financial analysis and reporting experience with fast pace business data analytics
MS Excel (Pivot tables) and building customer facing dashboards with visualization tools
Exceptional organizational, project management and time management skills
Data driven thinker with proven ability to analyze data
Excellent verbal and written communications skills;
Extremely organized, thorough and takes pride in quality
Proven ability to prioritize and handle multiple tasks in a time sensitive manner
Ability to work with a large amount detail without losing sight of the big picture
Excellent team player as well as the ability to work with limited direction must haves
Ability to communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels

MUST HAVES


Acknowledge the presence of choice in every moment and take personal responsibility for your life.
Possess an entrepreneurial spirit and continuously innovate to achieve great results.
Communicate with honesty and kindness and create the space for others to do the same.
Lead with courage, knowing the possibility of greatness is bigger than the fear of failure.
Foster connection by putting people first and building trusting relationships.
Integrate fun and joy as a way of being and working, aka doesn’t take yourself too seriously.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Business Systems Analyst
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
The Supervisory Control Technology sits within the Global Operations, Credit & Supervisory Controls Technology team that has complex interactions with technical teams throughout the Capital Markets division and wider RBC organization. The group is organized globally with a reporting line into the group head in Toronto.
Within Supervisory Control Technology the Capital Markets Access Control (CMACS platform) supports the Application Access Requests, Authorizations, Provisioning and Reconciliation as part of the regulatory requirement of managing the access control mechanism
If you have technical business system analysis background, and want to apply your technical and functional skills in the aforementioned area then this is a great opportunity to join our high performance and agile team to realize your potential and gain valuable experience through the exciting and innovative technical solutions the team builds.
What will you do?
Requirements Analysis, Requirements Elicitation/Management/ Documentation skills
Advanced level of facilitation and interviewing skills for running business requirements workshops
Advanced knowledge of Application test planning and execution
Knowledge of Data warehousing and reporting concepts
Understanding of business process as well as relational/dimensional data modeling concepts
Understanding of RDBMS concepts and SQL knowledge
Knowledge of SDLC methodologies
Ability to run small to medium enhancement projects independently by creating work breakdown structures, estimating efforts and executing the project within the prescribed timelines.
Provide third line production support
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
Data mapping experience using various file formats including but not limited to excel, csv, xml, txt flat file etc.
Experience with Unix, Windows user groups provisioning and access control
Excel macros and pivot tables, Confluence, SQL experience and be able to write medium complexity queries
Be able to perform dual role of Business Systems Analyst and QA using available BA/QA tools
Very good documentation skills including but not limited to Technical Design Document, Extract Agreements between source and target data owners, Data Mapping, Detailed Requirement Specifications, visio diagrams, use cases etc.
 Nice-to-havePrevious industry experience specific to Access Control, Requisitioning and Provisioning of the access.Automated testing experience
What’s in it for you?We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.Work on technically challenging and intellectually stimulating projects, where you can stretch your technical skills and apply cutting edge technologies to provide solutions to interesting business requirementsOpportunity to learn and develop your technical skills by joining a team of high achievers which is friendly and always willing to help each other and share knowledgeJoin team with very good track record of successful delivery of challenging projects, with leadership that strives to ensure everyone contributes to team success and get recognized for their effort and contributionGood work/life balance
RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

Title: BI Data Analyst
Description:
West Fraser is a leading diversified forest products company, listed on the TSX and NYSE. Recognized for the eighth time as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers, we are a growing company looking for talented people to be part of our team. Are you interested in working for a company that offers both a challenging work environment and a rewarding career path? Our IT Team in Vancouver, BC has an exciting opportunity for :
BI Data Analyst
You will be responsible for the following but not limited to:
Gather business requires for reporting and analytical solutions out of our data and analytical assets, e.g. data warehouse, source system data
Prototype solutions leveraging tools such as SQL, Excel and Power BI
Validate the logic behind measures, aggregations, groupings and filters from a technical and business perspective
Translate business requirements into technical specifications for our ETL and report developers
Develop reporting assets where required, e.g. Power BI Dashboards
Support unit and functional testing of developer outputs
Bridge the gap between the technical solution and the business users during functional and user acceptance testing
Validate production release accuracy and completeness
Support defect resolution and business user sign off
Job Requirements
Have at least 4+ years of experience in business intelligence as an analyst
Proven experience with Power BI is a must, Premium experience is an asset (e.g. Deployment Pipelines)
Knowledge of SQL queries and databases, Oracle database experience is an asset
Proven abilities to take the initiative and be innovative
Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Ability to manage multiple tasks in parallel
Knowledge of the forestry or paper industries is considered an asset
Experience with ERP systems, e.g., JD Edwards is an asset
Experience with Azure Data and BI Services is an asset
Experience with Data Quality tools and techniques
West Fraser is a growing, diversified wood products company with over 60 facilities in North America and Europe. We are the worlds’ largest softwood lumber producer. Our investments include a climate-controlled mill; modern, competitive manufacturing facilities; product innovation; and bioenergy. These investments are adding up to a bright future. Safety is one of West Fraser’s core values and our employees can expect a challenging, stable work environment with career development opportunities.
Apply:
If you are ready to build your career in a company that thrives on growth, internal promotions, training, safe work environment, rewarding work, challenge, and opportunity, come build your career with us at West Fraser: www.westfraser.com/jobs
We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please apply through our online application process. Be sure to attach your resume to your online profile as resumes will not be accepted at the site. No phone inquiries, please.
West Fraser believes inclusive, diverse teams build a more vibrant workforce, safer operations, and a stronger company overall. We strive to create workplaces and leadership teams that are reflective of the diverse communities we are a part of. We will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race, gender, national origin, or any other protected legal characteristic.
West Fraser is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/V/D & Drug-Free Workplace

Title: Analyst, CRM Operations (15-month contract)
Description:
Job Type: Temporary Contract
Reference code: 103115
Primary Location: Multiple Locations, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto; Alma; Amos; Bas St-Laurent; Brossard; Burlington; Bécancour; Calgary; Chicoutimi; Dolbeau; Drummondville; Edmonton; Farnham; Fredericton; Gatineau; Granby; Grand-Mère; Halifax; Havre-Saint-Pierre; Hawkesbury; Jonquière; Kanata; Kitchener; La Baie; La Sarre; Langley; Laval; London; Markham; Matane; Mississauga; Moncton; Montreal; New Richmond; Niagara; Normandin; Ottawa; Prince Albert; Prince George; Quebec City; Regina; Rimouski; Roberval; Rouyn-Noranda; Saguenay; Saint John; Saint-Hyacinthe; Saskatoon; Sept-Îles; Shawinigan; Sherbrooke; St-Félicien; St. John's; Trois-Pistoles; Trois-Rivières; Val D'Or; Vancouver; Vaughan; Victoria; Windsor; Winnipeg
Our Purpose
At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching.
Be encouraged to deepen your technical skills…whatever those may be.
Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness.
Do you enjoy collaborating, thinking holistically and solving problems? This may be the role for you!
What will your typical day look like?
You will assist with daily operations and special projects related to the firm’s internal CRM.
Provide user support and training
Execute daily operational tasks to maintain system administration and access
Assist in troubleshooting and tracking integration issues with enterprise systems
Participate in user acceptance testing
Run/build reports, leveraging SQL
Assist with data analysis, requirements gathering and process documentation
About the team:
As a member of the Marketing Technology team, you will work alongside a team dedicated to supporting internal technologies, platforms and tools that drive the firm’s go-to-market strategy for sales and marketing. We push the boundaries and make great things happen at Deloitte and for our clients.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you!
You are someone who has:
A minimum of 2 years of experience as a support analyst
Experience working in an enterprise system, preferably CRM (Siebel / Salesforce an asset)
A passion for quality customer service and a problem-solving mindset
Experience with analysis, testing and documentation
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Proficiency with Microsoft technology (e.g. Excel, Teams, etc.), SQL, data analytics
Demonstrated ability to multitask, establish priorities, and meet tight deadlines
Ability to navigate between business and technology and be able to present ideas in a logical and easily understandable manner.
Our shared values
While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.
They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.
Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:
Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.

Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.

Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.

Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.

Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.
The next step is yours
Sound like The One Firm. For You?
Apply by May 13, 2022.
At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.
We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!
By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.

Title: Operations Analyst (New Grad)
Description:
Meet our professionals
CGI Insights you can act on
Position Description:
CGI has a unique and challenging opportunity for a proactive leader with strong organizational ability, a keen analytical mind, who is relationship savvy, and has a desire to work with CGI's senior leaders to help to plan and support CGI as we continue to grow.


Supporting four GTA business units, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to display their solid academic background combined with an ambitious entrepreneurial spirit and an affinity to work closely with CGI's senior level management. This role requires the incumbent to work within tight timelines, with competing priorities and evolving requirements.


If you are a Business or Technology graduate with a few years of experience who is keen to be intrinsically involved in Canada's largest and fastest growing IT consulting company, this is the perfect opportunity for you.
Your future duties and responsibilities:
Extract and analyze data from multiple sources and present results for BU strategy decisions. Material must be streamlined, accurate and presented so management can action as needed.
Prepare and distribute data analysis with a focus on the effective representation of quantitative informationManage CRM system and ensure compliance with CGI’s best practices.
Local Account Representative on CRM (MS Dynamics) for GTA. The representative would resolve issues with updating accounts, creating accounts and providing support to members on CRM.Provide sales support to management teams including opportunity tracking, forecasting, deal reviews, advanced sales metrics and reporting, account planning and sales force management.
Co-ordinate material and feedback from multiple sources including the senior leadership team, Finance, Communications and Human Resources to ensure complete and accurate account from all parties.Educate and assist members in the proper use of CGI systems and processes.
Collaborate with Directors, and PCOs to ensure business operations is running smoothly while all processes are followed for audit purposes.Lead off shore teams to ensure quality deliverables that meet the needs of the BU.
Take initiative to ensure the BU meets CGI targets for initiatives as required.
Develop, prepare and present weekly Business Unit Review meetings for directors and senior management.Support the team by running/participating in various internal mini-projects that bring value to our members
Subject matter expert for CGI CRM (MS Dynamics), PSA Finance 9.2, Intellx, RM, and Ensemble
Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
Proactive LeaderAnalytical with Financial acumen
Understanding of data analysis, Financial analysis and financial management (budgeting, estimating, financial analysis)Attention to detail is imperative as data must be accurate and explainable for management decision making.
Advanced MS Office Skills with a focus on PowerPoint and Excel experience with macros an assetStrong written and verbal communication skills
A keen interest/understanding in technology is an assetQuick learner who is flexible and able to multi-task while still adhering to detail
Confident and comfortable interacting with senior leaders at all levels in the organizationPerforms well under pressureStrong problem-solving skillsPositive attitude with a strong desire to learnExcellent organizational and time management/prioritization abilities.
Skills:
Business Analysis
Business Process Analysis
Operations Management
Project Management
Requirements Analysis
Solution Analysis
What you can expect from us:
Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Title: Business Analyst Associate (Rotation Program)
Description:
Job Description:

We are Canada Life
Being a part of Canada Life means you have a voice. This is a place where your unique background, perspectives and talents are valued, and shape our future success.
You can be your best here. You’re part of a diverse and inclusive workplace where your career and well-being are championed. You’ll have the opportunity to excel in your way, finding new and better ways to deliver exceptional customer and advisor experiences.
Together, as part of a great team, you’ll deliver on our shared purpose to improve the well-being of Canadians. It’s our driving force. Become part of a strong and successful company that’s trusted by millions of Canadians to do the right thing.
Be your best at Canada Life.
We are looking for recent graduates to join our Associate Business Analyst rotational program.
Given the size and scope of our organization, we have the flexibility for this position to be located in the following head office locations: Toronto, London, Winnipeg, Waterloo.
Role description
The Canada Life Business Analyst Development Program is a full-time three-year rotational program for recent graduates, designed to attract, develop and retain top talent and build a business analysis pipeline within our Group Customer organization.
Within its assigned business unit, the Associate Business Analyst will be responsible for identifying, documenting, presenting, and implementing solutions to address business problems or opportunities. Although the nature of projects supported by the Associate Business Analyst will vary from one business unit to the next, projects will typically be related to systems enhancements or business process improvements.
The Business Analyst Development Program also provides diverse learning opportunities, a mentor program, and the ability to engage in the broader business analysis community within Canada Life. Upon completing the program participants will transition into their longer-term role within the organization.
What you will do
Work closely with stakeholder groups and Business Analysts to gather requirements.
Take part in project or product meetings, walkthroughs, and reviews.
Perform data exploration to assess opportunities and quantify their value.
Contribute to the creation of business cases, including cost benefit analyses.
Participate in the development of test cases in advance of implementation.
Execute test cases and document test results and defects.
Provide execution and implementation support to the business.
What you will bring
Recent post-secondary education related to business or business analysis, with Business Analyst courses or knowledge.
Familiarity with business analysis methodologies and principles.
Demonstrated ability & enthusiasm to develop technical knowledge of systems and business processes.
Strong Excel skills.
Creative problem solver.
Be your best at Canada Life- Apply today
We are one of Canada's top 100 employers!
Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.
We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.
Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted

Title: Network Analyst – Data Centre (Network Analyst)
Description:
Job Description:

POSITION PURPOSE
Reporting to a Projects Manager, ITS, is responsible for providing customer support, maintenance, repairs, upgrades, system backups and documentation of data centre and networking components, including servers, storage, security, software, virtual desktop, network and disaster recovery, etc; working closely with ITS staff, Senior Analysts and vendors to ensure all data centre and networking components are monitored, maintained, available, reliable and of sufficient capacity and capability to support current and future infrastructure initiatives.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES
Utilizes incident tracking software to manage requests for support from customers and the IT Service Desk, in compliance with corporate and ITS standards, guidelines and policies.
Maintains customer’s active directory accounts, including the creation, deletion and modification of accounts, groups, distribution lists and network print queues in accordance with appropriate security policies and specifics of customer requests.
Works with vendors to unpack, move, install, configure, maintain and repair data centre and networking components.
Creates and maintains documentation and diagrams of data centre and networking components, including locations, serial numbers, revision levels, software licensing and service history.
Creates, maintains and documents standard operating procedures to ensure system backup, security and daily procedures are effective, documented and followed.
Performs monitoring and maintenance procedures on data centre and networking components and makes recommendations for improvements in reliability, availability, incident, and problem management procedures.
Utilizes enterprise backup software to ensure all system backups and restores are performed in compliance with records management policies and customer requests.
Works with ITS staff, customers and vendors to configure and support data centre and networking components.
Provides support and guidance to other team members, ensuring effective knowledge transfer.
Performs backup duties for the Senior Network Analyst occasionally for the Network Analyst – LAN/WAN, as required.
Utilizes enterprise backup software to ensure all system backups and restores are performed in compliance with records management policies and customer requests.
Works with ITS staff, customers and vendors to configure and support data centre and networking components.
Provides support and guidance to other team members, ensuring effective knowledge transfer.
Ensures that services provided meet Regional customer service standards.
QUALIFICATIONS
Successful completion of a Community College Diploma in Information Technology or a related discipline or approved equivalent combination of education and experience.
Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE) and Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA).
Minimum three (3) years experience in the Information Technology field maintaining a server and networking infrastructure for a large organization, including enterprise class services, storage area networks, backup devices, Enterprise backup software and email systems, network switches, routers, and management software, Microsoft server operating systems and utilities and TCP/IP network infrastructure.
Experience with:
Microsoft Multi-Site Active Directory environments, ADFS and Azure AD.
VMware and Citrix infrastructure support and administration.
Microsoft PowerShell and other scripting languages.
Current Microsoft Exchange Server support and administration.
Enterprise Backup solution support and administration.
Current Microsoft Collaboration tools support and administration.
Enterprise SAN support and administration
Experience in a Microsoft LAN/WAN environment and voice over IP solutions.
Satisfactory Police Criminal Background Check.
Knowledge and demonstrated ability in corporate core competencies including communication, innovation, teamwork and collaboration, and personal ownership.
communication, team work, initiative/self management and accountability and flexibility/adaptability.
Knowledge of project management tools.
Organizational and time management skills to determine priorities, assess, and resolve issues within deadlines.

Title: E-Commerce Analyst
Description: Position Summary: Supports sourcing strategies, onboarding process of new vendors, and new product validation in alignment with Gordon Food Service Category merchandising strategies. Uses knowledge and resourcefulness to support daily business needs and ensure customers receive exceptional service and technical support. Provides performance analysis recommendations to support the Business Manager with category management decision-making and merchandising strategy development to maximize Gordon Food Service (GFS) sales and profits.Essential Functions: Communication & Relationship BuildingDevelops communication of relevant product and vendor information to support Division needs, procurement, logistics, quality assurance, brands and other departments as appropriate.Build relationships and ensures vendor performance through regular communication and Vendor Business Reviews.Collaborates with Merchandising and Marketing Service Center (MMSC) to resolve issues and share ideas.Serves as a support person for team to help with questions and troubleshooting issues.Item & Vendor ManagementProvides support and recommendations for product sourcing and validation.Collaborates with the Business Manager and Category Teams to ensure that appropriate products are effectively prioritized, marketed, and merchandised.Negotiates cost with special order vendors and updates vendor cost in GFS’ cost system. Implements proper margin of special order(s) in the system.Collaborates with EPO vendors to expedite Customer Development Specialist’s (CDS) rush orders.Initiates, negotiates and executes the return of drop-ship products to special order vendors.Approves new product setup and executes introduction, conversion, and discontinuance.Executes all aspects product life-cycle management, from initial sourcing and market introduction to deletion.Effectively manages expenses associated with tools and promotions within budget.Works collaboratively with other peers towards continuous improvement of existing processes and development of new tools to drive greater business efficienciesWorks with Quality Assurance to review compliance for product recalls and withdrawals for assigned product linesDevelops and manages strategic relationships with select vendors through regular communications and Vendor Business Reviews.Represents NA Merchandising Operations on special projects or cross-functional teams.Collaborates with the divisional key customer stakeholders, regional merchandising teams, and Home Office teams to establish appropriate sales, brand, and margin on item/vendor portfolios.Assists with interviewing, onboarding, and training of new team membersBusiness AnalyticsCollects, analyzes, summarizes and presents product sales and financial performance data to create recommendations and implement improvements in support of category analysis, business strategy, CMR preparation and vendor business reviews.Responsible for acquisition, accuracy, timeliness and relevance of core product data information.Assists the Project Manager in supporting the corporate marketing campaigns including campaign reporting.Performs other duties as assigned.Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Marketing / Product - knowledge of principles and methods for merchandising products and services. Knowledge of product and marketing segments.Project Management Skills - able to understand, follow and create processes in order to complete projects.Self-Management - Must have good time management and organizational skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously and to complete assign work on time and on budget. Must be results oriented and have excellent team skills.Customer Service — Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.Business Acumen - Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.Data Analysis / Analytics Skills - Proficiency in analyzing information; able to use analytics and associated tools (e.g., Excel, Access) in creative ways to tell the product story, garner buy-in, provide insights and to support decision-making.Active Listening — giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.Complex Problem Solving — identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.Critical Thinking — using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.Judgment and Decision Making — Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.Speaking and Writing — Requires effective verbal, written, and presentation skills in order to support projects, convey findings, share strategies and implement product marketing/merchandising presentations, or to sell an idea in a variety of ways including written correspondence, face-to-face, or group meetings.Coordination — adjusting actions in relation to others' actions.Maintains a working knowledge of quality assurance requirements and vendor compliance.Maintains knowledge of industry trends and developments by reading appropriate books, journals and other literature and attending related conferences, seminars, etc. Maintains industry relationships to share issues and ideas.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentBenefits:Dental careDisability insuranceEmployee assistance programExtended health careLife insurancePaid time offProfit sharingRRSP matchVision careWork from homeSchedule:Monday to Friday

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
A propos de Talan
 Talan Canada est en pleine croissance et cherche à renforcer ses équipes avec plusieurs Data Analyst pour le bureau de Montréal, capables d'intervenir auprès de clients principalement dans le domaine de la finance, de l’assurance ainsi que de la télécommunication.
 Responsabilités principales

Analyser et interpréter les résultats de plusieurs sources de données :
 Web Analytics (Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, Power BI, Agency Analytics, etc.);
 plateformes sociales (Facebook Insights, Twitter Analytics, etc.) ;
 plateformes média (Double Click, etc.) et CRM (Sales Force) ;
 Base de données SQL.
Développer des rapports et analyser des campagnes interactives et la performance globale des sites Web.
Consolidez les données dans des tableaux de bord
Développer et entretenir des relations avec les principales parties prenantes de l'unité commerciale ainsi qu'avec les partenaires du projet (équipe de développement, BI, informatique, agences externes et service client). ·

 Exigences

 Baccalauréat avec Minimum de 2 ans d'expérience dans un rôle similaire. ·
 Grande expérience avec Power BI. ·
 Vaste connaissance des bases de données, langage SQL, Microsoft SQL Server, JavaScript (atout). ·
 Expert avec Microsoft Excel (tableaux croisés dynamiques, macros, conception de modèles, interface de base de données). ·
 Connaissance des stratégies de marketing des nouveaux médias et du marketing interactif. ·

Title: Business Analyst, Strategic Accounts
Description:
Wolseley Canada requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by Health Canada, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.

As the world’s number one distributor of heating, plumbing, industrial, and waterworks supplies, we know that talented people are essential to maintaining our success in the future.
Wolseley Canada provides an environment where employees can take their skills, talents, experience and interests to the next level to grow professionally and build rewarding careers.
Wolseley Canada offers many challenging and diverse career opportunities in our local branch networks and throughout our Regional and Corporate offices across Canada.
We are driven to achieve results, collaborate with each other to determine the best course of action, hold ourselves accountable at all times and demonstrate resilience when new challenges come our way.
Does this sound like you? Do you want to make a difference and grow your career? If so, then come join our talented and high performing team.
What’s in it for you?Full health care benefits starting day one.Career development and training opportunitiesComprehensive benefits with premiums fully paid for by the company for the “Core” package.Life insurance, disability and wellness programsRetirement savings programs including RRSP and DC pension with up to 5.25% employer contributionPaid vacation and sick time and day off on your birthday!Bonus programs that include annual performance and profit sharingEmployee discounts on top brands of plumbing and HVAC/R productsEducation reimbursement for employeesEmployee referral programSafety shoe reimbursement
What you will do:
Assisting the Strategic Accounts team in all areas of business analytics
Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements, monitoring deliverables, and ensuring timely completion of projects
Understanding and assessing the changing needs of the business, analyzing the impacts of change, and capturing requirements needed to initiate a change
Effectively communicating insights and plans to cross functional team members and management
Communicate actionable, data-driven insights that improve decision-making capabilities
Ability to operate effectively in a matrix environment utilizing strong teamwork
Creating reports to support quality data output and to provide management information, generating ongoing routine reports as well as ad-hoc reports when needed
Identify business areas that can be improved to increase profitability, efficiency and strengthen business processes and communicate findings to help implement change
Creating pricing proposals for Strategic Accounts with the direction of the Strategic Account Managers
Analyzing sales trends for the Strategic Accounts to influence decisions
Completing rebate reporting to ensure customer and vendor incentives are being paid
Work overtime as needed
What you will bring:
Proficient with Microsoft Excel and Access at an advanced level
Familiar with database tools and concepts applied via Microsoft Access
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills
Must have strong business acumen
Self-motivated, highly organized and process oriented
Experience in Wholesale Distribution as it relates to
Plumbing, HVAC/R, Waterworks, Industrial would be
an asset
Knowledge of AS400 system would be an asset
Experience with Tableau would be an asset

Title: Inventory Analyst
Description:
Are you ready for a taste of the one of Canada's Top Employers? Purdys Chocolatier is delighted to have been voted by our employees as one of the Canada's Best Employers. This esteemed award is a testament to the rich texture of our history and our more than 100 years of dedication to quality, trust, tradition, and innovation. The Purdys difference is that we truly recognize the value of our people. 
 
 We reward you with competitive compensation, recognition for your achievements, opportunities for ongoing training to grow professionally and personally, delicious perks, and much, much more. Purdys Chocolatier is looking for an Inventory Analyst to join our Kingsway Office in Vancouver, BC! Under the direction of the Inventory & Scheduling Manager, the Inventory Analyst is responsible for inventory accuracy and inventory control processes within the organization. The Inventory Analyst has a critical role within the supply chain, ensuring that inventory levels across all product types (raw materials, packaging, bulk materials, finished goods) remain accurate so that the supply chain can make informed and accurate decisions in support of the business. 
 
 The Inventory Analyst works closely with production staff in investigating any variances, attributing root causes, and identifying corrective actions. The Inventory Analyst also works closely with the Supply Planner to ensure inventory levels are optimized to meet high levels of fill rate/service levels. As the Inventory Analyst, primary responsibilities include but are not limited to: • Auditing and developing inventory control processes to drive continuous improvement in inventory accuracy while balancing the needs of each respective department impacted • Making recommendations to the business on industry best practices for inventory control • Aiding in the development and integration of ERP & WMS software upgrades to better fulfill inventory management needs • Maintains system data to ensure reports are accurate to forecast needs and delivery requirements for purchasing and production • Makes recommendations on the strategic annual, monthly, weekly cycle count schedules • Adjusts inventory based upon thorough analysis and understanding of cycle count results • Identifies transactions that require investigations and carries out investigations to maintain inventory accuracy • Monitors work order completion and maintains planned orders to ensure MRP requirements remain accurate • Runs MRP at regular intervals • Prepares reports that indicate production progress; communicates issues proactively • Identifies and manages short-dated materials to minimize inventory obsolescence • Determines and manages appropriate safety stock levels • Analyzes changes in forecasts and communicates ramifications/risks to stakeholders • Identifying and reporting on orphaned and excess inventory to minimize inventory obsolescence • Supports physical inventory counts and performs other duties as assigned All successful candidates must possess the following: • Experience in logistics, planning, scheduling, using MRP software or relevant education in Operations Management, with a focus on planning and scheduling • Demonstrated problem solving abilities with excellent time management capabilities • Excellent communication, planning and organizational skills • Experience with inventory management in a retail-based environment (using POS) an asset • Strong data analysis skills • Ability to do root cause analysis • Ability to lead and influence others and create a teamwork environment • Expertise in Microsoft Excel (required), Power BI, Syteline (ERP), WMS • Strong knowledge of GMP’s in a food environment • Ability to work flexible shift times • Candidates working towards a professional supply chain certification will be an asset (APICS, SCMP) Purdys Chocolatier recognizes the value of skills and knowledge gained outside of formal education and paid employment. Applicants who present an equivalent combination of qualifications and experience will be considered and are encouraged to apply. 
 
 We thank all applicants for their interest in Purdys Chocolatier, but due to the volume of applications received, we are only able to contact those applicants who have been selected for an interview. No phone calls please. Purdys Chocolatier is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us via email at resumes@purdys.com

Title: Sr Analyst - Data and Analytics Platform
Description:
Joining Suncor means you will work for one of the best companies in Canada, providing tremendous future potential where talented people thrive and lead. As our business evolves, so do our employment opportunities. Our work culture includes a dynamic mix of professionals, with a diversity of skills and expertise.
We are looking for an individual who is excited to learn about new technologies, automating and streamlining processes. In this role, you will act as a champion for the Data and Analytics Platform, providing expertise to mature and develop our processes and tools while enabling our product teams to accelerate their speed and frequency of delivery.
Minimum Requirements:
Three years of experience in Information Technology, Data Management or Data Governance
A Bachelor’s degree or a technical diploma in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or related field
Understanding of product management and agile delivery techniques and systems
Ability to work in an Agile environment and continuously review business needs, refine priorities, outline milestones and deliverables, and identify opportunities and risks
Knowledge of industry data and analytics practices, tools and processes
Proven ability in servant leadership, team development and culture promotion
Strong interpersonal, communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills, and can communicate to a wide range of stakeholders including senior leadership
Demonstrated skills in design thinking, automation, and agile practices; and awareness of new digital technologies and use cases within the business and how to implement them
Responsibilities:
Help lead the enablement, operationalization and maturity of Data and Analytics capabilities in support of the platform and champion and evangelize the platform’s mandate, capabilities and offered services
Collaborate effectively with diverse cross functional teams to ensure current and future demand is well understood, prioritized and documented accordingly
Create, manage, and sustain stakeholder and vendor relationships, and collaborate with business and functional stakeholders to develop comprehensive technical solutions to meet product objectives and services
Continually identify, manage, and communicate opportunity vs. risk as it relates to the platform, stakeholders, and Suncor overall
Ensure platform standards, guidelines and governance is well managed, documented and followed by stakeholders leveraging our services
Work closely with product and project teams to provide input and help define, prioritize and groom their backlogs
Apply knowledge of various product management techniques to initiatives, and understand and promote delivery methodologies (i.e. Scrum, Kanban)
Location and other Key Details:
You will work out of our Calgary head office, located in the Suncor Energy Centre at 150 – 6th Ave S.W.
Hours of work are a regular 40-hour work week, Monday to Friday
Why Suncor?
Our operations include oil sands development and upgrading, conventional and offshore oil and gas production, petroleum refining, and our product marketing under the Petro-Canada brand. Our renewable energy portfolio includes investments in four operating wind farms and the operation of an ethanol plant. And our use of innovative technology has made us an industry leader in the energy business.
With a strong strategy for growth and our long-standing approach to sustainability, operational excellence, capital discipline and technology and innovation, Suncor offers a solid foundation for you to continue building your career. We offer rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions – all of which means tremendous potential for your future. We are focused on deepening our commitment to inclusion and diversity and creating a respectful workplace.
We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected. We have numerous employee inclusion networks to help foster an inclusive and respectful culture and drive positive change within Suncor. Current networks include both workplace inclusion networks (focusing on inclusion and respect for all), and identity-focused networks (focusing on building community and a sense of belonging and allyship). Through the Journey of Reconciliation, we are progressing the way we think and act to build greater mutual trust and respect with the Indigenous Peoples in Canada. Please note we will consider accessibility accommodations to applicants upon request.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Analyst, Business Systems
Description:
Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations. Our team of nearly 40,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.
Effective October 26th, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization “WHO” approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.
The Analyst, Business Systems provides support to an assigned portfolio in the areas of knowledge management, decision support and in corporate business areas by interpreting business strategies and objectives that support the selection, procurement and implementation of appropriate information systems applications. Analyzes business process reengineering concepts and methods and provides documentation of business requirements on information management projects. Provides analyst support for all phases of assigned systems development and implementation projects including providing hands-on application support. May lead small information systems projects.
Build on your experience as you:
Provides systems analysis by participating in the establishment of system scope and objectives, conducting feasibility studies, planning or modifying procedures to solve system problems, and preparing detailed specifications for development work. Solves existing systems logic difficulties as required.
Provides business analysis by performing functions such as work flow analysis, developing business information requirements and models, assisting in defining business scope and objectives, planning, designing, or modifying practical manual and automated business procedures.
Participates in strategic planning support and change management services by assisting the Manager, Senior Consultant or Consultant on projects that include confidential initiatives that may result in the loss of FTEs and that support the selection, procurement and implementation of appropriate information systems applications; conducts feasibility studies, workload efficiency analysis using formal data gathering techniques; identifies system deficiencies, user department operational inefficiencies and ways of improving business efficiency functions.
Under the direction of the Senior Consultant or the Consultant, participates in information systems projects by providing business systems analysis support. May lead small projects.
Provides third level application support and ensures that the application service level agreement is maintained and meets business expectations and Information Management capabilities.
Are you motivated to join us? We are looking for you to have the following:
Bachelor's degree in Health Information Science or Computer Science.
Two (2) to four (4) years' experience with business and systems analysis or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
An equivalent combination of education, training, and experience will be considered.
We have a full-time role available. This position will be based at our Central City Offices, Surrey, BC
If this sounds like the excellent role for you, here are more reasons why you should apply:
A career that offers you the opportunity to work in a fast growing and exciting organization with health care providers who are excellent in their respective fields.
Fantastic opportunities for support and management roles are available as you advance within the organization.
Competitive salary package, including comprehensive health benefits coverage.
A chance to create a difference every day in the world of health care.
Take the next step in your career and make a difference in the communities we serve! Apply today, so we can continue the conversation.
Curious to know what it’s like to work here ? Like us on Facebook (@fraserhealthcareers), follow us on Twitter & Instagram (@FHCareer), or connect with us on LinkedIn (fraserhealthcareers) for first-hand employee insights.
