Title: Data Visualization & Reporting Specialist
Description: PURPOSE: The Data Visualization & Reporting Specialist has an infectious enthusiasm to help others see what’s possible with data. An integral part of the Data Analytics program, they are responsible for supporting BCMEA’s continued progression toward a culture of data-driven decisions by taking a lead role on the DataHelp service desk.The Data Visualization & Reporting Specialist develops and maintains reproducible Tableau reports and dashboards, publishes them to Tableau Server, establishes subscriptions, and drives engagement and data literacy across the organization by always following-up with staff to ensure they know how to use the tools, and to provide any support possible to ensure staff have the information needed to make data-driven decisions and streamline their workflows where possible.The Data Visualization & Reporting Specialist coordinates with the rest of the Data Analytics Program by elevating complex analysis and modeling requests to Data Scientists, and by elevating the creation of customs data views to the Solution Data Architect. The team collaborates by assigning project leadership on a case-by-case basis, so interests and proven proficiency tend to lead to diverse opportunities for analytical work given the breadth of BCMEA’s operations.RESPONSIBILITIES AND ACTIVITIES: Deliver “how to” presentations and sessions to individuals and to groupsDesign and develop dashboards using data visualization best practicesDevelop custom reports and publish to Tableau Server upholding Data Analytics program standardsContinually look for ways to improve data collection and reporting; ensuring stakeholder’s needs are met efficiently through centralized dataReview report and dashboard usage regularly and follow-up with expected users if usage low in order to make any necessary changesWork closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and prioritiesDesign and conduct data quality validation and assurance audits to ensure continued completeness and accuracy of dataProvide accurate and relevant data to ad hoc information requestsKNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES: Undergraduate degree, diploma, or certificate in related disciplineExcited to share your enthusiasm about data and visualizationExcellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with and present to a wide range of audiences across the organizationProven organizational and analytical skills and problem-solving attitudeExperience gathering and analyzing report requirementsProficiency with Tableau Desktop and Tableau ServerProficiency in Microsoft Excel & PowerPointKnowledge on data governance including data integrity, standardization, change management, auditability and data securityExperience in a unionized environment beneficialWe thank all applicants for their interest; however only those selected for interviews will be contacted. The BCMEA is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes all applicants.Job Type: Full-timeSchedule:Monday to FridayCOVID-19 considerations:Masks are optional, signs are posted for social distancing, and sanitizer are posted at all doors.

Title: Analyst, Logistics Operations
Description:
We at Resolute are a diverse group of individuals who possess a wide variety of skills. Here, we believe that giving you the ability to maximize your potential without constraint is key to our shared success.

Our MONTREAL location in Quebec, Canada is currently seeking talent to fill the position of Analyst, Logistics Operations. This job is permanent, full-time.
.
Your challenges:
Reporting to the Supervisor, Logistics Analysis, the Analyst, Logistics will have the overall responsibility for providing required data, information, reports and KPI’s for the corporate Logistics team, relating to all logistics activities for paper, pulp and forest products in both domestic and international markets.

More specifically, you will focus on the following areas:
Extract required data from the Corporation’s legacy systems and, in conjunction with the implementation plan, incorporate data extraction using SAP Business Warehouse;Perform weekly and monthly monitoring and maintenance on the corporate demand planning system for the pulp and paper forecasts;Develop and facilitate logistics information needs through SAP Business Warehouse through project roll out;Develop processes to make the required data available for use on an ongoing basis for the Logistics and Planning team;Provide customized logistics reports and analysis for the managers, as required;Participate in contract negotiations and in logistics operation projects;Maintain necessary data inputs, collect appropriate information, and provide analytical input for the weekly S&OP report for Planning and the monthly Senior Management Report on Logistics.

Your profile:
Bachelor's Degree in IT or appropriate certification in IT within a large manufacturing environment and/or equivalent business experience;Minimum 1-3 years Logistics experience within a large scales manufacturing environment in a similar role;Demonstrated ability to successfully design processes and provide analysis for a large Logistics Team;Excellent knowledge of ERP/MRP applications software especially inventory management and production planning;Very good working knowledge of MS Office (Power User);Use and/or exposure to SAP (asset);Strong communication skills in English and French (verbal and written) and presentation competencies.

Your skills:
Ability to work autonomously, to manage and prioritize multiple projects;Strong organization and analytical skills;Customer oriented;Problem solving;Decision making;Results oriented;Team work.

Forest products are essential, as are each and every one of our employees and contractors. We take the necessary steps to protect the health and well-being of our employees and to safeguard the integrity of all Resolute facilities.

We are all in this together. We are one community. We are #RESOLUTEPROUD

Be part of the change. Be part of a dynamic team.
We are a global leader in the forest products industry offering an energetic and safe work environment with opportunities and challenges that will help develop your skills. We are more than 8,000 employees in Canada, the United States and various other international locations.

We are looking for employees with the experience and expertise to improve our efficiency, increase our long-term profitability and deliver first-class products and services to our customers. And you, what are you looking for?

We are a company writing a new story for itself in a rapidly changing industry. We have made important inroads to ensure our viability and to be an environmental supplier of choice. Come take part of our history and be part of the change!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Join our Winning Team as a Business Data Analyst
When was the last time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do it every day. Why? Because we’re proud to work for a company with a strong mission and trusted brand. We’re proud to work with people who care about what they do and work hard every day to deliver their best. And just announced, the return of the 4-day work week from May 30th through Labour Day! We’ve created the type of company culture where the term, “work- hard play- hard” isn’t just a catchy saying, it’s part of the #CARFAXdifference!
The Business Data Analyst is a part of the Data Services Team which transforms data from vetted sources into valuable information our customers trust. This involves complex research and analysis, strategic thinking, and strong problem solving skills as well as the ability to work cross-functionally across multiple departments and as part of a team.
As a Business Data Analyst you will:
Do complex research and analysis to support business initiatives, projects, and products
Identify and implement ways to improve data quality and data integrity
Derive, document, and communicate analytical business requirements
Demonstrate your areas of expertise by identifying data norms and anomalies and providing insight
Work with internal stakeholders to extract maximum value from data
To be considered for this role, you will need:
A minimum of 4+ years of direct experience performing data analytics
Bachelor’s degree required
Experience in writing SQL queries
Advanced EXCEL skills
Knowledge of SPSS, SAS, or R (strong R studio skills a significant plus)
Strong verbal and written communication skills, emphasizing technical writing
Strong problem-solving, analytical, and support skills; you’re a strategic thinker
Experience in effectively communicating analysis and insight to all levels of the organization
An appetite for continuous learning and confidence to challenge the status quo

Title: Business Analyst – Production Support
Description:
BUSINESS ANALYST – PRODUCTION SUPPORT (JOB NUMBER: OPS-040822-001-ARC)
  





At BNP Paribas Canada, it is our employees which make the difference... Our 75 nationalities are part of our diversity!
Do you like challenges, a structured framework, the prospect of optimizing and innovating? You are known for your originality and want a certain freedom to think while sharing your knowledge and ideas?


... Come help us contribute to the growth of our Canadian platform!


You will benefit amongst other things from:

Access to social volunteer and recreational programs, via our many Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)
Opportunities for career development through active internal mobility and our innovative training program: Canada Academy
A brand new workspace, flexible, comfortable and easily adaptable to your needs: remote work opportunities, standing desks, innovation lab., open meeting rooms and spaces


 
REPORT TO
Head of Global Banking Operations


MISSION AND OBJECTIVES
The mission of the Production Support Team is to provide technical assistance to the Loan Servicing and Trade Finance Global Operations Teams as well as to provide operational support when needed in supporting day-to-day operations.


MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
For Corporate Banking Operations, perform specified duties in support of Operations including, but not limited to, as follows:

Serve as a point of contact for Operations Teams reporting of processing and systems incidents, performing initial analysis and attempt to resolve prior to referral to relevant Application Support team if further analysis/action is required.
Performance of control procedures, including review of exception reports, investigation and follow-up for resolution of exception items;
Perform sanctions screening and follow-up as well as other support functions related to the trade finance activity;
Perform production support duties related to the loan, trade, supply chain and payment systems utilized by Corporate Banking Operations, including but not limited to review and approval of remittance instructions in Operations and Payments systems, including sanctions screening related thereto.
Serve as a back-up resource for operations processing when workload peaks require additional resources in the Operations Teams.

For Corporate Banking specific projects / initiatives, i.e. process improvement or implementation of a new activity / product:
 Assist in the execution of Global Banking Operations Line projects / initiatives for process improvements: prioritize, structure, plan, and execute projects in accordance with ITO-CB’s project management methodology and standards, as follows:

As directed document and update project plan; report project status, issues, and risks to the project manager. Participate in and contribute to the preparation of project meetings
Participate in the creation and execution of test cases
Participates in projects to optimize / streamline ops line processes and procedures and assist the project managers in all aspects of the project as directed:

Assist in the execution of the regional piece of global ITO-CB initiatives / projects, support deployment of major CIB group initiatives, and collaborate with IT teams (BA, Application Support and Development) on IT projects for the business requirement, testing, and roll-out phases:



In conjunction with the project team, assist in understanding business needs and in devising an efficient and effective solution to meet those needs
Participate in the functional testing phase (i.e. User Acceptance Test) of production system enhancements / new functionalities / other ops line IT initiatives in coordination / collaboration with Operations, IT, and external stakeholders (e.g. Finance, Risk). Contribute to the preparation of functional test cases and test plans. Also performs UAT processes and analysis of results as assigned
Participate in the implementation of system enhancements / new functionalities; make recommendations to optimize the use of systems and/or streamline processing; assist in the data migration effort following migration and contingency plans, deployment schedules, and procedures
Ensure timely completion of quality deliverables, identify and manage dependencies / critical path, monitor progress, and report project status to the various project committee meetings


Populate dashboards and help monitor KPIs for operational efficiency and performance contributing to:

Defining KPIs for operational efficiency and performance
Determining the reporting process for the ops line to include statistical reporting


 
Participate in periodic process reviews to ensure continuous improvement of ops line processes



 


REQUIREMENTS
TRAINING AND OCCUPATIONAL EXPERIENCE
Knowledge in the Global Banking Operations services industry with transversal knowledge of a wide range of banking products and processes, such as Trade Finance Operations, Lending Operations, ALM, Cash Management, Payments, Management Accounting, and Financial Reporting

ESSENTIAL SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS
Experience with banking applications (e.g. loan / credit management, trade finance, and cash management / payment applications), ability to develop understanding of the applications utilized by the Bank 
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills – i.e. the ability to anticipate problems and solve them quickly and effectively


SKILLS AND BEHAVIOURS
Proficiency in MS Office Suite, particularly Excel
Proficiency in Excel macros a plus
Excellent verbal and written communications skills
Strong team player


About BNP Paribas
With more than 200,000 employees in 72 countries, the Group serves nearly 32 million individual customers and 850,000 professionals, entrepreneurs, SMEs and large companies. BNP Paribas is a leading bank in the euro zone and a leading international banking player.


Did you know? In 2019, BNP Paribas named World’s Best Bank for Corporate Responsibility 2019


About BNP Paribas in Canada
With more than 900 employees, BNP Paribas Canada continues to attract experts from diverse fields as well as ambitious young talent from around the world. We are proud to offer our employees a rewarding and international workplace where they can build their professional careers by honing their skills, meeting challenges and enriching their knowledge of the financial industry.
A recruitment policy that promotes equality and diversity:
BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer. BNP Paribas recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, and other protected status (Employment Equity Act).
Part of BNP Paribas dedication to diversity, multiculturalism and inclusion is clearly reflected on how we believe and live diversity and inclusion all together. As such, one of BNP Paribas’ initiatives is hosting Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) which are focused on equality of gender, sexual orientation and learning from other cultures.
We can assist with access to job offers for people with disabilities who may be unable to use our career site - please contact us by email canada_recrutement@ca.bnpparibas.com or by phone on 514-285-6000


Want to know more about the BNP Paribas Group?
https://group.bnpparibas/en/group
** Only selected applications that meet the requirements of the role will be contacted **

Title: Revenue Management Analyst
Description:
#BeExtraordinary
At Andrew Peller Limited (APL), we deliver the perfect brand experience for every lifestyle, occasion, and generation. Through collaboration, open communication, honesty, drive to win, and accountability, we inspire teammates to be extraordinary every day.
Who We Are
We are one of Canada's largest and oldest wine companies with a rich heritage in quality winemaking.
We produce some of Canada's most recognized brands and offer our teammates a challenging and rewarding employment experience.
We are seeking a Revenue Management Analyst to join our Business Insights & Revenue Management Team!
The National Revenue Analyst will work closely with the Sales, Marketing, and Customer Solutions team nationally to provide valuable insights to help identify and maximize pricing opportunities to enhance revenue and profit. They are responsible for assisting the Senior Revenue Manager and Director in creating and executing on the revenue management process across the country for all channels and categories at Andrew Peller. This includes research into pricing, promotions and pack sizes, and innovation.
We are looking for a teammate with:
Bachelor's degree required, Economics, Business, Sciences, Math or Accounting.
3-5 years' experience in Net Revenue Management/ commercial strategy. Prior experience in Category, FP&A and Channel Marketing is preferred.
Experience using financial systems (MS Office, Tableau, EPM)
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Financial Acumen - analytically oriented
Prior Experience in creating compelling revenue management decks for Executive Management
This teammate will be accountable for:
Researching, gathering, and analyzing data to develop insightful conclusions, generate solutions and support the decision-making processes of the Sales & Marketing teams.
Working proactively with the Sales and Brand Managers to provide analytics to support the development of strategies, financial targets and objectives by channel, segment and brand.
Assisting the sales team to develop market/product specific strategies to ensure profitable growth and win share
Assisting the marketing team with market insights and recommend pricing and promotional strategies based on competitive data
Ad-hoc financial analysis for price and promotional change opportunities
Assist in budget preparation and expense control activities
Conducting competitor/market analysis to determine position in market and a pricing strategy to improve market share
Update and maintain pricing reports such as regional price trackers, VPMs, tableau reports
Analyzing financial statements to determine monthly/quarterly/annual revenue and promotional expenses
Identifying revenue related issues, investigate and provide solutions to resolve issues
Reviewing and recommend continuous improvements to existing revenue management processes and procedures
Assisting in developing internal controls to support revenue management activities
Working with the Marketing team to develop insights, identify product opportunities, and forecasting for new products in the PMR process
We are conducting an internal and external search simultaneously. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest; only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted. In addition, per our "Internal Job Posting Policy"; internal candidates should be in their current position for one (1) year and their performance must be in good standing.
Andrew Peller Limited is committed to meeting the needs of persons with temporary and/or permanent disabilities in a way that allows them to maintain their dignity and independence. We are happy to discuss any need for accommodation in the workplace and will make an effort to meet those needs a timely manner by preventing and removing barriers to accessibility in the areas of information, communications, and employment.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.
At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.


About the role


We’re looking for a Senior Data Analyst, Claims - National Supply Chain to join our growing team!
Workplace: Toronto (700 University Avenue) or Montreal (2020 Robert-Bourassa)
What you’ll do here:
Drive insights by creating and communicating thoughtful analyses of KPIs of our vendors in the claims supply chain (e.g. body shops, restoration companies) nationally.
Drive analysis for strategic projects supporting the National Supply Chain and insights for inquiries from business partners and senior management, to help us manage our supply chain better.
Perform continuous improvements to tools, such as Power BI, data and reports developed or used by National Supply Chain.
Collaborate within a high-performing, high-output team to support business partners; work in collaboration with our claims analytics team.


Qualifications


What you bring to the table:
Relevant college diploma or university degree or any equivalent combination of education and experience
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in an analytics role
Ability and desire to learn and adapt quickly to a changing environment
Ability to analyze and communicate complex results
Proven track record of collaboration across teams
Strong communication skills in effectively working within a virtual team and collaborating with a number of business partners
Ability to prioritize and often meet tight deadlines
Excellent knowledge of programming languages: SQL, VBA; knowledge of SAS is an asset
Excellent knowledge of Office Suite, particularly Excel, Power BI
Working proficiency in English is a must; bilingualism (English and French) is an asset
Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:
An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
An extensive, flexible benefits package
An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle
Flexible Work Arrangements
We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.


Closing Statement


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer
If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.
Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.


Referral Bonus


This role is eligible for employee referral bonus. #myReferrals1000

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description
Publicis Sapient is a digital transformation partner helping established organizations get to their future, digitally-enabled state, both in the way they work and the way they serve their customers. We help unlock value through a start-up mindset and modern methods, fusing strategy, consulting and customer experience with agile engineering and problem-solving creativity. United by our core values and our purpose of helping people thrive in the brave pursuit of next, our 20,000+ people in 53 offices around the world combine experience across technology, data sciences, consulting and customer obsession to accelerate our clients’ businesses through designing the products and services their customers truly value.

Job Description
Your Impact

You will function as part of a world class Data Analytics team to support experience optimization, data driven storytelling and digital insights.

Primarily responsible for digital analytics, A/B testing and multivariate testing and experimentation to optimize the customer experience - hands on Adobe Target/Optimizely/Site Spect experiment execution and analysis a must haveLeverage data to identify optimization opportunities and build the experiment pipelineDeliver data-driven and actionable insights using Adobe Analytics and Google AnalyticsAnalyze customer journeys under an optimization-focused lens, interpret experimentation results to help clients evolve the productsPresent insights to clients and account teams with recommendations backed by robust analysisGuide the team through experimentation learning & best practicesCollaborate with cross-functional teams, including creative, design and engineering to shape meaningful customer journeys and customer centric thinking
Your Skills & Experience

3-6 years of experience with a focus in Digital Analytics and Experimentation/Optimization - A/B and Multivariate testingPassion for digital analytics, working with data and deriving insights to solve client business challengesExperience with Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Google Analytics, Optimizely, SiteSpectAbility to build relationships and work as part of a large, cross functional team to solve complex problems - both with internal teams & external clientsExperience with optimization programs and delivering analytics engagementsHighly motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit & the ability to hit the ground runningStrong consultative skills and the ability to challenge status quo and gain adoption - proven ability to influence stakeholder and senior leaders, and manage organizational change

Additional Information
As part of our dedication to an inclusive and diverse workforce, Publicis Sapient is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at hiring@publicissapient.com or you may call us at +1-617-621-0200.

Title: Data Analyst
Description: We are currently seeking a talented and dynamic individual to join our auto data syndication and client services team. The person hired will be responsible for managing incoming requests from auto dealer clients and for working with our development team to enhance and improve our proprietary new and preowned vehicle syndication data tools. Auto dealers need us to display their vehicles on a multitude of web and mobile platforms in real time and it’s the data syndication team that is responsible for ensuring data consistency across the entire ecosystem.The data syndication team needs to master and help evolve the proprietary data syndication tools that are responsible for ensuring that data consistency is maintained across all data imports and exports with a large variety of technology partners and for over 100 dealers and 100,000 vehicles processed each day.In order to thrive in the role, a candidate will need evolved analytical and organizational skills, and will need to be detail oriented with a passion for offering excellent customer service.Duties: Analyze and interpret the results from multiple data sets;Design and coordinate development projects to improve the platform and work with the software development team to ensure their successful deployment;Efficiently examine and resolve client issues and ensure that resolution is promptly communicated to all interested parties by email or telephone;Provide technical support and clear and concise information to clients, technology partners and sales consultants;Acquire a deep knowledge of the characteristics of our products in order to be able to professionally respond to client requests;Perform quality control tasks on auto dealer vehicle data on a daily basis;Propose, document and apply solutions to all technical problems encountered.Required Skills: Completed post-secondary education in any technical program;Minimum of 2 years experience in a technical support role;Analytically inclined with a talent for problem solving and analyzing data consistency issues;Knowledge and experience using popular application suites including G Suite and Google Chrome. Knowledge of XML, CSV and XLS data files / formats and use of FTP protocol;Ability to correctly communicate using web terminology;Excellent organization and time management skills;Independent and autonomous.Remuneration: A competitive salary is offered based on qualifications and experience.Culture and Benefits: Friendly and supportive co-workersCoffee, snacks and refreshmentsCasual dressWe thank you for your interest in D2C Media. Only candidates with the required knowledge and experience will be contacted for an interview.D2C Media (https://www.d2cmedia.ca) is exclusively dedicated to optimizing the online presence of automotive dealers. With over 1000 automobile dealer clients, it’s no wonder that D2C Media has consistently ranked among the top 500 fastest growing companies in Canada for the past 5 years.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $45,000.00-$50,000.00 per yearBenefits:Casual dressDental careExtended health careLife insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayNo weekendsEducation:DCS / DEC (preferred)Expected start date: 2022-05-02

Title: Business Analyst, Corporate Digitization, Automation & Innovation
Description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
The Corporate Transformation and Operations (CTO) group is made up of six functions and was established to develop a strategy and model to build the capabilities, systems and processes required for best-in-class operations and other enabling capabilities across Finance, Risk, HR and Customer, Community & Corporate (CCC). The CTO represents Corporate Function leaders, in partnership with Technology, to manage BAU operations and deliver change with confidence for corporate technology and data platforms.

The Corporate Digitization, Automation & Innovation (CDAI) team is a team of automation and process improvement professionals who are responsible for developing the strategy, and executing on the delivery of digitization and automation initiatives which create capacity and improve the colleague experience across TD's Corporate areas.
Job Description
The analyst in this role will be a leader and expert on process improvement and automation capabilities. They will support the identification of opportunities, building business cases / implementation plans, and change execution. The team members will be involved in supporting the end-to-end delivery life cycle of process improvement with the following key responsibilities:
Assesses process automation opportunities with Business SME input, develops to-be process design (using Lean principles), and participates in testing and deployment activities as required
Conduct research and analysis of key issues, involving relevant stakeholders and other internal/external groups as necessary
Facilitate and participate in information gathering sessions with business partners to define a problem, understand scope and/or document a current state or future state process flows
Participate in the planning, organizing and executing of continuous improvement projects from conceptual stage through to implementation
Define, quantify and measure benefits for process improvement initiatives
Conduct review of the design and testing deliverables to ensure the solution meets the business requirements
Analyze impacts to customers, stakeholders, employees, process, technology and budgets of selected solutions
Responsible for project management of initiatives; tracks status against timelines, and identifies and escalates risks to Squad leader when required
Undertake and complete a variety of projects and initiatives with minimal guidance/supervision
Build visualizations, dashboards and reports as required
Supports and may contribute to communication and change management activities
Job Requirements
Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly and tactfully with a variety of stakeholders, including senior executives, both verbally and through written materials
Demonstrated ability to manage complexity, including multiple concurrent projects, and meet challenging timelines
Change management expertise, comfortable working with ambiguity
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment, multi-task and work with minimal supervision
Proactive and highly motivated individual with good work ethic and time management skills are essential
Strong team player with excellent communication, relationship management, consensus building and influencing skills
Solid understanding of process improvements such as Lean
Sound to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Excel, Visio, Access, VBA Programing)
Solid knowledge of RPA (i.e. Blue Prism) and visualization (i.e. PowerBi, Tableau) would be an asset
Experience delivering projects using Agile principles and tools such as JIRA would be an asset
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:
Crescent Point Energy is a conventional oil and gas producer with assets strategically focused on properties comprised of high-quality, long-life, operated light and medium oil and natural gas reserves in United States and Canada. Crescent Point strives to create sustainable, value-added growth in reserves, production, and cash flow through the execution of management’s integrated strategy of acquiring, and developing reserves.
Job title: HR Data Analyst
Location: Calgary, AB
Reports to: Team Lead, Data Analytics and Compensation
Employment type: Temporary Full-time (1 year term)
Purpose:
The HR Data Analyst at Crescent Point will be responsible for the development, automation, and maintenance of Human Resources (HR) analyses and reporting tools using Power BI and Excel/macros. This person will support workflows from all areas of HR by creating HR analytics and reporting tools to enable collaboration and efficiencies on our One-HR team.
Main Responsibilities & Activities:
Use Business Intelligence reporting tools and Excel macros to automate workflows
Apply statistical analyses, predictive analytics, and data mining techniques to continue the HR digitalization strategy
Support business workflows from Compensation, Payroll, Benefits, Talent Management, and other HR reporting requests from the business
Design, build and maintain innovative solutions (dashboards and templates) using Power BI and Excel/macros that deliver relevant workforce metrics and automation for effective decision making and planning
Partner with Financial Reporting on G&A budgeting, forecasting and accruals maintained through Power BI
Provide guidance on process improvements to enhance automation and efficiency
Connect people and data through literacy of Power BI tools within the HR department
Think creatively to solve business problems throughout the organization using technology
Support on various HR projects across the HR team
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Post-Secondary degree in Human Resources, Finance, Engineering or Computer Science; Data Analytics or Data Science program is an asset
Minimum of 1 year of experience in data analytics, reporting and forecasting is preferred
Working knowledge of Power BI (proficient in DAX, M, SQL) and demonstrated creation of business informatics
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel, with working experience in building macros and formulas
Experience in HRIS reporting (Workday) is preferred
Strong oral and written communication skills required
Self-starter, must be well organized, able to multi-task and prioritize various initiatives
Team player who demonstrates a love of learning and contributing to team goals
High attention to accuracy and detail
Why Crescent Point:
A highly engaged workforce who is supported, engaged, and connected.
A pilot flexible hybrid work model which allows for flexibility to work remotely up to two days a week as schedules allow.
Diversity & Inclusion:
Crescent Point is committed to building an inclusive organization that harnesses diverse thinking to innovate and grow. We are transforming our talent programming using an inclusive design lens where diverse points of view and talent are supported.
Crescent Point Energy is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes, and work environment. If you require accommodations at any stage in the hiring process, please let your Talent Management team know. This includes conducting interviews in person or virtually via Microsoft Teams. We encourage all qualified candidates to apply.

Title: Global HRIS Analyst
Description:
Job Description
The Global HRIS Analyst acts as the bridge between business needs and technical implementation – by helping Human Resources make informed choices and decisions before bringing requirements to the IT team. By providing superior customer service, acting as reliable subject matter expert and trusted business partner – the Global HRIS Analyst is responsible for managing global HR Technology projects from discovery, requirements gathering, implementation through to maintenance.
Key Areas of Focus:
1. HR Technology Business Analysis – The Global HRIS Analyst supports ATS Automation’s Human Resources Business Partners team globally by bridging business needs to technical implementation. The Global HRIS Analyst listens to ideas, supports discovery process, collaborates, builds current/future state process maps, documents and obtains approvals through internal HR & Corporate IT Governance steering committees.
2. Human Resources Information System (HRIS) Administration – The HRIS at ATS is SuccessFactors (SF) Employee Central (EC). The Global HRIS Analyst must understand SF EC functionality and be able enter and maintain employee data and organizational structure – as well as troubleshoot and train users. ATS also uses SF Recruitment, Onboarding, Performance and Goal Management (PMGM), Succession & Development, Compensation Planning, Learning & Reporting modules – which the Global HRIS Analyst supports in various capacities such as layouts/tiles management, form template management, approvals workflows, language settings, as well as upgrades and enhancements.
3. HR Technology Project Coordination – The Global HRIS Analyst understands and applies project management methodology to design, schedule, build, resource, test and implement requests (new or enhancements). Acting as a change agent, the Global HRIS Analyst makes project goals their own and inspires a sense of shared purpose. Working well under pressure and comfortable with change and complexity in dynamic environments, the Global HRIS Analyst can shift between ‘big picture’ and small (but critical) details.
Additional Information
Education:
Post-Secondary Degree / Diploma in Human Resources, Business, Data Analytics or similar field required
Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) and/or Project Management Professional (PMP) designation or working towards considered an asset
Requirements:
5 years of experience working with SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central
5 years of experience as an HRIS Analyst or related role – organizing and implementing enterprise wide HRIS modules (with at least 2 consecutive years within one organization)
2 years of experience coordinating projects and gathering business requirements using best-in-class tools
Exposure to global HR policies, process and best practices – organizing and maintaining employee data within existing (and potentially new) HR systems and technology.
Advanced MS Excel skills required; confident presentation and communication abilities
Experience and willingness to work in a large, complex and global environment where responsibilities and priorities may shift according to business needs
Highly resilient, comfortable in a fast-paced environment and can calmly navigate change
Exceptional collaboration and communication skills with a passion for providing exceptional customer service
Strong critical thinking, problem-solving, and storytelling skills with the ability to not only manipulate and summarize data, but also derive meaningful interpretations from data and ability to articulate in a simple and impactful way to a non-technical audience
Exposure to acquisitions and high-growth global organizations considered an asset
Demonstrated ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion – and handle sensitive information
Join the Winning Team at ATS Automation, a great place to automate your future! Take your place among the best in the business, and grow your career with the Corporate division at ATS Automation. Join an environment where a passion for innovation is combined with an uncompromised commitment to quality.
We attract some of the most talented and motivated individuals from a range of fields, with our global offering and growth opportunities as we expand on a global scale.
Why Join ATS?
Be a part of a global organization that is a leader in its industry
Subsidized breakfast and lunch daily; free gourmet beverages - coffee, tea and hot chocolate. Plus, Treat Day is every other week!
Monthly “In-Chair Massage” clinic on-site with a Registered Massage Therapist
Ability to participate in a variety of charitable events
Social Club that offers BBQs and other social events throughout the year
Work with other bright, talented people and discover opportunities for professional growth
And much more!
ATS is in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disability Act (AODA), 2005 and will, upon request, assist those who may require specific accommodations due to a personal disability. We would ask that those who require assistance to notify our offices as soon as possible if accommodation is necessary.

Title: Data Analyst - Remote
Description:
Data Analyst
 Who We Are at Elemy:
 Elemy is building the first managed marketplace for in-home chronic medical care, starting with pediatric autism. Our AI-powered technology matches families with like-minded therapists, resulting in better care that helps children learn new behaviors and reach life-changing milestones. Children receiving care with Elemy report a 13% increase in communication skills, 80% reduction in problem behavior, and 140% increase in skill adoption within six months - amazing milestones that further our mission each day.
 Since launching in April 2020, Elemy has become one of the fastest-growing healthcare companies in the United States, scaling from four employees to more than 1,300 employees in less than 18 months. The company is backed by some of the most prominent investors in healthcare and technology, including SoftBank, Goodwater, General Catalyst, Founders Fund, SignalFire, e.ventures, and 8VC.
 Interested in learning more? Watch a mother detail her Elemy experience on NBC News, read Bloomberg’s take on our Series B, listen to Elemy CEO, Yury Yakubchyk, discuss destigmatizing mental health on Spotify, or check out why Dr. Henry Roane was awarded the highest award of its honor in ABA therapy, the American Psychological Association Nathan H. Azrin Distinguished Contribution to Applied Behavior Analysis Award.
 Data Analyst at Elemy
 Analytics teams at Elemy play a critical role in driving rapid, rational decision making in support of product, operations, marketing, engineering, and business teams. We are masters of business context who can apply a broad set of data science & analytics techniques to solve amorphous problems. As a Data Analyst, you will partner with functional teams across Elemy to build metrics that are durable, design experiments that are defensible, create dashboards that are extensively utilized for decision making, and help shape an analytics practice that appropriately balances speed, accuracy, and risk. You will be a leader within the Elemy Data & Analytics organization, mentoring junior analysts and meaningfully contributing to how analytics at Elemy are done.
 What You’ll Do

Solve problems that matter.
Deeply understand the world of pediatric behavioral therapy, the stakeholders involved, and how analytics can (and cannot!) be deployed to bring this industry into the digital age.
Partner with colleagues in analytics and the business to identify key metrics we should track, analysis we should embark upon, and dashboards we should build.
Understand, implement, and maintain key data pipelines that relate to your specific area of the business. Contribute to our data ecosystem management strategy.
Synthesize complex analyses into consumable stories with actionable insights.
Break down - and often reframe - business problems into well bounded problems solvable with data & analytics.
Exercise good judgment - appropriately discerning when basic techniques are sufficient and when advanced methods are required.

Who You Are

3+ years working in an analytics team at a high-growth company
Excellent SQL skills, ability to write and debug complex SQL queries
Excellent written communication skills
Experience with Snowflake, Github, dbt, Python, and R is a plus
Experience with at least one data visualization tool (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Periscope)
A track record of working autonomously, with strong organizational and time management skills
Experience with communicating data driven insights to business stakeholders
Experience coaching business colleagues on how to leverage analytics appropriately
Experience mentoring other analysts is a plus

At Elemy, we are a globally-distributed team with many of our team members located throughout the world, including in the following cities: San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles, Miami, Toronto, Montreal, and Kyiv. While everyone currently works remotely, we envision a future that balances face-to-face collaboration with a remote-friendly environment.
 The above job description is meant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed; it is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required for the position.
 Elemy is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to providing all employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We celebrate diversity and welcome applicants from every background and life experience.
 #LI-Remote

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Job Field:
Business Support
Job Type:
Full-time
Building Location:
Ottawa
Length of Assignment:

Who We Are
BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6, 500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients’ businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia. Further information is available at www.bgis.com

SUMMARY

The Reporting Analyst is responsible preparing business reports to assist with enabling decision makers in making well-informed business decisions.

KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsible for data integrity within information management systems
Compiles and maintains large volume of real estate portfolio data within information management systems to support various reporting, benchmarking and analytical requirements.
Generates and compiles data from multiple data sources using various business intelligence tools and information management systems
Prepares various reports including but not limited to performance reports and scorecard reports to assist with business communication and decision making
Performs calculations and analysis to fulfill requirements including but not limited to performance reporting, occupancy cost allocation and chargeback, budget to spend variance reporting
Other duties as assigned

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

Ability to handle a large volume of information and accurate management of large datasets along
Very strong attention to detail
Strong data analysis and interpretation skills
Computer proficiency in relational databases, reporting tools, MS Office including MS Access and MS Excel, with ability to learn new information management systems quickly

Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation

None required

At BGIS we believe that diversity and inclusion is a key business driver, such that we never lose sight of its importance as it is woven into the fabric of our organization. We are committed to maintaining a barrier-free recruitment process by providing equal employment opportunities through recruiting and retention of individuals of all backgrounds. We recognize that promoting diversity is an essential component of our continuing pursuit for organizational success!

Title: Analyst - Pricing
Description:
Join a team that offers great hours, excellent benefits & a career to be proud of! The great thing about working for EECOL Electric is the opportunity to advance to a rewarding career in sales, management or one of the many other career paths. We are looking for a full-time, permanent, Regional Pricing Coordinator to add to our team. 
EECOL Electric is a leading Electrical Products Distributor with 60 locations in Canada. Our employees stay for the long-term because we offer a rewarding and exciting career, not just a job! Just ask our President, Executives or Management team what great opportunities this company offers; most started out in the warehouse. You will not meet a more down-to-earth, hardworking and dedicated team. Visit us at www.eecol.com to learn more. 
EECOL employees enjoy… 

Permanent, full time positions, Monday through Friday. Weekends and evenings are for friends, family and fun, not for work! 
Regular reviews, raises and bonus opportunities. 
Promotion from within; excellent opportunities to advance. 
First-rate benefits including generous flex benefits, health & dental plan, disability, life insurance, vision care and a pension plan to save for retirement! 

THE JOB… 

Manage pricing execution, including data integrity and consistency. 
Review existing price agreements and initiate updates and changes as required. 
Understand vendor price changes and apply price adjustments. 
Act as liaison between branch locations and pricing managers. 
Coordinate with district, branch and purchasing management to explore and find solutions. 
Take initiative in identifying and resolving issues around pricing 
Take ownership of process improvements and drive to successful implementation. 
Performs other duties as required. 

WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR… 

Minimum 2 years’ experience with pricing or related role. 
Strong computer skills including advanced Excel knowledge. 
Previous experience handling confidential and sensitive data. 
Effective multi-tasking, deadline management and project management skills. 
Proven troubleshooting skills. 
Able to work independently (once trained) or as part of a team. 
Good written and verbal communication skills. 
Self-starter and highly motivated to make proactive changes. 
Ability to accept and integrate constructive feedback from superiors. 


Working Environment: 
General Office – Work is generally performed within an office environment, with standard office equipment. Lighting and temperature are adequate and there are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, etc. 

EECOL Electric Corp. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. It is the policy of EECOL to not discriminate against any job applicant or employee based on age, race, religion, color, handicap, sex, physical condition, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status or any other protected status. This policy includes but is not limited to the following: recruitment and employment, promotion, demotion, transfer, compensation, selection for training including apprenticeship, layoff, or termination.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.
Working Arrangement
Hybrid
Job Description
US Retirement is seeking a motivated Business Analyst to join the Trade/Trust Operations team to help develop and automate daily processes for the team.
The Ideal Candidate Will Have:
Strong understanding of trading platforms
Knowledge of cash reconciliations
Effectively communicate with technical and non technical team members
Able to “weed out the noise” to understand requirements and formulate solutions
Experience creating automated solution using excel, SQL, access stored procedures
Experience documenting procedures guides and requirement gathering
Responsibilities:
Provide input on critical projects that impact Trade operations team.
Develop solutions to automate processes by creating macros, programs or databases.
Support enhancements and assess impacts to inter-connected systems.
Create conversion programs to convert pdf files into excel data friendly import files.
Develop and support business process automation using Visual Studio, MS Office Tools and SQL Server.
Identify and implement innovative ideas to improve upon current processes and enhance user experience.
Assist with requirement gathering for projects and create out of the box solutions.
Perform MS access database development and VBA programming support.
Execute and create queries using SQL / T-SQL in SQL Server and DB2 environment.
Identify opportunities by Eliminating, Streamlining, Automating, and Consolidation (ESAC)
Qualifications:
University Degree
Knowledge of Trading, Mutual funds & Cash Reconciliations
Understanding of US Retirement business.
Understanding of the mutual fund industry.
Experience creating solutions to convert pdf files to excel
Experience in data clean up solutions
Advanced knowledge of Excel using VLOOKUP’s, Pivot Tables and VBA Macros.
SQL programming, SQL Server and VBA programming.
MS Access data base programming
Experience with Alteryx and DUCO an asset
Ability to meet daily deadlines in a fast paced and demanding environment.
Good analytical, conceptual, diagnostic, analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work with and analyze large volumes of data.
Takes pride in their high level of accuracy and attention to detail.
Works well independently but is also a strong team player.
Ability to influence and work collaboratively with stakeholders in a demanding environment.
Good communication, interpersonal and customer service skills.
Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.
About John Hancock and Manulife
John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.
One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.
Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer
At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.
It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.

Title: Operational Analyst
Description:
Job Information
Job Requisition ID: 25503
Ministry: Energy
Location: Edmonton
Full or Part-Time: Full -Time
Hours of Work: 36.25 hours per week
Regular/Temporary: Regular
Scope: Open Competition
Closing Date: April 26, 2022
Classification: Subsidiary 01B 3625 Administrative Support 6

About Us

The Royalty Operations branch is responsible for accurate and timely calculation, assessment, collection and reconciliation of natural gas and conventional oil royalty. The branch is one of the primary drivers of revenue within the department, fostering relationships with natural gas and oil industry, providing exceptional client service to ensure reporting for royalty purposes is accurate and in compliance with legislation and business rules.

Role

Alberta Energy has various opportunities for experienced individuals looking to work within the world of Energy Operations.
Due to the changing nature of industry business, Energy Operation’s work environment promotes teamwork and flexibility. You will be responsible for providing excellent front line client services to stakeholders in accordance with Energy Operation’s operational processes and regulations. Your success will derive from your understanding of the clients’ needs and your ability to build and maintain positive relationships by using effective communication. A demonstrated ability to collaborate with other team members, manage multiple priorities, analyze data and make recommendations is essential to your success. Above all you must be comfortable in a continuously changing environment.


Energy Operations is looking for detail oriented and motivated individuals to fill the roles of Operational Analysts. With your keen eye for details; your outstanding interpersonal skills; and your ability to analyze information and problem solve; you will be a valuable part of a team that contributes to the accurate assessment, levy and collection of royalties for production in Alberta.

Operational Analyst:
The Gas Royalty Operations unit is looking for two Operational Analysts. You will be responsible for:
Providing quality client services to stakeholders and advising on interpretation of gas royalty regulations, policies and guidelines.
Researching, investigating, analyzing and proposing recommendations on issues or answering questions raised by internal or external stakeholders to ensure reporting for royalty purposes is accurate and in compliance.
Using organization, multitasking and prioritizing skills to ensure to meet multiple deadlines.
Assisting in the verification of the natural gas royalty invoice prior to releasing to industry to ensure the calculation of royalties is accurate.
Working as an individual or within project teams to ensure operational and business requirements are met.

The Oil Royalty Operations unit is looking for an Operational Analyst. You will be responsible for:
Analyzing and reconciliation of royalty variances, employing an in-depth understanding of the royalty framework to accurately determine and transact settlement decisions.
Regular communication with producers and pipeline operators to ensure royalty is delivered and reported correctly.
Utilizing an analytical approach to problem solving to improve the timelines and accuracy in which royalty volumes are reported and received.
Monitoring the royalty calculation cycle to ensure the monthly oil royalty calculation is processed accurately and timely which includes balancing of monthly oil royalty calculations and manual verification.
Qualifications

High school Diploma combined with 4 years related experience.
Equivalency:
Equivalencies will be considered on the basis of
1 year of education for 1 year of experience; or
1 year of experience for 1 year of education.
Assets
An accounting diploma or Canadian Association of Petroleum Production Accountants (CAPPA) certificate or related work experience.
Efficient in using Microsoft Word and Excel.
Excellent verbal and written skills.
Client service experience.
Organization, teamwork and collaboration skills.
Analytical and problem solving skills.
APS Competencies

Competencies are behaviors that are essential to reach our goals in serving Albertans. We encourage you to have an in depth understanding of the competencies that are required for this opportunity and to be prepared to demonstrate them during the recruitment process.
This link will assist you with understanding competencies:
If you haven’t included competency information in the “Role” section, you can include the critical competencies with examples of how they relate to the role being recruited to in this section; below is a list of the APS Competencies to assist you:
In this role, you will contribute to our team by demonstrating the following competencies:
Agility
Drive for Results
Build Collaborative Environments
Systems Thinking
Creative Problem Solving
Salary

$2,017.62 to $2,480.72 bi-weekly ($52,659 to $64,746 per year)

Notes

Hours of Work:
36.25 hours per week (full time)
Term of Employment:
This position is a permanent, full-time position.
Location:
9945 108 Street NW Edmonton, Alberta, T5K 2G6
Other information:
Final candidates will be required to undergo a security screening.
Please outline how your experience relates to the qualifications in detail in your cover letter.
This competition may be used to fill current and future vacancies across the Government of Alberta.

What we offer:
Working for the Alberta Public Service –
Pension plans:
Public Servies Pension Plan (PSPP) –
Leadership and mentorship programs
Professional learning and development
Positive workplace culture and work-life balance
How To Apply
If you are not currently an employee with the Government of Alberta, the first step in applying for a job is creating your candidate profile within our online application system,
Existing employees should access the Career tile in 1GX to submit their application in order to be recognized as an internal applicant.
Once you have created your candidate profile, visit the Alberta Public Service job site to apply for jobs at
Applicants are advised to provide information that clearly and concisely demonstrates how their qualifications meet the advertised requirements, including education, experience and relevant examples of required competencies.
Resources for applicants:
It is recommended that applicants who have obtained educational credentials from outside of Canada and have not had them previously assessed, obtain an evaluation of their credentials from the International Qualifications Assessment Service (IQAS)

Closing Statement

This competition may be used to fill future vacancies, across the Government of Alberta, at the same or lower classification level.
We thank all applicants for their interest. All applications will be reviewed to determine which candidates' qualifications most closely match the advertised requirements. Only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.
If you require any further information on this job posting or a copy of the role profile, and/or require a disability related accommodation during the recruitment process, please contact Ashley Mondor at Ashley.Mondor@gov.ab.ca.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Title: Data Analyst
Position Type: Regular - Full-Time
Position Location: Toronto HQ
Grade: 00
Requisition ID: 14654
We know the importance that food plays in people's lives – the power it has to bring people, families and communities together. Our purpose is to bring enjoyment to people’s lives through great tasting food, in a way which reflects our values.
OVERVIEW
McCain is embarking on a digital transformation. As part of this transformation, we are making significant investments into our data structures and policies to increase the quality of our data, the confidence of our business teams to use this data to make decisions and drive value through the use of data.
We have a new and ambitious global Data & Analytics group, which serves as a resource to the business teams in our regions and global functions. We are currently recruiting a talented individual to join our team in the role of Global Data Analyst, with a capability focus on the insights that can be pulled from data.
JOB PURPOSE:
Reporting to the Director of Global Analytics, the Global Data Analyst is part of a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team that brings together individuals with a wide range of experiences in business and technology. This individual will get a wide breadth of the business by rotating through functional and regional analytics teams in their first two years at McCain. These teams include but are not limited to:
Global Analytics
Commercial Analytics
Agriculture Analytics
North America Analytics
After spending two years with these teams, the Director of Global Analytics and Global Data Analyst will find new or existing roles within McCain for the Analyst to land within. The goal of the rotations is to create a well-rounded leader that can help drive our analytics agenda into the future.
This role will initially focus on business intelligence, with future opportunities existing across other analytics disciplines.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Requirement Gathering: Conduct requirements analysis with business stakeholders, and communicate technical requirements to the development team
Understand requirements and propose further technical solutions beyond what the business owner may initially conceptualize
Lead data discovery to ensure project viability
Operate between D&A leadership, business sponsors, and technical developers
End-to-End BI Development: Lead the end-to-end development of BI reports, including data modelling, dashboard development, feedback iteration, and full automation
Develop BI reports directly, with independence
Lead interaction with data owners, business sponsors, and in many cases key users
Resolve any roadblocks and issues that could impact timelines
Ensure quality assurance through user testing and feedback iteration
BI Systems Adoption: Support BI adoption efforts through leadership, best practice sharing, and individual consultation across the business
Learning and Development: Remain current with the latest BI tools, and all related analytics systems that can further McCain’s analytical agenda
KEY QUALIFICATION & EXPERIENCES:
Digital Skills
Requirement: Competence in Power BI report development, or a proven deep proficiency in similar tools
Nice to have: Understanding of SQL or any other programming languages such as Python, R, or SAS
Data Literacy and Communication
Understanding of how data systems are designed and ability to work with data engineers
Ability to connect data to business insights for non-technical audiences
Ability to translate non-technical business requirements into technical / BI solutions
Change Management
Comfortable working with business stakeholders across a range of experience with data and analytics
Able to establish a case for change and “sell” an idea
Able to explain data concepts in a way that is approachable and compelling
No previous working experience is required for this role, however work experience will be considered through the recruitment process
The health and safety of McCain employees and their families has been our number one priority since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic. Supported by science, and in line with our culture and values, we believe that being vaccinated is the most effective way to protect each other, our families, our customers, and our communities. It is therefore a requirement that the successful candidate for this role be fully vaccinated and have completed the mandatory incubation period prior to the candidate’s start date with McCain, subject to reasonable accommodations if you are unable to be vaccinated for protected grounds under applicable human rights legislation (e.g. medical or religious reasons).
McCain Foods is an equal opportunity employer. We see value in ensuring we have a diverse, antiracist, inclusive, merit-based, and equitable workplace. As a global family-owned company we are proud to reflect the diverse communities around the world in which we live and work. We recognize that diversity drives our creativity, resilience, and success and makes our business stronger.

McCain is an accessible employer. If you require an accommodation throughout the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials or accessible meeting rooms), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Your privacy is important to us. By submitting personal data or information to us, you agree this will be handled in accordance with the Global Employee Privacy Policy
Job Family: Information Technology
Division: Global Technology
Department: Global Analytics

Location(s): CA - Canada : New Brunswick : Florenceville-Bristol || CA - Canada : Ontario : Toronto
Company: McCain Foods (Canada)

Title: Client Onboarding Documentation Analyst
Description:
The Client Onboarding Documentation Analyst is a developing professional role. Deals with most problems independently and has some latitude to solve complex problems. Integrates in-depth specialty area knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices. Good understanding of how the team and area integrate with others in accomplishing the objectives of the subfunction/ job family. Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies. Requires attention to detail when making judgments and recommendations based on the analysis of factual information. Typically deals with variable issues with potentially broader business impact. Applies professional judgment when interpreting data and results. Breaks down information in a systematic and communicable manner. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information. Moderate but direct impact through close contact with the businesses' core activities. Quality and timeliness of service provided will affect the effectiveness of own team and other closely related teams.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for customer interaction, documentation issuance, review and system setups. Demonstrates high level of diligence, motivation and organizational skills.
Focuses on timely and accurate delivery of all account opening functions, as well as delivering superior customer service and resolution of customer issues
Performs day to day management of the account opening and maintenance processing, including daily management of in-process, pended, and service related activities, ensuring account opening requirements are clearly defined to support all scenarios of account opening and maintenance requirements, to include delivery of very high quality service to customers and internal partners. Responsible for various types of project management in the account services space, and managing cross-functional relationships with all teams
Determines new work procedures, analyzes complex and variable issues with significant departmental impact
Ensures consistent delivery of high quality service to customers through meeting or exceeding customer expectation guided by service level agreements and efficiency/accuracy standards
Ensures awareness and full compliance of internal processes, regulations, policies, guidelines, procedures, and practices
Establishes and maintains close working relationship with clients and within team to facilitate an open and direct communication of issues, needs, queries, etc., in such that these may be responded to in an efficient, prompt and professional manner
Embarks on continuous on the job training for end to end product knowledge.
Understands client requirements and implement them correctly
Understands new customer requirements and ensure adequate support to new customer requirements and initiatives
Monitors customer satisfaction and service level and drive process changes.
Provides innovative solutions to clients
Ensures a strong and robust processing environment with effective controls.
Establishes risk management practice
Maintains a strong culture of risk and controls in the team through various processes and check points. Daily deliverable of routine and defined tasks, while developing knowledge of the broader context in which work is being performed
Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision
Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy.
Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency
Qualifications:
2-5 years of experience in Documentation review, Account Maintenance and related Cash Management products preferred
Demonstrated interpersonal skills, pro-active team player but also able to work independently, with exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Highly motivated, persistent, and able to work in a structured, high volume, time sensitive, high-risk environment. Capable of multitasking and eager to learn multiple products in a challenging environment. Fast learner, strong attention to detail, and willingness to go extra mile
Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications. Exposure to Client interaction
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
Proficient in handling urgent and escalation cases and manage client and internal team expectations. Proficient knowledge of English (written and spoken)
Education:
Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience
