Title: Data Analyst, Office of Ethics & Compliance
Description:
What we offer
Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!
Location: Toronto, Canada or Virtual Canada
PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVES
The Office of Ethics & Compliance (OEC) is a part of the Office of CEO Board Area, and reports to both SAP SE’s Global CEO and the Audit Committee of the Supervisory Board. Our mission is to address the risks faced by SAP as a result of anti-bribery and corruption and to investigate fraud of a substantial and criminal nature. The OEC is responsible for various SAP compliance initiatives, including oversight and support of the SAP Code of Business Conduct, employee compliance training and communications, and the global governance document framework. We also monitor and enforce compliance. Our focus includes compliance with the FCPA (Foreign Corrupt Practices Act), UK Bribery Act, and other global anti-corruption and bribery laws, plus anti-competition compliance (in tandem with the field legal organization).

EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS
The Data Analyst will act as the Center of Expertise on Data Analysis and Analytics within OEC. The role will support data mining requests from OEC colleagues, support various data analytics initiatives, and provide consultation to OEC colleagues when there are general queries on common SAP systems and data. The successful candidate should have profound experience of at least one of SAP’s core systems and is well-versed in understanding the data model.
The successful candidate’s key responsibilities will include:
Performing data mining based on requests from OEC teams
Contributing to the compliance analytics projects with expertise on data models
Acting as the regional central point of contact within OEC for queries on systems, data and reports
Supporting current OEC tools and systems where necessary
Working independently and in teams on topics, while setting priorities, having sole and joint responsibility
Providing regular project / system status updates
The position reports to the Head of OEC Technology Solutions.

EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATION / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES
Full proficiency with the English language is required
Bachelor’s Degree in data science, business, finance, IT or equivalent work experience
Proficiency with SQL and knowledge with SAP ECC/ERP, CRM will be a must, while experience with SAP BW & PRM is advantageous
Hands-on with great attention to details with ability to do in-depth research and to interpret written guidelines and documents
Proactive, dynamic and result-driven individual
Ability to work with international, virtual teams with sensitivity to cultural differences
Following experience is not a must but will definitely be a plus / pluses
Creating ID&A reports
Using analytics tools such as R, predictive analytics
Applying Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to business scenarios
Project Management Professional (PMP) designation is an advantage
WORK EXPERIENCE
Minimum 5 years of work experience, including at least 3 years as Data Scientist, SAP System Admin, Database Management, or Data Analyst
Project Management and operational oversight experience are both required
Experience implementing solutions featured by Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence is highly preferred
BENEFITS
We offer: full time permanent employment, competitive salary and performance bonus, transportation allowance, pension plan, medical and life insurance, lunch allowance, possibility to invest in SAP shares
#LI-REMOTE
We are SAP
SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.
Our inclusion promise
SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.
SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com.
EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.
Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Job Status


       Regular Full-Time
      




About Us



        If you are civic-minded and interested in making an impact on people and businesses on the beautiful North Shore, consider working for the District of North Vancouver.
        


        Home to vast parkland and attractions including Grouse Mountain, Lynn Canyon and Capilano Suspension Bridge, the District is inspired by nature, and enriched by people. As one of 
        BC’s Top Employers, the District offers exciting professional development opportunities and a competitive total compensation package including a compressed day off schedule (nine-day fortnight). This is an exciting time to join the District, as we embark on a range of initiatives to transform digital service delivery, customer experience, and our approach to climate action.
       







Position Overview



        The District of North Vancouver is looking for a dynamic, highly motivated Business Systems Analyst to join the District’s Digital Services and IT team to build, manage, and support our enterprise applications.
       

 What we can offer you


         We’re looking for a talented Business Systems Analyst to join our team as a regular full-time employee. In this position you’ll work with a multi-disciplinary team to maintain and build solutions that both support and transform government services. Your work will be impactful and will help transform and support how the District does business.
       

         In this complex technical and analytical role, you will:
       

Be responsible for the ongoing maintenance and configuration of existing District enterprise business applications and new systems implementation projects.
Provide technical systems support for enterprise applications.
Gather and analyse data, identify priorities, find opportunities for the application of new technologies, and weigh the costs and benefits of new or revised systems.
Develop and maintain new programs, procedures and databases.
Evaluate resource and business requirements and translate business processes.
Conduct regular application maintenance, patching, and upgrades, including re-configuration of applications and software.
Coordinate and work with consultants on enterprise systems enhancements and implementations
Develop and produce custom reports.
Coordinate and provide training on new systems and procedures.
Create and maintain documentation for the environment and solutions.



What you’ll need to succeed


A degree or diploma in computer sciences plus considerable related systems support and project leadership experience.
Experience managing and supporting enterprise applications.
An expert understanding of relational data structures.
An in-depth knowledge of MSSQL structures and queries.
Experience working with content management systems (ex. Drupal, SharePoint).
Experience with data migration.
Be a self-starter with the ability to work independently, take ownership over processes, and have a strong desire to understand the root causes of problems.
The ability to consider the “big picture” when implementing solutions including provision of technical support and long term sustainability.
The ability to work with members of the business to identify problems, define requirements and come up with solutions.
An enthusiasm for tackling new and unfamiliar tasks.


It’s great if you have


Knowledge and experience delivering and maintaining solutions and services using Microsoft 365, Azure, or Microsoft Power Platform.
Knowledge of regular expressions.
Some background in software development (C#, Java, JavaScript).
Experience using web service APIs.
An understanding of Enterprise Integration Patterns.
Experience migrating and transitioning legacy systems to modern applications and technologies.
Experience using SSIS, FME, or similar, for data transformation and migration.
Knowledge of cybersecurity requirements for on premise and cloud-based applications.
Experience with municipal land management, taxation and revenue systems (ex. Tempest).
Familiarity with municipal permitting systems (ex. EnerGov).
Knowledge of ERP systems (ex. JDE Enterprise One).
Experience working with staff scheduling applications (ex. TeleStaff).


Who we are


         We are a growing, multi-disciplinary team of technology professionals focused on providing our customers and colleagues the right solutions to help them succeed. You will be an integral part of the business systems operations team and will work closely with our business customers throughout the organization. You will be supported by skilled technical architects, technology infrastructure specialists, and usability and user experience professionals.
       

         We love what we do and take pride in delivering what our customers need, and we have been recognized for the innovative and high-quality work that we have delivered.
       

         If you have what we’re looking for, and have a passion to serve people and the community, and a demonstrated commitment to supporting a healthy and safe workplace, we would like to hear from you. Please apply with your resume and cover letter online at https://careers.dnv.org. 
        This position will remain open until filled.





 We thank you for your interest in employment with the District of North Vancouver and advise that only those shortlisted for an interview will be contacted.






Compensation


       The pay range for this unionized position is $44.78 - $52.91 per hour based on a 35 hour work week.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Remote
Description:
Senior Data Analyst

Who We Are at Elemy:

Elemy is building the first managed marketplace for in-home chronic medical care, starting with pediatric autism. Our AI-powered technology matches families with like-minded therapists, resulting in better care that helps children learn new behaviors and reach life-changing milestones. Children receiving care with Elemy report a 13% increase in communication skills, 80% reduction in problem behavior, and 140% increase in skill adoption within six months - amazing milestones that further our mission each day.

Since launching in April 2020, Elemy has become one of the fastest-growing healthcare companies in the United States, scaling from four employees to more than 1,300 employees in less than 18 months. The company is backed by some of the most prominent investors in healthcare and technology, including SoftBank, Goodwater, General Catalyst, Founders Fund, SignalFire, e.ventures, and 8VC.

Interested in learning more? Watch a mother detail her Elemy experience on NBC News, read Bloomberg’s take on our Series B, listen to Elemy CEO, Yury Yakubchyk, discuss destigmatizing mental health on Spotify, or check out why Dr. Henry Roane was awarded the highest award of its honor in ABA therapy, the American Psychological Association Nathan H. Azrin Distinguished Contribution to Applied Behavior Analysis Award.

Senior Data Analyst at Elemy

Analytics teams at Elemy play a critical role in driving rapid, rational decision making in support of product, operations, marketing, engineering, and business teams. We are masters of business context who can apply a broad set of data science & analytics techniques to solve amorphous problems. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will partner with functional teams across Elemy to build metrics that are durable, design experiments that are defensible, create dashboards that are extensively utilized for decision making, and help shape an analytics practice that appropriately balances speed, accuracy, and risk. You will be a leader within the Elemy Data & Analytics organization, mentoring junior analysts and meaningfully contributing to how analytics at Elemy are done.

What You’ll Do

Solve problems that matter.
Deeply understand the world of pediatric behavioral therapy, the stakeholders involved, and how analytics can (and cannot!) be deployed to bring this industry into the digital age.
Partner with colleagues in analytics and the business to identify key metrics we should track, analysis we should embark upon, and dashboards we should build.
Understand, implement, and maintain key data pipelines that relate to your specific area of the business. Contribute to our data ecosystem management strategy.
Synthesize complex analyses into consumable stories with actionable insights.
Break down - and often reframe - business problems into well bounded problems solvable with data & analytics.
Exercise good judgment - appropriately discerning when basic techniques are sufficient and when advanced methods are required.

Who You Are

5+ years working in an analytics team at a high-growth company
Excellent SQL skills, ability to write and debug complex SQL queries
Excellent written communication skills
Experience with Snowflake, Github, dbt, Python, and R is a plus
Experience with at least one data visualization tool (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Periscope)
A track record of working autonomously, with strong organizational and time management skills
Experience with communicating data driven insights to business stakeholders
Experience coaching business colleagues on how to leverage analytics appropriately
Experience mentoring other analysts is a plus

At Elemy, we are a globally-distributed team with many of our team members located throughout the world, including in the following cities: San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles, Miami, Toronto, Montreal, and Kyiv. While everyone currently works remotely, we envision a future that balances face-to-face collaboration with a remote-friendly environment.

The above job description is meant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed; it is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required for the position.

Elemy is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to providing all employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We celebrate diversity and welcome applicants from every background and life experience.

#LI-Remote

Title: Derivative Analyst – Fixed Income, Currencies and Commodities P&L/PAA, Global Middle Office
Description:
Address:
100 King Street West
Job Family Group:
Customer Shared Services
Provides support and delivers operational processes to ensure timely and accurate processing of securities and trade transactions are booked correctly in systems for clean downstream settlement. Provides guidance and execution in the support and booking of new strategies, and daily capture of transactional information to support downstream analytics and financial accounting processes. Supports the maintenance of appropriate governance and controls over the trade capture process.
Responsible for the accurate, complete, and timely generation of daily and monthly P&L (Profit & Loss) and PAA (Profit Attribution and Analysis) reporting.
Requires the application of in-depth product knowledge, trade flow reconciliation, and profit attribution knowledge to ensure consistency and effectiveness of drilling down of the P&L drivers to support Capital Markets and Corporate Treasury trading businesses.
Have working knowledge in the areas of fixed income, and other interest and credit related hedging instruments including swaps, futures, and options.
Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendation.
Gathers and formats data into regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
Resolves standard and relatively straightforward issues, referring non-routine issues to more senior team members and/or manager.
May function as a problem-solving resource for more junior staff.
Provides input and analysis into the continuous improvement of business processes and procedures and participates in the planning, testing and implementation of projects and new/ revised products/services or processes as required.
Follows documented policies and procedures to execute day to day transactions, activities, processes and ensure all Service Level Agreements(SLAs) are met. Checks and reconciles information and documentation to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Analyzes data and information to provide insights and recommendations.
Identifies and analyzes issues and problems, and resolves discrepancies in a timely manner. Deals with clients directly to resolve trade issues and/or escalates as required.
Communicates and collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives.
Develops and maintains effective relationships with internal & external stakeholders to execute work and fulfill service delivery expectations.
Collaborates in development/implementation of new processes/systems and changes/improvements to existing systems and processes.
Understands the regulatory requirements and risks inherent in the operations and ensures appropriate actions are taken and operational integrity is maintained.
Supports the development of tools and delivery of training focused on delivering business results.
Focus may be on a business/group.
Thinks creatively and proposes new solutions.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works mostly independently.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Minimum 1-2 years of relevant experience in financial industry and post-secondary degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Completion of CFA or FRM or CPA or equivalent would be asset
Experience in Fund Accounting or Derivative Valuation or Trade Reconciliation would be an asset
Knowledge of the risk and regulatory requirements of the business – In-depth.
Prioritization skills – Good.
Customer service skills – In-depth.
PC skills (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint) – In-depth.
Specialized knowledge from education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Title: Observer Analyst
Description:
Business Unit:
Cubic Mission and Performance Solutions
Company Details:
Cubic offers an opportunity to provide innovative technology for government and commercial customers around the globe, helping to solve their future problems today. We’re the leading integrator of payment and information technology and services for intelligent travel solutions worldwide, and the leading provider of realistic combat training systems, secure communications and networking and highly specialized support services for military and security forces of the U.S. and allied nations. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and thrive in an innovative environment, we want to talk to you about your next role at Cubic! We are seeking employees inspired by technology, and motivated by the rewards of hard work, commitment, teamwork, quality, integrity, and respect. We invite you to explore opportunities with Cubic.
Job Details:
Job Summary: This position applies comprehensive technical and tactical knowledge in order to create AARs to meet the training objectives. When not conducting the essential duties functions, the OA may be called upon to assist in the tasks required to execute the training, or to assist in updating / fixing faults in the UOTS or CWES systems. An OA conducts training analysis in support of military training exercises. They work to make the best use of the UOTS and CWES systems, combined with military judgement, to ensure that data is captured effectively and in accordance with the plan for the construction and delivery of After-Action Reviews (AARs). All required training will be provided in order to accomplish the assigned tasks.
ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Works in an Exercise Control Centre (EXCON), monitoring the events of an instrumented training exercise.
Works extended shifts (up to 13 hours) as required.
Operates an EXCON specific IT system which includes monitoring of instrumented training activity, monitoring tactical radio communications and communicating with Observer Controller Trainers (OCTs) in the field.
Analyzes data to provide objective evidence of training performance in line with the overall exercise plan.
Collates information from multiple systems into a useable format that OCTs can use for AARs at the end of each mission / phase. Assists with AAR delivery, centrally or in the field, as required.
Supports the training staff as required in exercise planning and preparation in trend analysis using the same tools.
Interfaces with training staff to meet their requirements within their schedule.
Conducts training of personnel on the use of the UOTS and CWES as required.
Assists the Technical Support Technician, within scope, in the maintenance / updating of the UOTS and CWES systems as required.
Conducts other duties as required.
Shift work and overtime beyond 40 hours per week required during exercise periods.
Require a 3-month probationary period
MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS: Four year college degree, plus two years related experience. A combination of alternative education and experience will be considered. Working knowledge of military operations, training and tactics. Very familiar and comfortable with using computers, IT and MS Office applications. Possess good communication skills and able to deal tactfully and courteously with all personnel. Valid driver’s license. Proof of the legal right to work in Canada and secret security clearance from the Canadian Government. Requires mental alertness and ability to follow written and verbal instructions. Physically fit, able to lift 50 lbs repeatedly and able to work in tight spaces. Able to sit or stand for extended periods of time and to climb stairs. May be required to travel periodically, both nationally and internationally. Prefer 12 years military experience in the combat arms with former rank Sgt – Capt, Experienced in operations, training, and doctrine. Instructional experience and exercise planning. And bilingual in English/ French.
Cubic Field Services Canada (CFSC) provides instrumented training systems for the Canadian Army using the Canadian Weapon Effects Simulation (CWES) system. Employing cutting edge technology, the Urban Operations Training Sites (UOTS) are becoming functional over the next 18 months in Gagetown, NB; Wainwright, AB; Valcartier, QC; and Petawawa, ON
The description provided above is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all job duties, responsibilities and requirements. Duties, responsibilities and requirements may change over time and according to business need.
Worker Type:
Contingent Worker

Title: Associate Business Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? At Olympus, we help make people’s lives healthier, safer and more fulfilling, every day.

Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.
Job Description
Olympus Canada is looking for an Associate Business Analyst to join our Business Intelligence team. This individual will be supporting various parts of the organization including but not limited to Sales Marketing Operations and Service. They will also be the go-to individual to turn data into correct and meaningful information to support all aspects of the business. The position will be responsible to provide Service contract profitability reports verify service profitability for new contracts and build models to improve efficiency in various parts of the organization and gain visibility in areas of progress. This position will also be responsible for working closely with IT for the maintenance and improvement of current dashboards programs and reporting solutions.
Job Duties
The key tasks of the Associate Business Analyst are:
Service Profitability
Reporting Profitability
Evaluation for new service contracts
Managing daily ad-hoc requests
Creating queries in the Access database, building Excel models to support the business and building reports and dashboard in PowerBI.
Managing the technical and financial aspects of Sales and Marketing programs and being the main point of contact for all involved departments from start to finish.
Job Requirements
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree in Business or Computer Science required.
Excellent communication skills and ability to interact with field personnel and other departments
Ability to create and manage data
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Exceptional user of Microsoft products (Excel Access Word and PowerPoint).
Highly organized and detail oriented.
Ability to solve problems of a complex and dynamic environment and provide creative solution.
SAP and/or Data Sweep and/or Power/BI knowledge is an asset.
We realize work isn’t just a job to you.

It’s a big part of your life, but not the only part. That’s why we offer competitive salaries, annual bonus program and comprehensive medical benefits, as well as tuition reimbursement, flexible schedules, parental and adoption leave, on-site services and Colleague Affinity Networks — so you can be ready for where life can take you.
Olympus is a global technology leader, crafting innovative optical and digital solutions in medical technologies; life sciences; industrial solutions; and cameras and audio products. Throughout our 100-year history, Olympus has focused on being true to society and making people’s lives healthier, safer and more fulfilling.
Olympus Canada Inc. (OCI)—a subsidiary of Olympus Corporation of the Americas—manages the Company’s operations and workforce throughout Canada in roles such as sales, marketing, service, and support functions. Based in Richmond Hill, ON, OCI is committed to developing our employees and supporting our local communities. For more information, visit olympuscanada.com and truetolife.com.
Olympus…True To You. True To Society. True To LIFE.
Olympus embraces diversity and inclusion. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, our policies as well as our values prohibit unlawful discrimination based on an employee's or applicant's race, color, sex, age, physical or mental disability, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, genetic information, ancestry, military or veteran status, or any other federal, state or local protected classification. EOE Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled
Posting Notes: || Canada (CA) || Ontario (CA-ON) || Richmond Hill ||

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Growth
Description:
We're the banking app that believes in small businesses.

Our company is looking for high performing builders to join our growing team as we enter our next phase of expansion . We are a San Francisco, New York, Portland, Toronto and remote-friendly based, venture-backed startup at the heart of the FinTech movement that is shaping the way financial services are delivered. We are backed by some of the best VCs in the world (Battery Ventures, Redpoint Ventures and more) and are growing fast.
Our mission

We eliminate the pain that small business owners face through financial management and banking. Poor financial literacy has an outsized impact on the costs and failure rates amongst small businesses, and we are on a mission to solve these problems. We've created a mobile, tech-powered account built specifically for startups, freelancers, and small/medium-sized businesses (SMBs) that acts as a world-class Finance Department that most small businesses could never afford. Small businesses are the bedrock of every community and the economy, and you'll be their champion. Ready to start?
Our team

We ❤ growth. As a Senior Data Analyst, Growth, you'll partner with our world-class Product Growth team on generating insights to identify the best areas of opportunity. Reporting to our Director of Product, Growth, you'll also benefit from our experienced management team, who have already created and exited startups and come from leadership roles at brands like Square, McKinsey, Google, Frank and Oak, Strava, Instacart, Prodigy, Oportun, eBay and more.

We're building a product that solves real pain vs the imagined kind. Small businesses are the bedrock of every community and of the American economy. Their storytelling potential is endless, they have been underserved by banking and fintech for far too long, and you'll be their champion.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

Owning and managing our Product Growth team's data requests.
Building forward-looking models and dashboards to assess the impact of proposed business cases, experiments, A/B tests, features, products, user flows, and marketing campaigns.
Maintaining documentation, projections, monitoring dashboards, test results, and making them available to the team.
Contributing growth ideas to the team based on insights derived from your own analysis and research.
Working closely with the Director of Product, Growth to define KPIs, projects and set targets, and surface insights to the broader product group.

REQUIREMENTS

Today you might be a Senior Data Analyst, Data Analyst, Product Analyst, Growth Analyst, Marketing Analyst, or the equivalent in your company...or something that we haven't heard of yet - we keep an open mind.

The most important characteristic for our Senior Data Analyst, Growth is your attitude. We want you to join because you don't see roadblocks, you see opportunities to be at your best. You know that somehow, you can figure anything out.

The skills required for this role:

You have 4+ years of data analytics experience working on digital products/SaaS.
You get giddy about building awesome quantitative models using SQL/Excel/Looker.
You get excited about using your strong analytical skills and aggressively focusing on driving business results.
You're a natural communicator and you love solving problems using data.
You're a pro at using product analytics tools like Mixpanel, Amplitude, etc.
You have experience using a Customer Data Platform like Segment, Mparticle, etc.

Bonus points -

You have previous python experience
You're familiar with communications platforms like Braze, Mailchimp, etc.
You geek out over startups, growth, and product management!

If you are this close to what we've described but aren't sure, apply. Let's figure out together if this is where you could shine.

BENEFITS

Our mission is big and audacious, but we're assembling a team to take the challenge head on.

As a Senior Data Analyst, Growth, you'll be joining a team that prioritizes:

People: Our company is more than just a business. We're a tight-knit team supporting each other on our mission to rebuild business banking. We're really serious about mission, fit, and the people we work with. You'll be part of a rapidly scaling team that reflects these values and keeps this place special.
Learning and Development: We have a learning culture and provide opportunities for our Customer Experience Associates to invest in their professional development, whether it's perfecting their craft or learning about other areas of the business.
Diversity: You'll find yourself in an environment that values diversity and inclusivity. We believe that a broad array of lived experiences and backgrounds are essential for creating the best possible product and company culture.
Leadership: You're right in the thick of it, making critical decisions that will clear our path forward.

You'll receive:

Top-tier health/dental benefits: We care about the people we work with and put their health first. NorthOne is proud to offer inclusive health and dental coverage.
Flexible working hours: We don't clock in and out at set times. You know when you do your best work. We celebrate accomplishments, not how many hours are spent at the office.
Unlimited paid time off: We hire talented people and know that they need time off to be at their best. Take as much time off as you need to recharge and make sure you're working sustainably.
The latest computer equipment: We make sure you have the best equipment so you can produce great work.
Professional development budget: We support lifelong learners by covering the cost of classes, workshops, conferences and books.
Remote and in person get-togethers: Bond with your teammates over shared interests at regular get-togethers. Find like-minded people who are passionate about everything from sport and music to gaming and cooking.
Remote-friendly environment: Flexibility to work from home, office, or both! We support our teammates wherever they prefer to work within North America. We are a distributed team and do not require our employees to be located in one of our office hubs.
One hell of an adventure!
Few people have been trained for this sort of role and research shows that women and people from underrepresented groups are less likely to apply if they haven't satisfied every requirement. If you are this close to what we've described, but aren't sure, apply. Let's figure out together if this is where you could shine.

NorthOne is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and celebrates diversity. We welcome all applicants regardless of race, colour, gender, age, religion, sexual orientation, disability status or national origin.

From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Title: Observer Analyst
Description:
Business Unit:
Cubic Mission and Performance Solutions
Company Details:
Cubic offers an opportunity to provide innovative technology for government and commercial customers around the globe, helping to solve their future problems today. We’re the leading integrator of payment and information technology and services for intelligent travel solutions worldwide, and the leading provider of realistic combat training systems, secure communications and networking and highly specialized support services for military and security forces of the U.S. and allied nations. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and thrive in an innovative environment, we want to talk to you about your next role at Cubic! We are seeking employees inspired by technology, and motivated by the rewards of hard work, commitment, teamwork, quality, integrity, and respect. We invite you to explore opportunities with Cubic.
Job Details:
Job Summary: This position applies comprehensive technical and tactical knowledge in order to create AARs to meet the training objectives. When not conducting the essential duties functions, the OA may be called upon to assist in the tasks required to execute the training, or to assist in updating / fixing faults in the UOTS or CWES systems. An OA conducts training analysis in support of military training exercises. They work to make the best use of the UOTS and CWES systems, combined with military judgement, to ensure that data is captured effectively and in accordance with the plan for the construction and delivery of After-Action Reviews (AARs). All required training will be provided in order to accomplish the assigned tasks.
ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Works in an Exercise Control Centre (EXCON), monitoring the events of an instrumented training exercise.
Works extended shifts (up to 13 hours) as required.
Operates an EXCON specific IT system which includes monitoring of instrumented training activity, monitoring tactical radio communications and communicating with Observer Controller Trainers (OCTs) in the field.
Analyzes data to provide objective evidence of training performance in line with the overall exercise plan.
Collates information from multiple systems into a useable format that OCTs can use for AARs at the end of each mission / phase. Assists with AAR delivery, centrally or in the field, as required.
Supports the training staff as required in exercise planning and preparation in trend analysis using the same tools.
Interfaces with training staff to meet their requirements within their schedule.
Conducts training of personnel on the use of the UOTS and CWES as required.
Assists the Technical Support Technician, within scope, in the maintenance / updating of the UOTS and CWES systems as required.
Conducts other duties as required.
Shift work and overtime beyond 40 hours per week required during exercise periods.
Require a 3-month probationary period
MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS: Four year college degree, plus two years related experience. A combination of alternative education and experience will be considered. Working knowledge of military operations, training and tactics. Very familiar and comfortable with using computers, IT and MS Office applications. Possess good communication skills and able to deal tactfully and courteously with all personnel. Valid driver’s license. Proof of the legal right to work in Canada and secret security clearance from the Canadian Government. Requires mental alertness and ability to follow written and verbal instructions. Physically fit, able to lift 50 lbs repeatedly and able to work in tight spaces. Able to sit or stand for extended periods of time and to climb stairs. May be required to travel periodically, both nationally and internationally. Prefer 12 years military experience in the combat arms with former rank Sgt – Capt, Experienced in operations, training, and doctrine. Instructional experience and exercise planning. And bilingual in English/ French.
Cubic Field Services Canada (CFSC) provides instrumented training systems for the Canadian Army using the Canadian Weapon Effects Simulation (CWES) system. Employing cutting edge technology, the Urban Operations Training Sites (UOTS) are becoming functional over the next 18 months in Gagetown, NB; Wainwright, AB; Valcartier, QC; and Petawawa, ON
The description provided above is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all job duties, responsibilities and requirements. Duties, responsibilities and requirements may change over time and according to business need.
Worker Type:
Contingent Worker

Title: Associate Business Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a company that cares about people’s lives and health, including yours? At Olympus, we help make people’s lives healthier, safer and more fulfilling, every day.

Let’s inspire healthier lives, together.
Job Description
Olympus Canada is looking for an Associate Business Analyst to join our Business Intelligence team. This individual will be supporting various parts of the organization including but not limited to Sales Marketing Operations and Service. They will also be the go-to individual to turn data into correct and meaningful information to support all aspects of the business. The position will be responsible to provide Service contract profitability reports verify service profitability for new contracts and build models to improve efficiency in various parts of the organization and gain visibility in areas of progress. This position will also be responsible for working closely with IT for the maintenance and improvement of current dashboards programs and reporting solutions.
Job Duties
The key tasks of the Associate Business Analyst are:
Service Profitability
Reporting Profitability
Evaluation for new service contracts
Managing daily ad-hoc requests
Creating queries in the Access database, building Excel models to support the business and building reports and dashboard in PowerBI.
Managing the technical and financial aspects of Sales and Marketing programs and being the main point of contact for all involved departments from start to finish.
Job Requirements
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree in Business or Computer Science required.
Excellent communication skills and ability to interact with field personnel and other departments
Ability to create and manage data
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Exceptional user of Microsoft products (Excel Access Word and PowerPoint).
Highly organized and detail oriented.
Ability to solve problems of a complex and dynamic environment and provide creative solution.
SAP and/or Data Sweep and/or Power/BI knowledge is an asset.
We realize work isn’t just a job to you.

It’s a big part of your life, but not the only part. That’s why we offer competitive salaries, annual bonus program and comprehensive medical benefits, as well as tuition reimbursement, flexible schedules, parental and adoption leave, on-site services and Colleague Affinity Networks — so you can be ready for where life can take you.
Olympus is a global technology leader, crafting innovative optical and digital solutions in medical technologies; life sciences; industrial solutions; and cameras and audio products. Throughout our 100-year history, Olympus has focused on being true to society and making people’s lives healthier, safer and more fulfilling.
Olympus Canada Inc. (OCI)—a subsidiary of Olympus Corporation of the Americas—manages the Company’s operations and workforce throughout Canada in roles such as sales, marketing, service, and support functions. Based in Richmond Hill, ON, OCI is committed to developing our employees and supporting our local communities. For more information, visit olympuscanada.com and truetolife.com.
Olympus…True To You. True To Society. True To LIFE.
Olympus embraces diversity and inclusion. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, our policies as well as our values prohibit unlawful discrimination based on an employee's or applicant's race, color, sex, age, physical or mental disability, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, genetic information, ancestry, military or veteran status, or any other federal, state or local protected classification. EOE Minorities/Females/Veterans/Disabled
Posting Notes: || Canada (CA) || Ontario (CA-ON) || Richmond Hill ||

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Growth
Description:
We're the banking app that believes in small businesses.

Our company is looking for high performing builders to join our growing team as we enter our next phase of expansion . We are a San Francisco, New York, Portland, Toronto and remote-friendly based, venture-backed startup at the heart of the FinTech movement that is shaping the way financial services are delivered. We are backed by some of the best VCs in the world (Battery Ventures, Redpoint Ventures and more) and are growing fast.
Our mission

We eliminate the pain that small business owners face through financial management and banking. Poor financial literacy has an outsized impact on the costs and failure rates amongst small businesses, and we are on a mission to solve these problems. We've created a mobile, tech-powered account built specifically for startups, freelancers, and small/medium-sized businesses (SMBs) that acts as a world-class Finance Department that most small businesses could never afford. Small businesses are the bedrock of every community and the economy, and you'll be their champion. Ready to start?
Our team

We ❤ growth. As a Senior Data Analyst, Growth, you'll partner with our world-class Product Growth team on generating insights to identify the best areas of opportunity. Reporting to our Director of Product, Growth, you'll also benefit from our experienced management team, who have already created and exited startups and come from leadership roles at brands like Square, McKinsey, Google, Frank and Oak, Strava, Instacart, Prodigy, Oportun, eBay and more.

We're building a product that solves real pain vs the imagined kind. Small businesses are the bedrock of every community and of the American economy. Their storytelling potential is endless, they have been underserved by banking and fintech for far too long, and you'll be their champion.

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING

Owning and managing our Product Growth team's data requests.
Building forward-looking models and dashboards to assess the impact of proposed business cases, experiments, A/B tests, features, products, user flows, and marketing campaigns.
Maintaining documentation, projections, monitoring dashboards, test results, and making them available to the team.
Contributing growth ideas to the team based on insights derived from your own analysis and research.
Working closely with the Director of Product, Growth to define KPIs, projects and set targets, and surface insights to the broader product group.

REQUIREMENTS

Today you might be a Senior Data Analyst, Data Analyst, Product Analyst, Growth Analyst, Marketing Analyst, or the equivalent in your company...or something that we haven't heard of yet - we keep an open mind.

The most important characteristic for our Senior Data Analyst, Growth is your attitude. We want you to join because you don't see roadblocks, you see opportunities to be at your best. You know that somehow, you can figure anything out.

The skills required for this role:

You have 4+ years of data analytics experience working on digital products/SaaS.
You get giddy about building awesome quantitative models using SQL/Excel/Looker.
You get excited about using your strong analytical skills and aggressively focusing on driving business results.
You're a natural communicator and you love solving problems using data.
You're a pro at using product analytics tools like Mixpanel, Amplitude, etc.
You have experience using a Customer Data Platform like Segment, Mparticle, etc.

Bonus points -

You have previous python experience
You're familiar with communications platforms like Braze, Mailchimp, etc.
You geek out over startups, growth, and product management!

If you are this close to what we've described but aren't sure, apply. Let's figure out together if this is where you could shine.

BENEFITS

Our mission is big and audacious, but we're assembling a team to take the challenge head on.

As a Senior Data Analyst, Growth, you'll be joining a team that prioritizes:

People: Our company is more than just a business. We're a tight-knit team supporting each other on our mission to rebuild business banking. We're really serious about mission, fit, and the people we work with. You'll be part of a rapidly scaling team that reflects these values and keeps this place special.
Learning and Development: We have a learning culture and provide opportunities for our Customer Experience Associates to invest in their professional development, whether it's perfecting their craft or learning about other areas of the business.
Diversity: You'll find yourself in an environment that values diversity and inclusivity. We believe that a broad array of lived experiences and backgrounds are essential for creating the best possible product and company culture.
Leadership: You're right in the thick of it, making critical decisions that will clear our path forward.

You'll receive:

Top-tier health/dental benefits: We care about the people we work with and put their health first. NorthOne is proud to offer inclusive health and dental coverage.
Flexible working hours: We don't clock in and out at set times. You know when you do your best work. We celebrate accomplishments, not how many hours are spent at the office.
Unlimited paid time off: We hire talented people and know that they need time off to be at their best. Take as much time off as you need to recharge and make sure you're working sustainably.
The latest computer equipment: We make sure you have the best equipment so you can produce great work.
Professional development budget: We support lifelong learners by covering the cost of classes, workshops, conferences and books.
Remote and in person get-togethers: Bond with your teammates over shared interests at regular get-togethers. Find like-minded people who are passionate about everything from sport and music to gaming and cooking.
Remote-friendly environment: Flexibility to work from home, office, or both! We support our teammates wherever they prefer to work within North America. We are a distributed team and do not require our employees to be located in one of our office hubs.
One hell of an adventure!
Few people have been trained for this sort of role and research shows that women and people from underrepresented groups are less likely to apply if they haven't satisfied every requirement. If you are this close to what we've described, but aren't sure, apply. Let's figure out together if this is where you could shine.

NorthOne is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and celebrates diversity. We welcome all applicants regardless of race, colour, gender, age, religion, sexual orientation, disability status or national origin.

Title: BI Advisor [#3946]
Description:
Alteo is looking for a BI Advisor for a permanent position. The company is based in Montreal.

*** Hybrid: office + remote (up to 100% at your choice) ***

You will take on a key role that requires both people skills and technical knowledge. You will be responsible to build strong relationships with our partners, as well as dive into data analysis. Involved in the full life cycle of a BI solution, the ideal candidate is a people person that adapts quickly to change and simultaneous projects.

Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain strong connections with our partners while assisting them on their business needs.
Manage customers’ requests by ensuring their needs are taken care of by internal teams
Communicate with clients on updates and statuses about their requests, as well as estimate when they can expect feedbacks.
Occasionally offer trainings to our partners
Create, design, and maintain dashboards, reports, data models according to customer needs.
Create queries in SQL
Performing optimization tests and suggest improvement areas to the executive team.


Profile:
DEC/BAC in It or equivalent
3 years experience of relevant work experience
Knowledge of SQL and relational databases
Global knowledge of ERP systems
Global knowledge of Business Intelligence
Ability to solve problems and think systemically
Ability to work on several projects simultaneously
Assets: knowledge of business notions such as finance, manufacturing, and sales
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English (French is an asset but not required)
@@@@@

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Contractor (1year)
Description:
Join our team
We are the Business Intelligence team, an integral part of the TELUS Business Marketing (TBM) organization. We are a dynamic, entrepreneurial, and engaged team driven to rapidly respond and adapt to the changing needs of Canadian business customers including Small, Medium and Large segments. We are the destination of choice for entrepreneurial team members that enjoy starting something from nothing and building it up.
Come join our team if you have a passion for data, marketing, to put customers first, embrace change and embody spirited teamwork to support stakeholders across a wide variety of teams.
This role will report to the Sr. Manager of Market Intelligence, Sales & CRM Data team.
Here's the impact you'll make and what we'll accomplish together
You will build foundational data assets enabling sales teams across channels
You will drive cross segment sales channels' performance through valuable insights
Here's how
You will develop new analytical solutions to provide timely insights to the business
You will work on Salesforce (CRM) Customer data, business wireline productsYou will collaborate with cross functional teams: TBM Sales channel enablement team, Sales team, IT and other BI teams to develop foundational data assets that will drive sales' performance, measurement, and finally compensation.
You will coordinate with the product management team to ensure reporting readiness for new product launches.
You will be part of a high performing team, celebrate wins, socialize learnings and progress to our leadership team.
You're the missing piece of the puzzle
You have an extraordinary ability to build relationships, collaborate, and influence across multiple teams
You are inherently curious to understand how things work, have ability to think outside-of-the-box and work around constraints
You focus on continuous learning and development across multiple domains including telecommunications industry, technology, and customer experience
You have advanced Structured Query Language (SQL) skills and hands-on experience working on Oracle and / or SQL server databases with more than 5 years of experience
You have intermediate to expert level proficiency in SAS with at least 5 years of hands on experience
Great to haves
Prior telecommunications or B2B marketing experience
University degree in Engineering or Commerce and/or equivalent combination of experience and education
Working knowledge on Google cloud platform (GCP) and BigQuery is an asset

Title: Condition Monitoring Analyst II
Description:
Company:
Finning Canada
Number of Openings:
1
Worker Type:
Permanent
Position Overview:
The Condition Monitoring Analyst ll, (CMA) – Mining role supports the customer by maximizing productivity, lowering cost per ton, and assists in the sales effort by conveying our differentiated product support offering to our customers.

The CMA takes a proactive approach to maintenance by utilizing the latest technologies and available equipment data to provide recommendations that allow our customers to optimize their fleets. Our monitoring software allows multiple data sources (Fluid analyses, Machine Inspections, Repair History, Equipment Data, Site Conditions) to be analyzed and interpreted by a team of CMAs. Based on knowledge and experience, the CMA will interpret the information, create a recommendation and assign a priority level before sharing the recommendation with the key stake holder and customers.

Remote equipment monitoring is an evolving technology across the Mining industry and our Condition Monitoring Team members are partnering with our customers in innovative ways to improve Finning’s ability to improve mechanical availability and reduce equipment total cost of ownership. This position is a great opportunity for experienced technicians with an aptitude for technology.

To prepare for success in the role, the CMA will be provided training in various condition monitoring methods such as oil analysis, interpretation of electronic data from mining equipment, magnetic plug/ filter inspection, site condition analysis etc. The CMA will have access to a wide variety of Caterpillar and Finning training courses on the mining machines, predictive maintenance, failure analysis, data analysis, time and work management, etc. which will lay a development path for the CMA in the role. The CMA can also rely upon mentorship as well as support from Finning product managers to make smart recommendations and communicate them effectively to the customer.
Job Description:
Review and interpret condition management data to diagnose failure modes 30%
Communicate equipment condition to customers/Finning personnel to initiate preventive action 20%
Ensure that customer processes are in place to utilize condition monitoring recommendations 10%
Follow up on previous recommendation to ensure problem resolution and identify learning opportunities. 20%
Provide recommendation at fleet level to reduce customer cost and improve operator behavior 10%
Actively participate in projects to improve condition monitoring processes 10%
Qualifications:
Heavy Duty Mechanic, Mechanical or Mining Engineering Degree, or similar education
5+ years of mechanical experience required
Understanding Condition Monitoring workflow & Industrial Internet of Things (IIOT) knowledge will be consider an asset.
Knowledge of Fluid Analysis interpretation
Extended knowledge of mining equipment (Large Off Highway Trucks, Shovels, Track Type Tractors, Motor Graders) and mine site processes considered an asset
Working knowledge of engines, powertrain, hydraulics, electronic system, and telematics.
Service experience at Finning or another Caterpillar dealer will be an asset
Knowledge of machine application, design, functionality and understanding the environmental effect on the equipment performance.
Understanding effective inspection process and equipment lifecycle planning
We are committed to diversity at Finning, to building and sustaining a diverse and inclusive workforce and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all qualified individuals. Finning does not discriminate against applicants based on genders, races, national and ethnic origins, religions, ages, sexual orientation, marital and family status, and/or mental or physical disabilities.

Title: Business Analyst, Sustainability
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.
Canadian Tire’s approach to sustainability is a business strategy which fosters innovation and change that enhance social or environmental outcomes while providing compelling value to the business in the form of reduced operational costs, reduced risk and new business growth opportunity.
The Business Analyst Sustainability reports to the Manager, Business Sustainability, Innovation and Corporate Waste Management and supports the Senior Consultant Sustainability and Innovation. The successful applicant will help lead, promote, and execute customer facing sustainability programs and initiatives to support the development and success of the business sustainability strategy. The successful candidate will be data-driven and lead all of our innovation programs analysis, providing continuous feedback to the manager and senior consult on performance and opportunities for growth and improvement. Through its business sustainability strategy, the company aims to serve its customers, communities, employees, and shareholders, both now and in the future.
To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. The Business Analyst, Sustainability position is categorized as a Roamer, which means that the incumbent can successfully complete their role objectives virtually and are not required to be present on a CTC campus unless they choose to do so.
What you’ll do
Build a robust analytical framework for tracking better for the environment products
Provide regular performance analysis of the sustainable product portfolios, insights provided to relevant stakeholders and identify future opportunities
Assist with building business case proposals for various sustainability pilot projects including using competitive analysis, market, and customer research
Become a subject matter expert in all aspects of the product lifecycle and associated master data systems at the Canadian Tire family of companies
Leverage analysis to promote desired departmental outcomes
work cross-functionally with Merchandising, Marketing, Product Stewardship, Product Development, ESG and IT teams on various initiatives
Assist senior consultant with vendor engagement
Proactively look for opportunities for Canadian Tire to bolster our sustainable product programs
Complete competitive scans for the department
Keep up to date on all Environmental Sustainability initiatives throughout the organization and act as a hub for knowledge
What you bring
University or College degree. Focus on Business, Sustainability or Environmental related programs is an asset.
2+ years of business experience in an analytical role
Innovative thinker with natural curiosity; the candidate should be a motivated self-starter able to champion innovative solutions and work independently in a complex and deadline-driven environment.
Problem solvers with the ability to analyze and prioritize to meet business objectives and deadlines.
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who builds relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward.
Able to identify & develop best practices
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills.
Strong competency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.
Merchandising/Category Management experience an asset
About Canadian Tire Corporation
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn .
CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice.
#LI-GM1
 Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Finance & Admin
Ontario-Toronto
Permanent
Full-time

Title: Global Markets Analyst Rotational Program
Description:
Address:
100 King Street West
Job Family Group:
Capital Mrkts Sales & Service



Provides a markets-based suite of sales and trading solutions to Institutional, Corporate, and Retail clients. Offers a full spectrum of integrated capabilities to deliver leading market insight, risk management, and execution services to issuing and/or investor clients, including access to major global markets across asset classes including: debt, foreign exchange, interest rate, credit, equity, securitization, and commodities. Provides competitive pricing to all clients and seeks out new opportunities with prospective clients. Maximizes profit while prudently minimizing the bank’s exposure and adhering to regulatory statutes.
Acts as point person to provide client support in the form of proposals, marketing material, event planning, and scheduling with the cooperation of trading and sales, research, and marketing and with the support of a senior leader.
Responds to inquiries from clients, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community in a professional manner and determines acceptable solutions.
Helps manage the flow of inquiries, market data, and other information from clients. Routes client calls appropriately and responds quickly to client questions.
Seeks to develop an understanding of client needs and outcomes.
Coordinates conference calls, client events and meetings.
Maintains a proactive, client service focus in order to meet their needs and increase revenue; contacts customers to present available investment services and develops client prospects from among current customers, referral leads and other sources.
Verifies that all confirms on trades or sales are accurate and promptly delivered.
Communicates transaction details to the brokerage community and custodians. Resolves settlement issues related to incorrect billing.
Answers phones, file, fax, and coordinates meeting and travel arrangements.
Develops strong market knowledge to provide comprehensive service to clients, develop new solutions, and construct compelling recommendations.
Reads, analyzes and interprets common technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents in order to better serve client needs.
Supports the execution of strategic initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
Ensures alignment between stakeholders.
Cultivates strong relationships with the research team in order to understand their industries and stock coverage.
Uses analytical skills (probability, statistical inference, etc.) and applies appropriate technical concepts and completes/leads consistent and reliable technical and financial reports/analyses to support client deliverables.
Defines problems, collects data, establishes facts, and draws valid conclusions.
Develops an understanding of and proficiency in using all required systems and models.
Supports change management of varying scope and type; tasks typically focused on execution and sustainment activities.
Executes a variety of administrative and analytical tasks as assigned and with minimal supervision (e.g. procedural documentation, brokerage and client commission reporting, maintenance of contacts database, disaster recovery planning, tracking and updating of periodic trading or sales metrics, etc.).
Administers all aspects of the sales and or trading desk, record keeping, reporting, and file maintenance in accordance with internal controls and compliance policies and external regulations.
Responds to requests for information from both internal and external sources.
Communicates market data and client changes to colleagues when they are on the road or in meetings.
Provides feedback on, and, supports continuous improvement opportunities.
Considers risk, internal controls and compliance as part of day-to-day accountabilities and adheres to policies and procedures.
Focus may be on a business/group.
Thinks creatively and proposes new solutions.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works mostly independently.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Typically between 3 - 5 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Familiarity with institutional equity markets.
Series 7, 63 licenses.
Able to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, investment and financial reports.
Strong familiarity with Outlook, Excel, Reuters Plus, Bloomberg, public finance/business news websites is desired.
I-Star familiarity.
Specialized knowledge from education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
BMO Capital Markets
BMO Capital Markets is a leading, full-service North American-based financial services provider offering equity and debt underwriting, corporate lending and project financing, merger and acquisitions advisory services, securitization, treasury management, market risk management, debt and equity research and institutional sales and trading. BMO Capital Markets has approximately 2,600 professionals in 33 locations around the world, including 18 offices in North America.
BMO Capital Markets is a member of BMO Financial Group (NYSE, TSX: BMO), one of the largest diversified financial services providers in North America with US$760 billion total assets and nearly 43,000 employees as of January 31, 2021.
Global Markets
We offer research and access to global markets for institutional, corporate and retail clients through an integrated suite of sales and trading solutions that include debt, foreign exchange, credit, equity, securitization and commodities.
Program Overview:
Sales & Trading Analysts and Associates work in the Global Markets Group of BMO Capital Markets, comprising Global Fixed Income, Currency and Commodities (FICC), Global Equities and Financing Solutions (GEFS), Cross Asset Solutions (CAS) and Global Markets Engineering serving our corporate, institutional and government clients. There is a defined onboarding/training program supported by continuous professional development throughout the program.
This program is 12-16 months in length and throughout the program you will participate in rotations through various sales, trading and risk desks. Each rotation is 4-5 months in length and the Sales & Trading Analyst or Associate will gain exposure to a wide variety of products and services.
Responsibilities:
The duties of the role include performing a variety of analytical and administrative tasks as assigned. These assignments will vary widely from day to day and may include developing presentation materials using MS PowerPoint and MS Excel, fielding client phone inquiries and providing other client contact support as necessary.
Qualifications:
We are looking for highly motivated individuals who can work well in a team based environment.
Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or Master’s degree program graduating in December 2021 or Spring 2022;
Strong academic record and extracurricular achievement;
Demonstrated interest in and knowledge of financial markets;
General knowledge of financial strategy / accounting / economic / capital management principles;
Excellent research and analytical skills, able to collect, analyze and interpret data;
Experience in numerical and data analysis;
Detail and results orientated;
Strong interpersonal skills used within a demanding team environment;
Demonstrated proactivity, resiliency, positive attitude and high motivation;
Ability to attentively review, assess and provide detailed information daily on multiple projects in an organized manner;
Excellent written and oral communication skills;
Strong work ethic and a high level of professional integrity.
Technical Skills:
Excellent data manipulation/Excel/spreadsheet skills including VBA
Experience accessing data streams, such as Bloomberg
Database experience helpful (SQL, Oracle)
How to Apply:
For your application to be eligible for consideration, you must apply to the BMO application link.
Please ensure the following items are submitted in your application:
1. Resume
2. Transcript ( required for application consideration – please upload it in the resume section when applying in BMO’s Workday application)

We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
