Title: ANALYSTE ASSURANCE QUALITÉ/ QUALITY ASSURANCE ANALYST
Senior Data Analyst / Data Solution Architect
Description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Senior Data Analyst / Data Solution Architect
Job Description
Data Analytics and Consolidation Services
Support RBC enterprise wide client and credit information consolidation and analytics based on Enterprise Business Registry (EBR) functions.
Provide day to day reference data services (initiatives and inquiries) for EBR consumers i.e. Enterprise Risk Reporting, Capital Measurement, Large Exposure Framework (LEF) reporting and IFRS9.
Build the data controls for critical reference data elements that EBR owns the derivation and precedence rules.
Build the data controls and attestations for reference data that EBR published and exception reports.
Regularly monitor the exception reports and attestation results to assess the impact to EBR data consumers.
Support the review and challenge of the data assessment from RBC finance and risk data second line of defense units for EBR perspective.
Support the data quality investigation and remediation action from Finance and Risk Data Management Office.
Maintain the proof of records for Initiatives, Investigation, Challenges, and Data Audits from various RBC data policy and control units from EBR perspective.
Reference Data and Rules Management
Maintain and document the enterprise critical Credit Risk Data Element derivation and precedence rules with Risk and Finance stakeholders (i.e. business owners from Credit Risk, Finance and Capital Measurement, Risk Models and Parameter Estimation, Risk and Finance Reporting adjudicators etc.)
Engage the enterprise stakeholders and manage the rule reviews.
Manage the reference data rule inquiries and investigations with stakeholders and data consumers.
Oversight the quality of critical Credit Risk Data Elements and data issue reporting impacts for areas including Enterprise Risk Reporting (ERR), Wholesale Portfolio Management (WCPM), Wholesale Credit Risk (WCR), Special Loan (SL), Wholesale Parameter Estimation, Finance and Risk Capital.
Execute the data controls and attestations to assess the effectiveness of Credit Risk Reference Data and relevant reporting process impact.
Report impact and assist in possible solutions for data defects and remediation.
Advise on reference data risk control adjudications.
Manage the coordination and reviews for remediation activities with Finance and Risk Data Management and Operations
Support regulatory reviews, audit inquiries, self-assessments and exams as appropriate.
What do you need to succeed?
Must-Have:
Credit Risk and/or Finance Management: Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in any area among Credit Risk management, modelling or reporting in the areas of Wholesale/Retail Credit Risk, Wholesale Portfolio Management and Risk Reporting, Capital and Finance calculation and reporting, etc.
Data Analytics and Business Data Requirement: Proven experience as a senior data analyst. Ability to independently query databases, consolidates data, automate the data collection, conduct analysis, review logic and business rules. Supply explicit business data requirement for IT counterparts.
Data Quality Management: Ability to design and execute appropriate scenarios, tests and analytical approaches to validate the quality of data and reports, test the effectiveness of data controls.
Communication: Effective written and oral communications skills to explain concepts, structure content and proven ability to communicate to different levels.
Problem Solving: Creative thinking to support or advise the development of creative solutions.
Agile, Structured Thinking & Critical Reasoning: Ability to adapt quickly and learn and innovate while dealing with ambiguity and unknowns by creating structure to reach solutions.
Collaboration: Ability to engage and collaborate with medium to large groups of counterparts and audience.
Networking: Ability to build and utilize internal networks
Nice to Have:
Assurance and/or management consulting experience are a plus.
Analytical and modelling experience is a plus.
Tableau development experience is a great asset.
Credit Risk report preparation experience is a plus.
Understanding of major risk/finance regulatory requirements and/or BCBS 239 Principles.
Knowledge of RBC’s finance/risk systems infrastructure and data architecture is a plus.
Graduate degree in business or related discipline and/or MBA, or other professional related qualification.
Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in data quality related activities.
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work
Job Summary
Manage the Enterprise Reference Data analytics and Data solutions from financial institution’s Risk and Finance perspective. Assist in establishment and execution of Reference Data Management Framework and Data Controls to safeguard the reference data published to RBC Risk and Finance reporting units. Provide day to day service to enterprise consumers and stakeholders of reference data consumed and published. Manage the reference data precedence rule and reviews with stakeholders. Manage the reference data consumption and sourcing improvement and development based on regulatory and consumer/provider initiatives.

Title: Business Analyst IAM
Description:
Company Description
Talan Canada is growing and looking to strengthen its team with a Business Analyst IAM for the Montreal office, who will be interested in working with clients from multiple industries.

Job Description
The main tasks are:
Support / Onboarding:
Be Single Point of Contact to onboard application on IAM solutions (SSO + IAM)
Capture the requirements of users that ease the adoption and push it to the Product Owner
Ensure of the stability and availability of the services/tools for IAM
Ensure to operate the services in compliance with the security rules
Communicate on incidents
Participate to reduce the online support activity by:
Promoting the Self service
Enhance the existing documentation
Identify automation of recurrent tasks
Spread the knowledge
Liaise with teams in Bangalore and Paris
Contribute to the documentation and spread the good usage of the tools
Promote the SSO solution of the group by holding presentation session
Animate Hands-on session with applications.

Qualifications
Technical Skills:
Desired: IAM, AD/LDAP, OIDC, SAML2, basic network, API, Git
Plus: Python or any language, ELK stack, SQL
A curiosity on security field is mandatory.
Soft Skills:
Practical sense: the candidate must suggest pragmatical solutions to fit the need of the user while respecting the quality standards.
Analysis and synthesis: be able to understand complex problems involving multiple IT teams or users.
Organisation and planning: be able to manage his working time autonomously and have a strong sense of priority
Perseverance and result oriented: Demonstrate self-exigence. Perseverance to find a solution, despite the difficulty. Stay positive. Focus on the outcome.
Oral and written communication: adapt your message to capture the attention of your audience. The candidate should able to communicate with developer, business analyst or manager.
Client centric and sense of service: To identify needs, the candidate must understand the reasons and motivations of the users of the platforms. He must direct his tasks according to their work habits, while helping them to evolve.
Cooperation and Team Spirit: He must work in good agreement with the members of the IAM teams all around the world and other teams like security and infrastructure team.
Languages: English, French is a strong plus since we are supporting tools at group level.
Experience needed:
At least 5 years experience in support, business or developer analyst and be knowledgeable on Identity Access Management domain.
Educational Requirements:
Bachelor of computer science or other related university degree
You must live in Montreal or be willing to relocate rapidly from anywhere in Canada and possess a valid work permit.
Additional Information
Talan is a consulting firm specializing in digital innovation and transformation. For over 20 years, Talan has been advising, supporting, and implementing transformation projects for businesses and public authorities, in France and abroad. With operations on five continents and nearly 5,000 consultants, the group anticipates a revenue of 600 million euros in 2022 and expects a turnover of 1 billion euros by 2024. The group places innovation at the heart of its development strategy and is involved in areas of technological change affecting major corporations, such as Big Data, the Internet of Things, Cryptocurrencies, and Artificial Intelligence.
Joining Talan also means:
Joining a Canadian group with more than 500 consultants, working in an agile and pragmatic way with large companies (Finance, Insurance, Telecommunications, Services, Distribution, Public sector) by combining consulting services / technological expertise / innovation / ability to deliver and deploy projects
Joining dynamic teams, where the role of the employee is at the center of attention, with the desire to create spaces allowing everyone to flourish
Participating in different communities to contribute to development and to innovate, all with a strong team and entrepreneurship spirit
Talan is a great playground, it's up to you!

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Senior Business Analyst

 Measure and analyze credit exposures and Economic Capital for various units within the bank
 Investigate, analyze and explain changes in portfolio sector and country concentrations

 As Senior Analyst, you are a key member of the Portfolio Management team, and play a significant role in managing the bank’s wholesale credit portfolio, including the analysis and implementation of concentration management methodologies and related work. Title: BI Consultant (Remote)
Description:
As an integral member of our consulting team, the Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant is responsible for the modification of cubes, pipelines and processes to support report and dashboard development; and the development of those custom reports and dashboards. Given our broad geographical footprint, they can be located anywhere in the US or Canada.
Responsibilities:

Translate business requirements into specifications that will be used as the basis to develop the required reports and dashboards
Modify data warehouse, cubes, pipelines and/or data models to support reporting and dashboard requirements
Develop reports, analytics and dashboards to meet clients’ requirements using appropriate BI tool
Develop SQL views to support reporting and dashboard requirements
Provide technical assistance and cross training to other team members
Proactively communicate status, issues, and concerns to Director of BI and/or project manager
Understand and follow NexTec Implementation Methodology and best practices
Independently manage work schedule and organize assigned tasks to meet deadlines. Independently resolve scheduling/workload conflicts while responsible for multiple activity streams and tasks
Other duties as assigned


Requirements:

Bachelors’ Degree in Accounting, Business, MIS, Computer Science, Finance, Supply Chain or equivalent combination of education and experience
3+ years experience with Power BI, including Desktop and Service, and use of Data Analysis Expression (DAX)
SQL skills required including the ability to write complex SQL queries
Experience with the complete Microsoft BI stack (Power BI, Power Pivot, Power Query and SQL)
Experience with BI for Sage X3, Microsoft GP, Acumatica a plus
Prior consulting experience a plus
Excellent interpersonal (verbal and written) communication skills
Strong analytical, conceptual and problem-solving abilities
Results-oriented individual who can prioritize and execute activities in a high-pressure environment
Demonstrated ability to deliver work product on-time and within budget
Demonstrated ability to work within defined project scope and recognize client request that are outside of scope
Customer facing, outgoing, and confident personality
Professional demeanor, able to work well with other team members as well as customers
Ability to take direction, as well as work autonomously
Ability to travel in the US and Canada up to 10%

About NexTec:

NexTec Group is a consulting firm with offices, customers and employees spread throughout the US and Canada, specializing in technology to help our clients manage and transform their business. This includes Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Business Intelligence (BI), Cloud and On-premise solutions for mid-sized businesses. In the 25+ years that NexTec has been in business, we’ve developed close working relationships with our customers, partners and each other. Consistently recognized on of the top 100 VARs by Bob Scott and Accounting Today, we have the biggest and most experienced Sage team in the industry with multiple Sage awards throughout the years and our Acumatica team is a Gold-certified partner and President’s Club member.

Title: Business Analyst (Technical & Data)
Description:
Position Location: London, ON
Position Title: Business Analyst (Technical & Data) – Full time/Permanent
Position Reports To: Team Lead, Enterprise Analyses
Department/Unit Name: Corporate Operations
Job Summary:

Playing a dual role, a Business Analyst – Technical and Data (BATD) will analyze information and operational systems and develop software applications or data analytics solutions for the company. They manipulate and analyze large data sets to answer business questions and document results which may be used as the basis for new or updated software solutions. They sometimes provide ongoing support for these solutions. As technology changes and customers evolve, so must their products.
AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:
Data Analysis

Work with larger data sets, manage and manipulate through programming.
Analyze these data sets and deliver reports that outline a company’s inefficiencies, inaccuracies and other issues.
In collaboration with functional leaders or experts, make recommendations, draw market-oriented conclusions and develop business solutions


Business Analysis:

Help gather and determine requirements, either with cross-functional groups or other Business/Process analysts.
Assist stakeholders to determine best solutions to a problem and then create and lead system change proposals
Assess ways to further leverage existing systems
While evaluating new projects or requests for enhancements, help determine the project cost, timeline, goals and feasibility and then support the project through completion.

Existing Software Modification
Ensure data or software solutions continue to meet customer needs by capturing changes in requirements and making corresponding updates to existing software or data analytics. This can range from implementing small software enhancements to completely redesigning a program


Software Development

Partnering with other programmers, aid in the design, development and implementation of new programs and applications. This can include developing in-house software or software for sales purposes.
Participate in the testing and de-bugging of new software, making recommendations to the programming team that respond to technical problems.


Qualifications:

Applicants should have a minimum of a combination of college diploma + 3-5 years of relevant experience or an undergraduate degree with 1-3 years of relevant experience. The successful candidate will possess strong quantitative and analytical skills. Further, they will have excellent written and verbal communication skills and good business acumen. In addition, the ideal candidate will be self-motivated and work with a sense of urgency. The Business Analyst role requires proficiency in current programming and data analytics languages/tools and database management/design skills.
WORKING CONDITIONS:

 Hybrid based
Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available upon request.

Title: Workforce Analyst
Description:
Address: 100 King Street West 
  







Job Family Group: 






Data Analytics & Reporting 
  
Consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes. Provides advice on the configuration, functionality, applicability, and usability of data management, data analytics, and data visualization technology solutions. Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality and data analytics, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools. 

Acts as a trusted advisor to assigned business/group. 
Leads the design, development, and implementation of analytic solutions. 
Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making. 
Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business 
Ensures alignment between stakeholders about business needs and data needs. 
Ensures alignment between stakeholders about business needs and data needs. 
Leads/participates in the design, implementation and management of new analytics & reporting solutions. 
Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions. 
Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards. 
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations. 
Structures and assembles data into multi-dimensions with various granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions). 
Cleanses, manipulates, and transforms data through programming / scripting for model training and validation. 
Automates validation tests to improve quality and efficiency of the validation process. 
Validates and tests models used in analytics and reporting to assess/address performance and compliance. 
Conducts various pre-implementation and post-implementation analyses to estimate/measure business impact caused by model adoption (e.g., revenue increase, cost reduction, corporate brand image). 
Promotes reporting automation, self-serve analytics consumption, and the culture of analytics-driven decision making. 
Monitors and tracks tool performance, user acceptance testing, and addresses any issues. 
Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhanced analysis and/or streamlined reporting. 
Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions. 
Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards. 
Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights. 
Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs. 
Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. 
Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations. 
Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users; may include delivery of training to audiences. 
Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes. 
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders. 
Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives. 
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus. 
Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support. 
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules. 
Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations. 
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed. Qualifications: 
Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 
Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Spotfire, Tableau, SQL, SAS, R, Python, MATLAB, SPSS - In-depth. 
Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience. 
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth. 
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth. 
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth. 
Influence skills - In-depth. 
Data driven decision making - In-depth. 


We’re here to help 

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world. 

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

Title: Sr. Pricing Analyst
Description:
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY:

As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.
THE OPPORTUNITY:
Lead the Pricing Process & business case construction for new models, new products, promotions & structures, working with product management to ensure pricing supports product strategy
Constantly evaluate & refine price points, pricing models & policies
Devise simplification strategies and build roadmaps to reduce portfolio pricing complexities
Become the “trusted advisor” to product management team on all aspects of product licensing and pricing and become knowledgeable in both product solutions and market dynamics
Work directly with operations team to ensure appropriate packaging and setup of new products reflects business intent & simplicity for Sales
Determine and conduct business analysis to (1) support strategic model/market shifts, (2) model financial impacts of pricing actions, (3) estimate street prices, (4) monitor progress of initiatives, (5) understand buying & selling behaviors (6) model financial impact of pricing actions, (7) derive customer ROI analysis as part of a value-based pricing approach.
Create instructional/training material to educate stakeholders, ie Sales teams, PM, PMK, etc
Support Deal Desk on deals, helping with deal configuration and discount requests/assessments as needed.
YOU ARE GREAT AT:
A sharp, analytical well-rounded person who wants to employ finance, marketing, and operations knowledge and skills to excel as a Pricing Analyst in a large, multi-billion software company?
A curious problem solver?
A self-directed, motivated person who wants to work to be the expert on all things pricing for the assigned portfolios
A personable, collaborative person to work with Product Managers, Sales and other stakeholders to achieve outstanding outcomes that drive revenue and efficiencies?
Willing to learn the enterprise software business from a unique perspective, with exposure to Operations, Product Management, Engineering, Product Pricing, Pricing Strategy and Sales?
WHAT IT TAKES:
Bachelors degree required
MBA and/or equivalent work experience
Knowledge of Product Mgmt, Product Mktg, Sales, Operations, Finance and/or Pricing processes a plus
Knowledge of the software or IT industry
Strong problem solving and communication skills
Ability to understand and conduct business analysis & data analysis to support projects and/or problem hypotheses
Strong team player with excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to anticipate issues and challenges, and prioritize effectively with little supervision
Ability to adapt and function effectively in a fast-paced, changing environment
Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills
Required: 3+ years in related role in a Product Mgmt, Product Mktg, Operations, Analytics and/or Pricing capacity
Demonstrated problem-solving and analytical skills
#LI-REMOTE
OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

Title: Analyst, Business Improvement
Description:
Job Description:

Business Improvement Analyst
Health Services - Strategic Policy & Performance
13 Month Contract - Full Time
Reporting to the Manager, Health Strategic Planning and Performance, this position works closely with stakeholders across the Health Services department to improve performance through planning, measurement, evaluation and process management efforts.
The incumbent will contribute to the work of the team by assuming a project support role on large and complex projects by providing business improvement knowledge and analytic support.
Responsibilities:
Contribute to the development and maintenance of the team practices and methodologies (e.g. strategic/business planning, operational planning, performance measurement and reporting, program/service evaluation, business process management and process improvement)
Support the facilitation of teams at all levels across the Health Services department through various initiatives using established methodologies
Responsible for analysis and report writing
Conduct literature reviews and best practice research
Document process mapping
Develop and administers surveys and/or leads focus groups to gather perspectives and data
Build and strengthen positive relationships with internal customers, stakeholders and colleagues
Ensure all phases of project delivery are performed within standards, timeframes, scope and budget requirements and that project risk is managed
Raise awareness, desire, knowledge and use of planning, measurement, evaluation and process management across the department
Support the integration of performance management into existing business practices within the Health Services department
Participate in the design and implementation of a planning and performance management system for Health Services
Build capacity across the Health Services department through education, facilitation and sharing of best practices
Maintain ongoing focus on internal customer needs
Stay current on relevant trends and priorities across the Public and Healthcare sectors in Ontario
Provide additional just in time support to the team as needed
Qualifications:
University degree in Business, Health or Public Administration, with courses in quantitative and qualitative research methods or related experience
1-3 years of experience working in a project environment, including working knowledge of project management, change management, analysis and interpretation, facilitation, client relationship management and consultation
An equivalent combination of education and/or experience may be considered
Experience working in the health sector considered an asset
Strong interpersonal skills to be able to work with teams at all levels across the Health Services Department
Ability to think strategically
Demonstrated ability to develop and implement timely solutions to complex problems
Ability to maintain focus, energy, commitment and positive attitude in the face of uncertainty, change and resistance
Ability to adapt and work effectively in a variety of situations and with various individuals or groups.
Customer-centred philosophy and approach
Strong numeracy and analysis skills
Strong primary and secondary research skills with ability to critique, synthesize, summarize and write complex articles and/or reports
Ability to organize, evaluate, analyze and present information effectively and concisely both verbally and in writing
Effective time management skills with the ability to juggle multiple priorities
Strong organization skills and attention to detail
Ability to work independently with minimal direction and the ability to meet strict deadlines
Proficiency in all MS office applications (Visio, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project)
Intermediate knowledge and experience working with SPSS
Ability to conduct statistical analysis considered an asset
Location: In this role you will have the ability to work mostly remote. You will be required to occasionally attend on-site meetings based on operational requirements at the 7120 Hurontario Street, Mississauga worksite. Your remote work location must be located within the province of Ontario.
Hours of Work: 35 Hours/week Monday - Friday 8:30 AM - 4:30 PM
The Region of Peel offers job based flexible hours of work that allows employees to manage personal and professional responsibilities while at the same time ensures business operational needs and customer service expectations are achieved.
Interview: Our recruitment process will be completed with video conference technology.
If this opportunity matches your qualifications and experience, please apply on-line.
As part of the Region’s ongoing commitment to health and safety, there are enhanced Covid-19 specific safety protocols and/or personal protective equipment requirements (e.g. masks, eye protection, etc.) in place to help protect health and safety. The additional requirements are determined based on the nature of the work being carried out.
New employees who commence employment on or after October 1, 2021 are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Being fully vaccinated is determined as the status of having received the full series of approved vaccines (both doses of a two dose vaccine series, one dose of a single dose vaccine series) and any additional doses required and approved by Health Canada and having satisfied the full post vaccination period required to ensure vaccination efficacy. The Region of Peel reserves the right to request proof of vaccination at any time. Acceptable proof includes an Ontario Ministry of Health COVID-19 vaccine receipt which you can obtain through the Provincial portal https://covid19.ontariohealth.ca/, or other government-issued vaccine passport or certification.
The requirement to be fully vaccinated is subject to the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you are not fully vaccinated, a documented medical reason provided by a physician or registered nurse and time period for the medical reason may be accepted.
About Us:

The Region of Peel serves more than 1.4 million residents and approximately 173,000 businesses in Brampton, Caledon and Mississauga. We deliver a wide range of resident focused services across the Region.
Our 20-year vision for Peel is “Community for Life.” Our goal is to create a place where everyone enjoys a sense of belonging and has access to the services and opportunities needed to thrive in each stage of their lives. Our 2015-2035 Strategic Plan outlines the work we're focused on to bring this vision to life.
To learn more about the Region of Peel, explore peelregion.ca.
Additional Information:

The Region of Peel is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is respected and valued for their contributions, and where everyone is treated fairly and has opportunity to grow and develop. As one of the most diverse regions in Canada, we are committed to establishing a qualified workforce that is reflective of the population we serve.
The Region of Peel is committed to providing accommodations throughout the recruitment process, upon request. If you require accommodation please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs. Accessible formats and communication supports are available. Please contact zzg-hrtalentacquisition@peelregion.ca. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.
Please be advised, the Region of Peel uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicant’s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the position and your application will be removed from the competition.

Title: Statistical Analyst
Description:
About Western

Since 1878, Western University has been committed to serving our communities through the pursuit of academic excellence and by providing students, faculty, and community members with life-long opportunities for intellectual, social, and cultural growth. We seek excellent students, faculty, and staff to join us in what has become known as the "Western Experience" - an opportunity to contribute to a better world through the development of new knowledge, new abilities, new connections, and new ways to make a difference.

About Us

The Department of Medicine possesses a strong track record of academic excellence. We attract the best and brightest students, residents, and fellows, because of our excellent faculty and staff, innovative teaching methods and diverse learning experiences in an environment that is supportive and nurturing. Our faculty and trainees are passionate about ensuring the consistent delivery of patient centered care, including safety and quality. We are part of a larger healthcare system that works to deliver the health solutions that people require in London and Southwestern Ontario. The Department of Medicine works closely with academic hospitals, the Southwest Local Health Integrated Network and community physicians and partners to achieve accessible and sustainable healthcare for all.

Responsibilities

The Department of Medicine (DOM) seeks a detail-oriented and statistically adept Statistical Analyst to assist Department of Medicine researchers in designing experimental surveys and clinical studies, determining sample size calculations, and performing quantitative data analysis to help identify actionable and statistically robust conclusions. The successful candidate should be highly familiar with and able to: provide direction and support to DOM researchers in survey design, developing analysis plans, managing, cleaning and transforming numerical and other data, generating descriptive statistics and performing a variety of statistical analyses. The Incumbent will also assist researchers with interpreting their results and translating findings into appropriate formats for written and oral presentations as well as publications.
Within the Department of Medicine, research is conducted by senior investigators, new and mid-career faculty and postgraduate trainees. An ability to effectively communicate with these various types of Investigators is essential. In addition, the Incumbent would provide teaching and ongoing workshops on experimental design, data organization and archiving and statistical analysis to trainees and new faculty.

Qualifications

Education:
PhD in statistics or biostatistics or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience:
- 3 years' work experience in a related academic research environment - Experience in most of the tools, SAS, Stat, SQL, R, MS Office Suite, SPSS

Required Skills:
PhD in statistics or biostatistics or an equivalent combination of education and experienceExperience in health economic evaluations and quality improvement methods is an assetExperience in most of the tools: SAS, SPSS, Stat, SQL, R, MS Office SuiteAbility to manage numerical dataAbility to perform statistical analysisAbility to form and present results, including clear interpretationsAbility to prioritize projects with competing deadlinesAbility to manage time and resources, work independently and effectively as a team member to achieve department goalsCommunication skills to describe concepts effectively to both novice and sophisticated usersMust be able to travel between Hospital, University and Research Institute sites within LondonMay occasionally need to work outside regular business hours

Applying at Western

To ensure that your application is given full consideration, please complete all relevant sections of the application. In addition, you can choose to supplement your application with a cover letter and current resume.

Consideration of applicants will include an assessment of previous performance, experience, and qualifications. Applicants should have oral communication skills in English.

Western Values Diversity

The University invites applications from all qualified individuals. Western is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, members of racialized groups/visible minorities, Indigenous persons, persons with disabilities, persons of any sexual orientation, and persons of any gender identity or gender expression.

Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require accommodations for interviews or other meetings, please contact Human Resources at hrhelp@uwo.ca or phone 519-661-2194.

Please Note:

Effective September 7, 2021, all employees and visitors to campus are required to comply with Western's COVID-19 Vaccination Policy.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.

Title: IT Business Analyst
Description: Athenian Group is a full-service placement agency providing Professional Technical Recruitment, Staffing and Payroll services to Canada’s top Consulting, Engineering, Manufacturing and Construction companies.Our focus is on providing businesses with the highest quality of worker for both contract and permanent staff positions.Our client is a Leading Energy Services company with multiple business lines operating across Western Canada.Currently we are recruiting for a Sherwood Park, Alberta based;IT Business Analyst The IT Business Analyst translates business needs into technical requirements for business systems or processes, and ensures all solutions support and conform to business needs and specifications. The IT Business Analyst acts as liaison between business unit and IT teams. The IT Business Analyst reports directly to the Information Technology Manager.Key Responsibilities: Act as a liaison between Information Systems and business areas/subject matter experts in Accounting, Finance, Project Services, HR, Payroll, SCM, and other teams. Analyze and assess current business processes and underlying systems/applications. Plan, elicit, capture, analyze and validate business, functional and technical requirements. Identify business needs and design solutions within an enterprise framework.Evaluate and lead changes and smaller projects that integrate across complex business applications; designing and documenting specifications for system changes, system integrations, and making application configurations.Develop all testing criteria, scripts, and test plans required to ensure that system changes and enhancements function as designed, including system, integration and user acceptance testing.Help develop, implement, and continually improve processes for the management of incidents, changes, data, projects, security, knowledge base, contracts, auditing, and any other internal business processes.Produce timely and high-quality requirements-related work products, including requirement specifications, process flows, mock-ups and qualifications.Proficient in both traditional Waterfall SDLC and Agile / Lean methodologies, Microsoft Project, Office and Visio.Leverage use of business intelligence for enterprise data reporting, analytics and dashboards to meet or anticipate business and executive needs.Perform other duties as required or assigned which are reasonably within the scope of roleQualificationsDemonstrated experience with full SDLC software and hardware projects from a Business Analyst perspective and proven adherence to Business Analyst standards and best practicesStrong relationship management skills with internal clients (e.g. management, peers and colleagues); proven ability to develop collaborative approachesAbility to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a continually changing environmentAbility to understand how systems integrate and interrelate and resolve complex integration issues.Project experience: conceptualization, planning, leading or managing, traditional and agile methodologiesKnowledge with programming languages and technical tools, especially SQL, is a plusExperience as an IT/Systems Business Analyst in an ERP environment is preferred.Outstanding written and verbal communications skills, including documentation and presentations, for business and technical audiencesExperience with data management, integrations, business intelligence and analytics is a plusEducation: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology, Business or Equivalent.Business process reengineering experience, Six Sigma certification etc. is a plus.ITIL certification desiredExperience: 5+ years experience work experience as a Business Analyst with business systems / ERPs, especially the following modules:FinancialsHRPayrollProjectsSCMSecurityExperience with IFS and/or UKG software is an advantageProject Management experience a plusIf you or someone you know is interested in this position, please contact;http://www.atheniangroup.ca/job-seekers/?JOBSHAREYE6HBXQRUIBCI4D44DLSPOFCFJETRLXR5667CQCKO6RB3E7OX5XTW2KB2DBSSOW76MNITZ56ZQGVZRDCWAZSM4Y4WJ6V3A3VJob Type: Full-timeSchedule:Monday to Friday

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
The Bounteous Business Intelligence team is currently looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who can lead reporting, dashboarding, and analysis for strategic clients. The right candidate should have a strong understanding of digital analytics, data visualization, marketing tactics and strategies, enabling strong recommendations and insights in program reporting.
Roles and Responsibilities
Develop regular and ad hoc analyses rooted in drawing out insights and optimization
Work with internal teams and clients to strategize and implement analytics measurement plans
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources, work with data science and data implementation teams as necessary to ensure proper data tracking and aggregation
Provide quality assurance of data on an ongoing basis, identifying and correcting inaccuracies
Work directly with clients in presenting analysis and reporting on ongoing marketing initiatives
Manage and grow analytics partnerships, staying on top of cutting edge technologies and vendors
Recognize opportunities for efficiencies in processes, and work appropriately across teams to realize enhancements
Preferred Qualifications
4+ years digital analytics experience
2+ years experience in at least two of the following data viz platforms: Tableau, PowerBI, Looker
Keen eye for developing insightful data visualization and passion for data storytelling
Has focused on one or more of the following areas: digital analytics, optimization, statistical modeling, consumer insights, and/or marketing analytics.
A degree in IT, Digital Marketing Analytics, or related field plus internship experience in digital analytics
Experienced with Google Analytics and has implemented, configured, and customized the tool
Strong proficiency in excel
Understand how to read and interpret reports
Ability to clearly explain technical ideas verbally and in writing
Ability to manage and prioritize a number of concurrent projects
A team player that can lead analytics projects and rally colleagues around a shared vision
Desire and talent for presenting data to clients and colleagues
R knowledge or can speak to big data
Experience with BigQuery and SQL is a plus

Title: Logistics and Inventory Analyst
Description:
Logistics and Inventory Analyst

Located at 3099 Barrington Street in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada, B3K 5M7, and 35 Micmac Boulevard, Dartmouth, Nova Scotia, Canada, B3A 4Y8, Irving Shipbuilding has a proud history as Canada's shipbuilder. A proud member of the J.D. Irving, Limited group of companies, we have been building quality vessels and fabricated modules for more than 50 years, and our Halifax Shipyard has been at the forefront of Canadian shipbuilding for 130 years.
Since 2012, we have invested more than $400 million in facilities, people, processes, and technology, making Halifax Shipyard one of the most modern and capable shipyards in North America. Over the next 30 years our shipbuilders will construct 20+ modern patrol ships and surface combatants for the Royal Canadian Navy as part of Canada's National Shipbuilding Strategy, the largest defence procurement in Canadian history. This year we delivered the second lead Arctic and Offshore Patrol Ship, the largest Navy ship built in Canada in 50 years and we're just getting started. The third ship will be delivered in 2022.

We're growing our team with career-defining opportunities that will revitalize Canada's shipbuilding industry and provide Canada's sailors with the ships they need to protect Canada's interests at home and abroad. Our workforce of over 2,000 will grow to more than 2,800 at peak construction of the Canadian Surface Combatants. We have built more than 80% of Canada's current combatant fleet and continue to perform maintenance and modernization work on the ships, including the Halifax-class frigates.

Irving Shipbuilding Inc. is seeking a Logistics and Inventory Analyst.
This is a permanent full-time role based in Halifax Regional Municipality, Nova Scotia. The primary language of work is English. We encourage applications from qualified African Nova Scotians, racially visible persons, women (applying for non-traditional positions), persons with disabilities, Aboriginal persons and persons of the LGBTQ+ community. ISI encourages applicants to self-identify in the cover letter/resume portion of your application. Irving Shipbuilding Inc. is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment where all employees feel supported and valued.

The Logistics and Inventory Analyst will be responsible for mining data to identify opportunities for improvements, completing analysis, and working to resolutions. The Inventory and Logistics Analyst will be a self-starter, who thrives in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a high level of professionalism, accuracy, and detail.

Qualifications:
Academically qualified with a recognized university bachelor’s or graduate degree
2-5 Years experience in a related area
Proficient with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, etc.)
Strong analytical, organization and communication skills
Fimilar with lean methodologies and project management principles
MRP/ERM experience would be considered an asse

All successful applicants must meet requirements for Canadian Controlled Goods Program (CGP), Canadian Government Security clearance, and U.S. International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR).

Key Responsibilities:
Analyze business trends
Design and Support implementation of end-to-end operational models
Lead problem solving activities from identification, analysis through to resolution
Lead or support improvement projects within the Inventory and Logistics team
Improve deficiencies in Inventory and Logistics processes, utilizing lean methodologies

What We Offer:
Irving Shipbuilding is proud to offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including but not limited to:
A flexible medical, dental, and vision plan;
Employee & Family Assistance Programs;
RRSP matching program;
Health & Wellness reimbursements;
Opportunities to take part in job related training and development;
Growth and progression opportunities within Irving Shipbuilding and the larger network of the JD Irving group of companies.
Relocation costs (if applicable)

Please be advised that some positions within our business have been designated as ‘Safety Sensitive’ where the employee holding the position has a heightened responsibility for his/her own safety or the safety of others due to the nature of the job. If this is the case, you will be informed in the interview process.

For further details, please contact Stephen Empringham at Empringham.Stephen@Irvingshipbuilding.com

To Apply for this Career Opportunity:
Please complete the online application form. An up-to-date resume of past experience and education is required.


All applications will be reviewed by one of our recruiters. If the recruiter sees a potential opportunity (current or future) that matches your skills and experience, you will be contacted to discuss your qualifications for a position with Irving Shipbuilding.


We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Title: Supply Chain Analyst- 6 Month Contract
Description:
GRIFFITH FOODS

Griffith Foods is a global manufacturer of food products. We provide a wide range of taste and texture components for food industry customers throughout the world. Our products include seasoning blends, dry mixes, coating systems, dough blends, crumbs, flavors, sauces and food bases that are used in an extensive variety of application from snack foods and processed meat and poultry to ready meals. Our customers include food processors, restaurant operators and grocery retailers. While our name may not be familiar to consumers, our products are key components of foods offered by many of the world’s best-known companies.

Summary:
The Supply Chain Analyst is responsible for the gathering, reporting and providing analysis of Finished Goods volumes to make key demand and supply decisions. This role is responsible for the coordination of Inventory at Risk (IAR) and issues related to aging inventory, as well as, assistance with the mid to long-term (MLT) Supply Planning process.

Responsibilities:

Prepare supply chain management reports at multiple levels on a periodic basis.
Support the supply chain team and other functional areas with data extracts and dashboard reporting.
Be the supply chain point of contact for commercial teams to develop or enhance stock agreements for negotiation with customers.
Responsible for maintaining integrity of the master data.
Support in developing pragmatic decision-making models using statistical methods and operations research to measure, standardize and optimize supply chain elements.
Collaborate with IT developers to mine data and develop queries to provide information for decision-making.
Perform special supply chain related projects and assignments as needed.

Inventory Planning & Analysis

Perform inventory management duties, such as Safety Stock analysis, Lead Time review, MOQ review and monitoring short-dated inventory.
Monitor inventory levels, and review, evaluate and analyze the impact of business or operational changes to supply and service levels.
Proactively identify products at risk of stock-out; develop and execute action plans to mitigate low supply.
Monitor and identify the Inventory at Risk of obsolescence, perform root cause analysis and recommend preventive/corrective actions.

Partner and collaborate with cross-functional business teams to salvage the inventory and reduce the inventory exposure

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in supply chain, Industrial/Operations Engineering or Business, required.

APICS/ CPIM preferred.

ERP system knowledge preferred.

Proficiency in Advanced MS Excel, MS Office, Data Analysis Tools.

Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills.

What We Offer (*):

Health and Group Benefits (100% of premiums paid by Griffith foods)

Education reimbursement program
Life event recognition and on the job recognition
Generous defined contribution retirement plan
Career development and growth opportunities
Annual wellness allowance
Annual incentive

please note that terms and conditions apply

Equal Opportunity Employer:
Griffith Foods is an equal opportunity employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, we celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

If you need assistance or an accommodation due to disability, please let us know at the time of interview

Title: Analyst, Service Enablement
Description:
About The Role

Safe Software is looking for an Analyst, Service Enablement to join our Service Enablement team. As an Analyst, you will be responsible for providing data insights and improving automated business and development workflows between the Product team and other key divisions within the company: Marketing, Sales, Legal and customer-facing groups at Safe.

Your contributions will play an important part in informing strategy at Safe Software, as well as in helping the company operate smoothly and efficiently.

About The Team

Service Enablement is a team that facilitates the smooth communication and sharing of data and resources between departments and teams to enable the delivery of product. We help cross-functional teams work effectively and efficiently. At Safe, not only are we connecting our product development effort with customer-facing teams, but also connecting with our external users by managing the flow of inbound and outbound product data.

Service Enablement ensures that the product organization is equipped to scale and grow consistently and with low friction, and helps the product management team make data-driven prioritization decisions based upon product data and statistics.

What You'll Be Doing

As an Analyst, Service Enablement, you will have the opportunity to:

Collaborate across departments in support of our Atlassian ecosystem, primarily with Jira, to help teams implement and refine their Kanban workflows, manage user settings and assist with reporting needs.
Collect, organize and analyze user data arriving from our product streams for consumption by multiple teams at Safe including Product as we increase our focus on data-driven decision making.
Develop and explore our search insight data framework from our Coveo federated search stack to provide actionable feedback to our content delivery teams.
Develop software in Python, Node.js, and React to help in the automation of workflows and the production and presentation of reports through web services and enterprise integrations.

Qualifications, Skills, and Competencies

A degree or diploma in Computer Science, data analytics, or equivalent experience.
Previous experience working in data analytics or have relevant industry experience.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Collaboration skills and ability to work with multiple teams.
Ability to analyze complex data with a high attention to detail.
Familiarity with scripting languages such as Python.
Positive and self-motivated.
Strong time management and organization skills.

Bonus Points

Previous experience with Jira, and other products in the Atlassian suite.
Previous experience with Coveo.

Life At Safe

At Safe, you’ll find a community of passionate and innovative people who thrive on working together as a team to push our vision forward.

While we take our work seriously, Safe is committed to encouraging work-life balance. With extra paid time off during the holidays and plenty of lunchtime sports to join, Safers are able to stay happy and healthy year-round. All Safers have the opportunity to grow with access to a learning and development budget, give back to their community with volunteer time, and get to know each other better with annual team-building events. This way, all Safers are able to innovate, support each other, and have some fun along the way.

When you join Safe, you’ll get your own laptop along with a new hire welcome package complete with Safe swag, of course. Currently, you’ll be working remotely along with the rest of the team due to COVID-19. On your first day, you’ll receive an orientation and meet your team to get role-specific training. After that, feel free to join any virtual activities like trivia, virtual coffee chats, or team games!

About Safe Software

Safe Software is the creator and developer of FME — the data integration platform with the best support for spatial data worldwide. Over 10,000 organizations around the world use FME in industries like AEC, government, utilities, and transportation to maximize the value of their data.

Founded in 1993, Safe is headquartered in Surrey, BC with over 190 team members and counting. We’re always looking for talented individuals with diverse backgrounds who are determined to learn and grow. Are you ready to join the team?

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Safe Software is an equal opportunity employer and we truly believe that innovation and strength begin with diversity and inclusion. We welcome all candidates regardless of race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, ability, disability, national or ethnic origin, political belief, religion, or family status. Should you require accommodations during the recruitment process, please contact careers@safe.com.

Title: Business Systems Support Analyst
Description:
About Ryerson
At the intersection of mind and action, Ryerson is on a transformative path to become Canada’s leading comprehensive innovation university. Integral to this path is the placement of equity, diversity and inclusion as fundamental to our institutional culture. Our current academic plan outlines each as core values and we work to embed them in all that we do.
Ryerson University welcomes those who have demonstrated a commitment to upholding the values of equity, diversity, and inclusion and will assist us to expand our capacity for diversity in the broadest sense. In addition, to correct the conditions of disadvantage in employment in Canada, we encourage applications from members of groups that have been historically disadvantaged and marginalized, including First Nations, Metis and Inuit peoples, Indigenous peoples of North America, racialized persons, persons with disabilities, and those who identify as women and/or 2SLGBTQ+. Please note that all qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, applications from Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.
In August 2021, the university announced that it would begin a renaming process to address the legacy of Egerton Ryerson for a more inclusive future. Let's write the next chapter together. To learn more about our work environment, colleagues, leaders, students and innovative educational environment
 The team
Ted Rogers School of Management at Ryerson University (TRSM) is developing collaborative, creative leaders who will drive 21st century business forward while making a positive impact on society. Home to nearly 10,000 students and more than 250 industry-connected faculty, TRSM is Canada's leading diverse, entrepreneurial business school centred in an urban learning environment. TRSM offers 12 Bachelor of Commerce degrees, two Bachelor of Health Administration degrees, the Ted Rogers MBA, Professional Masters Diplomas, Executive Education courses, and a Masters of Science in Management. TRSM is also home to 15 innovative research centres, institutes and labs www.ryerson.ca/tedrogersschool.
The Opportunity
As the Business Systems Support Analyst you will oversee the integrity of daily control and maintenance of all internal TRSM Business Systems, such as Salesforce, Blackthorn, Event Management System (EMS), TRS Catering, etc. You will provide day-to-day system administration, configuration, support and improvement of systems. You will play a major role in new system implementations, new module implementations, system enhancements and upgrades, and will provide special reporting based on end user needs for all users of the various systems, and related special projects associated with all internal TRSM systems. You will work with leaders and organizational units across TRSM to identify, develop, maintain and deploy new business processes. The Business Systems Support Analyst will also troubleshoot systems and escalate issues with third-party vendors as needed.
Qualifications
To help us learn more about you, please provide a cover letter and resume describing how you meet the following required qualifications:
Completion of a post-secondary degree in Business Administration, Business Commerce, Information Management, Computer Science or equivalent.
Minimum 3 (three) years of experience as business systems application administrator, specifically in a University setting.
Experience in designing and implementing new processes and facilitating user adoption.
Certification in Salesforce ADM 201.
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
Strong understanding of the Salesforce platform, with the ability to build custom apps and objects, formula fields, workflows, custom views, and other content of intermediate complexity.
Knowledge of systems analysis, design, implementation, and maintenance.
Demonstrated skill in preparing documentation, user guides and training manuals.
Knowledge of information technology, database management and data
Communications/networking.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements.
Excellent project management skills.
Skills in facilitation of training sessions.
Computer proficiency and knowledge of computers and various software application packages (e.g., Google Workspace, Word, Excel, Access, Microsoft Project, e-mail, PowerPoint, etc.)
Additional Information
Position Number(s) 20004018

Reports To IT Manager

Vacancy Type TERM

Employee Group OPSEU

Start Date ASAP

End Date 1 year from start date

Hours of Work 36.25 hours per week

Grade and Step 11

Salary Scale $66,620.63 - $79,548.49

Application Close Date April 29, 2022

Notes:
Applicants who do not meet all of the posted qualifications may, upon the University’s sole discretion, be considered to fill a vacancy on an underfill basis.
Candidates must have a demonstrated record of dependability/reliability and a commitment to maintain confidentiality.
We encourage all First Nations, Metis and Inuit peoples or Indigenous peoples of North America, to self-identify in their applications and also reach out to Tracey King, Indigenous Human Resources Lead for support during the selection process.
As part of the selection process, candidates may be required to complete an occupational assessment.
Applications will only be accepted online through Ryerson's careersite.
Ryerson University is committed to the principles of the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA), and aims to ensure that independence, dignity, integration and equality of opportunity are embedded in all aspects of the university culture.

We will provide an accessible experience for applicants, students, employees, and members of the Ryerson community.We are committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, beginning with the recruitment process. If you have restrictions that need to be accommodated to fully participate in any phase of the recruitment process, please contact hr@ryerson.ca. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
.

Title: Senior Business Analyst - TELUS Health
Description:
Location: Toronto, ON, CA 
     







      Req ID: 22727 
     







      Jobs by Category: Health 
     







      Job Function: Health Solutions 
     







      Status: Full Time 
     







      Schedule: Regular 
     







Description




Position Overview


This client facing role of Senior Business Analyst is required in a collaborative, fast paced team environment where we are managing multiple projects and client requirements on an ongoing basis. The successful candidate must be a strong creative and analytical thinker with strong documentation and planning skills.


In this role, as a key member of our TELUS Health team, you will be at the forefront of providing excellent customer service as it relates to client requested changes, implementation activities, and the product evolution of our employee benefit management solutions.
