Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
Job Description Summary
STEMCELL’s Pricing Operations team is responsible for ensuring the prices of STEMCELL’s products and services appear accurately across all sales channels to enable a frictionless purchasing experience for our Customers and Sales team. Pricing Operations is part of STEMCELL’s Global Pricing team within the Business Operations department.

Reporting to the Manager, Pricing Operations, and working with colleagues in Pricing, Marketing, Sales, and Sales Operations, the Pricing Analyst will be an integral team member responsible for providing data management and analysis support, coordinating updates to product pricing data, and maintaining data provided to eCommerce sites.
Job Description
Duties and Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain a strong working knowledge of STEMCELL products, key markets, trends, customers and competitors
Maintain pricing data in SAP, including effectively managing and updating customer specific pricing rules, as well as all internal and external systems where this data syncs or is uploaded
Provide first line of support for all pricing related issues reported by internal and external customers
Identify opportunities to streamline pricing data processes in order to better serve internal and external customers
Facilitate and/or participate in various pricing meetings / discussions with a variety of internal and external business groups
Create and analyze pricing reports, metrics and dashboards that can be used to monitor the performance of the Pricing Operations team
Independently perform other activities as required to support the Global Pricing Department
Qualifications:
Minimum Bachelors degree in Life Sciences, Data Science, Economics, or other degree with a focus on data analysis
Minimum two (2) years analytical experience preferably in a pricing, sales or marketing capacity, or equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Similar industry experience preferred
Excellent organizational skills, keen attention to detail, and the ability to work with large, complex, datasets, using Spreadsheet applications
Demonstrated business acumen and excellent analytical skills
High proficiency level of Microsoft Office Suite and /or Google Apps
Ability to work independently while contributing to a high performing team
This role requires being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as per STEMCELL’s vaccination policy, the current recommendations by local health authorities and as required by public health orders in place from time to time, including any COVID-19 boosters as recommended by local health authorities and as required by public health orders in place from time to time.
#United
STEMCELL Technologies Inc. is a privately-owned biotechnology company based in Vancouver that helps power leading-edge life science research around the world. Scientists performing stem cell, immunology, cancer, regenerative medicine and cellular therapy research are among those who rely on our cell culture media, cell separation products, instruments, ancillary reagents and contract assay services. We create novel, useful, standardized products of unfailing quality and deliver them to more than 70 countries via our many regional offices plus distribution centres in Vancouver, Seattle, Grenoble and Singapore. Driven by our love of science and our passion for quality, we see ourselves simply as “Scientists Helping Scientists” – standing by our customers to provide outstanding products, technical support and training. We have over 1000 science-oriented employees globally, including 250 PhDs/MScs, with most others holding a BSc or engineering degree. STEMCELL is proud to be the largest Biotechnology employer in Canada.
This is an opportunity to work with highly motivated colleagues in a science-oriented, creative and dynamic environment. We offer a competitive salary, excellent benefits and significant career development opportunities.
To apply please select the apply button. You will then be directed to a login screen asking you to set up an account. You must set up an account in order to apply.
Create an account by selecting the create account button. You will then be asked for your email and to create a password. Your Password must be eight characters long, contain at least one special character, one capital letter, and a number.Once you have created your password you will be asked to upload your resume. Uploading your resume will provide the ability to auto-populate your application with information from your resume. If you prefer to manually complete all of the fields in the application you can do this by clicking next. You can upload your cover letter as an attachment in the attachments screen. Thank you for your interest in STEMCELL!

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Business Systems AnalystOur client drives for unique and innovative solutions that solve their customer’s problems. They are trusted advisors who create data and analytics solutions for complex challenges through collaboration, creativity and an innate need to solve tough business and data problems.ROLE SUMMARY: The Business Systems Analyst works with internal and external stakeholders including the technology and business teams to develop and implement data warehouse solutions. The nature of the projects varies from Waterfall to Agile and technology varies from legacy to cutting edge. They are involved throughout the project lifecycle by capturing and documenting requirements, developing test strategy/plans and test cases, test execution and implementing into production. They are supported by team members and the Practice Manager.JOB DESCRIPTION: Develop a deep, multilayered understanding of the business issues and the data challenges of the client’s organizations and their industriesEnsure requirements are clear and complete, eliminating uncertainties and ambiguitiesCreate business, functional/non-functional requirements documents, review and obtain sign off from key stakeholders.Establish quality solutions through validation against the requirementsCreate test strategy and plans, execute test cases, regression testing and defect management.Communicate clearly with project team members, identify/resolve issues, and escalate when required.Participate in the development of project plans to establish appropriate workload expectations and schedules.Foster strong and professional client and project team relationships to facilitate cohesive teamwork & delivery successParticipate and contribute to lessons learned and process improvements.Apply new technologies to improve work efforts when available.Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of, and adopt, relevant market trends and practices.EXPERIENCE/SKILLS: 3-7 years’ experience on data-centric projects (analytics, data warehousing) as a Business Systems AnalystBachelor’ degree in Computer Science/ Engineering or a related fieldAbility to develop complex SQL and work with relational databasesStrong data analysis experience (i.e., data quality, data migration, data profiling, data manipulation)Experience in one or a number of these areas: Data Warehousing, Data Analytics, BI, Cloud, or Big Data (Hadoop, Hive, Impala)Comfortable with Agile and Water SDLC methodologies and project management lifecycle practicesKnowledge of ETL concepts, data transformations, and experience creating ETL mapping specifications. Working with ETL tools is an assetAbility to communicate clearly and effectively to convey complex ideas, verbally and in writing, to both business/technical staff and customers.Ability to effectively manage multiple projects/tasks varying in complexity, meet deadlines and work well under pressureStrong client focused consulting skillsJob Types: Full-time, PermanentAdditional pay:Bonus payBenefits:Extended health careSchedule:Monday to Friday

Title: Business Analyst -16 Month Secondment
Description:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.
At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.











      About the role
      










We’re looking for a Business Analyst to our team!
As a Business Analyst, your work will have a big impact on the national Commercial Lines and Specialty Solutions Operations & Planning team which supports the strategic projects initiatives. You will be responsible for obtaining, analyzing, documenting, communicating, and validating business requirements. The Operations and Planning department is seeking individuals with exceptional analytical and organizational skills for a Secondment Business Analyst position.
This is a 16-month Secondment BA position available in any of our West, Ontario, Quebec or Atlantic offices.
What you’ll do here:

Collaborate with various business stakeholders to assess identified system/process needs
Contribute to the resolution of issues and suggest alternatives to achieve objectives
Identify and collaborate with project stakeholders, including individuals in Corporate UW, Actuarial, Distribution, Sales & Business Development, other teams within Ops & Planning & IT
Support the planning, tracking and management of small projects or project phases
Support project Change Management activities, including implementation efforts and transition issues to ensure business risks are identified and solutions are recommended. 











      Qualifications
      










What you bring to the table:

Experience in business analysis, project activities, underwriting or data analysis required
You forge strong relationships with internal stakeholders and can work with all levels from individual contributor to executive, and from different areas of the business
You have strong written and verbal communication skills and able to explain complex issues to employees and management alike
You can work on multiple projects and quickly adjust in a rapid changing environment, and works well under pressure and tight deadlines
You are a self-starter who can work effectively with little supervision
Strong organizational and personal time management skills
PMP, CAPM, CBAP and/or CCBA certifications are an asset
Proven familiarity with Specialty Solutions, Commercial P&C and/or Commercial Auto Underwriting is an asset
Experience with Visio and workflow diagramming is an asset
Experience with operational change management is an asset
Experience and knowledge of agile and scrum framework is an asset

Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:

An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career

Flexible Work Arrangements
We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.











      Closing Statement
      










We are an Equal Opportunity Employer
If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.
Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.
This posting closes on April 28, 2022 at 11:59PM.

Title: Analyst - Pricing
Description:
Join a team that offers great hours, excellent benefits & a career to be proud of! The great thing about working for EECOL Electric is the opportunity to advance to a rewarding career in sales, management or one of the many other career paths. We are looking for a full-time, permanent, Regional Pricing Coordinator to add to our team.
EECOL Electric is a leading Electrical Products Distributor with 60 locations in Canada. Our employees stay for the long-term because we offer a rewarding and exciting career, not just a job! Just ask our President, Executives or Management team what great opportunities this company offers; most started out in the warehouse. You will not meet a more down-to-earth, hardworking and dedicated team. Visit us at www.eecol.com to learn more.
EECOL employees enjoy…
Permanent, full time positions, Monday through Friday. Weekends and evenings are for friends, family and fun, not for work!
Regular reviews, raises and bonus opportunities.
Promotion from within; excellent opportunities to advance.
First-rate benefits including generous flex benefits, health & dental plan, disability, life insurance, vision care and a pension plan to save for retirement!
THE JOB…
Manage pricing execution, including data integrity and consistency.
Review existing price agreements and initiate updates and changes as required.
Understand vendor price changes and apply price adjustments.
Act as liaison between branch locations and pricing managers.
Coordinate with district, branch and purchasing management to explore and find solutions.
Take initiative in identifying and resolving issues around pricing
Take ownership of process improvements and drive to successful implementation.
Performs other duties as required.
WHO WE’RE LOOKING FOR…
Minimum 2 years’ experience with pricing or related role.
Strong computer skills including advanced Excel knowledge.
Previous experience handling confidential and sensitive data.
Effective multi-tasking, deadline management and project management skills.
Proven troubleshooting skills.
Able to work independently (once trained) or as part of a team.
Good written and verbal communication skills.
Self-starter and highly motivated to make proactive changes.
Ability to accept and integrate constructive feedback from superiors.
Working Environment:
General Office – Work is generally performed within an office environment, with standard office equipment. Lighting and temperature are adequate and there are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, etc.
EECOL Electric Corp. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. It is the policy of EECOL to not discriminate against any job applicant or employee based on age, race, religion, color, handicap, sex, physical condition, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status or any other protected status. This policy includes but is not limited to the following: recruitment and employment, promotion, demotion, transfer, compensation, selection for training including apprenticeship, layoff, or termination.

Title: People Services Data Analyst - GO Rail Expansion (RER)
Description:
Build Your Career at Aecon
Aecon is proud to build some of the most impactful infrastructure projects of this generation. From the roads and transit systems that connect our communities, to the communication networks that link us from coast-to-coast, and the water infrastructure that supplies our businesses and homes. Our integral work includes constructing the pipelines that join provinces with the energy that fuels the nation, and the airports and ports that connect us all. Aecon is there, safely and sustainably building the future.

We lead the infrastructure industry with purpose, and our people are at the heart of everything we do. Our business success relies on strong execution and continuous improvement – driven by the diversity, expertise and teamwork of our employees. We are always searching the globe for exceptional candidates to join the Aecon family and be a part of our forward-thinking, innovative, best-in-class organization!


What is the Opportunity?
Aecon Concessions and Deutsche Bahn International Operations have formed a partnership to operate and maintain the Regional Express Rail (RER) network in the Greater Hamilton and Toronto Area (GHTA), Canada.
The partnership will be called ONxpress Operations Inc and the combined experience and capability of the ONxpress partnership enable us to bring the international experience of designing, constructing, and operating rapid transit solutions in high-density population and urbanization locations.
Reporting directly to the Head of People Services, the People Services Data Analyst will be responsible for compiling and analyzing ONxpress Operations and Maintenance Company’s workforce data in order to develop a process and dashboard to monitor workforce planning analytics on an ongoing basis. This includes providing support for all organizational workforce analytics, HR Technology and Human Resources Information Systems (HRIS) programs.
What You’ll Do Here:
Oversee the accuracy of data and deliverables of reporting to various stakeholders
Troubleshoot data issues as required
Coordinate and support the data/report requests for the HR team and the business
Create and run moderate to complex queries and data requests to support management in making decisions related to human capital management, succession planning and strategic business initiatives. Also provide scenario planning, forecasting, and future state modeling of workforce analytics
Support the team in addressing HR issues that require new approaches, complex solutions and involve expertise and knowledge of HR data, information systems, and analysis
Act as a key contributor to the workforce planning processes, ensuring integration with business planning and operational staffing plans
Contribute to HR system implementations, ensuring all current and future reporting and analytics requirements are considered and planned for
Provide technical guidance and training to HR on appropriate use of HRIS and reports
Contribute to cross-functional teams to address complex people resources issues
Optimize existing workforce planning tools and provide recommendations on attaining efficiencies and use of alternate tools
Develop performance measures and monitoring tools to support the forecasting, reporting, and analysis of key measurements, trends, and benchmarks assisting the business in making employee-related decisions and demonstrating the return on investment of HR initiatives

What You Bring to the Team:

A degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related area of study with emphasis in the business planning and/or data analytics field
3-5 years of relevant experience in the areas of Workforce Planning, Reporting and HR Analytics
Experienced in the use of HRIS systems and applications, implementation experience highly desirable
Highly process oriented with developed quantitative and qualitive analytical skills, problem solving ability and critical thinking skills
Demonstrated technical competence in creating complex reports, dashboards, and visualizing effective metrics
Advanced research and data analysis skills and a demonstrated ability to draw associated insights and make effective recommendations
Demonstrated ability and confidence in presenting complex technical information to end users
Progressive and forward thinking with the demonstrated ability to develop clear and concise recommendations
Ability to successfully navigate a fast-paced, complex, and changing work environment, while managing multiple and shifting priorities
Knowledge of statistical methods (i.e. regression analysis, forecasting and modelling etc.)
Advanced capability with all Microsoft Office related products
Strong ability to collaborate with others in order to achieve the best results and deliver the most value

Title: Credit Portfolio Risk Analyst
Description:
3M has a long-standing reputation as a company committed to innovation. We provide the freedom to explore and encourage curiosity and creativity. We gain new insight from diverse thinking, and take risks on new ideas. Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter.
Job Description:
As a Credit Portfolio Risk Analyst, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:
Support lead manager on credit analysis and risk rating of the portfolio, based on statistical models, and lead segmentation variables
Monitors and proactively manages risk/exposures and compliance with policies for credit risk portfolio. Support global team with credit data analysis to formulate practical portfolio problem solving models
Participate on cross functional teams to identify opportunities and support initiatives for process improvements, centralization, and standardization
Monitor performance of AR credit quality and analyze AR performance, aging, trends, risk exposure and advise business leadership teams in actions to be taken. Supporting management reporting for KPIs
Educate and advise business divisions on portfolio, customer credit risk and payment terms
Work in collaboration with the CIR organization to implement frameworks and global governance policies. Review and approve requests related to credit limits or payment terms.
Provide financial counsel and analysis on DSO initiatives to the business group leaders and team, influencing business thinking.
Lead small projects related to credit risk management or working capital optimization.
Your Skills and Expertise
To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, accounting, economics, mathematics, and/or statistics
Two (2) years of data analytics, data management and/or risk analysis experience
Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:
Experience in problem-solving, financial modeling, data analytics and data management
Knowledge of financial statement analysis, bankruptcy laws, basic accounting techniques, and financial principles used in analyzing and interpreting the working capital impact of decisions regarding credit risk
Skills include analytical reasoning, persuasive and assertive, adaptable, optimistic, innovative, collaborative, excellent written and verbal communication
Experience in Credit and Collections is a plus
Experience using SAP.
Travel: May include up to 10% domestic/international
Relocation Assistance: Is not authorized
What We Offer:
Comprehensive Benefit Plan, RSP plan, Stock Purchase Plan, Incentive Plan, and Defined Contribution Pension Plan
Paid time off over the winter holidays
Health & Wellness subsidies
Individual Development Plan and Tuition Reimbursement Program
3M Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
We work to reflect the diversity of our global customers, suppliers and channel partners, and build on each individual employee’s abilities.
At 3M, we know that inclusion is the key to unlocking the power of our diversity. An inclusive culture is one that supports and appreciates differences, and provides fair and equal opportunities for everyone. It’s a place where people realize they are respected for their whole and unique selves, and that they belong. Inclusion leads to engagement, which in turn fosters the collaboration, creativity and innovation that drive long-term growth – for 3M as well as for our people and our teams.

Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M_Canada or @3MNewsroom.
3M Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Our approach to flexibility is called Work Your Way, which puts employees first and drives well-being in ways that enable 3M’s business and performance goals. You have flexibility in where and when work gets done. It all depends on where and when you can do your best work.

Title: Data Analyst (Business Intelligence)
Description:
Hive Media redefines what it means to be a data-driven online publishing company. Our team focuses on creating and acquiring web properties, which allow us to build relationships with our readers, advertising partners and technology experts. We own and operate dozens of websites with highly verticalized content and use sophisticated technologies built in-house to deliver individualized experiences to our readers.

Hive Media Group is seeking a sharp, ambitious Data Analyst to join our team. The Data Analyst must be investigative and analytical by nature. We need someone who is adaptable, detail-oriented, and passionate about large data sets. The ideal candidate should be seeking increased responsibility, will have a passion for data, and a solid understanding of the digital publishing landscape. This is a great opportunity for someone who is seeking rapid career growth in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.

The Ideal Candidate:
Independent, self-motivated individual that has a passion for solving puzzles.
Extremely detail-oriented and organized with a habit of checking and double-checking any work before submitting it for review.
Analytical thinker with excellent problem-solving skills who is able to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information quickly and accurately.
Team player with the ability to work across team functions to bring the best possible outcomes forward.


Responsibilities:
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends/patterns in complex data sets.
Produce reports for business leaders that are uniform, accurate, and consistent. Summarize key findings and propose action plans.
Tell a story with data. Advise business leaders on which directions to go, how to pivot and adapt to an ever changing environment.
Work cross functionally across Engineering, Product, Media, and Revenue teams to provide forecasting, data modeling, predictive analysis, and A/B testing insights and strategies.
Investigate root causes for issues/anomalies and provide creative yet logical solutions for solving data and/or business intelligence problems.
Research industry trends and identify new process improvement opportunities.


Requirements:
2+ years experience in data or business analytics, preferably in a digital publisher setting.
Expert Excel skills with the ability to work with large data sets.
Working knowledge of SQL and the ability to quickly learn internal tools
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, etc.
Flexible, startup mindset, and ability to operate within a very dynamic, fast-paced work environment.
Strong communicator, both written & verbal with the ability to communicate results to both technical, and non technical stakeholders.
Eager to learn and grow to expand beyond the outlined responsibilities.
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Data Science, or related field.
Preferred – understanding of the online advertising and publishing industry, campaign metrics, and media buying/selling.
Why Work for Hive Media?:
Competitive wages
Employer contribution towards Medical, Dental, and Vision premiums for all regular full-time employees and their dependents.
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Registered Retirement Saving Plan (RRSP) with company match for employees residing in Canada
Paid Time Off
We care about your career and foster a culture of learning. We provide dedicated time to improve your skills, lunch and learns, online courses, knowledge sharing between team members, and many more opportunities
A management team focused on performance, growth, engagement and connection
Company-sponsored events and fully hosted summer and winter parties.
During the COVID-19 pandemic, this role will temporarily require the use of telework. Hive Media Group may require employees to return to regular, in-office work by state and local public health guidelines. Some "perks" will not be available during telework arrangements.
Hive Media Group LLC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by law.

Title: Agile Business Analyst
Description:
Opening up a world of opportunity.


We're a financial services organization serving more than 40 million customers across the globe through our Wealth & Personal Banking, Commercial Banking and Global Banking & Markets businesses.
We’re here to use our unique expertise, capabilities, breadth and perspectives to open up a world of new opportunities for our customers, our people and our communities.


HSBC Global Services Canada Limited (HGCA), is a subsidiary of HSBC Global Services Limited, owned by HSBC Holdings plc. HGCA provides operational services to countries across the HSBC Group which is the largest and leading international bank in the Canada.
We help companies and individuals across Canada to manage their finances through three global business lines: Commercial Banking, Global Banking and Markets, and Wealth and Personal Banking. 
It’s this global connectivity that you will find yourself inspired and collaborating with colleagues not just locally but also across continents and cultures.


About the role
Wholesale Data & Analytics is creating a world class “data-driven” organisation that leads our competitors and inspires our employees. We are building a revolutionary data analytics ecosystem to generate business insights and provide great customer experience from well-managed and trusted data assets.
The aim of WS D&A IT is to support the business in unlocking the value of their data, and building a competitive advantage by making distinctive, lasting improvements in technology, processes and capabilities. We deliver effective and reusable data assets at pace, providing valuable insights on a scalable and self-service platform, that supports and encourages a data-driven culture. We focus on transforming and simplifying data to meet our business needs, to create competitive advantage, enhance risk controls and enable growth
WS D&A IT partner with a broad range of stakeholders across Markets and Security Services, Banking and Wholesale to design an effective data strategy to maximise the potential value of data, and deliver operational excellence, new products and services, competitive agility, and growth
We are a globally, inclusive team reflecting a diversity of skill, talent, thinking and culture. Leadership is based across all the regions, supporting us to build the capabilities and culture necessary to become a truly data-driven organisation 
This role is part of the WS D&A IT organisation structure. A Senior Business Analyst is required to work on use cases to create a strategy for delivery of new capabilities to support the business teams. The role will require working directly with multiple business lines/senior management and IT teams.
Our Technology teams use a range of digital, data and analytics solutions and have embraced Agile and DevOps as the mechanism to deliver business capability frequently into production.
You will be an articulate communicator and strategic thinker, with a track record of successful complex product ownership and simplifying complex requirements


Responsibilities:

Adhere strictly to compliance and operational risk controls in accordance with HSBC and regulatory standards, policies and practices; report concerns or observations in terms of control weaknesses, compliance breaches and operational risk impact.
Ensure adherence to best practice delivery standards across the pods, with risks, issues and dependencies correctly defined and managed




   Requirements 
  



Serve as voice of the customer
Develop/scope and define backlog items (epics/features/user stories) that guide the development team
Managing the capture, analysis and documentation of data & analytics requirements and processes (both business and IT) 
Create analysis of customer journeys and own the product roadmap
Managing implementation of data & analytics solutions 
Manage change interventions such as training, adoption planning to stakeholder management 
Tracking and documenting progress and managing delivery status 
Helping define and track measure of success for products 
Risk identification, risk reporting and devising interventions to mitigating risks 
Budget management and forecasting 
Management of internal delivery teams and/or external service providers
Data Platform, Service and Product Owner experience 
Experience of applying Design Thinking 
A Data-Driven mind-set 
Outstanding cross-platform knowledge (incl. Teradata, Hadoop and GCP) and understands the nuances of delivery across these platforms both technically and functionally and how they impact delivery 
Communication capabilities, decision-making, problem solving skills, lateral thinking, analytical and interpersonal skills
Experience in leading a team and managing multiple, competing priorities and demands in a dynamic environment
Highly analytical with strong attention to detail
Demonstrable track record of delivery in a Banking and Financial Markets context
A strong and diverse technical background and foundation (ETL, SQL, NoSQL, APIs, Data Architecture, Data Management principle and patterns, Data Ingest, Data Refinery, Data Provision, etc.)
Experience in customising and managing integration tools, databases, warehouses and analytical tools
A passion for designing towards consistency and efficiency, and always striving for continuous improvements via automated processes
Experience in Agile Project methodologies and tools such as JIRA and Confluence



HSBC Proud

Title: Junior Technical Systems Analyst
Description:
At WUXLY, we produce the world’s warmest brand of outerwear. Made in Canada, our unique combination of highly technical + sustainable materials delivers elite performance, while respecting the beauty of our planet and remaining peaceful to all living beings. We are creators of warmth, from Wuxly to community, and community into the world. LIVE WARM 
 
 As Wuxly continues its growth as a leading Canadian brand, we are looking for a Junior Technical Systems Analyst to help power and support the next phase of Wuxly’s growth through technology.  
 
 We are looking for someone who has experience executing on technology roadmaps within the corporate/ retail/ warehouse space and has a track record of delivering key technology solutions and managing key vendors to drive digital optimization.  
 
 We are looking for someone who is Humble, Hungry, and has Heart, and is able to wear multiple hats in an exciting, team oriented, start-up environment. 
 

Responsibilities:


Act as a Wuxly Movement ambassador in all interactions, fully adopting the #LiveWarm approach
Support the continuous improvement of all Wuxly technological systems to ensure they are aligned with current business requirements
Stay current on Office 365 features and capabilities including availability, reliability, performance, monitoring, backup, and security
Provide expert-level support and technical mentoring to internal and external stakeholders
Identify, negotiate, and on-board key technology vendor partners as part of technology stack
Support the teams in all locations with day-to-day technical issues and create educational platforms to enhance overall digital and technological competency for all departments
Maintain technology inventory, ensuring all assigned items are accounted for and recovered when required
Become subject matter expert and brand ambassador for Wuxly Movement and all Wuxly products
Additional responsibilities as the role develops

Profile:


3-5 years of experience in delivering technology products (website, mobile, e-commerce, CRM systems, data analytics platforms)
Track record in launching customer facing technologies and internal technology systems
Experience managing key technology partners/vendors 
Experience working with marketing technologies including customer platforms, social and 3rd party (Google/FB) ads, e-marketing platforms 
Highly analytical and ability to manage key priorities and business alignment
Highly organized and works well under pressure in a initiative driven, fast-paced
 Wuxly Movement values diversity in our workforce, as well as in our customers, suppliers and others. We provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees, and do not discriminate on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status, family status, or disability. 
 
 Wuxly Movement welcomes and encourages applications from everyone. Accommodations may be available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you would like to request a specific accommodation because of a disability or a medical need, please advise the Recruiter or Human Resources Associate when you are selected to participate in the recruitment process. 
 
 Wuxly Movement is committed to doing business with local manufacturers, vendors, and partners, and to be leaders in the efforts to re-shore manufacturing in Ontario and Canada. Wuxly Movement prioritizes recruiting and hiring local talent into positions to lead these initiatives, and are committed to being positive corporate citizens within our community.

Title: IT Quality Intermediate Analyst
Description:
The IT Quality Intmd Analyst is a developing professional role. Deals with most problems independently and has some latitude to solve complex problems. Integrates in-depth specialty area knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices. Good understanding of how the team and area integrate with others in accomplishing the objectives of the subfunction/ job family. Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies. Requires attention to detail when making judgments and recommendations based on the analysis of factual information. Typically deals with variable issues with potentially broader business impact. Applies professional judgment when interpreting data and results. Breaks down information in a systematic and communicable manner. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information. Moderate but direct impact through close contact with the businesses' core activities. Quality and timeliness of service provided will affect the effectiveness of own team and other closely related teams.

Responsibilities:
Supports initiatives related to User Acceptance Testing (UAT) process and product rollout into production. Testing specialists who work with technology project managers, UAT professionals and users to design and implement appropriate scripts/plans for an application testing strategy/approach.
Conducts a variety of moderately complex process monitoring, product evaluation and audit assignments; reports issues and makes recommendations for solutions.
Ensures project standards and procedures exist, are fully clearly documented and followed throughout the software development life cycle; makes recommendations for enhanced documentation.
Monitors products for conformance to standards; monitors processes for conformance to procedures.
Documents findings and performs preliminary root causes analyses to provide recommended improvements.
Ensures all corrective actions are assigned, documented and completed.
Verifies traceability in project work products.
Gathers, maintains and creates reports on quality metrics.
Exhibits good understanding of procedures and concepts within own technical area and a basic knowledge of these elements in other areas.
Requires basic understanding of how own area integrates within IT Quality to achieve objectives.
Makes evaluative judgments based on the analysis of factual information; resolves problems by identifying and selecting solutions through the application of acquired technical experience and guided by precedents.
Directly impacts the business by ensuring the quality of work provided by self and others; impacts own team and closely related work teams.
Provides informal guidance to new team members.
Performs other duties and functions as assigned.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Nice-to-have Skills:Understanding of Listed Derivatives, particularly futures contracts, and Clearing workflowPrior experience in testing client-facing/onboarding applications having faced-off clientsExperience testing a low latency, high volume application.Familiarity with FIX protocolExperience working in a Windows and Unix Environment (well versed with Unix commands).Ability to understand and construct SQL Queries.
Qualifications:
2-5 years Quality Assurance (QA) experience in the Financial Service industry preferred
Experience in requirement reviews & able to identify, communicate and document discrepancies.
Understanding of QA within the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and QA methodologies
Understanding of Quality Processes
Demonstrated logical analysis skills, attention to detail and problem solving Proven ability to work to deadlines.
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
QA Experience in defining, designing & executing test cases
Education:
Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience
-
Job Family Group:
Technology
-
Job Family:
Technology Quality
-
Time Type:
Full time

Title: Customer Experience Analyst
Description:
At NRG, we’re bringing the power of energy to people and organizations by putting customers at the center of everything we do. We generate electricity and provide energy solutions and natural gas to millions of customers through our diverse portfolio of retail brands. A Fortune 500 company, operating in the United States and Canada, NRG delivers innovative solutions while advocating for competitive energy markets and customer choice, working towards a sustainable energy future. More information is available at www.nrg.com. Connect with NRG on Facebook, LinkedIn and follow us on Twitter @nrgenergy.

 Job Summary:
 

The CET Analyst is responsible for resolving inbound customer inquiries, those that have escalated to Level 3 (Office of the President) and 4 (Third Party Regulatory Complaints), and approving the resolutions performed by our vendor.
 The Analyst is responsible for developing and communicating a formal response to customer and/or regulatory entities such as the Utilities Consumer Advocate, Better Business Bureau, Media inquiries and Alberta Utilities Commission. 
Ability to put oneself in the customers’ shoes is a must. As well the agent must have the creativity to “think outside the box” when resolving issues.
 The analyst will handle inquiries via phone, email, social media, and in person to over 900 thousand customers from both DE and DERS.
 Must have exceptional communication skills; both verbal and written. All external communication must be in compliance with regulatory guidelines while keeping the best interests of the customer and the business in mind.


 Essential Duties/Responsibilities:


 Works independently to investigate and resolve customer inquiries. 
Ability to recognize customer pain-points and offer ideas and solutions for resolution at the higher “bigger picture” level.
 Identifies and implements applicable corrective and preventative actions to facilitate inquiry closure and improve overall satisfaction for all customers.
 Confidently communicates with customer throughout investigation and resolution
 Identifies and alerts management to events with potential high business impact
 Recognize and report billing error trends and know when opening incidents are necessary when errors are difficult to explain. 
Effectively manages workload to meet all SLA’s and productivity goals.
 Approve outgoing cases being handled by vendor prior to the resolutions being sent to customers, Utilities Consumer Advocate, Better Business Bureau, Media and Alberta Utilities Commission
 Ensures appropriate inquiry classifications are assigned in our databases to allow precise trending for data analysis purposes
 Review vendor calls, perform QA and coaching to ensure high quality of service.
 Put the customer’s experience and consequently improving our KPI at the forefront.
 Collaborate with HCL, Home Service, Sales, Quality Assurance, Credit and Collections and the Front and Back Office teams to ensure information flows between the groups when they affect the customer’s experience.
 Amend and add process Documents to CET data base as required
 Manage all correspondence comments, inquiries and complaints made on Social Media
 Address all Voice of Customer Surveys whether the customer has requested a call-back or not.
 Alberta Customer Experience Analyst are the designated group to handle Safer Spaces customers (victims of domestic violence)


 Minimum Requirements:
 

Minimum 3-years experience in a customer service role
 Call center experience required
 Exceptional verbal and written communication skills required
 Able to work and collaborate effectively in team environment is required
 Highschool level education or GED equivalent


 Preferred Qualifications:
 

Experience in a customer-service role specializing in complaints management and escalation
 Atleast 3 years or more experience in the electricity, utilities, and/or natural gas market
 Atleast 3 years or more call center experience
 Social Media knowledge an asset
 Certificates related to training, service, or related disciplines are an asset
 Bachelor’s degree preferred but not required


 Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:


 Ability to interact with agitated/escalated customers over phone, in person or via email and social media
 Able to analyze accounts while under pressure
 Moderate skill working with Microsoft Office and Outlook
 Strong ability to learn various platforms to carry out duties


 Working Conditions:


 Open office environment.
 Overtime may be required as special projects or excessive workload arise.
 Some travel required which may require a valid passport.
 This role can be based out of Calgary, AB or Edmonton, AB.


 Physical Requirements:


 Ability to sit for long periods of time


 #CB-LH
 #NRG
 NRG Energy is committed to a drug and alcohol free workplace. To the extent permitted by law and any applicable collective bargaining agreement, employees are subject to periodic random drug testing, and post-accident and reasonable suspicion drug and alcohol testing. Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Overview:

As a Business Analyst you will plan and conduct business studies to resolve moderately complex business problems and present solutions, resulting in new or improved products and services. You will provide production support for a full range of enterprise business applications including custom developed and packaged configurable applications.
Responsibilities:
Develop and present solutions for moderately complex business problems by conducting business case analyses, cost/benefits analyses, and feasibility studies.
Analyze business processes and recommend new or improved solutions through research and investigation, fact-finding, analysis and evaluation.
Develop and implement detailed work plans to introduce new products and services while assisting in the development of the annual work plan for the department.
Implement new products and/or services in the capacity of project leader. Oversee or liaise in the development of associated procedures, documentation and training in the user areas.
Assist in quality assurance to ensure that the products/services meet all functional and compliance requirements.
Qualifications:
Degree or diploma in Business, Management, Commerce, Information Technology or a related discipline.
Two – three years of related analytical experience conducting process analysis, documenting system and business requirements, and performing complex data analysis.
Experience with process and billing with IRP is considered an asset.
Knowledge of MPI legislatation /regulations is considered an asset.
Intermediate communication skills (verbal, written and group presentation skills) with the ability to communicate complicated technical issues and solutions in a clear, concise and understandable manner for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to manage multiple priorities under strict deadlines.
Experience and knowledge in agile practices, scrums, and Kanban is an asset.
Experience providing production support to multiple applications is an asset.
Employee Benefits:

Health benefits
We offer a comprehensive health benefits program that includes:
flexible health, dental and vision plans
health spending account
travel health coverage
other extended health benefits such as ambulance, massage and physiotherapy
Financial security
In an effort to support financial security, we offer:
registered pension plan
group, dependent, and optional life insurance coverage
critical illness insurance
sick leave to cover short-term disability
long-term disability
Wellness
We offer programs that focus on how to better achieve a balance between work and personal commitments, as well as maintain a healthy workplace culture. This includes:
vacation entitlement
maternity, parental and adoptive leaves
bereavement and family responsibility leaves
employee and family assistance program
mental-health programming
lunch-and-learn offerings
discounted gym memberships and wellness account
Diversity and inclusion
Manitoba Public Insurance believes that diversity and inclusion strengthens us. We consider ourselves to be a barrier-free organization where individual values, beliefs and practices are respected and appreciated for the diversity they bring to our work life.
Employee recognition
It’s important to recognize our employees for their contributions. Not only do we recognize employees as they achieve milestone years in their careers, we also have several outlets for leaders and peers to reward each other for work well done.
Professional development
We want our employees to grow, which is why we offer support in keeping their skills up-to-date. We offer in-house training, professional development and an educational assistance program.
Safety and health
In an effort to encourage a safe and healthy work environment, we offer various safety, health and workplace policies and programs along with technical expertise and assistance to support employee activities in safety and health.

Title: Business Analyst II - Resource Strategy Performance Analysis and Excellence Team
Description:
Location:
Calgary, AB, CA Toronto, ON, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Barrie, ON, CA
Req ID: 24533
Jobs by Category: Operations
Job Function: Planning and Analysis
Status: Full Time
Schedule: Regular
Description
Create better business outcomes with your analytical acumen and creativity.

Join our team

The Resource Strategy Performance Analysis and Excellence Team is looking for a talented, driven, passionate individual with strong analytical and interpersonal skills.

We love to turn data into stories – stories about saving customers time and effort, saving money that had fallen through the cracks, success stories about insights created with new technologies, but most importantly stories about our customers and how we can enhance their experience. Our culture fosters collaborating, learning and out-of-the-box thinking in a fast-paced environment. Come help us make the TELUS customer experience awesome!

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

Aid in growing our business with the courage to innovate and embrace change in our business intelligence capabilities and embody the spirited teamwork necessary to support stakeholders across a wide variety of teams
Use data to understand and resolve complex business challenges and provide timely insights
Facilitate/liaise at all levels within our business as well as associated stakeholders to gather, validate and assess business requirements for projects to achieve a successful, collaborative solution and/or plan of implementation
Recommend and assess key business opportunities to drive efficiencies, improve processes, reduce unnecessary customer contacts, and enable agents to increase productivity and quality of customer interactions

Here's how

You have an optimal mix of business and technical skills honed in a high performance data driven business
You have strong business analysis, problem solving and critical thinking skills
You must be willing to roll up your sleeves and get close to the data
You have an extraordinary ability to build relationships, collaborate, and influence across multiple teams
You are self-motivated and can take decisive action by assessing risk-adjusted options and prioritization across a multiple of concurrent projects and work streams
Your have a real passion for working in a dynamic, high performance culture and for building, operating, and transforming new businesses
Ability to think outside-of-the-box and implement contrarian ideas to standard practices entrenched in a traditional industry
You have a focus on continuous learning and development across multiple domains including industry best practices, technology trends, and customer experience opportunities
Have grit! You use your influence and network to get what you need to deliver solutions

Qualifications
You're the missing piece of the puzzle

2+ years of project management/business analysis knowledge & experience
University degree and/or equivalent combination of experience and education
Experience dealing/communicating effectively across different areas of the organization
Expertise in Microsoft Office and Google applications (Excel, Sheets, Slides, Doc’s, Visio)
Experience developing and implementing business improvement solutions
Knowledge in Six Sigma or Agile methodology experience will be considered an asset
Experience in a Call Centre environment and knowledge will be considered an asset
Creative/innovative thinking

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Your Opportunity:
You have a passion for new technology and are looking to make a difference by participating in the transformation and modernization of health care. Virtual Health is about providing streamlined access to healthcare via technology, connecting care providers with patients and families in a safe, convenient, and professional manner. Acting as the Business Analyst for Virtual Health Technologies, you will assist in the development, operational delivery, and implementation of the collective Virtual Health IT services for the organization, ensuring usability to healthcare providers, patients, and families. This includes leveraging existing technologies, procuring new technology, and scaling and spread of proven solutions to better meet the needs of patients. In this role, you will collaborate with stakeholders across the continuum of care to understand the structure, policies, and operations of an organization, and to recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals. This involves interpreting client needs, assessing requirements and identifying solutions to non-standard issues and requests, providing advice and direction to clients, and contributing to solutions by providing input into strategy, coordination, testing and delivery for assigned projects and programs. You will perform data analysis and reporting activities to assist with the evaluation and monitoring of virtual health initiatives to support the achievement of higher quality, safer, and more sustainable healthcare. You will report directly to the Director of Health Technologies. Work location is negotiable, allowing you to choose your ideal setting.
Description:
As a Business Analyst, you will work as a liaison among stakeholders in order to understand the structure, policies and operations of an organization, and to recommend solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals. You will interpret client needs, assess requirements and identify solutions to non-standard issues and requests, provide advice and direction to clients, and contribute to solutions by providing input into strategy, workflows and delivery for assigned projects and programs.
Classification: Business Analyst
Union: AUPE GSS
Department: IT Virtual Health
Primary Location: QuarryPark
Multi-Site: Multisite
FTE: 1.00
Posting End Date: 20-APR-2022
Employee Class: Regular Full Time
Date Available: 23-MAY-2022
Hours per Shift: 7.75
Length of Shift in weeks: 1
Shifts per cycle: 5
Shift Pattern: Days
Days Off: Saturday/Sunday
Minimum Salary: $37.31
Maximum Salary: $50.38
Vehicle Requirement: Not Applicable
Required Qualifications:
Completion of a post-secondary degree in a related field, or equivalent level of education and experience.
Additional Required Qualifications:
3-5 years related business analyst experience. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. You are also highly organized, have a proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment, possess strong critical thinking and analytical skills and are detail-oriented. You understand IT systems and can create workflow models detailing interactions between systems and actors. You have experience creating a wide variety of documentation, conducting cost-benefit analyses, and preparing management and analytical reports. You work closely with stakeholders to capture and understand technical requirements and then engage with the required AHS IT teams to validate requirements and develop technical specifications or plans.
Preferred Qualifications:
Prosci certification. Microsoft suite of tools, with preference given to Visio experience. Preference is given to trainer or developer experience with Connect Care.

Title: Senior Analyst, Branch Data Engineering
Description:
Requisition ID: 148246

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
Purpose:
Contributes to the overall success of Canadian Banking Analytics, ensuring specific individual goals, plans, initiatives are executed and delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities are conducted in compliance with governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.
The Senior Analyst, Benchmarking develops and supports data analytics for our benchmarking systems to evaluate product and process efficiencies and operational capacity for our customer-facing channels and business teams. This role is responsible for sourcing, extracting, compiling and visualizing data from a wide range of sources using data analytics and visualization tools to uncover insights in support of business initiatives and operations. In addition, the incumbent provides a high level of professional service to customers both internal and external consistent with department standards and procedures and is responsible for timely and accurate data and related tracking and reporting.
Accountabilities:
Use a variety of analytical and reporting tools (including SAS, SQL, Power BI) to perform complex analysis and reporting, including regular reports and ad-hoc requests as requiredEnsure integrity of data used for reporting, reconciling data sources and developing quality checksEffectively manage and prioritize multiple business initiatives, projects and ad-hoc analysis with business stakeholders and/or external partners/consultants.Document existing processes and work flows, and look for opportunities to optimize and automate work streamsWork closely with data infrastructure groups on data-related matters such as implementation of new data sources, platform migration, and data requirements for projectsDesign and develop programs for new internal process and enhancementDesign and deliver accurate, high quality on demand reports of high complexity level in available computing environments such as dynamic web reporting or static reports in various formatsExtract and manipulate data from a wide variety of systems and platforms, such as MVS (mainframe flat file extracts), DB2, Hadoop, MS Excel, and other various databases and sourcesProvide day-to-day debugging support to other team members on existing processes and reportingDesign, develop and maintain in-house application systems, including reviewing and refining user requirements, post completion reviews, identification of problems and recommended solutions, and identification and design of automation processesCoordinate with other teams and external vendors for server/application support where requiredCoach and provide knowledge transfer to new and existing team members

Requirements & Qualifications:
Degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or related fields is preferred.Strong programming skills in SQL and SAS (1+ years) required. Python and/or R experience would be an asset.Experienced with Power BI or Tableau. (1 year)Mainframe/JCL experience would be a significant asset.Experience optimizing queries across different databases would be an asset.Experience in automating queries and code would be an asset.Open to learn new tool and explore new way of analyzing business and campaign performance.Strong knowledge of Relational Databases such as DB2. Must be able to query data from large tables.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Must be able to interpret and consolidate large amount of information in actionable recommendations.Strong written and verbal communication skills are a must. Ability to communicate and translate technical concepts to non-technical staff.Knowledge of banking and financial services products, covering all business lines (day-to-day, borrowing, investing, insurance, wealth management, and small business) would be an asset.Experience with Big Data ecosystem tools (e.g. Hadoop, Hive, Spark) and data processing within the Enterprise Data Lake for ‘big data’ would be an asset.Must be flexible to adapt to a dynamic environment and make quick and sound decisions under pressure.Must be reliable, pro-active, results-oriented, customer-focused and attentive to details.Must possess excellent time management and organizational skills in order to deliver initiatives in a timely manner.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Title: Business Analyst, Parental Leave
Description:
Req Id: 366131
At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
Corporate Services is at the centre of the action, providing the support that enables Bell’s industry leadership. Our Corporate Security & Responsibility, Communications, Human Resources, Procurement & Value Creation and Real Estate teams work collaboratively to drive our corporate strategy forward.
Real Estate Services at Bell Canada is widely recognized throughout the industry for its ability to manage the entire BCE and Bell Real Estate Portfolio, which covers over 3000 buildings in Canada and the United States. Our mission is to provide a safe environment to employees, to ensure reliability of the telecommunications network and to provide value-added services.
The Performance Management team of Real Estate Services is currently seeking for a Business Analyst to assist in maximizing Real Estate Services’ efficiency and performance.

Lead meetings with both hosted or virtual teams; in either virtual remote or office environments;

Strong background in quantitative analysis and numerical model development;
Advanced communication and negotiation skills; must be able to articulate recommendations and results, influence key stakeholders

Experience in project management and change management;
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Proficient with Microsoft Excel (VLookup, Pivot Tables, Functions, Charting)
Proficient with PowerPoint

Experience with data visualization software such as Power BI
Experience with data analysis programming language such as Python or R
Bilingual (French & English)

Title: Senior Supply Chain Analyst
Description:
Aurora is a global leader in the cannabis industry serving both the medical and consumer markets. Headquartered in Edmonton, Alberta, Aurora is a pioneer in global cannabis dedicated to helping people improve their lives. The Company's brand portfolio includes Aurora, Aurora Drift, San Rafael '71, Daily Special, AltaVie, MedReleaf, CanniMed, Whistler, and Reliva CBD. Providing customers with innovative, high-quality cannabis products, Aurora's brands continue to break through as industry leaders in the medical, performance, wellness and recreational markets wherever they are launched.

Senior Supply Planning Analyst
Reporting to the Director, Supply Planning, the Senior Supply Planning Analyst is an integral part of the planning and supply chain process and is a primary link between Supply Chain functions. This role will focus on communicating, measuring and delivering supply chain performance and improvements, with heavy emphasis on problem solving, internal collaboration, and decision making. A strong understanding of the end-to-end supply chain, planning cycles, inventory management, and demand planning fundamentals are critical to success.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
Play a leading role in the S&OP process to support and drive business objectives
Drive initiatives that support reduced cost and improved service levels
Identifying supply gaps and propose mitigation solutions
Consolidate and analyze demand and supply information for operational and strategic plans, and uses data to drive on-time delivery, establish lead times, and inventory turns
Determine target inventory and planning method policies for major products with input from business and segment leaders
Maintain data, conduct analysis, and report to key stakeholders regarding key performance indicators. Track and drive related improvement activities
Develop and recommend inventory targets to meet desired service levels while minimizing working capital requirements
Place necessary purchase orders and interact / follow up with vendors as required
Perform DRP activities including creation of transfers as required
Respond and approve inquiries regarding inventory supply, abnormal movements, and customer inventory returns
Investigate and help explore resolution for Supply Chain service level complaints
Liaise as appropriate with all areas of the business including Sales, Customer Support, Operations, Manufacturing, Logistics, Finance and others
Create, maintain, and manage excel tools that support key Supply Chain processes

KNOWELDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:
Broad knowledge and understanding of planning concepts, including but not limited to, operational planning, inventory management, demand planning, records management, constraints planning, and reporting
Demonstrated ability to quickly adapt; maintain focus and a high degree of accuracy while working with complex data in an environment of ever-changing deadlines, priorities, and requirements
Strong analytical, organizational, decision making, and presentation skills
Self-motivated and efficient time management skills
Strong interpersonal skills are also essential to effectively interact with all teams, areas and levels of business affecting the forecast process
Ability to consolidate inventory and data from separate sources
Strong Excel modeling skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, PowerPoint) and PowerBI (or similar database tool)

EXPERIENCE:
Undergraduate degree in supply chain management, engineering or related field
3-5 years of experience as a Supply Chain Analyst, or in a similar role
SCMP designation is an asset
Prior cannabis, CPG, or alcohol/beverage experience is an asset

*As a condition of employment, all candidates must provide proof of vaccination against COVID-19 or receive an approved medical or human rights accommodation prior to commencing employment with Aurora. If proof of vaccination is not provided or a request for accommodation is not approved, the offer of employment will be rescinded*

Title: Business Analyst
Description: Works with key stakeholders to analyze business and user needs, documentingrequirements (user stories) and translating them into proper systems requirementspecifications Working on multiple projects, participating in and/or managing specific sections of largeprojects The technical business analyst will demonstrate skills in relationship building and is able tocoordinate work among other business analysts, product owners, infra and delivery teams Performs any necessary documentation activities required to support the specific businessrequirements and projects Performs any necessary data mapping and data lineage activities and documentsinformation flows to support specific business requirements Demonstrates an informed knowledge of business functions to resolve problems andcapitalize on improvement opportunities Play a key role in supporting and working on application incident management whenneeded Demonstrate a can-do attitude and ask the right questions to contribute towards thesuccess of the projectWhat You Will Bring to Succeed Over 8+ years of technical BA experience Over 3+ years of Wealth technology experience Good experience with database (e.g. Oracle, SQL) Experience with agile methodologies (Scrum) Excellent communication and presentation skills (written/verbal) Proven relationship management skills Experience with wealth management applications (Charles River) is preferredJob Type: Fixed term contractContract length: 6 monthsSchedule:8 hour shiftDay shiftMonday to FridayExperience:Business analysis: 8 years (required)SQL: 3 years (required)

Title: Sales Accounting Analyst
Description:
Description

Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.


The Sales Accounting Analyst will analyze new and existing sales processing & accounting processes; identifying opportunities for accounting & control improvements and proposing innovative solutions that will best meet Corporate & Branch requirements.

Expected to apply accounting disciplines, data analytics as well as change management, collaborative problem-solving and influencing others to ensure effective processes, accounting, controls and documentation.


Responsibilities:

Perform continuous analysis of data and business practices to understand current state, opportunities, and gaps to identify and define accounting change requirements, establish new procedures, test, implement and validate changes.

Identify and champion opportunities to improve process efficiency and effectiveness of sales and refund accounting processes and controls through; system/automation enhancements, process improvement, new tools and skill training (self and others).

Review and establish accounting policies and controls related to current and new Sales Processing, Cash & Alternate Payments, Refunds, and ticket database correction processes.

Develop and maintain process & control 52-109 documentation, and user procedure documentation.

Perform internal & external audit support requirements in partnership with the Audit Team.

Assist Manager, Sales and Refund Accounting with monthly accounting tasks and oversight, including reviewing accounting journals, GL account activity and GL account reconciliations

Interface with the PRA System Delivery group in the system change process; investigating & resolving production issues, identifying opportunities and solutions.

Define new business requirements and test conditions; perform review pre & post implementation and provide training to functional business teams as applicable.

Work closely with key business stakeholders to ensure all business requirements and timelines are understood, developed, and clearly communicated and that solutions provide expected benefits.

Document new processes, controls, user procedures and distribute to functional groups & management.

Collaborate with multiple branches, system vendors and external business partners to understand business objective, evaluate options, focusing on optimal solutions for AC while safeguarding Sales Processing efficiencies & Sales Accounting controls.

Ensure appropriate escalation to functional management and resolution management practices are in place for initiatives and day-to-day deliverables


Leadership Attitudes:


Thought Leadership

Analysis & Decision Making - Analyzes problems and situations, and their impacts on the business and its global network.

Strategic Thinking - Brings to life our vision of becoming "A Top 10 Airline in Everything We Do". Aligns personal and workgroup activities to the organization's strategic goals to provide value to our customers.

Customer Centricity - Builds and delivers solutions for internal and external customers that meet and exceed their needs, identifying innovative opportunities that will benefit them, creating value added services.

Results Orientation - Manages performance, holding self and others accountable to effectively and efficiently complete work responsibilities. Demonstrates initiative, a strong commitment to achieving meaningful results, and acts on opportunities to create value.

People/Personal Leadership

Building Collaborative Partnerships - Encourages personal achievement and excellence. Plays a part in attracting, developing, and retaining top talent. Ensures that all talent receives mentoring, training, feedback, and development opportunities.

Building Talent - Fosters an inclusive culture that makes people feel valued and respected. Works effectively with others across the organization to achieve goals. Ensures that all functions (assigning work, performance management, training and development, succession planning, determining developmental needs, rewarding and disciplining) are conducted in a fair and equitable way.

Adaptability - Responds resourcefully and shows nimbleness when faced with new challenges and demands. Effectively manages the pressures and complexities of various situations. Moves forward positively and productively under conditions of change or uncertainty.
Qualifications

Advanced accounting skills - CPA or equivalent an asset

Extensive knowledge of PeopleSoft- General Ledger Accounting

Working knowledge of Teradata, Siebel and writing SQL queries

Proficiency in PC applications -Advanced Excel, Word, One Note

Demonstrated effective investigation strategies, analytics, results compilation, recommendation summaries

Excellent analytic and problem-solving skills in troubleshooting issues as part of a global team

Demonstrated ability to work on multiple deliveries with tight deadlines and evolving priorities

Strong understanding of and experience with change management, process changes

Effective implementation planning, coordination & documentation abilities

Demonstrated high level of accountability, initiative, flexibility and ability to manage workload and achieve results

Knowledge of Passenger Revenue Accounting business functions and systems infrastructure - Navitaire (Sales, Refunds, AFR); Direct Sales Systems; IATA BSP

Excellent interpersonal & communication skills, both written and oral, with an ability to communicate with all levels of management, multiple AC Branches, employees, external system providers, business partners

Self-starter with ability to operate under minimum supervision

Conditions of Employment:

Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position.

Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Required


Linguistic Requirements

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.



Diversity and Inclusion


Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees' unique contributions to our company's success.


As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

Title: BI Developer
Description:
Are you ready for a taste of the one of Canada's Top Employers? Purdys Chocolatier is delighted to have been voted by our employees as one of the Canada's Best Employers. This esteemed award is a testament to the rich texture of our history and our more than 100 years of dedication to quality, trust, tradition, and innovation. The Purdys difference is that we truly recognize the value of our people.

We reward you with competitive compensation, recognition for your achievements, opportunities for ongoing training to grow professionally and personally, delicious perks, and much, much more. Do you have a passion for transforming data and creating innovative solutions? If so, Purdys Chocolatier might be just what you are looking for! We are looking for a Business Intelligence Developer to join our Support Office team in Vancouver, BC.

The BI Developer is responsible for creating, managing, and transforming data into reports that provide insights into the business; this includes designing, building and deploying BI solutions. This individual will be the owner of the Microsoft Power BI application at Purdys including licensing, product updates, data security monitoring, building reports and dashboards. The BI Developer will work closely with various departments to define best practices and advise on architecture and roadmaps for Business Intelligence technology. The key responsibilities include, but are not limited to: • Designing, developing, deploying, and maintaining business intelligence solutions • Gathering and analyzing data; ensure users can access the data • Design and develop BI dashboards and reports based on business and user requirements • Recommend improvements to streamline processes regarding data flow and data quality to improve
