accuracy, usability, and value • Conduct maintenance on the Power BI platform • Design solutions that take into consideration the business processes of different departments • Maintain up to date technical documentation • Provide options to address roadblocks in system designs • Prepare and validate end to end business logic and mappings • Develop POC datasets and reports • Utilize best practices in testing and reporting including usability, data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation • Adapt ETL processes as required to accommodate changes in source systems and business user requirements • Monitor, troubleshoot and debug issues with the system • Design and develop data models to be used for reporting and information delivery The successful candidate should have: • Diploma or degree in computer science • Minimum 5 years of experience handling data and building reports • Previous experience with business intelligence rollouts • Experience building complex measures and calculated fields in Power BI • Advanced RLS configuration • Advanced level experience with the Microsoft technology stack (SSAS, SSRS, SQL Server, TSQL, MDX, DAX, Power BI, Power Pivot, Power Query) • Understanding of data architecture, data quality, data mapping and data structures • Must be able to understand and prioritize user and business requirements • Proven ability to plan and execute complex projects • Excellent communication skills • An entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to proactively make recommendations and drive the Business Intelligence roadmap Purdys Chocolatier recognizes the value of skills and knowledge gained outside of formal education and paid employment.

Applicants who present an equivalent combination of qualifications and experience will be considered and are encouraged to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest in Purdys Chocolatier, but due to the volume of applications received, we are only able to contact those applicants who have been selected for an interview. No phone calls please. Purdys Chocolatier is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities.

If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us via email at resumes@purdys.com

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
We are proud of the innovation, dedication, partnership and resourcefulness of our physicians, employees and volunteers. More than any building or technology, it's our people who make Fraser Health distinct.
Effective October 26th 2021, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization “WHO” approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.
Do you want to utilize your technical skills, information systems knowledge and develop as a leader? If so, then keep on reading.
Your strong logical thinking and troubleshooting skill, combined with a passion of working in the healthcare industry will assure your success in this role.
As a Senior Business Analyst , you will provide technical leadership within the eHealth Services . Bring your real passion for innovation and performance in technology as you contribute to change lives in healthcare.
Build your career experience as you:
Provide leadership in Business Process Reengineering concepts, methods and technologies.
Lead the analysis and documentation of business requirements for client-facing and internal Informatics services delivery processes for business, clinical, and systems support services within Fraser Health.
Engage in multiple initiatives and will be responsible for project planning, business requirements gathering, data analysis and supporting the execution of projects and change management support.
Provide leadership and acts as an escalation point for Business Analysts to assist in resolving complex problems.
Are you motivated to join us? We will be looking for you to have the following:
Bachelor's degree in Health Information Systems Management or related field.
Three (3) to Five (5) years recent related experience in a medium to large sized organization.
Including experience with health and corporate information systems.
Experience with electronic health information systems such as Meditech, PARIS, and/or Intrahealth Profile.
An equivalent combination of education, training and experience is acceptable.
This is a full-time position based at our Central City Offices, Surrey, B.C.
If this sounds like the excellent role for you, here are more reasons why you should apply:
A career that offers you the opportunity to work in a fast growing and exciting organization with health care providers who are excellent in their respective fields.
Fantastic opportunities for support and management roles are available as you advance within the organization.
Competitive salary package, including comprehensive health benefits coverage.
A chance to create a difference every day in the world of health care.
Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations. Our team of nearly 40,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.
Take the next step in your career and make a difference in the communities we serve! Apply today, so we can continue the conversation.
We value diversity in the work force and seek to maintain an environment of respect, caring and trust.
Find out what it’s like to work here. Like us on Facebook (@fraserhealthcareers), follow us on Twitter & Instagram (@FHCareer), or connect with us on LinkedIn (fraserhealthcareers) for first-hand employee insights!

Title: Research Data Analyst/Statistician Cntre for Gbl Hth
Description:
RESEARCH BIOSTATISTICIAN (Full time, Toronto)
The Centre for Global Health Research (CGHR) is an independent, not-for-profit organization co-sponsored by Unity Health Toronto and the University of Toronto. Founded in 2002 on the principle that effective health initiatives must be supported by reliable, evidence-based research, CGHR was created to conduct large-scale epidemiological studies in developing countries. CGHR’s mission is to lead high-quality public health research that advances global health for all, with particular attention to the world’s poorest populations.
We are recruiting a skilled and experienced Biostatistician. The successful candidate will work on large-scale epidemiological projects in a team of multidisciplinary scientists, analysts and trainees in our Toronto office as well as with partners in international collaborative efforts. This is a 12-month contract position, renewable subject to performance.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
The successful candidate will be responsible for the statistical analysis for research projects, create data visualizations and tables, and be responsible for writing methods and results sections of manuscripts for submission to peer-reviewed scientific journals. Working with the data management and IT teams, the Biostatistician will also have a role in organizing and maintaining CGHR's data holdings. They will provide statistical expertise in the design, analysis, and reporting of research projects and consultative assistance for ad hoc requests. The successful candidate will be expected to take ownership of projects and serve multiple research roles as needed. They will collaborate in the preparation of manuscripts, reports, presentations, and grant applications, and maintain excellent documentation of data management and statistical analysis processes.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Minimum masters-level degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a related discipline
Expert computing skills in R for advanced statistical analysis
2+ years experience in applied epidemiological research, study design, cleaning and organization of datasets, and data analysis
Strong proficiency in preparation and linking of large datasets (country level cohort studies, national surveys, censuses, etc.)
Knowledge of relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.)
Demonstrated ability to be self-motivated and do independent work
Demonstrated ability to learn new skills and to adapt quickly to changing requirements
Strong problem solving skills, with ability to derive innovative solutions
Strong interpersonal skills
Excellent oral and writing skills; Excellent attention to detail
Experience in global health research and proficiency in languages other than English are assets
Interest in health issues of developing countries is required
As a condition of employment, all external hires will be required to submit proof of COVID-19 vaccination or documentation unless a valid accommodation under the Ontario Human Rights Code exists. All internal candidates must be in compliance with Unity Health Toronto's COVID-19 Vaccination Policy.

Title: Analyst, ESG Reporting
Description:
THE ROLE
It’s an exciting time to join the Sustainability team at Triovest. In 2014, we launched Triovest’s ESG program and declared our committed to improve our environmental and societal impacts. Since then, we have been expanding on that foundation by improving energy performance, certifying properties under green building programs, and establishing sustainable processes and standards for our upcoming developments.
Join Triovest as an Analyst, ESG Reporting at either our downtown Calgary or Toronto location. As a member of the Sustainability team, you would be responsible for assisting with sustainability reporting and disclosures, including preparation of the annual Environment, Social and Governance Report, compliance with the Ontario Energy and Water Reporting and Benchmarking regulation, and disclosure to the Global Real Estate Sustainability Benchmark (GRESB). You will also be directly involved in driving leading projects including green building certification (LEED, BBEST, WELL, WIREDSCORE, etc.), net-zero water and energy projects, and corporate initiatives and improvements across our building portfolio.
This is a highly visible role that will provide you with the foundations of a successful career in real estate and sustainability. You will have the opportunity to work with a diverse group of internal and industry experts across a variety of property types (retail, industrial and office).
WHY CHOOSE TRIOVEST?
At Triovest, we have clear guiding core values and principles, and we live by them every day in everything we do. When you join us, you will find that collaboration and trust go hand-in-hand, creating genuine relationships with colleagues, leaders, shareholders, and clients.
As we grow and evolve, you can too. There is ample opportunity to build your skills and grow in your career while working on exciting, industry-leading projects. Your potential is limitless.
Here is some of the great benefits that our employees enjoy:
A comprehensive health benefits package, including a health spending account and personal spending account, access to virtual health, and an employee and family assistance program (EFAP)
Personal & sick days
National and local social committees – fun events, webinars and team building activities held throughout the year for employees
Speaker Series to support diversity, equality, and inclusion
Corporate Charity Program – making a positive difference and supporting our communities through paid volunteering days and charity matching
Tuition for training & development
Employee Referral Program – our people are our greatest asset, we’re always looking to grow our teams, and we offer a substantial Employee Referral Program
Discounted membership fees with GoodLife
Cell phone plan discounts with Rogers
WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?
Support the preparation of annual disclosures, including our Environment, Social and Governance Report and GRESB submissions.
Prepare responses to the annual Ontario Energy and Water Reporting & Benchmarking (EWRB) regulation and assist in ENERGY STAR certification of properties.
Assist with the management of building-level energy, water, waste and greenhouse gas (GHG) data and analyze data quality and timeliness.
Support the management of our ESG database and Building Score Cards, including the collection, review, and analysis of sustainability-related data (e.g., energy and water consumption, waste production, GHG emissions, and sustainability-related activities).
Coordinate with service providers, internal teams (e.g., property management, portfolio, etc.), and externally hosted databases (EPL, RYCOME, etc.) to ensure sustainability-related information (e.g., property details, utilities data) is up-to-date and accurate in various systems.
Contribute to drafting sustainability/ESG/impact content and reports for clients, internal and external stakeholders; including engagement with other internal teams (i.e. Operations, Human Resources, Marketing, Finance, etc.).
Support the preparation and submission of green building certification applications (LEED, BBEST, WELL, FITWELL, etc.) and the required annual renewals.
Coordinate with the Property Management team on matters related to implementation of Resilience Assessment, Smart Building Implementation, and green building certifications such as LEED, BBEST, FITWELL, WIREDSCORE and WELL.
Complete company-wide analysis of ESG KPIs and stakeholder engagement.
Support the development of the Triovest’s ESG policies, guidelines and best practices as well as ESG/Risk Management information system.
Support Triovest’s internal target-setting initiative(s) and the development and execution of programs related to climate change risk management (i.e., net-zero, resiliency).
Clearly and accurately document and convey key findings, formally and informally, providing necessary supporting facts and analysis, and makes appropriate recommendations.
Complete quarterly reporting on ESG.
Contribute to annual business planning and goal setting as it pertains to ESG.
Ability to identify, interpret and document relevant and accurate quantitative and qualitative data to provide well thought-out recommendations and produce insightful reports.
Support and, as directed, lead innovative ESG integration projects to support Triovest’s objectives.
Look for efficiencies in the team’s activities and where appropriate, identify the relevant data sources and technology to streamline team efforts.
Manage and update property database and contact databases and integrate new team initiatives and information updates.
Develop and oversee the production of clear, comprehensive, and detailed deliverables.
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
We believe success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills:
The ideal candidate is highly organized with a keen eye for detail, strong technical acumen, a high level of business maturity and solid decision-making skills.
The successful person will possess deeply rooted emotional intelligence and be a thoughtful and humble collaborator. As well, they must be self-starter, a strategic thinker and have a service-oriented attitude that will encourage continuous improvement of service and performance.
Strong interpersonal skills with an outstanding level of integrity that will gain the trust and respect of staff and external stakeholders.
Demonstrated organizational skills, and the ability to effectively prioritize in a demanding, high paced environment.
Ability to resolve complex issues and unforeseen obstacles quickly and efficiently.
Desire to take on new challenges and continued professional development.
Self-motivated and able to work independently.
Must be inclusive and supportive of the diversity within the Triovest team.
A strong communicator who can effectively address both small and large groups with empathy, credibility and trust.
Ability to collaborate remotely across geographies and sectors.
To fulfill this role successfully, you should demonstrate the following minimum qualifications:
University degree in sustainability management, engineering, urban planning, business/commerce, finance, or other relevant disciplines with knowledge of the investment, consulting and/or commercial real estate industry.
Minimum 2+ years experience in a sustainability-related field.
Expertise in preparation of BBEST and LEED Certification submissions.
Knowledge of third-party green building rating systems (i.e.: WELL, Fitwel, Passive House, zero building standard or related).
LEED GA, LEED AP, WELL AP accreditation is an asset.
Advanced knowledge of corporate governance, social, and environmental issues, preference for climate change expertise with experience with GRESB. Knowledge of Science-Based Targets, GRI and TCFD is an asset.
High level of competency with Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Office Suite is essential.
Proficient with creating spreadsheets, developing Excel reports and condensing complex data into succinct reports.
Knowledge of private-sector carbon accounting, Scopes I, II and III is an asset.
ESG/sustainability analysis gained in an investment context, or Sustainability experience gained within a corporate or a consulting practice.
Previous design, construction or project management experience on new construction and major renovation/retrofit projects with important sustainability and energy efficiency objects such as LEED, Zero Carbon Building Standard or Passive House is an asset.
ABOUT TRIOVEST
Triovest is a Canadian investment manager and developer of institutional-quality commercial and residential properties. The company offers a full suite of complementary real estate services, including asset management, leasing, property management, sustainability, and risk-mitigation services. Its portfolio of office, industrial, residential, retail, and mixed-use properties is valued at over $12 billion, with $2 billion currently under development. With more than 45 million square feet of real estate assets under management on behalf of individual and institutional investors, Triovest is one of the largest privately-owned commercial real estate companies in Canada.
We believe that the quality of our people directly impacts the quality of our work, therefore we place a high value on attracting and retaining exceptional individuals. Triovest fosters a hands-on approach to value creation for our clients through innovation and collaboration. Learn more about Triovest by visiting our website.
Triovest is an Equal Opportunity Employer
We believe in the power of diversity and we are dedicated to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment at Triovest. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request during the recruitment and selection process. For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process, please contact eboyack@triovest.com for assistance/support.
Vaccination Policy
Triovest requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. An exemption from this requirement is provided on an exceptional reason, such as medical, creed or religious reasons in accordance with the relevant Human Rights legislation in the province in which you work.
#LI-DNI

Title: Data Analyst (ON)
Description:
Tiger Analytics is looking for experienced Data Analysts to join our fast-growing advanced analytics consulting firm. We are the trusted analytics partner for multiple Fortune 500 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our business value and leadership has been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner. We are looking for top-notch talent as we continue to build the best global analytics consulting team in the world.
As a Data Analyst at Tiger Analytics, you will apply strong expertise in AI through the use of machine learning, data mining, and information retrieval to design, prototype, and build next generation advanced analytics engines and services. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams and business partners to define the technical problem statement and hypotheses to test. You will have the opportunity to drive current and future strategy by leveraging your analytical skills as you ensure business value and communicate the results.
Key Responsibilities:
This requirement is for a Student loans remediation team. This team looks into cases where there have been instances of overcharging to the client, late fee/ additional interest charges, etc. They need to find out the root cause of this and work towards remediation and intervention strategies. The need is for Data Mining skills (SQL proficiency is a must, handling complex queries). In addition, organizational, communication, documentation, and problem-solving skills are good to have.
Requirements
Work with remediation analysts and business partners to review eprob, population file, or any relevant documents provided by triage team to understand the issue and harm caused to the impacted consumers.
Work with the team to review SQL queries provided by triage or BT, and write challenger queries to validate the impacted population of the issue. Present to the management team and seek approval on the population.
Make recommendations and seek approval from management on the remediation category. Review and write challenger queries to validate the input data provided by BT and ensure accuracy of the redress amount calculation.
Prepare the remediation file and submit it for redress execution. Validate and audit the output to make sure redress is executed as intended.
Provide data support for the remediation analysts for proper documentation within eprob, data requests from internal audits, etc.
Develop and automate reports on redress for leadership and regulatory update if needed.
Build out standardized templates for data pull and redress calculation where applicable. Recommend improvement to work processes to increase efficiency while maintaining the quality of work.

Skills/Education
SQL expertise (including complex joins, grouping aggregation, nested subqueries, and cursors)
Strong critical thinking skills, with proven ability to; 1) think creatively about how to solve problems with data, and 2) troubleshoot quality issues
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, applied mathematics, engineering) Master's degree preferred
Minimum of 3 years of relevant work experience, five years of experience preferred (avg. incumbent has seven years of exp.)
Benefits
Significant career development opportunities exist as the company grows. The position offers a unique opportunity to be part of a small, fast-growing, challenging and entrepreneurial environment, with a high degree of individual responsibility.

Title: Inventory Replenishment Analyst
Description:
Company Description
At Farm Boy, it is our mission to create a fun, fresh experience for all! Whether you are a team member or a customer, Farm Boy is passionate about creating a unique fresh food shopping experience and ensuring that we deliver on our commitments.
As we continue to grow within Ontario, Farm Boy is excited to welcome new team members that share our passion for providing the best fresh shopping experience!

Job Description
This position is responsible for managing all aspects of inventory control for assigned departments with the purpose of achieving Farm Boy’s vision, maximizing sales and profitability and enabling the strategic growth of the company. The performance of the duties must ensure a quality service approach to all employees, customers and suppliers. All responsibilities must be performed in a manner consistent with the Farm Boy Way.
Major Responsibilities:
Inventory Management
Determine proper levels of inventory by SKU for the purpose of maximizing fill rates, shelf-life availability and product freshness resulting in increased Inventory Turns.
Facilitate clear communications through supply chain (Supplier - Farm Boy Procurement, Distribution Centre, Accounting and Retail) in an effort to expedite accurate transmission of information and product.
Strive to meet and or exceed the fill rate and freshness objectives of Farm Boy Procurement on a consistent basis.
Maintain acute awareness of various influences on product inventory such as but not limited to - feature planning, instore planning, store openings, seasonal changes, consumer trend influences.
Maintain accurate current and historical data enabling effective decision making in regards to inventory control.
Supply Logistics
Liaise with external suppliers, internal departments as well as Store and Department Managers on all issues relating to the ordering process.
Follow up with Category Managers on issues relating to short shipments, out-of-stocks, etc. and communicate to all parties concerned.
Effective and timely communications on all supply related issues such as but not limited to: supplier shortages, damages, late deliveries, product recalls.
Coordinate, analyze and challenge suppliers regarding in-bound receiving, with particular attention to minimum order quota and lead time requirements.
Facilitate timely and orderly delivery of product to maximize distribution center efficiencies.
Quality Assurance
Understand product specifications as determined by Product Development / Category Management for the intention of ensuring a high level of product integrity on a consistent basis.
Ensuring proper rotation and flow through of inventory in an effort to optimize product quality at all times
Effectively communicate Farm Boy Procurement Policies for product specifications in an effort to avoid disruptions to supply chain management.
Internal Controls
Strict adherence to all Farm Boy policies and procedures as they pertain to replenishment in an effort to minimize issues created through both internal and external areas of supply chain.
Develop a thorough understanding of I.T. systems developed to facilitate replenishment responsibilities.
Develop awareness of potential shortfalls in I.T replenishment systems for communication to developers.
Miscellaneous
May be requested to undertake other related duties on a periodic basis (i.e., new store procurement set-up).

Qualifications

Typically requires completion of a post-secondary office administration program plus 2 to 3 years of experience in an office setting with administrative responsibilities or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
A passion for food retailing and people.
Solid retail experience.
Sound knowledge of business practices.
Good knowledge of retail industry and food products.
Superior standards of quality.
Ability to work with minimum supervision and interact with employees on all levels.
Good judgement and decision-making abilities.
Excellent analytical skills.
Experience working with various computer software programs (i.e Microsoft Suite).
Clear and effective communication style, both written and oral.
Impeccable organizational skills with keen attention to detail.
Skilled at working in a fast-paced environment while maintaining priorities and a high level of performance.
¨Fluency in English and French shall be considered an asset.
Work & Sensory Environment
Providing service to several people or departments, working under many simultaneous deadlines.
Exposure to eye strain from computer terminals.
Exposure to periodic and various temperature environments.
Additional Information
Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and employees with disabilities.

Title: Sr. Consultant - Business System Analyst
Description:
Nous bâtissons une banque axée sur les relations pour un monde moderne. Nous recrutons des professionnels talentueux et passionnés qui ont à cœur de faire ce qu’il faut pour nos clients.
À la Banque CIBC, nous misons sur vos forces et vos ambitions pour vous donner le pouvoir d’agir. Les membres de notre équipe disposent de ce dont ils ont besoin pour apporter une contribution significative et être valorisés, à la fois pour ce qu’ils sont et ce qu’ils font.
Description d'emploi
What you'll be doing
You’ll be joining CIBC’s Technology Team. You’ll lead complex projects to design strategic solutions aligned to CIBC’s enterprise architecture roadmap. As a Sr. Business Systems Consultant (BSC), you’ll support end-to-end project implementation and act as a subject matter expert in both business and technology. You’ll ideate and collaborate with a diverse team to create and set up flexible, innovative solutions that deliver a best-in-class client experience.
How you'll succeed
Understanding and documenting requirements - Work closely with business partners to gather complicated business requirements and facilitate solution design discussions to ensure you meet project needs. Create strong relationships, lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements.
Solution design - Assemble client-focused solutions that meet business requirements. Prepare and validate solution design documents around areas such as scope clarification, solution requirements, and quality assurance.
Leading and mentoring – Support end-to-end project implementation as a subject matter expert, and provide guidance to a diverse team of technology and project professionals. Maintain a collaborative work environment and support team members to resolve organizational, operational, and process problems.
Who you are
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.
You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You communicate detailed information in a meaningful way.
You're inspired by collective success. You know that teamwork can transform a good idea into a great one. You know that an inclusive team that enjoys working together can bring a vision to life.
Your influence makes a difference. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by sharing your expertise.
You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Business, and/or a related field, and you’ve spent at least 3 years in a BSC role leading projects and designing solutions. It’s an asset if you have experience with Agile methodologies, and Application and/or Architecture Development.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
What CIBC offers
At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program
Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients
We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development
Ce que vous devez savoir
La Banque CIBC s’est engagée à créer un milieu de travail intégrateur où tous les membres de l’équipe et les clients se sentent à leur place. Nous recherchons des candidats dotés d’un large éventail de compétences et offrons une expérience accessible aux candidats. Si vous avez besoin d’une solution d’adaptation, écrivez à Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com.
Vous devez être légalement admissible à travailler au Canada dans les lieux précisés ci-dessus et, s’il y a lieu, détenir un permis de travail ou d’études valide.
À la Banque CIBC, nous nous engageons à protéger notre équipe, nos clients et les collectivités que nous servons. Il est important pour nous d’avoir un milieu de travail sûr et sain et de fournir notre part d’efforts pour traverser cette pandémie. Dans le cadre de cet engagement, nous exigeons comme condition d’emploi que tous les candidats retenus soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 au moment de leur entrée en poste. Dans le cas contraire, ils devront présenter une preuve écrite d’exemption médicale ou une demande d’adaptation justifiée en vertu des lois sur les droits de la personne applicables.
Lieu de travail
Toronto-200 King St. W., 7th
Type d’emploi
Permanent
Heures de travail hebdomadaires
0
Compétences

Title: Analyst
Description:
Analyst
Yazaki is a global leader in the research, development and delivery of vehicle power and data solutions.

Yazaki works with virtually every major auto manufacturer in the world, and we've strived to maintain strategic and stable growth throughout our 83-year history. Today, we're on the lookout for energetic people with the potential to perform, as well as the ability to strengthen - and thrive in - the positive work environment we pride ourselves on.

Location: Kitchener, ON, USA


POSITION SUMMARY

Responsible for viewing, compiling and analyzing customer releases, creating shipping orders, making adjustments as necessary and sending ASN’s. Responsible for maintaining customer web based applications and completing customer and departmental documentation as required. Requires daily interaction and communication with external OEM and PIA customers as well as internal business unit customers and functional groups

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Accesses Customer systems to collect and analyze daily shipping requirements
Reconciles shipment accums and related discrepancies (DMR, RDR, RMO)
Creates orders in Future 3
Sends ASN’s
Monitors ASN’s for errors and accuracy
Monitors daily and monthly customer delivery ratings (reporting to core group as designated) and dispute as necessary
Ensures Customers specific requirements such as labeling, packaging, routing, window times, and EDI specs are communicated, complied with, and current
Direct contact and communication with external customers
Direct contact and communication with internal customers and functional groups
Prepares and submits corrective actions required internally or by external customers such as 8D’s, 7D’s, PRR, etc.
Completes and submits of all internal /external customer and departmental documentation for single and or multiple locations
Reports shipment and delivery activity as required by the internal / external customer or management
Provides training on specific department and Customer systems, processes and procedures
Communicates regularly with individuals inside and outside of department
Reads and analyzes spreadsheets and EDI releases
Identifies root cause of failures in department processes, procedures, and systems
Assists in the promotion of an orderly workflow
Provides help, guidance and training in established processes, procedures, and systems
Accepts additional responsibilities in the absence of the department Team Lead or Supervisor
Assists management in meeting corporate and departmental goals and objectives
Supports corporate policies and departmental policies
Supports EMS/QMS policies and procedures
Supports health and safety policies
Associate must be able to relate to other people beyond giving and receiving instructions
Experience in the following systems:
Future 3
JDE
PkMS
Microsoft Office applications
Ford DDL
Covisint
DC Smart
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Degree Requirements:
Associates degree preferred but not required

Certification Requirements:
N/A

Previous Experience:
A minimum of 3 years in material planning, scheduling, and or data analysis

Travel Requirements:
As required

On Call Requirements:
24/7

Physical Requirements:
Ability to lift up to 30 lbs.

Yazaki North America is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons regardless of race, color, religion, sex, age, marital status, national origin, disability, handicap, veteran status, or other legally protected status or characteristic. Equal opportunity extends to all aspects of the employment relationship. Yazaki North America complies with federal and state equal employment opportunity laws and strives to keep the workplace free from all forms of harassment.

Title: Security Data Analyst
Description:
Job Functions:
Conduct analysis on trends, patterns to proactively raise concern and suggest mitigation strategies
Review, improve and develop reports to support the work of the Branch Units and top tier clientele needs.
Develop, test, and implement solutions to meet business requirements approved by Director of Operations.
Clearly convey the key insights the data reveals in a visual format that is grouped, summarized, or formatted to be easily understood and actionable
Interact with clients, analyze business requirements, and recommend solutions that will have a measurable impact on the effectiveness of the security program.
Ensure presentation of information is professional, timely and accurate.
Ensure that imperative specification and support documentation are understood by the reviewers, approvers, and users of the material.
Modernize the branches SharePoint tool to create rich digital experiences using lists, libraries, forms, workflows, and custom apps through continual enhancement and development.
Define and set standards around Content Management within SharePoint including site appearance and page layouts, formatting, styling, color scheme, graphics etc.
Work with all units (SSU, OCU, BSU) to triage, track, communicate, mitigate, and resolve issues.
Job Requirements:
High level of proficiency using Microsoft Excel (Pivot Tables, Visualizations, Formulas)
Experience with statistical analysis
In-depth understanding of relational database structure and principles
Strong interest in data analysis and developing creative solutions to problems
Ability to independently manage complex projects
Able to communicate professionally in a clear and direct manner, both verbal and written
Excellent interpersonal skills
Familiar with Tracktik, Power BI, WinTeam, Jira, and other security reporting programs is an asset
Qualifications:
Post-secondary education in Business, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or other Analysis related programs is preferred
Security management/supervisor experience considered an asset

Title: BI Developer
Description:
Are you ready for a taste of the one of Canada's Top Employers? Purdys Chocolatier is delighted to have been voted by our employees as one of the Canada's Best Employers. This esteemed award is a testament to the rich texture of our history and our more than 100 years of dedication to quality, trust, tradition, and innovation. The Purdys difference is that we truly recognize the value of our people.

We reward you with competitive compensation, recognition for your achievements, opportunities for ongoing training to grow professionally and personally, delicious perks, and much, much more. Do you have a passion for transforming data and creating innovative solutions? If so, Purdys Chocolatier might be just what you are looking for! We are looking for a Business Intelligence Developer to join our Support Office team in Vancouver, BC.

The BI Developer is responsible for creating, managing, and transforming data into reports that provide insights into the business; this includes designing, building and deploying BI solutions. This individual will be the owner of the Microsoft Power BI application at Purdys including licensing, product updates, data security monitoring, building reports and dashboards. The BI Developer will work closely with various departments to define best practices and advise on architecture and roadmaps for Business Intelligence technology. The key responsibilities include, but are not limited to: • Designing, developing, deploying, and maintaining business intelligence solutions • Gathering and analyzing data; ensure users can access the data • Design and develop BI dashboards and reports based on business and user requirements • Recommend improvements to streamline processes regarding data flow and data quality to improve accuracy, usability, and value • Conduct maintenance on the Power BI platform • Design solutions that take into consideration the business processes of different departments • Maintain up to date technical documentation • Provide options to address roadblocks in system designs • Prepare and validate end to end business logic and mappings • Develop POC datasets and reports • Utilize best practices in testing and reporting including usability, data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation • Adapt ETL processes as required to accommodate changes in source systems and business user requirements • Monitor, troubleshoot and debug issues with the system • Design and develop data models to be used for reporting and information delivery The successful candidate should have: • Diploma or degree in computer science • Minimum 5 years of experience handling data and building reports • Previous experience with business intelligence rollouts • Experience building complex measures and calculated fields in Power BI • Advanced RLS configuration • Advanced level experience with the Microsoft technology stack (SSAS, SSRS, SQL Server, TSQL, MDX, DAX, Power BI, Power Pivot, Power Query) • Understanding of data architecture, data quality, data mapping and data structures • Must be able to understand and prioritize user and business requirements • Proven ability to plan and execute complex projects • Excellent communication skills • An entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to proactively make recommendations and drive the Business Intelligence roadmap Purdys Chocolatier recognizes the value of skills and knowledge gained outside of formal education and paid employment.

Applicants who present an equivalent combination of qualifications and experience will be considered and are encouraged to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest in Purdys Chocolatier, but due to the volume of applications received, we are only able to contact those applicants who have been selected for an interview. No phone calls please. Purdys Chocolatier is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities.

If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us via email at resumes@purdys.com

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
We are proud of the innovation, dedication, partnership and resourcefulness of our physicians, employees and volunteers. More than any building or technology, it's our people who make Fraser Health distinct.
Effective October 26th 2021, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization “WHO” approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.
Do you want to utilize your technical skills, information systems knowledge and develop as a leader? If so, then keep on reading.
Your strong logical thinking and troubleshooting skill, combined with a passion of working in the healthcare industry will assure your success in this role.
As a Senior Business Analyst , you will provide technical leadership within the eHealth Services . Bring your real passion for innovation and performance in technology as you contribute to change lives in healthcare.
Build your career experience as you:
Provide leadership in Business Process Reengineering concepts, methods and technologies.
Lead the analysis and documentation of business requirements for client-facing and internal Informatics services delivery processes for business, clinical, and systems support services within Fraser Health.
Engage in multiple initiatives and will be responsible for project planning, business requirements gathering, data analysis and supporting the execution of projects and change management support.
Provide leadership and acts as an escalation point for Business Analysts to assist in resolving complex problems.
Are you motivated to join us? We will be looking for you to have the following:
Bachelor's degree in Health Information Systems Management or related field.
Three (3) to Five (5) years recent related experience in a medium to large sized organization.
Including experience with health and corporate information systems.
Experience with electronic health information systems such as Meditech, PARIS, and/or Intrahealth Profile.
An equivalent combination of education, training and experience is acceptable.
This is a full-time position based at our Central City Offices, Surrey, B.C.
If this sounds like the excellent role for you, here are more reasons why you should apply:
A career that offers you the opportunity to work in a fast growing and exciting organization with health care providers who are excellent in their respective fields.
Fantastic opportunities for support and management roles are available as you advance within the organization.
Competitive salary package, including comprehensive health benefits coverage.
A chance to create a difference every day in the world of health care.
Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations. Our team of nearly 40,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.
Take the next step in your career and make a difference in the communities we serve! Apply today, so we can continue the conversation.
We value diversity in the work force and seek to maintain an environment of respect, caring and trust.
Find out what it’s like to work here. Like us on Facebook (@fraserhealthcareers), follow us on Twitter & Instagram (@FHCareer), or connect with us on LinkedIn (fraserhealthcareers) for first-hand employee insights!

Title: Research Data Analyst/Statistician Cntre for Gbl Hth
Description:
RESEARCH BIOSTATISTICIAN (Full time, Toronto)

 The Centre for Global Health Research (CGHR) is an independent, not-for-profit organization co-sponsored by Unity Health Toronto and the University of Toronto. Founded in 2002 on the principle that effective health initiatives must be supported by reliable, evidence-based research, CGHR was created to conduct large-scale epidemiological studies in developing countries. CGHR’s mission is to lead high-quality public health research that advances global health for all, with particular attention to the world’s poorest populations.

 We are recruiting a skilled and experienced Biostatistician. The successful candidate will work on large-scale epidemiological projects in a team of multidisciplinary scientists, analysts and trainees in our Toronto office as well as with partners in international collaborative efforts. This is a 12-month contract position, renewable subject to performance.

 JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
 The successful candidate will be responsible for the statistical analysis for research projects, create data visualizations and tables, and be responsible for writing methods and results sections of manuscripts for submission to peer-reviewed scientific journals. Working with the data management and IT teams, the Biostatistician will also have a role in organizing and maintaining CGHR's data holdings. They will provide statistical expertise in the design, analysis, and reporting of research projects and consultative assistance for ad hoc requests. The successful candidate will be expected to take ownership of projects and serve multiple research roles as needed. They will collaborate in the preparation of manuscripts, reports, presentations, and grant applications, and maintain excellent documentation of data management and statistical analysis processes.

 QUALIFICATIONS:

 Minimum masters-level degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, or a related discipline
 Expert computing skills in R for advanced statistical analysis
 2+ years experience in applied epidemiological research, study design, cleaning and organization of datasets, and data analysis
 Strong proficiency in preparation and linking of large datasets (country level cohort studies, national surveys, censuses, etc.)
 Knowledge of relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.)
 Demonstrated ability to be self-motivated and do independent work
 Demonstrated ability to learn new skills and to adapt quickly to changing requirements
 Strong problem solving skills, with ability to derive innovative solutions
 Strong interpersonal skills
 Excellent oral and writing skills; Excellent attention to detail
 Experience in global health research and proficiency in languages other than English are assets
 Interest in health issues of developing countries is required



 As a condition of employment, all external hires will be required to submit proof of COVID-19 vaccination or documentation unless a valid accommodation under the Ontario Human Rights Code exists. All internal candidates must be in compliance with Unity Health Toronto's COVID-19 Vaccination Policy.

Title: Analyst, ESG Reporting
Description:
THE ROLE
It’s an exciting time to join the Sustainability team at Triovest. In 2014, we launched Triovest’s ESG program and declared our committed to improve our environmental and societal impacts. Since then, we have been expanding on that foundation by improving energy performance, certifying properties under green building programs, and establishing sustainable processes and standards for our upcoming developments.
Join Triovest as an Analyst, ESG Reporting at either our downtown Calgary or Toronto location. As a member of the Sustainability team, you would be responsible for assisting with sustainability reporting and disclosures, including preparation of the annual Environment, Social and Governance Report, compliance with the Ontario Energy and Water Reporting and Benchmarking regulation, and disclosure to the Global Real Estate Sustainability Benchmark (GRESB). You will also be directly involved in driving leading projects including green building certification (LEED, BBEST, WELL, WIREDSCORE, etc.), net-zero water and energy projects, and corporate initiatives and improvements across our building portfolio.
This is a highly visible role that will provide you with the foundations of a successful career in real estate and sustainability. You will have the opportunity to work with a diverse group of internal and industry experts across a variety of property types (retail, industrial and office).
WHY CHOOSE TRIOVEST?
At Triovest, we have clear guiding core values and principles, and we live by them every day in everything we do. When you join us, you will find that collaboration and trust go hand-in-hand, creating genuine relationships with colleagues, leaders, shareholders, and clients.
As we grow and evolve, you can too. There is ample opportunity to build your skills and grow in your career while working on exciting, industry-leading projects. Your potential is limitless.
Here is some of the great benefits that our employees enjoy:
A comprehensive health benefits package, including a health spending account and personal spending account, access to virtual health, and an employee and family assistance program (EFAP)
Personal & sick days
National and local social committees – fun events, webinars and team building activities held throughout the year for employees
Speaker Series to support diversity, equality, and inclusion
Corporate Charity Program – making a positive difference and supporting our communities through paid volunteering days and charity matching
Tuition for training & development
Employee Referral Program – our people are our greatest asset, we’re always looking to grow our teams, and we offer a substantial Employee Referral Program
Discounted membership fees with GoodLife
Cell phone plan discounts with Rogers
WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?
Support the preparation of annual disclosures, including our Environment, Social and Governance Report and GRESB submissions.
Prepare responses to the annual Ontario Energy and Water Reporting & Benchmarking (EWRB) regulation and assist in ENERGY STAR certification of properties.
Assist with the management of building-level energy, water, waste and greenhouse gas (GHG) data and analyze data quality and timeliness.
Support the management of our ESG database and Building Score Cards, including the collection, review, and analysis of sustainability-related data (e.g., energy and water consumption, waste production, GHG emissions, and sustainability-related activities).
Coordinate with service providers, internal teams (e.g., property management, portfolio, etc.), and externally hosted databases (EPL, RYCOME, etc.) to ensure sustainability-related information (e.g., property details, utilities data) is up-to-date and accurate in various systems.
Contribute to drafting sustainability/ESG/impact content and reports for clients, internal and external stakeholders; including engagement with other internal teams (i.e. Operations, Human Resources, Marketing, Finance, etc.).
Support the preparation and submission of green building certification applications (LEED, BBEST, WELL, FITWELL, etc.) and the required annual renewals.
Coordinate with the Property Management team on matters related to implementation of Resilience Assessment, Smart Building Implementation, and green building certifications such as LEED, BBEST, FITWELL, WIREDSCORE and WELL.
Complete company-wide analysis of ESG KPIs and stakeholder engagement.
Support the development of the Triovest’s ESG policies, guidelines and best practices as well as ESG/Risk Management information system.
Support Triovest’s internal target-setting initiative(s) and the development and execution of programs related to climate change risk management (i.e., net-zero, resiliency).
Clearly and accurately document and convey key findings, formally and informally, providing necessary supporting facts and analysis, and makes appropriate recommendations.
Complete quarterly reporting on ESG.
Contribute to annual business planning and goal setting as it pertains to ESG.
Ability to identify, interpret and document relevant and accurate quantitative and qualitative data to provide well thought-out recommendations and produce insightful reports.
Support and, as directed, lead innovative ESG integration projects to support Triovest’s objectives.
Look for efficiencies in the team’s activities and where appropriate, identify the relevant data sources and technology to streamline team efforts.
Manage and update property database and contact databases and integrate new team initiatives and information updates.
Develop and oversee the production of clear, comprehensive, and detailed deliverables.
WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
We believe success in this role will demonstrate itself through the following attributes and skills:
The ideal candidate is highly organized with a keen eye for detail, strong technical acumen, a high level of business maturity and solid decision-making skills.
The successful person will possess deeply rooted emotional intelligence and be a thoughtful and humble collaborator. As well, they must be self-starter, a strategic thinker and have a service-oriented attitude that will encourage continuous improvement of service and performance.
Strong interpersonal skills with an outstanding level of integrity that will gain the trust and respect of staff and external stakeholders.
Demonstrated organizational skills, and the ability to effectively prioritize in a demanding, high paced environment.
Ability to resolve complex issues and unforeseen obstacles quickly and efficiently.
Desire to take on new challenges and continued professional development.
Self-motivated and able to work independently.
Must be inclusive and supportive of the diversity within the Triovest team.
A strong communicator who can effectively address both small and large groups with empathy, credibility and trust.
Ability to collaborate remotely across geographies and sectors.
To fulfill this role successfully, you should demonstrate the following minimum qualifications:
University degree in sustainability management, engineering, urban planning, business/commerce, finance, or other relevant disciplines with knowledge of the investment, consulting and/or commercial real estate industry.
Minimum 2+ years experience in a sustainability-related field.
Expertise in preparation of BBEST and LEED Certification submissions.
Knowledge of third-party green building rating systems (i.e.: WELL, Fitwel, Passive House, zero building standard or related).
LEED GA, LEED AP, WELL AP accreditation is an asset.
Advanced knowledge of corporate governance, social, and environmental issues, preference for climate change expertise with experience with GRESB. Knowledge of Science-Based Targets, GRI and TCFD is an asset.
High level of competency with Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Office Suite is essential.
Proficient with creating spreadsheets, developing Excel reports and condensing complex data into succinct reports.
Knowledge of private-sector carbon accounting, Scopes I, II and III is an asset.
ESG/sustainability analysis gained in an investment context, or Sustainability experience gained within a corporate or a consulting practice.
Previous design, construction or project management experience on new construction and major renovation/retrofit projects with important sustainability and energy efficiency objects such as LEED, Zero Carbon Building Standard or Passive House is an asset.
ABOUT TRIOVEST
Triovest is a Canadian investment manager and developer of institutional-quality commercial and residential properties. The company offers a full suite of complementary real estate services, including asset management, leasing, property management, sustainability, and risk-mitigation services. Its portfolio of office, industrial, residential, retail, and mixed-use properties is valued at over $12 billion, with $2 billion currently under development. With more than 45 million square feet of real estate assets under management on behalf of individual and institutional investors, Triovest is one of the largest privately-owned commercial real estate companies in Canada.
We believe that the quality of our people directly impacts the quality of our work, therefore we place a high value on attracting and retaining exceptional individuals. Triovest fosters a hands-on approach to value creation for our clients through innovation and collaboration. Learn more about Triovest by visiting our website.
Triovest is an Equal Opportunity Employer
We believe in the power of diversity and we are dedicated to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment at Triovest. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is available upon request during the recruitment and selection process. For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process, please contact eboyack@triovest.com for assistance/support.
Vaccination Policy
Triovest requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. An exemption from this requirement is provided on an exceptional reason, such as medical, creed or religious reasons in accordance with the relevant Human Rights legislation in the province in which you work.
#LI-DNI

Title: Data Analyst (ON)
Description:
Tiger Analytics is looking for experienced Data Analysts to join our fast-growing advanced analytics consulting firm. We are the trusted analytics partner for multiple Fortune 500 companies, enabling them to generate business value from data. Our business value and leadership has been recognized by various market research firms, including Forrester and Gartner. We are looking for top-notch talent as we continue to build the best global analytics consulting team in the world. 
As a Data Analyst at Tiger Analytics, you will apply strong expertise in AI through the use of machine learning, data mining, and information retrieval to design, prototype, and build next generation advanced analytics engines and services. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams and business partners to define the technical problem statement and hypotheses to test. You will have the opportunity to drive current and future strategy by leveraging your analytical skills as you ensure business value and communicate the results.
 Key Responsibilities:
 This requirement is for a Student loans remediation team. This team looks into cases where there have been instances of overcharging to the client, late fee/ additional interest charges, etc. They need to find out the root cause of this and work towards remediation and intervention strategies. The need is for Data Mining skills (SQL proficiency is a must, handling complex queries). In addition, organizational, communication, documentation, and problem-solving skills are good to have.
 Requirements

Work with remediation analysts and business partners to review eprob, population file, or any relevant documents provided by triage team to understand the issue and harm caused to the impacted consumers.
Work with the team to review SQL queries provided by triage or BT, and write challenger queries to validate the impacted population of the issue. Present to the management team and seek approval on the population.
Make recommendations and seek approval from management on the remediation category. Review and write challenger queries to validate the input data provided by BT and ensure accuracy of the redress amount calculation.
Prepare the remediation file and submit it for redress execution. Validate and audit the output to make sure redress is executed as intended.
Provide data support for the remediation analysts for proper documentation within eprob, data requests from internal audits, etc.
Develop and automate reports on redress for leadership and regulatory update if needed.
Build out standardized templates for data pull and redress calculation where applicable. Recommend improvement to work processes to increase efficiency while maintaining the quality of work.




Skills/Education

SQL expertise (including complex joins, grouping aggregation, nested subqueries, and cursors)
Strong critical thinking skills, with proven ability to; 1) think creatively about how to solve problems with data, and 2) troubleshoot quality issues
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, applied mathematics, engineering) Master's degree preferred
Minimum of 3 years of relevant work experience, five years of experience preferred (avg. incumbent has seven years of exp.)

Benefits
 Significant career development opportunities exist as the company grows. The position offers a unique opportunity to be part of a small, fast-growing, challenging and entrepreneurial environment, with a high degree of individual responsibility.

Title: Inventory Replenishment Analyst
Description:
Company Description
At Farm Boy, it is our mission to create a fun, fresh experience for all! Whether you are a team member or a customer, Farm Boy is passionate about creating a unique fresh food shopping experience and ensuring that we deliver on our commitments.
As we continue to grow within Ontario, Farm Boy is excited to welcome new team members that share our passion for providing the best fresh shopping experience!

Job Description
This position is responsible for managing all aspects of inventory control for assigned departments with the purpose of achieving Farm Boy’s vision, maximizing sales and profitability and enabling the strategic growth of the company. The performance of the duties must ensure a quality service approach to all employees, customers and suppliers. All responsibilities must be performed in a manner consistent with the Farm Boy Way.
Major Responsibilities:
Inventory Management
Determine proper levels of inventory by SKU for the purpose of maximizing fill rates, shelf-life availability and product freshness resulting in increased Inventory Turns.
Facilitate clear communications through supply chain (Supplier - Farm Boy Procurement, Distribution Centre, Accounting and Retail) in an effort to expedite accurate transmission of information and product.
Strive to meet and or exceed the fill rate and freshness objectives of Farm Boy Procurement on a consistent basis.
Maintain acute awareness of various influences on product inventory such as but not limited to - feature planning, instore planning, store openings, seasonal changes, consumer trend influences.
Maintain accurate current and historical data enabling effective decision making in regards to inventory control.
Supply Logistics
Liaise with external suppliers, internal departments as well as Store and Department Managers on all issues relating to the ordering process.
Follow up with Category Managers on issues relating to short shipments, out-of-stocks, etc. and communicate to all parties concerned.
Effective and timely communications on all supply related issues such as but not limited to: supplier shortages, damages, late deliveries, product recalls.
Coordinate, analyze and challenge suppliers regarding in-bound receiving, with particular attention to minimum order quota and lead time requirements.
Facilitate timely and orderly delivery of product to maximize distribution center efficiencies.
Quality Assurance
Understand product specifications as determined by Product Development / Category Management for the intention of ensuring a high level of product integrity on a consistent basis.
Ensuring proper rotation and flow through of inventory in an effort to optimize product quality at all times
Effectively communicate Farm Boy Procurement Policies for product specifications in an effort to avoid disruptions to supply chain management.
Internal Controls
Strict adherence to all Farm Boy policies and procedures as they pertain to replenishment in an effort to minimize issues created through both internal and external areas of supply chain.
Develop a thorough understanding of I.T. systems developed to facilitate replenishment responsibilities.
Develop awareness of potential shortfalls in I.T replenishment systems for communication to developers.
Miscellaneous
May be requested to undertake other related duties on a periodic basis (i.e., new store procurement set-up).

Qualifications

Typically requires completion of a post-secondary office administration program plus 2 to 3 years of experience in an office setting with administrative responsibilities or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
A passion for food retailing and people.
Solid retail experience.
Sound knowledge of business practices.
Good knowledge of retail industry and food products.
Superior standards of quality.
Ability to work with minimum supervision and interact with employees on all levels.
Good judgement and decision-making abilities.
Excellent analytical skills.
Experience working with various computer software programs (i.e Microsoft Suite).
Clear and effective communication style, both written and oral.
Impeccable organizational skills with keen attention to detail.
Skilled at working in a fast-paced environment while maintaining priorities and a high level of performance.
¨Fluency in English and French shall be considered an asset.
Work & Sensory Environment
Providing service to several people or departments, working under many simultaneous deadlines.
Exposure to eye strain from computer terminals.
Exposure to periodic and various temperature environments.
Additional Information
Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and employees with disabilities.

Title: Sr. Consultant - Business System Analyst
Description:
Nous bâtissons une banque axée sur les relations pour un monde moderne. Nous recrutons des professionnels talentueux et passionnés qui ont à cœur de faire ce qu’il faut pour nos clients.
À la Banque CIBC, nous misons sur vos forces et vos ambitions pour vous donner le pouvoir d’agir. Les membres de notre équipe disposent de ce dont ils ont besoin pour apporter une contribution significative et être valorisés, à la fois pour ce qu’ils sont et ce qu’ils font.
Description d'emploi
What you'll be doing
You’ll be joining CIBC’s Technology Team. You’ll lead complex projects to design strategic solutions aligned to CIBC’s enterprise architecture roadmap. As a Sr. Business Systems Consultant (BSC), you’ll support end-to-end project implementation and act as a subject matter expert in both business and technology. You’ll ideate and collaborate with a diverse team to create and set up flexible, innovative solutions that deliver a best-in-class client experience.
How you'll succeed
Understanding and documenting requirements - Work closely with business partners to gather complicated business requirements and facilitate solution design discussions to ensure you meet project needs. Create strong relationships, lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements.
Solution design - Assemble client-focused solutions that meet business requirements. Prepare and validate solution design documents around areas such as scope clarification, solution requirements, and quality assurance.
Leading and mentoring – Support end-to-end project implementation as a subject matter expert, and provide guidance to a diverse team of technology and project professionals. Maintain a collaborative work environment and support team members to resolve organizational, operational, and process problems.
Who you are
You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.
You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You communicate detailed information in a meaningful way.
You're inspired by collective success. You know that teamwork can transform a good idea into a great one. You know that an inclusive team that enjoys working together can bring a vision to life.
Your influence makes a difference. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by sharing your expertise.
You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science, Business, and/or a related field, and you’ve spent at least 3 years in a BSC role leading projects and designing solutions. It’s an asset if you have experience with Agile methodologies, and Application and/or Architecture Development.
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.
What CIBC offers
At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program
Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients
We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development
Ce que vous devez savoir
La Banque CIBC s’est engagée à créer un milieu de travail intégrateur où tous les membres de l’équipe et les clients se sentent à leur place. Nous recherchons des candidats dotés d’un large éventail de compétences et offrons une expérience accessible aux candidats. Si vous avez besoin d’une solution d’adaptation, écrivez à Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com.
Vous devez être légalement admissible à travailler au Canada dans les lieux précisés ci-dessus et, s’il y a lieu, détenir un permis de travail ou d’études valide.
À la Banque CIBC, nous nous engageons à protéger notre équipe, nos clients et les collectivités que nous servons. Il est important pour nous d’avoir un milieu de travail sûr et sain et de fournir notre part d’efforts pour traverser cette pandémie. Dans le cadre de cet engagement, nous exigeons comme condition d’emploi que tous les candidats retenus soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 au moment de leur entrée en poste. Dans le cas contraire, ils devront présenter une preuve écrite d’exemption médicale ou une demande d’adaptation justifiée en vertu des lois sur les droits de la personne applicables.
Lieu de travail
Toronto-200 King St. W., 7th
Type d’emploi
Permanent
Heures de travail hebdomadaires
0
Compétences

Title: Analyst
Description:
Analyst
Yazaki is a global leader in the research, development and delivery of vehicle power and data solutions.

Yazaki works with virtually every major auto manufacturer in the world, and we've strived to maintain strategic and stable growth throughout our 83-year history. Today, we're on the lookout for energetic people with the potential to perform, as well as the ability to strengthen - and thrive in - the positive work environment we pride ourselves on.

Location: Kitchener, ON, USA


POSITION SUMMARY

Responsible for viewing, compiling and analyzing customer releases, creating shipping orders, making adjustments as necessary and sending ASN’s. Responsible for maintaining customer web based applications and completing customer and departmental documentation as required. Requires daily interaction and communication with external OEM and PIA customers as well as internal business unit customers and functional groups

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Accesses Customer systems to collect and analyze daily shipping requirements
Reconciles shipment accums and related discrepancies (DMR, RDR, RMO)
Creates orders in Future 3
Sends ASN’s
Monitors ASN’s for errors and accuracy
Monitors daily and monthly customer delivery ratings (reporting to core group as designated) and dispute as necessary
Ensures Customers specific requirements such as labeling, packaging, routing, window times, and EDI specs are communicated, complied with, and current
Direct contact and communication with external customers
Direct contact and communication with internal customers and functional groups
Prepares and submits corrective actions required internally or by external customers such as 8D’s, 7D’s, PRR, etc.
Completes and submits of all internal /external customer and departmental documentation for single and or multiple locations
Reports shipment and delivery activity as required by the internal / external customer or management
Provides training on specific department and Customer systems, processes and procedures
Communicates regularly with individuals inside and outside of department
Reads and analyzes spreadsheets and EDI releases
Identifies root cause of failures in department processes, procedures, and systems
Assists in the promotion of an orderly workflow
Provides help, guidance and training in established processes, procedures, and systems
Accepts additional responsibilities in the absence of the department Team Lead or Supervisor
Assists management in meeting corporate and departmental goals and objectives
Supports corporate policies and departmental policies
Supports EMS/QMS policies and procedures
Supports health and safety policies
Associate must be able to relate to other people beyond giving and receiving instructions
Experience in the following systems:
Future 3
JDE
PkMS
Microsoft Office applications
Ford DDL
Covisint
DC Smart
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Degree Requirements:
Associates degree preferred but not required

Certification Requirements:
N/A

Previous Experience:
A minimum of 3 years in material planning, scheduling, and or data analysis

Travel Requirements:
As required

On Call Requirements:
24/7

Physical Requirements:
Ability to lift up to 30 lbs.

Yazaki North America is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons regardless of race, color, religion, sex, age, marital status, national origin, disability, handicap, veteran status, or other legally protected status or characteristic. Equal opportunity extends to all aspects of the employment relationship. Yazaki North America complies with federal and state equal employment opportunity laws and strives to keep the workplace free from all forms of harassment.

Title: Security Data Analyst
Description:
Job Functions:
Conduct analysis on trends, patterns to proactively raise concern and suggest mitigation strategies
Review, improve and develop reports to support the work of the Branch Units and top tier clientele needs.
Develop, test, and implement solutions to meet business requirements approved by Director of Operations.
Clearly convey the key insights the data reveals in a visual format that is grouped, summarized, or formatted to be easily understood and actionable
Interact with clients, analyze business requirements, and recommend solutions that will have a measurable impact on the effectiveness of the security program.
Ensure presentation of information is professional, timely and accurate.
Ensure that imperative specification and support documentation are understood by the reviewers, approvers, and users of the material.
Modernize the branches SharePoint tool to create rich digital experiences using lists, libraries, forms, workflows, and custom apps through continual enhancement and development.
Define and set standards around Content Management within SharePoint including site appearance and page layouts, formatting, styling, color scheme, graphics etc.
Work with all units (SSU, OCU, BSU) to triage, track, communicate, mitigate, and resolve issues.
Job Requirements:
High level of proficiency using Microsoft Excel (Pivot Tables, Visualizations, Formulas)
Experience with statistical analysis
In-depth understanding of relational database structure and principles
Strong interest in data analysis and developing creative solutions to problems
Ability to independently manage complex projects
Able to communicate professionally in a clear and direct manner, both verbal and written
Excellent interpersonal skills
Familiar with Tracktik, Power BI, WinTeam, Jira, and other security reporting programs is an asset
Qualifications:
Post-secondary education in Business, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, or other Analysis related programs is preferred
Security management/supervisor experience considered an asset
