Title: Business Analyst - Supply Chain Planning Support
Description:
Wolseley Canada requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by Health Canada, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.

As the world’s number one distributor of heating, plumbing, industrial, and waterworks supplies, we know that talented people are essential to maintaining our success in the future.
Wolseley Canada provides an environment where employees can take their skills, talents, experience and interests to the next level to grow professionally and build rewarding careers.
Wolseley Canada offers many challenging and diverse career opportunities in our local branch networks and throughout our Regional and Corporate offices across Canada.
We are driven to achieve results, collaborate with each other to determine the best course of action, hold ourselves accountable at all times and demonstrate resilience when new challenges come our way.
Does this sound like you? Do you want to make a difference and grow your career? If so, then come join our talented and high performing team.
Business Analyst, Supply Chain Planning Support
What’s in it for you?Full health care benefits starting day one.Career development and training opportunitiesComprehensive benefits with premiums fully paid for by the company for the “Core” package.Life insurance, disability and wellness programsRetirement savings programs including RRSP and DC pension with up to 5.25% employer contributionPaid vacation and sick time and day off on your birthday!Bonus programs that include annual performance and profit sharingEmployee discounts on top brands of plumbing and HVAC/R productsEducation reimbursement for employeesEmployee referral programSafety shoe reimbursement
What will you do:
Support data development efforts within Supply Chain; collaborates on special projects to support processes and operations through effective use of technology and standard operating procedures.
Utilize database processes to pull, track and distribute improved data for Weekly Maintenance Tools. Must keep this process on schedule.
Perform Stock Maintenance uploads directly into divisions to support Replenishment and Demand Planning
Support data quality and logic of internal optimization tools as these tools roll-out.
Responds to internal inquiries for information, creates reports to support quality data output and to provide management information, generates Supply Chain reports as well as ad-hoc pricing analysis when needed.
Complete the daily out of stock review, identifying trends and inventory depth opportunities that could result in out of stocks.
Promotional forecasting – Analyze inventory and sales data (where required) to support proposed promo position and evaluate impact on current and future inventory levels to determine the best way to support customers.
Execute department and SKU level plans to drive availability i.e., Core
Evaluate minimum presentation/ Bin fill quantities, stock balancing, and inventory variances at store and make required changes and/or recommendations as required.
Target Competencies:
Drive for Results: Sets plans and prioritizes, working with others to ensure that they understand their assignments and performance expectations. Measures progress towards goals and quickly redirects efforts as needed. Analyzes job duties to determine wasteful practices that could be improved.
Strategic Approach: Takes a long-term view of organizational success; Works to clarify long term organizational goals; Able to stand back from immediate problems to focus on overarching themes; Solution oriented.
What will you bring:
2-3 years prior experience in a Supply Chain role is preferred.
Experience with business intelligence/decision support software
Experience in AS400 and Slim4 software
Successful completion of post-secondary education, with a focus on retail management, inventory or supply chain is an asset.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite (specifically Excel, Outlook, Access, Word, PowerPoint, Power BI), SQL and VBA.
Big Data Analytics - Ability to provide insights, and/or predict opportunities proactively by extracting information from the data lake
Ability to manage multiple priorities and to manage their time effectively with changing priorities.
Passionate
Problem solver

Title: Analyst, Private Equity Business Management
Description:
Company Description
Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization
When you invest your career in CPP Investments, you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $500 billion, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to reach $3 trillion by 2050. CPP Investments invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney.
CPP Investments attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:
Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment
Accelerated exposure and responsibility
Global career development opportunities
Being motivated every day by CPP Investments’ important social purpose and unshakable principles
A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance
If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPP Investments.

Job Description
The Private Equity (PE) department is responsible for all of CPP Investments’ private equity investments globally. By investing in funds, secondaries, and directly in private equity, we seek opportunities to build a global, diversified portfolio that will outperform comparable passive public alternatives over the long term. The Private Equity Business Management group leads business management activities that support the operations of PE in an efficient and effective manner.
We are recruiting an Analyst, Business Management within the PE department, reporting to the Managing Director of Business Management Private Equity. The role will support key processes and deliverables related to the investment process, technology systems and data, governance and compliance, internal and external communications, departmental procedures and business continuity, with a focus on private equity investments.
The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical and business writing skills, investment knowledge, innovative thinking and is an enthusiastic problem solver. In this role, it is critical to be able to multitask and work well under pressure, learn systems and processes, possess a strong attention to detail and an ability to collaborate effectively across multiple stakeholders and departments. The successful candidate will be self-starter and active listener, who asks questions to attain clarity and can develop concise communication to be shared both internally and externally.
Role- Specific Accountabilities
Investment Committee Support & Portfolio Analytics:
Support internal investment committee processes and investment-approval related activities
Act as back up investment committee secretary if required
Execute ad-hoc analysis & reporting to support business management and investment decisions
Understand various platforms and business intelligence tools to retrieve data as well as guide/train investment professionals to become self-serve
Assist in the preparation of management reports and presentations
Business Management / Operations:
Power user for specific high use systems able to answer PE deal team questions, coordinate data requests, visualize and create dashboards and reports and seek areas of improvement and efficiency
Act as Data Steward for PE’s systems ensuring high standards for data quality, working with external parties as required
Provide testing support for new departmental systems and tools as required
Coordinate departmental deal pipeline data requirements for PE
Contribute to the on-going effort to expand department-wide knowledge sharing and collaboration including efficient access to data used by the investment teams
Update and maintain department policies and procedures, and handle related inquiries
Manage communication updates for external and internal websites, pitchbooks, etc.
Manage the due diligence closing file process, other document management processes and information requests
Support Enterprise-wide change initiatives E.g. Workplace Technology, Facilities and Office Services and Enterprise Risk
Support internal audit requests for the PE department
Represent PE on the Business Continuity Management team and maintain PE’s Impact Plan
Other relevant duties and projects as assigned

Qualifications

Undergraduate or graduate degree in a relevant discipline such as Finance, Commerce, Accounting, Engineering or Economics
2-3 years of finance and /or investment related experience; Private asset experience is an asset
Solid understanding of the investment industry, in particular knowledge and understanding of operations, and processes is an asset
Highly proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and able to learn new systems and applications quickly
Ability to quickly grasp new concepts and work in a high-performing culture
Highly organized, proven attention to accuracy and detail and an ability to produce high-quality work under pressure and with time-sensitive deadlines
Strong analytical and management reporting skills; ability to solve multi-dimensional problems
Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to build relationships effectively across all levels
Ability to think critically and creatively, apply sound judgement and make solid recommendations
Self-motivated, flexible, and adaptable to changing priorities and new challenges
Proven ability to work independently as well as to perform effectively in a team-oriented environment
Exemplify our Guiding Principles of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance
Additional Information
Visit our LinkedIn Career Page or Follow us on LinkedIn. #LI-LW1
At CPP Investments, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.
We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact candidates selected to advance in the hiring process.
Our Commitment to Inclusion and Diversity:
In addition to being dedicated to building a workforce that reflects diverse talent, we are committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible experience. If you require an accommodation for any part of the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms, etc.), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
Disclaimer:
CPP Investments does not accept resumes from employment placement agencies, head-hunters or recruitment suppliers that are not in a formal contractual arrangement with us. Our recruitment supplier arrangements are restricted to specific hiring needs and do not include this or other web-site job postings. Any resume or other information received from a supplier not approved by CPP Investments to provide resumes to this posting or web-site will be considered unsolicited and will not be considered. CPP Investments will not pay any referral, placement or other fee for the supply of such unsolicited resumes or information.
Mandatory Vaccine Policy
All employees in the Toronto, New York, San Francisco, Mumbai, Sydney, Hong Kong, and Sao Paulo offices will be required to be vaccinated against COVID-19. Accommodations to this policy will be made for medical or other protected grounds. Please contact us to discuss any accommodation needs.

Title: NA
Description: NA

Title: Senior Analyst, DQ & Issue Mgmt. Remediation
Description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Senior Analyst, DQ & Issue Mgmt. Remediation
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
In the increasingly complex world of financial services, accurate and complete data is critical for risk management and regulatory compliance. Ensuring data integrity begins with an understanding of financial services data, data quality controls and identifying and resolving data issues. As a Senior Analyst/Manager, Data Quality Issue Management you will be accountable for driving improvements in Risk and Finance data through the identification, root cause analysis, and management of data issues through to resolution for business critical processes and regulatory reports. Reporting to the Associate Director, you will define and monitor data quality controls and resolve data issues for business partners across the organization including Finance, Group Risk Management, Personal & Commercial Banking, Capital Markets, and Wealth Management.
What will you do?
Data Quality Monitoring:
Monitor data quality control exceptions, conduct detailed investigations, including root cause analysis, and identify and document data issues
Collaborate with business process and report owners, and other users of shared data assets to capture systemic and other self-identified data issues and control gaps
Use standardized and ad hoc reporting to communicate data quality results, trends and insights to business partners and management
Issues Management & Resolution (IMR):
Track and manage data quality and control issues from assignment through to resolution by applying best practices and using the Collibra IMR workflow and Jira project management tools
Collaborate with the Chief Data Office, Data Management Offices, IT and other business functions to facilitate data remediation, adjustments and/or system changes to address the root cause of the data issues
Provide monthly summary and detailed reporting on resolved and outstanding issues, finding and recommendations to business partners and key stakeholders.
Continuous Improvement:
Propose process changes/improvement to address identified gaps or inconsistencies in data, processes and/or controls
Gain and apply an in-depth understanding of data quality controls, data profiling tools and systems to support the definition and implementation of effective controls and reporting
Work with the Chief Data Office and other Data Management Offices to support standards and best practices to improve data quality, participating in initiatives to raise awareness and drive improved data quality across the organization (e.g. Data Working Groups, Data Literacy projects)
[1] Collibra is RBC’s master data management platform and includes Issues Management & Resolution (IMR) work flow and reporting capability.
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have:
 3+ years of relevant experience with data quality principles, data control design, data management and data analysis
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of data analysis methods and the ability to analyze and resolve complex data related issues.
2+ years of experience conducting root cause analysis, using tools/frameworks such as SQL, Excel, Python, Hive.
Education in a numerical discipline, IT, business or equivalent work experience.
Excellent communication skills, verbal and written.
Proficiency in preparation of reports and presentations.
Nice-to-have:
General understanding of financial reporting, finance and risk business concepts and procedures
Experience working with financial services and systems including finance and/or credit risk data
Experience using Collibra or a similar data management or workflow platform
Ability to manage multiple competing priorities during busy periods
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work
Job Summary
Identifies and collects data sources, analyzes and extracts key data and information, evaluates and monitors data quality to meet the organization's information system needs and requirements. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.

Title: Senior Technical Business Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 148866

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
The Team
Non-Retail Risk Systems provides the project, change, & development management and services of non-retail enterprise risk systems to support the Global Risk Management (GRM) business lines.
The Role
Reporting to the Senior Manager Development, the Sr. Technical Business Analyst will be involved in all phases of the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC), including feasibility studies, research, analysis, elicit, define, assess and document detailed business and system design requirements (functional, operational, transitional, information & non-functional) for new systems & systems enhancements and identify any gaps within current capability. To join our team, the incumbent must be proactive and dynamic, demonstrate initiative, have an eagerness to learn, be adaptable to a high-paced environment, and thrive on challenge.
Some of the Key Accountabilities include:
Elicit, define, assess and document detailed business and system design requirements (functional, operational, transitional, information & non-functional) for new systems & systems enhancements and identify any gaps within current capability.
Identify complex process and systems solutions to address major system needs.
Performs analysis and evaluation of options, alternatives, and system capabilities.
Provide strong subject matter expertise across multiple functional areas and across functional process flows or functional and cross functional teams.
Understand complex system integrations including source and target systems and how they relate to each other and perform data analysis.
Assist with managing projects and coordinate work with Stakeholders and Project Teams and provide post rollout support for system enhancements.
Coordinate timing for development and testing if the change involves multi-systems to meet deployment date, provide support for developers and testers during the sprints and preparing release notes
Participating and supporting the Intake process
Perform CDE analysis, create reports and communicate to business partners
Ability to handle multiple projects and activities in a timely, organized manner.
Independently resolve complex, multi-faceted problems to meet the business needs.
Ability to facilitate meetings, action plans and audit reports.
What You Will Bring to Succeed
Proficiency in Business Analysis procedures and requirements, as well as technical analysis and design requirements.
Highly experienced in writing business requirements for system development.
Experience in data analysis and data modeling (Conceptual and/or Logical and/or Physical) and the ability to grasp a customized repository (as defined by a relational or dimensional database) approach.
Knowledge of enterprise applications and enterprise analysis.
Strong SQL knowledge and skilled and experienced in working with relational database structures MS SQL Server.
Experience working in a project environment and SDLC methodologies.
Knowledge of Credit and Risk applications preferred.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Creative problem solver, flexible, proactive and able to work in a fast paced, ever- changing environment.
Nice to have skills:
4-7 years of demonstrated experience in business and functional requirements elicitation, translation and documentation in insurance, financial services or technology, with demonstrated data analysis abilities.
Experience working with big data platforms (Hadoop, etc.)
Experience working in Agile environment
Financial and Credit Risk / Loss experience
The Workplace
We are technology partners who help the business transform how our employees around the world work
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
We foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning
We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results
We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation
Scotiabank
As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.
Is this Role not the Exact fit?
Sign up to stay in touch; we’ll let you know when we have new positions on the team.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Working at Vancity you’ll be a part of a values led organization on a mission to change our world for the better. You’ll also be joining an organization that puts people first and is continually looking for ways to promote our employee’s well-being. This shows up in many ways, including:

Generous vacation days (starting at 4 weeks).
A defined benefit pension (you may have to ask around what they are as they are pretty uncommon these days) with generous employer contributions.
Up to $2,400 towards self directed professional development each year
Flexible work schedules available.

The ITS Solutions team seek to understand the problems of our members and staff and find the right technical solution to remove the points of friction. We are excited to hire a Business Analyst to support us in delivering solutions that will power Vancity’s mission to be a financial force for change.
 The Role:
 The Business Analyst will work alongside the ITS Solutions team to:

Be the “voice of the member”, within the team and within projects, in recommending options that drive improved user experience.
Conduct business analytics to define the “to-be” business processes that align with complex multi-vendor-based technology platforms
Identify, deﬁne and document technical, functional and system requirements through consultation with internal stakeholders.
Participate in user acceptance testing to ensure high quality deliverables that meet stakeholder expectations.
Actively contribute to project/program/product deliverables and support the execution of design, build, test, training and roll out.

 You Are:

Curious – ask questions, challenge assumptions, and discover new insights
Creative – we encourage you to think about how you might share information in new and creative ways
Comfortable with ambiguity – we are focused on continuous improvement and always seeking ways to work more effectively and efficiently
Solutions oriented – you have a growth mindset and approach new and challenging situations with a “how might we” attitude
Excited to learn

You Have:

3-5 years’ experience in information technology, preferably in working on information security or infrastructure related projects
Bachelor’s degree in Technology, Business, or a related field
Razor-sharp attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communications
A good grasp of the Software Development Life Cycle
Willingness to work in a highly flexible environment with multiple competing priorities
Have worked on performing systems analysis

Bonus points if you have:

Experience working with data visualization tools, like PowerBi, and development planning tools, like Azure DevOps
Programming experience
Documented technical architecture designs

The team: 
In this role, you will report into Manager, Everyday Banking & Investing, ITS Solutions
 Posting Deadline: Please apply by 4:00 PM PST, April 26, 2022.
 Please note that all shortlisted candidates for this role will be required to complete a background check which includes resume verification, credit check, criminal record check, and proof of full COVID-19 vaccination status. Exemptions requested under Human Rights law will be addressed through Vancity’s accommodations processes.
 About Vancity:

When you join Vancity as an employee and a member, you join a movement that believes that when we use money for what’s right, we truly are a financial force for change.
Our vision is to redefine wealth—and we are doing so by using the tools of finance to prioritize the wellbeing of our members and our communities by tackling the climate crisis and we are proving every day that sustainable is profitable.
We are the largest private-sector Living Wage Employer in Canada and have been consistently recognized as one of the Top Employers in Canada. Come join our team of 2,600 diverse individuals and access competitive rewards & benefits, all while knowing you are apart of a greater movement.
Start your Vancity career journey with us even if you’re new to financial services! We provide in-house paid training to gain general financial knowledge, and to learn about our products & services. We encourage opportunities to learn & develop to prepare you for career success, which in turn continuously impresses how we serve our membership.
Vancity is committed to a diverse workplace and values Integrity, Innovation, Responsibility and Reconciliation.
To learn more about Vancity, please visit www.vancity.com/AboutVancity.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Come join us and help make a difference in the lives of older adults! As employees at a Verve Senior Living Retirement Residence, our primary goal is to help each person, have a great day, every day! Our employees thrive on collaboration and have a passion for excellence, achieving multiple awards including the Order of Excellence in Quality, from Excellence Canada. As part of our team, the things you do are key to helping us achieve our shared vision of helping seniors live longer, better. Oh, and you’ll also have a lot of fun doing it. Want to join us?


ACCOUNTABILITY OBJECTIVE

The Financial Analyst will be responsible for supporting and streamlining the company’s corporate financial analysis process, which includes the monthly reporting analysis, the budgeting and forecasting process and other financial analysis. Other responsibilities will include assisting in preparation of management reporting, supporting new finance program rollouts to residences and other ad hoc requests as needed. A component of this role will also include systems-related roles and responsibilities including daily on-going systems activities and systems implementation analysis and support.


Strong interpersonal skills and communication skills are a must as this role will work closely with the Finance team, executives at the Corporate Office and management teams at the residences. The ability to work efficiently on both teams and independently is required.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


Financial Analysis, including budgeting and forecasting (65% of the time)

Possess financial reporting and analysis skills for business partnering
Insightfully analyze and interpret financial results and create scenarios
Able to create reports (including templates for reports)
Utilize financial reporting systems to enhance management reporting through developing reports in Sage 300, Oracle or other reporting tools
Good to have: hands on experience with Oracle and Sage 300 as much of the analysis will be generated from these systems
Assist in the preparation of management reporting packages and other operating reports
Assist in the preparation of quarterly Board reporting, ad hoc financial risk management analysis and reporting as required
Develop communications and training plans for adoption of new Finance processes and practices for the residences
Assist with training for the teams at the residences, facilitate sharing of best practices and increase financial acumen across the residences
Identify opportunities for process improvements, document them and collaborate with the Finance team to move them forward
Coordinate/assist with the annual budget process for the residences while working with the Controllers and General Mangers (“GMs”)
Support the monthly forecasting process for the residences while working with the Controllers and GM’s including updating templates as required


Systems Analysis (25% of time)

Possess the ability to apply basic systems understanding to various scenarios
Good to have: hands on experience with systems implementation (design, testing, training)
Able to enhance management reporting through developing reports in Sage 300, Oracle EPM Cloud and Smart View for Microsoft Office
Assist with data synchronization and validations
Assist with financial system maintenance and troubleshooting, which may include:
Code and account maintenance
User account and access maintenance
Workflow and approval channel maintenance
Investigate and troubleshoot system errors
Assist with data input

Treasury and Financial Modelling (10% of the time)

Work with the Treasury consultant to maintain and streamline the corporate financial model process
Develop an understanding of the Credit Facility covenants and reporting requirements
Maintain the debt and commitments schedule
Assist in the annual valuation process
Assist with refinancing activities and Credit Facility reporting requirements
Business Support
Other ad hoc Treasury, Financial projects and associated matters as required


Qualifications and Competencies

University degree with at least two years business or financial experience
Prefer candidates that have or are in the process of obtaining a finance designation
Strong computer skills including MS Office and highly-proficient in MS Excel and PowerPoint
Strong acumen in cash flow reporting and financial analysis
Strong mathematical skills and aptitude
Experience working with operations is an asset
Detail oriented, results focused and self-motivated
Effectively handles pressure and competing priorities
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Excellent organizational skills and ability to meet tight deadlines
Unfailing integrity and respect for confidentiality
Some travel may be required


General

Complies with the Occupational Health and Safety Act, Workplace Safety and Insurance Act, and Workplace Hazardous Material Information System. This includes recognizing health and safety hazards, reporting incidents, fulfilling responsibilities under the applicable legislation, as well as participating in in-services and fire drills.
Complies with all corporate policies and procedures.

Completes all required mandatory training/education

Verve Senior Living is an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. We are dedicated to building a team that reflects the diversity of the residents and communities in which we live and serve. If you require accommodation for any portion of the recruitment and hiring process, please let us know.


All offers of employment are subject to a Criminal Background Check. We thank all who apply; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted.

Title: Analyst , Process Engineering 1
Description:
Job Requisition Id: 154821
Business Function: Engineering
Primary City: Halifax
Other Location(s):
Province: Nova Scotia
Employment Type: Full-Time
Employment Status: Term (2 year Term)
Language Requirement: English Essential
Employee Class and Level: UPCET02
Number of Vacancies: 1
Job Closing Date (MM/DD/YYYY):04/29/2022
Health and safety is our highest priority. With vaccination shown to be the most effective tool to reduce the risk of transmission of COVID-19 and protecting individuals from severe consequences of this virus, Canada Post has implemented a Vaccination Practice. Accordingly, you will be required to attest to being fully vaccinated. If you are unable to be vaccinated, you may request an accommodation due to a medical, religious, or other prohibited ground of discrimination as described in the Canadian Human Rights Act.
Job Description
The Analyst Process Engineer applies professional and technical engineering expertise in the delivery of value stream improvements, operational performance (cost, quality, time) and resource optimization (equipment, people, money) initiatives. Leads or partners in the analysis, development and deployment of regional and local projects and/or is accountable for specified deliverables in national and cross-functional projects. Ensures the correct application of engineering principles to continuous improvement projects, and that solutions are designed in accordance with the Engineering Design Process. Guides the technical work of first level process engineering team members.
Job Responsibilities
Below are the main job requirements and responsibilities for the Analyst, Process Engineering:
Provides broad experience and sound technical, business and problem analysis to improve operational performance of value streams and shared business processes. Demonstrates expertise, innovative thinking and initiative in the analysis, planning and deployment of projects approved by Operations regionally or nationally.
Provides work methods design expertise to value stream improvement teams at the process or task level to promote efficiency, productivity and safety; evaluates flow constraints within the value stream to increase productivity, or reduce cost and lead time.
Supports and/or leads project teams within the Region. Provides regional and local engineering expertise in national engineering projects and deploys national projects regionally and locally. Applies professional project management skills ensuring that all approved projects are delivered on-time and on-budget; tracks and reports regularly to senior management and project sponsors on project status and benefits. Integrates change management into all project plans, ensuring that all stakeholder needs are identified, that proper communication occurs and that operational staff is educated or trained in new methods or process requirements.
Applies thorough knowledge and experience with the principles of Lean, Six Sigma and Process Management as the foundation of the Engineering Design Process, in problem solving and continuous improvement activities and documents solutions in accordance with these principles. Applies Project Management methods and tools within the Engineering Design Process to all assigned projects. Continues to develop professional and technical knowledge and skills and promotes continuous improvement.
Develops Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) for all business processes and value streams and ensures that SOPs are documented in accordance with national configuration control standards.
Job Responsibilities (continued)
Oversees the collection of data required for various projects and conducts studies or analyses using this data. Develops computer applications to expedite activities and maintains program documentation.
Uses proven simulation and project management tools in the analysis of business solutions and provides comprehensive reports and recommendations. Provides engineering expertise in the use of proper technology to assess space requirements, work methods and health and safety solutions.
Uses proven financial evaluation methods and data-based engineering analyses to properly evaluate project feasibility, risks and benefits; participates in cost reduction efforts by analyzing proposals to determine viability, operations impact and return on investment.
Analyzes and recommends changes to the work environment to improve employee comfort and performance (lighting, noise, cleanliness); recommends changes to the form, fit or function of tools and equipment used by employees at their workstations to make the work easier from a human factors perspective.
Consults, informs and works with local or regional union representatives as guided by regional Labour Relations to ensure open and transparent communication on projects that are approved for implementation. Represents the project team or engineering group in meetings with various stakeholders.
Qualifications
Education
A University Degree in Engineering
Designation and or certifications:
Must be eligible for registration as a Professional Engineer in the province of employment
Experience
2-5 years of related work experience is required.
Other Candidate Requirements
Thorough knowledge of Lean, Six Sigma and Process Management.
Above average skills with Microsoft suite of tools such as Excel, Word, and PowerPoint,
Working knowledge of query languages such as MS Access and SQL Server.
Familiarity with working in a union environment.
Ability to influence others and negotiate successfully, communicate ideas and generate consensus.
Excellent professional presentation and verbal communication skills.
Skilled at identifying customer needs and designing business processes and solutions to meet customer requirements.
Demonstrates innovative thinking and initiative in the analysis, planning and development of projects.
Other Information
Knowledge
Proven ability to apply Lean thinking to both operational and management value streams
Proven ability to develop Process management systems
Quality methods and basic statistics including variation (Six Sigma tools)
Measurement system design (outcome and process metrics)
Standardization of processes include definition of roles and responsibilities
Basic ergonomics of work and work design
Intermediate Project management and project planning
Systems/process design
Data analysis methods and model building
Database development
Business engineering economics and evaluation of returns on investment
Testing and sampling methodologies
Process and value stream mapping
Skills and Abilities:
Professional presentation and oral communication skills
Process design for capability
Analyze data
Work methods measurement
Prepare cost/ benefit analysis
Develop databases, queries, macros and analysis tools
Test developed designs
Identify technology solutions to meet customer needs
Write technical and business documents
Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical personnel
Manage time and resources to meet required deadlines
Safety Sensitive Positions
This position may be considered a Safety Sensitive position.
Employment Equity
Canada Post will represent Canada’s diversity and provide a safe and welcoming workplace that embraces and celebrates our differences.
We are committed to employment equity and encourage applications from women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities and visible minorities.
Conflict of Interest
The Conflict of Interest Policy prohibits employees from hiring, supervising or reporting to, directly or indirectly via the reporting hierarchy, their immediate family or close personal relations. Should you feel that you may be in an actual or potential Conflict of Interest in regard to this job opportunity, you must communicate with the designated Human Resources representative.
Accommodation
Canada Post is committed to providing an inclusive and barrier-free work environment, starting with the hiring process. If you are contacted by Canada Post regarding a job opportunity, please advise if you have any restrictions that need to be accommodated. All information received in relation to accommodation will be kept confidential.
Important Message
Your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the requirements as Canada Post cannot make assumptions about your education and experience. We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
Leadership Behaviours
Decision Making – A champion of the organization who takes calculated risks and makes prudent, common sense decisions about current issues, future opportunities and resource requirements in a timely, well thought out manner, that aligns with the corporation's best interests.
Accountability – An individual who strives for performance excellence and who holds him/herself and direct reports accountable for decisions and actions and for learning from mistakes when intended results are not achieved.
Business Orientation – A proactive individual who understands the competitive nature of the business, and is committed to sustaining the business through excellent customer service and new business opportunities.
Execution – A focused and self-motivated individual who acts with a sense of urgency and delivers on time and within budget, by dealing effectively with challenges and ambiguous situations.
Leading People – A compelling communicator and leader who engages, motivates and inspires others to achieve results and who encourages personal growth and finding better ways of doing things.
Our Values
We value diversity as an essential part of who we are as a company, how we operate and how we see our future. We believe that attracting, developing, and retaining people who reflect the diversity of Canada is essential to our success because this matters to all communities and customers we serve.
Canada Post’s corporate values reflect the principles, beliefs and aspirations that guide our behaviour and shape our culture.
Safety – We are committed to a safe and healthy environment for all our stakeholders.
Customer – We serve Canadians with pride and passion.
Respect – We treat each other with fairness and respect.
Integrity – We act responsibly and with integrity.
Transformation – We will innovate and transform to win in the marketplace.

Title: Category Business Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.
To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. The Category Business Analyst position is categorized as a Connector, which means that the incumbent will be working with a variety of colleagues and partners to achieve business outcomes that require a mixed use of virtual and CTC campus presence.
What you’ll do
The Category Business Analyst plays a direct role helping equip Canadians for the jobs and joys of life in Canada, by managing vendor processes, examining new and existing product lines, and performing analysis that better prepares us to meet the evolving needs of our customers.
As a key member of our buying team you will be at the hub of our retail organization. You will support Category Business Managers in creating a compelling and relevant assortment for our stores by providing robust analysis and key insights that strengthen the brand with our customers and that deliver against the category level objectives and financial goals.
Who you are
We are looking for individuals who are:
Creative and courageous, with the ability to manage in an environment of change and ambiguity to help us take bold, strategic moves in this rapidly evolving retail environment
Action oriented, and comfortable taking calculated risks to better serve our customers and business
Outcome focused, critical thinkers with the ability to analyze and visualize, to ensure continuous improvement across our entire business
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward
If you’re curious, ready to take on new challenges and open to doing things differently to help us evolve rapidly, then this is definitely the place to be.
What you bring
You have an undergraduate and/or post graduate degree in Business, Commerce, Retail Management or Data & Analytics with experience in retail in an analytical role, is an asset. New graduates are welcome to apply!
Demonstrated ability to collaborate, influence, and negotiate with colleagues or more senior business members
Strong presentation skills with demonstrated ability to adjust style and format as required to suit the audience
Our best Category Business Analysts are progressive thinkers, with solid experience in retail merchandising/buying, and managing cross-functional partnerships. This group is masterful at project coordination and planning, and have highly accomplished quantitative, problem-solving skills. To be successful in this role, you should have an analytical mindset with a strong understanding of utilizing data in order to create recommendations.
About Canadian Tire Corporation
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn .
CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice.

Alberta-Calgary

What you can expect from us:
Build your career with us.

It is an extraordinary time to be in business. As digital transformation continues to accelerate, CGI is at the center of this change—supporting our clients’ digital journeys and offering our professionals exciting career opportunities.

At CGI, our success comes from the talent and commitment of our professionals. As one team, we share the challenges and rewards that come from growing our company, which reinforces our culture of ownership. All of our professionals benefit from the value we collectively create.

Be part of building one of the largest independent technology and business services firms in the world.

Learn more about CGI at www.cgi.com.

No unsolicited agency referrals please.

CGI is an equal opportunity employer. In addition, CGI is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities in accordance with provincial legislation. Please let us know if you require a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during any aspect of the recruitment process and we will work with you to address your needs.

Title: Data Analyst (Support Operations)
Description:
Data Analyst (Support Operations)

At Skillsoft, we are all about making work matter. We believe every team member has the potential to be AMAZING. We are bold, sharp, driven and most of all, real. Join us in our quest to democratize learning and help individuals unleash their edge.

OVERVIEW:
Support Operations is a group which provides business process support for the SumTotal Customer Support organization with extensive interactions with cross functional operational groups such as Sales, Professional Services and Cloud Operations. The team also provides support and general project management to Senior Management to run key programs & initiatives. The team’s key focus areas are:

Management of CRM developed application systems & ensuring data accuracy for the business

Data Analytics & Reporting (Power BI)

Knowledge on designing and building scalable data models

Build easy to understand data visualizations
Collaborate with key stakeholders to deliver insights based on identified requirements
Monitor and respond to inquiries from internal/external customers across various applications and delivery methods
Own, follow-up and resolve issues with limited day-to-day supervision

We are looking for folks who enjoy automation of business processes and analyzing data to discover and unlock data insights. The specific skill sets are:

(US Eastern Time Hours)

Title: Total Rewards Compensation Analyst
Description:
Great Canadian Gaming is looking for it's next Total Rewards Compensation Analyst to join it's team!


As the Total Rewards Compensation Analyst you will report directly to the Senior Total Rewards Manager and will be responsible for leading the analysis, reconciliation and costing of Great Canadian's compensation programs. In addition, you will serve as a Total Rewards, Payroll and Human Resources HCMS subject matter expert related to compensation programs and will support the ongoing day-to-day functionality of HR Shared Services, by ensuring our Compensation programs align with the Company’s objectives.


Your strong analytical and numerical analysis skills will be used to perform detailed research and data analysis, data consolidation and configuration, job evaluation and competitive market analysis, survey participation and general program coordination.


Working with team members and management and collaborating with site Human Resources and Operations leads, you will support Total Rewards, Payroll and Human Resources activities and initiatives.


As our next Total Rewards Compensation Analyst these will be some of your key accountabilities:

Managing salaried pay plans and benchmarking activities
Managing compression analysis related to minimum wage and market changes and proposing changes to pay structures – this entails analysis of rates, job mapping, costing, communication with stakeholders and change management activities
Managing union pay scale changes – including keeping up to date on collective agreements, reviewing the competitive landscape, costing proposals and coordinating with stakeholders
Performing job evaluation and job analysis and making pay recommendations - ensuring job functions, families and titles are consistent, aligned with the marketplace and support internal organizational structures
Leading the annual compensation survey process, including the submission of data and the analysis and application of results
Conducting analysis and research to ensure compliance with pay equity legislation and regulatory requirements
Updating and maintaining job structures and Position Management in the company’s Human Capital Management System HCMS (branded as CONNECT) along with performing regular audits
Updating and maintaining the company’s benchmarking platform, Payscale Marketpay
Assisting with broad compensation projects as they come up throughout the organization
Developing tools and resources to drive integrated and consistent company-wide compensation processes
Enabling and supporting a variety of initiatives through rigorous assessment of data, trends and program cost/benefit analysis

The right candidate will posses the following education and qualification requirements:

Post-Secondary education in Business, Human Resources or Finance, along with a minimum of 3 years as a practicing Compensation Analyst at the professional level; Certified Compensation Professional (CCP) designation desired
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detail, including experience with modeling and costing
Highly proficient in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint; advanced Excel skills required
Effective verbal, written and presentation skills and ability to present complex ideas to diverse audiences
Must be able to work independently and as part of a diverse team
Self-motivated individual who is able to handle multiple deliverables and priorities, with a focus on continuous process improvements
Ability to work with all levels throughout the organization and maintain highly confidential information
Must be a quick learner when facing new problems and be able to think with a short term and long-term focus
Requires flexibility to work in situations where there is no unique, correct answer and in a dynamic business environment

 If this sounds like a GREAT opportunity for you, we invite you register your interest. If your skills and experience are a match for our position, our professional recruiters will be in contact with you. Thank you for your application and your interest in Great Canadian.


Great Canadian Gaming Corporation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we welcome all qualified applicants to apply to join our team of unique contributors. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an accommodation is required. We thank all applicants for their interest, and will contact those qualified to continue in the recruitment process.

Title: Communications Analyst & Project Coordinator (Project Management), Fall 2022 Student
Description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Communications Analyst & Project Coordinator (Project Management), Fall 2022 Student
Job Description
What will you do?
Provide input into the planning and implementation of operational and strategic programs, and support project management activities.
Develop creative communication and marketing materials in support of the Leap Program, including promotional materials, email communications, newsletters, intranet stories, and informative presentations (may also include producing graphic design materials related to communication activities).
Work with program managers to troubleshoot any emerging issues to ensure smooth program delivery.
Distribute and manage all Leap Program regular communications and contribute to a change initiative to migrate these activities into a new platform tool (Workday Learning)
Design / maintain our intranet sites (using Jive) for the Leap and assessment programs (training can be provided).
Coordinate onboarding sessions for participants and facilitators, working with leaders to ideate, plan, and deliver.
Manage the program mailboxes by responding to, and escalating, inquiries.
Distribute assessments and support internal partner requests related to our Assessments Portfolio of tools.
Support Leap program evaluation by compiling and analyzing data and producing periodic reports for internal distribution and team reporting
What do you need to succeed?
Must have
Currently enrolled at a Canadian post-secondary institution in a Business, Marketing and Communications, or HR program (or equivalent)
Leadership acumen and a passion to apply it in a dynamic business environment
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written)
Creative and analytical thinker who is self-driven and able to work in a fast-paced environment
Proven experience developing ideas using PowerPoint and/or designing web pages in Jive
Ability to conduct data-driven analysis and reporting (e.g. highly proficient in Excel & MS Office).
Nice-to-have
Proven experience in project coordination / management or equivalent experience
Website/Graphic Design or interface design experience
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
Network and build lasting relationships with students from diverse backgrounds from across Canada
Participate in fun events and gamification challenges to help build your career tool kit while enjoying a work-life balance
Leaders who support your development through coaching and learning opportunities.
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive and highly performing team
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Enjoy a comfortable work environment with the option to dress casually

Title: 301-21 - Health Outcomes Analyst (Repost)
Description:
CancerCare Manitoba located in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada is a provincial agency which provides clinical and academic services and leadership for cancer control and the treatment of blood disorders. We invite applications for the position of:

 Health Outcomes Analyst- Repost
Epidemiology and Cancer Registry - MacCharles
Permanent, Full-Time (1.0 EFT)
Competition #: 301-21-715566702

Job Summary:

The Health Outcomes Analyst is vital to projects involving cancer-related data using the Manitoba Cancer Registry and other population health databases. The incumbent ensures the completion of various cancer-related projects including statistical consultation, designing and refining data analysis plans, ensuring the completion of appropriate analyses, and presenting data informatively (via graphs and tables) with clear written interpretation. With these projects, the Department of Epidemiology and Cancer Registry is able to provide statistical analysis and support to help CancerCare Manitoba fulfill its mandate as a Centre of Excellence. Appropriate scientific, logic-based approaches are integral to the HOA’s work; thus training and experience in statistics and research methods are essential.
Qualifications:
Required:
MSc or MPH in Epidemiology, Biostatistics, or other health statistics-oriented field with relevant experience or an MD with post graduate training in epidemiology or biostatistics. Other degrees and working experience in Epidemiology, Biostatistics or another field with an emphasis on the use of statistics in health may be applicable
Experience using SAS for data management and statistical analysis
Strong quantitative analytical skills
Proficient with computer software systems in a windows environment, Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Outlook)
Working familiarity with epidemiological concepts and administrative databases
Ability to prioritize large workload and independently complete a variety of tasks
Excellent communication skills in English both oral and written, interpersonal, and collaborative skills
Capable of carrying out the duties of this position with diplomacy, sound judgement, tact and professionalism in a team environment
Must be able to maintain confidentiality, take initiative, and lead projects from initiation through completion
Satisfactory employment record
Must be legally able to work in Canada

Preferred:
Experience with administrative databases
Ability to speak French

Asset:
Knowledge of other statistical software programs such as STATA, or R
Experience in Project Management
Experience with large database

Salary: Out of Scope

CancerCare Manitoba reserves the right to underfill this position.

Please submit a detailed cover letter outlining how you meet the requirements for this position along with a current resume which references the Competition Number.

Closing Date: April 28, 2022

This position is subject to a Criminal Record Check, including Vulnerable Sector Search, an Adult Abuse Registry Check and a Child Abuse Registry Check. The successful candidate will be responsible for any service charges incurred.

CancerCare Manitoba is committed to developing inclusive, barrier-free recruitment processes and work environment. If you are contacted by CancerCare Manitoba regarding a job opportunity or testing, please advise if accommodation measures must be taken to enable you to apply and be assessed in a fair and equitable manner.

We thank all that apply and advise that only those applicants selected for further consideration will be contacted.

Title: Logistics Cost Analyst
Description:
The Peak Group of Companies is a leader in home improvement, supplying a vast array of innovative products throughout Canada and the United States. Peak is a highly valued, strategic partner of Home Depot. Our unique business platform perfectly aligns with Home Depot’s do-it-yourself and professional customer, and our best in class products are offered throughout Home Depot’s massive retail network.
The greatest strength of Peak is our people, a team of remarkably talented, vibrant and competitive individuals. Quick to act and passionate to win, the Peak team continuously drives the company’s growth, which in turn continuously provides individual career growth. This formula for success is entrenched in our culture, where innovation is encouraged, talent and teamwork are celebrated and where results and success are rewarded.
We are experiencing continuous growth and have an immediate opening for the Logistics Cost Analyst position, working remotely. The position will be reporting to the Manager, Strategic Finance & Business Insights and is responsible for conducting various planned and ad hoc cost analysis to continuously identify cost out opportunities relating to domestic and international logistics costs. Key Responsibilities and Qualifications include, but are not limited, to the following:
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and maintain a comprehensive database covering all key logistics costs including all types of freight, warehousing & distribution, pallets and related costs; update and maintain various logistics costing models
Perform detailed cost analyses on international and domestic logistics costs to identify quick wins and longer term cost-out opportunities continuously
Review and audit international and domestic logistics invoices
Conduct forecast-to-actual variance analyses to identify the variances, the drivers and explain the results
Collaborate with diverse functional teams to learn their business, understand their data and reporting, assist in setting KPIs, and conduct financial analysis for business cases as they arise
Work on special projects and ad-hoc duties as required
Experience, Traits and Qualifications:
At least two (2) years of financial & costing analysis, cost modelling, and cost accounting experience
Experience and familiarity in analyzing all types of freight, warehousing & distribution, pallets, and related costs
Bachelor’s degree or postsecondary education in business administration, commerce, mathematics, economics, statistics, or a related field
Possess strong business analysis skills
Respected for taking ownership of the deliverables under minimal supervision and driving continuous process improvement by engaging and consulting with other partners
Proficient in MS Office, Excel, including PowerPoint, Teams or other planning and communication tools
The Peak Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We respect the dignity and worth of every individual in the workplace and value the importance of diversity, fairness, and trust. We offer a dynamic work environment and a competitive compensation package. Our goal is to attract, develop, and engage employees with exceptional ability and diverse backgrounds.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Sr. Business Data Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.
As the Sr. Business Data Analyst, you will provide structured transparency and management of our data assets. By leveraging a strong data management background focusing on data sourcing, integration, data quality and governance principles, the Sr. Business Data Analyst will ensure we know where our data comes from, is stored, is going and how it is being used and transformed along the way. The Sr. Business Data Analyst will enable a collaborative data environment where all stakeholders have access to the data they need, understanding, confidence and trust in the data they use and support for the data they steward.
To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. This position is categorized as a Connector, which means that the incumbent will be working with a variety of colleagues and partners to achieve business outcomes that require a mixed use of virtual and CTC campus presence.
What you’ll do
Establish and implement data governance and data management standards, policies, procedures and controls which include adhering to privacy, compliance and legal requirements for sensitive data
Continuously assess the current state of our data environment to identify process improvement opportunities such as inefficient table structures, ineffective load processes, R.O.T. or metadata and reference data enhancements
Proactively monitor data, metadata and reference data and lead continuous data quality improvements while supporting the data stewardship community in resolving identified data quality and data integrity concerns
Create and maintain data models and conceptual architecture as well as metadata and documentation such as data glossaries and catalogs, data mappings, data lineage and data classifications
Lead data integration efforts and enable collaboration between I.T., business data owners\stewards and SMEs while conducting data profiling and data discovery to support these efforts
Consult on data related designs to ensure best practices are followed and supporting documentation can be maintained
Experiment with emerging technologies to understand how they may impact what comes next and provide thought leadership in areas of advanced data techniques
Maintain open communication between all data stakeholders, from producers to consumers, and remain an active enabler of effective data management and the overall data governance structure of the Bank
What you bring
Post-secondary education in Computer Science or related program
Proven experience in the delivery of data solutions
Advanced PL\SQL combined with 5+ years experience with Oracle or comparable structured data environment
Working experience in modern data warehousing techniques and cloud technology platform solutions such as Azure or GCP
Experience with processes supporting data transformation and clear understanding of data ingestion protocols and ETL
Exposure to the following tools or technology: Hadoop, Hive, Python, R, Shell Scripting, SAS, basic Linux commands
Proven work experience with data in a corporate environment and supporting cross-functional data governance including monitoring data quality, recommending improvements in data, data modeling, data classification and data governance capabilities
Analytical mindset for metadata and data investigation and troubleshooting
Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft tools including Visio, PowerPoint and Excel

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
As a Senior IT Operations Analyst, TNS Automation & Instrumentation, you will support operations, project implementation and financial planning for Telecommunications and Network Services. You will liaise with teams in the department, senior management and enterprise partners, gather requirements and develop an understanding of the data necessary to deliver on their requests, help the team source and interpret the data, and finally provide data analysis and visualization to drive insight.
What will you do?
Create and analyze reporting results/dashboard and identify issues, trends and communicate to Management
Liaison for requirements gathering/documentation as it relates to reporting requirements, data collection and processing
Some process, compliance and system support functions will occasionally be part of your responsibilities.
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have:
University or College Degree in Computer Science or a related field or Equivalent years of experience as an IT Analyst
Typically requires 5 - 7 years of related experience.
Business intelligence tools, visualization and design
Scripting/relational databases
Collaboration tools support experience
Nice to Have:
Basic knowledge of networking
Familiarity with network monitoring tools
Information Technology operational support experience
Agile Development Methodologies
Familiarity with ElasticSearch
Industry knowledge of networking technologies and vendor products such as Cisco, Arista, Aruba, and an understanding as to how they are implemented within the financial services industry
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies
RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.
