Title: Senior Oracle Business Analyst
Description:
Metrolinx is connecting communities across the Greater Golden Horseshoe. Metrolinx operates GO Transit and UP Express, as well as the PRESTO fare payment system. We are also building new and improved rapid transit, including GO Expansion, Light Rail Transit routes, and major expansions to Toronto’s subway system, to get people where they need to go, better, faster and easier. Metrolinx is an agency of the Government of Ontario.
We embody our values in everything that we do. We Serve with Passion, Think Forward, and Play as a Team. If you can relate, we want to hear from you!
Our Business Technology Support Finance Office is seeking a Senior Oracle Business Analyst to provides functional/technical expertise to implement financial system (Oracle EBS) solutions. In this role you will streamline operations through involvement in projects, develops end to end BI reporting solutions, provide system support to end users, and ensure system enhancements/upgrades/patches are delivered without negatively impacting existing functionality. This role will be reporting into Senior Manager, Business Technology Support Finance.
What will I be doing?
Leads and supports changes to Oracle ERP and related systems which interface to Oracle
Coordinates and facilitates resolution of Finance system production issues; categorizes and identifies issues, design amendments, and incidents or investigation; investigates issues to identify root causes; defines the scope and impacts of root causes
Ensure operational issues with Oracle EBS system are identified and corrected in a timely manner to ensure limited disruption to the processing of transactions in Oracle EBS.
Coordinates and facilitates resolution of Finance system production issues; categorizes and identifies issues, design amendments, and incidents or investigation; investigates issues to identify root causes; defines the scope and impacts of root causes
Generates test plans, including test scenarios, and leads business users through testing activities; reports on outcomes and recommends solutions to address identified issues
Proposes improvements to automate business functions and make effective use of technology to improve the customer-service experience
Develops and maintains BI dashboards including preparation of data
Develops a thorough understanding of the business goals, practices, and processes to translate them into system functionality and user-requirements that define scope and specifications
Works closely with all stakeholders (e.g. cross functional teams, external partners, and vendors) to establishes, maintains, and strengthens relationships with external vendors and clients, build cross-functional relationships and liaise with internal departments regarding operational issues or improvements
Reviews design plans to ensure alignment to business requirements
What skills & qualifications do I need?
Completion of a degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Finance, Accounting, or a related discipline – or a combination of education, training, and experience deemed equivalent
Minimum six (6) years of experience as a financial systems business analyst with Oracle ERP and BI reporting experience
Knowledge of computerized financial systems such as Oracle R12/Oracle Cloud
Knowledge of BI reporting solutions and related development processes
Analytical and problem solving skills to define finance system impacts resulting from new or modified
Interpersonal and oral/written communication skills to facilitate meetings, review updates to workflow documents, procedures, and policies, and establish cross-functional relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Proven track record of managing and leading project teams encompassing application, technical, change management / transformation and testing competencies
Oracle Project Costing and Billing experience is a plus
Oracle Receivables and Collections experience is a plus
Accommodation:
Accommodation will be provided throughout the hiring process, as required. Applicants must make their needs known in advance.
Application Process:
All applicants must be legally entitled to work in Canada. Metrolinx will be using email to communicate with you for all job competitions. It is your responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence, we recommend that you check your email regularly. If no response is received, we will assume you are no longer interested in pursuing the opportunity. Please be advised that a Criminal Record Check may be required of the successful candidate. Should it be determined that any background information provided be misleading, inaccurate or incorrect, Metrolinx reserves the right to discontinue with the consideration of your application.
Metrolinx employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in accordance with Metrolinx’s Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy as a condition of being eligible for the recruitment process. Proof of COVID-19 vaccination will be required. If you are not able to obtain COVID-19 vaccination for a reason related to a protected ground of discrimination under applicable human rights legislation, you can request accommodation from Metrolinx.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Title: Sr. Pricing Analyst
Description:
Req id: 27948
Virtual, CA Waterloo, ON, CA
OPENTEXT - THE INFORMATION COMPANY:

As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.


THE OPPORTUNITY:

Lead the Pricing Process & business case construction for new models, new products, promotions & structures, working with product management to ensure pricing supports product strategy
Constantly evaluate & refine price points, pricing models & policies
Devise simplification strategies and build roadmaps to reduce portfolio pricing complexities
Become the “trusted advisor” to product management team on all aspects of product licensing and pricing and become knowledgeable in both product solutions and market dynamics
Work directly with operations team to ensure appropriate packaging and setup of new products reflects business intent & simplicity for Sales
Determine and conduct business analysis to (1) support strategic model/market shifts, (2) model financial impacts of pricing actions, (3) estimate street prices, (4) monitor progress of initiatives, (5) understand buying & selling behaviors (6) model financial impact of pricing actions, (7) derive customer ROI analysis as part of a value-based pricing approach.
Create instructional/training material to educate stakeholders, ie Sales teams, PM, PMK, etc
Support Deal Desk on deals, helping with deal configuration and discount requests/assessments as needed.

YOU ARE GREAT AT:

A sharp, analytical well-rounded person who wants to employ finance, marketing, and operations knowledge and skills to excel as a Pricing Analyst in a large, multi-billion software company?
A curious problem solver?
A self-directed, motivated person who wants to work to be the expert on all things pricing for the assigned portfolios
A personable, collaborative person to work with Product Managers, Sales and other stakeholders to achieve outstanding outcomes that drive revenue and efficiencies?
Willing to learn the enterprise software business from a unique perspective, with exposure to Operations, Product Management, Engineering, Product Pricing, Pricing Strategy and Sales?

WHAT IT TAKES:

Bachelors degree required
MBA and/or equivalent work experience
Knowledge of Product Mgmt, Product Mktg, Sales, Operations, Finance and/or Pricing processes a plus
Knowledge of the software or IT industry
Strong problem solving and communication skills
Ability to understand and conduct business analysis & data analysis to support projects and/or problem hypotheses
Strong team player with excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to anticipate issues and challenges, and prioritize effectively with little supervision
Ability to adapt and function effectively in a fast-paced, changing environment
Excellent Excel and PowerPoint skills
Required: 3+ years in related role in a Product Mgmt, Product Mktg, Operations, Analytics and/or Pricing capacity
Demonstrated problem-solving and analytical skills

Title: Lead Data Science Analyst, Catalog
Description:
Wayfair’s Data Science team builds the algorithmic systems that drive our business, enhance customer experience, & improve customer loyalty. The Data Science Catalog team at Wayfair develops machine learning models to: (1) improve customer experience by accurately tagging products using multimodal data sources (image, text, categorical, numeric, etc.), (2) drive catalog and pricing strategy by powering comparisons between large numbers of products, and (3) solve the product cold-start problem to enable customers to find the best new products.

We partner closely with our Merchandising, Engineering, and other Data Science teams in order to build scalable algorithmic systems responsible for predictive modeling that drives business strategy for various merchandising and supplier side teams.

We are looking for a Lead Data Science Analyst to join the Data Science Catalog Analytics team, with an emphasis on ensuring the healthiness of machine learning products. You will be working together with other analysts, data scientists, as well as multiple merch and engineering teams to solve one of our most impactful and intellectually challenging data science problems at Wayfair.

What You'll Do

Integrate tightly into our Data Science workstreams and act as the subject matter expert for data and analytics in the respective domain.
Explore, prototype, test and automate data pipelines and provide insights into model performance and business KPI impact.
Uncover deep insight hidden in our vast repository of raw data, and provide tactical guidance on how to act on findings.
Excellent organizational, analytical, and hypothesis- driven critical thinking skills to identify business opportunities and transform data into actionable insights.
Provide leadership to corporate initiatives which requires the ability to work with executives and be a thought partner with the cross functional leadership team.

What You'll Need

4+ years of experience as a data analyst/data engineer with background in a technical/quantitative field (e.g. mathematics, economics, computer science, analytics, engineering, physics, neuroscience, operations research etc.)
Ability to effectively work with business leads: strong communication skills, ability to synthesize conclusions for non-experts and desire to influence business direction
Good understanding of how quantitative and technical work aligns closely with business priorities and business value
Understanding of the data analytical stack to build complex reporting and data visualization dashboards using Tableau, Data Studio or redash
Experience with programming, e.g languages such as Python and SQL and building scalable data processing pipelines with big data frameworks as Apache suite, GBQ or Hive
Ability to work in a dynamic environment where there can be degrees of ambiguity
Bonus points for creative curiosity and a strong desire to always be learning

About Wayfair Inc.

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

Title: Integrations Architecture (IA) Support Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.
Provide tier 2 and tier 3 support for core business applications. Exercise a strong understanding of retail business processes and application usage to meet operational goals. Evaluate business processes to ensure operational processes and procedures align with support capabilities. Ensure business and operational support documentation exists for knowledge sharing. Act as the incident or problem coordinator where applicable. Lead tasks related to transitioning activities from project to production in areas of expertise. Facilitate training sessions to ensure knowledge transfer and cross training across the SRE and Monitoring teams. Demonstrate strong leadership capabilities.
What you’ll do
Provide hands on application support for daily operations of our core business applications, including service, data and process integrity, configuration, user administration, reporting and optimization.
Identification of root cause analysis and resolution of incidents reported by the monitoring systems and end users. Analyze data inaccuracies and work with IT team members and business stakeholders to correct the data.
Collaborate with IT units and business stakeholders to fully understand the business processes and requirements supported by the application. Work with business stakeholders to determine business process improvements and optimization of the application to improve value add to the organization.
Maintain documentation and provide knowledge transfer for other system support analysts. Prepare and facilitate training sessions where required. Evaluate gaps in process and operational support documentation and implement plan to address the missing information.
Understand and adhere to all compliance requirements (audit controls) for our applications. Participate in evidence collection and review for ITGC`s that pertain to application support. This process involves understanding applicable compliance aspects from the FGL information security policy as well as ITIL and COBIT frameworks.
Provide application expertise to assist with identifying business and technical requirements for project activities. Identify and raise risks as they relate to the application or business processes around the application. Identify and communicate support requirements and lead the transition of support activities from project to production.
Demonstrate a strong understanding of retail applications and business processes related to inventory movement (Plan, Buy, Move, Sell framework). Ability to communicate with business stakeholders in business terms at all levels of the organization.
Act as incident and problem coordinator where required. Facilitate regular meetings and working sessions with IT team members and different business units to address on going issues that require further understanding or analysis.
Participate in an on-call rotation to provide after hours support for our key business applications.
What you bring
Minimum of 3-5 years in a retail environment and 5-10 year in an IT environment
Strong knowledge of retail based applications and business processes
Strong understanding of database environments (Oracle, SQL) with the ability to read, write and execute SQL statements/scripts
Excellent analytical skills and understanding of common business analysis practices
Ability to learn new concepts in a short timeframes and share knowledge between team members
Ability to compile ideas into a formal presentation and deliver to a group of individuals at all levels of the organization
Ability to create and deliver training sessions
Strong commitment to creating and maintaining documentation
Ability to perform gap analysis to identify areas for improvement in application performance, functionality and processes
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Bilingual (English/French) is an asset
Technologies
TIBCO (must have)
IIB 7/10 (must have)
MQ(Admin) (must have)
DataStage 8/9 (must have)
CDC
MessageWay
MoveIt

Academic / Educational requirements
Diploma or degree from an accredited technical institution in computer technologies

Desired behaviors
Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values. Is seen as direct, truthful, and trustworthy by co-workers, vendors, and customers.
Committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives.
Demonstrates a desire to help and serve internal/external customers to meet their needs. Is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs.
Works collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives. Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups.
Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused. Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation.
Self-driven committed to high performance.
Must have a high level of confidence in own abilities
Working Conditions
Ability to work in a team oriented, fast paced and energetic environment with a drive to meet and exceed expectations.
Ability to work on multiple projects/tasks while maintaining strict project timelines to deliver results.
Willingness to participate in an on call rotation to support core applications after hours

Title: Power BI Developer
Description:
CPQi provides consultative services and expertise to help our clientele in the financial industry deliver better services to their users, speed up development lifecycles and bring them into a digital age. We work with 8 of the world's top 12 banks, exposing our team to the most exciting technologies and strategies in today's digital era. You will be working on various projects supporting our clients and we want you to grow with us. In doing that we focus heavily on the progress and education of all of our team members. That's why we invest in you by offering CPQi University, paid certifications and other training programs. We want to build a career for life here at CPQi.
We are currently seeking a Power BI Specialist developer to join our team!
The incumbent will be facilitating Power BI support for a CPQi Client and expected to work well with the client as an extension of CPQi. The incumbent must be able to work in a fast-paced environment while meeting aggressive target dates and deliverables.
Tasks:
Develop high level matrix based on business requirements, functional and technical specifications, and development standards for assigned projects/applications.
Assist with the production of reports using SQL Server, Analysis Services (SSAS) and reporting services (SSRS)
Design databases by adding tables, relationships, creating stored procedures, views and performance tuning of SQL queries and stored procedures.
Design, develop, maintain application using .net and C#.
Implement business logic written in C#.
Develop test cases based on test matrix including test data preparation for Data Completeness, Data Transformations, Data quality, Performance and scalability.
Develop Power BI reports and dashboards from multiple data sources.
 Perform data quality analysis using advance SQL skills, perform count validation, dimensional analysis, statistical analysis, data migration.
Explore data in a variety of ways and across multiple visualizations using Power BI.
Involved in troubleshooting, resolving and escalating data related issues and validating data to improve data quality.
Design and develop various abstract interfaces to construct business logic using C#, entity framework and SQL.
Design ad-hoc reports in excel power pivot and share them using Power BI to decision makers for strategic planning.
Qualifications and Requirements:
5-8 + years of hands-on experience in developing BI Applications utilizing SQL server, BI Stack, Power BI and Tableau
Experience in building SSAS cubes and dimensions with different architectures and data sources for Business Intelligence and writing MDX Scripts.
Strong knowledge of Data Warehousing methodologies
Familiarity with C#, Agile methodologies, and application development
Proficient in creating, configuring workflows designed in MS SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Experience in developing C# scripts in SSIS and automation of tasks using C#.
Experienced in designing and developing SSRS reports using data from various heterogeneous data sources.
Strong knowledge with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Cosmos etc.
Skills which are assets:
o Program languages – Python, Java, C# and C
o Algorithms – Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Decision Tree, SVM, Oracle, MySQL, HBase, Mongo DB
o Tools & Software – Jira, Microsoft SQL server data tools, and Power

Title: Invoicing Analyst
Description:
Who is RecycleSmart:
 A National B2B managed services firm that provides outsourced management of waste, organics and recycling to a broad range of industries across Canada.
 We do our part to ensure we make the world a better place!
 We are a dynamic, fast-paced, fun, collaborative environment where we value innovation while helping our teammates and customers grow.
 We get recognized for our successes (be sure to look at our company page).

 What we need:
 We are currently seeking an Invoicing Analyst, reporting to the Manager of Procurement & Vendor Partnerships. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting vendor invoice reconciliation and data integrity. You will investigate customer invoice challenges, identifying root cause, actioning resolution, and mitigating future issues. You quickly learn and adapt to new systems and are comfortable working with an ERP. 


What People say about You:
 You are well-organized and a self-starter who can work with minimal supervision. You have excellent problem-solving skills, strong communication skills, and intuitively learn and adapt to new systems quickly. Reconciling to the penny is your happy place and you thrive in details and information accuracy. You are proficient using Excel to sort, organize, and analyze a large volume of data, and can quickly enter and organize information in ERP’s. You excel in dynamic, fast-paced, team-oriented environments and believe strongly in collaboration, sustainability, and growth.


 What you will be doing:
 Vendor Invoice Reconciliation

Oversee the invoice discrepancy inbox and track all vendor invoice errors
Send standard communication to all Vendors detailing errors 
Follow up to ensure all errors are corrected and credits are applied correctly
Prepare summary reports on vendor invoice issues, identifying root causes
Suggest and implement improved efforts and processes to avoid invoice discrepancies



 Vendor Data Management & Maintenance

Assist in the maintenance of all vendor invoice data within the ERP
Update the ERP with updated/corrected data in a timely manner
Monitor missing and unresolved data issues
Accurate tracking of vendor responses and payment agreements



 Reporting

Assist in generating periodic reports from various sources to provide summary information on Vendor invoice errors, improvements, and general information
Various reports on vendor information as required



 Is This You?
 “Must Have” Skills/Experience:

Education: Diploma, Degree, or Designation in accounting or supply chain management 
Experience: At least 5 years in AP/AR, Purchasing, and/or invoice management
Experience: At least 2 years in Vendor Management – preferably in logistics/transportation
Technical: Advanced proficiency in Excel and data analysis
Technical: Proficiency with ERP systems
High attention to detail
Critical thinking, strong problem-solving skills, and good judgment
Comfortable multi-tasking and making schedule driven decisions and recommendations
Experience navigating a fast-paced, changing environment
Good time management, with ability to organize, prioritize and meet deadlines

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
We are The Kersheh Group; a multi-brand sleepwear, loungewear, underwear and socks designer and manufacturer based in Montreal and servicing major U.S. and Canadian retailers. We are independently owned and proud to celebrate over 43 years in the industry. Our leadership team, driven by our core values and entrepreneurial spirit, is passionate about building lasting relationships with clients and team members. We are a team-driven company marked by passion, commitment and unmistakable flair with the goal to become the sleepwear category champion of choice in North America.
The Kersheh Group is looking for an analytical and detail-oriented Business Intelligence Analyst to join our IT team. Reporting to the IT/IS Director, you will be responsible for all BI projects across the organization.
Top Reasons to Join the TKG Team:
Play a key role in the company’s success
Be part of a collaborative, diverse and welcoming team
Benefit from various training and growth opportunities
Enjoy countless perks including flex time and remote work
Participate in fun, team building social events
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package including:
Group Insurance Plan including Telemedicine and Employee and Family Assistance Plan (EFAP)
Group Retirement Savings Plan (RRSP)
Paid personal days
Early departure every Friday
Fitness Membership Reimbursement Program
Employee Referral Program
Employee discounts on our products
Free parking
What You’ll Be Doing:
Participate in the collection, analysis and defining of the needs of internal clients.
Understand the operational and business requirements of each different department in the company.
Conduct various analyses (scope, context, issues, impacts, stakeholders, change management).
Ensure the integrity of different data sources.
Develop and maintain data extraction and transformation programs.
Define, develop and maintain dashboards, KPIs and reports.
Coordinate User Acceptance Tests. Plan, write, execute and document test scenarios in collaboration with end users.
Perform Proof of Concepts designed to meet the needs and objectives of the user.
Collaborate in the drafting of proposals, calls for tenders, RFI (Request for Information) and RFQ (Request for quote) involving external suppliers.
Train and support business analysts from other departments in the use of Power BI.
Train end users on the understanding and use of dashboards, KPIs and reports.
What you’ll Need to Succeed in this Role:
College/University degree in IT, Management or equivalent.
A minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar position.
Experience with Power BI, SQL and SSRS and the following languages: M and DAX.
Strong oral and written communication skills in English and French.
Advanced knowledge of the Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Good knowledge of Supply Chain Management concepts.
Knowledge of ERP systems.
Experience dealing with major retail accounts in Canada and USA, an asset.
Knowledge of Project Management (MS Project an asset).
We can’t wait to welcome you, so apply today!

Title: Commercial Operations Analyst
Description:
**Posting Deadline: Please submit your application by 11:59 PM PST, April 16, 2022**Position Type:  TemporaryDuration: Approximately 6 monthsTogether, Let’s Do Great Things!We’re the largest financial institution based on Vancouver Island and the Gulf Islands, and we’ve got an opportunity for you. We are looking for a Commercial Operations Analyst to join our Commercial team, so if you’re passionate about systems data analysis and reporting, we’d like to hear from you.What’s the role?As the Commercial Operations Analyst you are responsible to provide administration and systems support to the Commercial division. You will assist the Senior Manager, Commercial Operations & Risk with delivery of government assistance programs for business, as well as reporting and data analysis required for regulatory and performance portfolios. As Commercial Operations Analyst you will aid with various system data analysis and reporting requirements and act as a main support for commercial technology maintenance and implementations.What are we looking for?

Successful completion of a Bachelor's Degree or diploma in a related discipline (e.g. Commerce and Business Administration) requiring 3 - 4 years of full-time study or equivalent.
Two (2) years of experience in business systems analysis and implementation, technology troubleshooting, system conversions, applications and maintenance and/or a combination of education and experience

Ideally, you are a flexible, collaborative team player with:

Extensive knowledge and understanding of commercial lending operations, user procedures and workflows providing solid solutions for complex issues
Knowledge of business concepts and requirements that apply to a financial institution
Knowledge and understanding of banking operations, user procedures and workflows
Knowledge of credit union industry
Strong technical knowledge of banking system and commercial loans origination system
Strong knowledge of Internet and Web Based applications
Proficient in Microsoft Office products

If you’re an approachable problem solver who embraces self-development and life-long learning, you’ll be a great fit with us.What we offer you: 

Competitive salary
A comprehensive benefits package including MSP, dental, and extended healthcare
Employer paid RRSP benefit
Ongoing support for education and career development

Who are we?Since first forming in 1946, Coastal Community has grown to become the largest financial services provider based on Vancouver Island. We’re proud of the legacy we’ve built and the things that make us who we are:

We’re 100% member-owned, with all decisions made locally—right here on Vancouver Island.
We’re a growing organization with over $4 billion in assets under management. Coastal Community helps improve the financial health of over 100,000 members and clients through our 24 branches, 16 insurance offices, 4 business centres, plus our wide range of online and digital services.
We believe in making meaningful contributions to the communities we call home. Each year, we give over half a million to community organizations and programs.

If you join us you’ll work hard, but have a lot of fun along the way. We offer a generous compensation package and a great work/life balance because we want you to spend your career here. Many people do!
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Pharmacy Analyst, Pricing and Reporting
Description:
Requisition ID: 165800
Career Group: Corporate Office Careers
Job Category: Pharm Category Mgmt &Payer Relationships
Travel Requirements: 0 - 10%
Job Type: Full-Time


Country: Canada (CA)
Province: Alberta; Nova Scotia; Ontario; Québec
City: Dartmouth / Stellarton / Montreal / Mississauga / Calgary
Location: Dartmouth Office, Bureau de Montréal-Nord, Calgary Office, King St. Office, Tahoe Office
Postal Code:


Our family of 134,000 employees and franchise affiliates share a collective passion for delivering exceptional shopping experiences and amazing food to all our customers. Our mission is to nurture the things that make life better – great experiences, families, communities, and our employees. We are a family nurturing families.


A proudly Canadian company, we started in a small town in Nova Scotia but we are now in communities of all sizes across this great country. With over 1500 stores in all 10 provinces, you may know us as Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, Lawton’s Drug Stores or another of our great banners but we are all one extended family.


All career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting.



 Overview


 Sobeys is full of exciting opportunities and we are always looking for bright new talent to join our team! We currently have a full time opportunity for a Pharmacy Analyst, Pricing and Reporting to join our National Pharmacy team based out of our one of our main offices located in Dartmouth, NS, Stellarton, NS, Montreal, QC, Mississauga, ON, or Calgary, AB. This position will have the option to be Hybrid working two or more days in the office.




 Job Description



 In this fast paced role, you will:


Responsible for strengthening our pricing capabilities and financial results
Ensure the execution and implementation of Pharmacy pricing is being optimized
Complete analysis and put forward suggestions to improve financial results, processes and business improvements
Compile and maintain vendor reporting related to pharmaceutical pricing and forecasting
Responsible for maintaining accurate and timely Manufacture list pricing as well as third party and wholesale pricing
Responsible for accuracy and collection of pharmacy data including provincial formulary listing status, Government and Private Reimbursement status, Provider numbers, Drug cost changes and Third Party Policy updates
Strong working relationship with stores, PDMs, Operations, Data Integrity and IT
Other duties as required







 Job Requirements



 What your resume will include and demonstrate to us:


An Undergraduate Degree and a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience or a minimum of 4 years relevant experience
Front line pharmacy experience an asset
Knowledge of pharmacy software (i.e. Kroll)
Analytical training/experience
Understanding of pharmaceutical pricing
Proficient use of Excel, Outlook and Word
Ability to think strategically and posses’ strong analytical skills




This is an outstanding opportunity to join a leading Canadian company with a clear vision and focus. If you feel that this describes the kind of work you want to do, and you are excited about what Sobeys has to offer, then we look forward to reviewing your application. Please ensure that you take the time to ensure your profile shows us why you’re the most qualified applicant for the role.


Sobeys offers our employees many valuable benefits such as: Growing organization Competitive salary Pension plan Flexible health and dental benefits plan (eligible employees) Flexible working arrangements Ongoing Training & Development Opportunity for internal mobility to other departments and/or promotions (for employees who are strong performers)


#LI-Hybrid 



Sobeys is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process and will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of this process.


While all responses are appreciated only those being considered for interviews will be acknowledged.


We appreciate the interest from the Staffing industry however respectfully request no calls or unsolicited resumes from Agencies.

Title: Integrations Architecture (IA) Support Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada 
Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies. 
Provide tier 2 and tier 3 support for core business applications. Exercise a strong understanding of retail business processes and application usage to meet operational goals. Evaluate business processes to ensure operational processes and procedures align with support capabilities. Ensure business and operational support documentation exists for knowledge sharing. Act as the incident or problem coordinator where applicable. Lead tasks related to transitioning activities from project to production in areas of expertise. Facilitate training sessions to ensure knowledge transfer and cross training across the SRE and Monitoring teams. Demonstrate strong leadership capabilities. 
What you’ll do 

Provide hands on application support for daily operations of our core business applications, including service, data and process integrity, configuration, user administration, reporting and optimization. 
Identification of root cause analysis and resolution of incidents reported by the monitoring systems and end users. Analyze data inaccuracies and work with IT team members and business stakeholders to correct the data. 
Collaborate with IT units and business stakeholders to fully understand the business processes and requirements supported by the application. Work with business stakeholders to determine business process improvements and optimization of the application to improve value add to the organization. 
Maintain documentation and provide knowledge transfer for other system support analysts. Prepare and facilitate training sessions where required. Evaluate gaps in process and operational support documentation and implement plan to address the missing information. 
Understand and adhere to all compliance requirements (audit controls) for our applications. Participate in evidence collection and review for ITGC`s that pertain to application support. This process involves understanding applicable compliance aspects from the FGL information security policy as well as ITIL and COBIT frameworks. 
Provide application expertise to assist with identifying business and technical requirements for project activities. Identify and raise risks as they relate to the application or business processes around the application. Identify and communicate support requirements and lead the transition of support activities from project to production. 
Demonstrate a strong understanding of retail applications and business processes related to inventory movement (Plan, Buy, Move, Sell framework). Ability to communicate with business stakeholders in business terms at all levels of the organization. 
Act as incident and problem coordinator where required. Facilitate regular meetings and working sessions with IT team members and different business units to address on going issues that require further understanding or analysis. 
Participate in an on-call rotation to provide after hours support for our key business applications. 

What you bring 

Minimum of 3-5 years in a retail environment and 5-10 year in an IT environment 
Strong knowledge of retail based applications and business processes 
Strong understanding of database environments (Oracle, SQL) with the ability to read, write and execute SQL statements/scripts 
Excellent analytical skills and understanding of common business analysis practices 
Ability to learn new concepts in a short timeframes and share knowledge between team members 
Ability to compile ideas into a formal presentation and deliver to a group of individuals at all levels of the organization 
Ability to create and deliver training sessions 
Strong commitment to creating and maintaining documentation 
Ability to perform gap analysis to identify areas for improvement in application performance, functionality and processes 
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills 
Bilingual (English/French) is an asset 

Technologies 

TIBCO (must have) 
IIB 7/10 (must have) 
MQ(Admin) (must have) 
DataStage 8/9 (must have) 
CDC 
MessageWay 
MoveIt 
Diyotta 
Atacama 
DataPower 
ESP 
PL1/JCL – C++ 
AIX (Admin) 
NGINX 
EDW / EDL 
ORACLE/p-SQL 
Netezza 

Academic / Educational requirements 

Diploma or degree from an accredited technical institution in computer technologies 
ITIL Version 2 or 3 certification 

Desired behaviors 

Builds Trust and Credibility by consistently adhering to the organization’s business principles and values. Is seen as direct, truthful, and trustworthy by co-workers, vendors, and customers. 
Committed to results by taking personal responsibility for achieving mutually agreed upon individual/team objectives. 
Demonstrates a desire to help and serve internal/external customers to meet their needs. Is proactive, responsive, and focused on discovering, anticipating, and exceeding the customer’s needs. 
Works collaboratively and cooperatively with others to achieve shared goals and objectives. Considers the wider team, function, banner or the organization and takes action or makes decisions which support the success of those groups. 
Recovers quickly after change, disruptions, or mistakes and can remain productive and focused. Is adaptable and can apply lessons learned in one situation to another situation. 
Self-driven committed to high performance. 
Must have a high level of confidence in own abilities 

Working Conditions 

Ability to work in a team oriented, fast paced and energetic environment with a drive to meet and exceed expectations. 
Ability to work on multiple projects/tasks while maintaining strict project timelines to deliver results. 
Willingness to participate in an on call rotation to support core applications after hours 

About Canadian Tire Corporation 
Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . 
To learn more about this team and the Canadian Tire family of companies follow us on LinkedIn . 

#LI-KS1 


   Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Information Technology 
  

   Ontario-Oakville 
  

   Permanent 
  

   Full-time

Title: Power BI Developer
Description:
CPQi provides consultative services and expertise to help our clientele in the financial industry deliver better services to their users, speed up development lifecycles and bring them into a digital age. We work with 8 of the world's top 12 banks, exposing our team to the most exciting technologies and strategies in today's digital era. You will be working on various projects supporting our clients and we want you to grow with us. In doing that we focus heavily on the progress and education of all of our team members. That's why we invest in you by offering CPQi University, paid certifications and other training programs. We want to build a career for life here at CPQi.
We are currently seeking a Power BI Specialist developer to join our team!
The incumbent will be facilitating Power BI support for a CPQi Client and expected to work well with the client as an extension of CPQi. The incumbent must be able to work in a fast-paced environment while meeting aggressive target dates and deliverables.
Tasks:
Develop high level matrix based on business requirements, functional and technical specifications, and development standards for assigned projects/applications.
Assist with the production of reports using SQL Server, Analysis Services (SSAS) and reporting services (SSRS)
Design databases by adding tables, relationships, creating stored procedures, views and performance tuning of SQL queries and stored procedures.
Design, develop, maintain application using .net and C#.
Implement business logic written in C#.
Develop test cases based on test matrix including test data preparation for Data Completeness, Data Transformations, Data quality, Performance and scalability.
Develop Power BI reports and dashboards from multiple data sources.
 Perform data quality analysis using advance SQL skills, perform count validation, dimensional analysis, statistical analysis, data migration.
Explore data in a variety of ways and across multiple visualizations using Power BI.
Involved in troubleshooting, resolving and escalating data related issues and validating data to improve data quality.
Design and develop various abstract interfaces to construct business logic using C#, entity framework and SQL.
Design ad-hoc reports in excel power pivot and share them using Power BI to decision makers for strategic planning.
Qualifications and Requirements:
5-8 + years of hands-on experience in developing BI Applications utilizing SQL server, BI Stack, Power BI and Tableau
Experience in building SSAS cubes and dimensions with different architectures and data sources for Business Intelligence and writing MDX Scripts.
Strong knowledge of Data Warehousing methodologies
Familiarity with C#, Agile methodologies, and application development
Proficient in creating, configuring workflows designed in MS SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Experience in developing C# scripts in SSIS and automation of tasks using C#.
Experienced in designing and developing SSRS reports using data from various heterogeneous data sources.
Strong knowledge with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Cosmos etc.
Skills which are assets:
o Program languages – Python, Java, C# and C
o Algorithms – Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Decision Tree, SVM, Oracle, MySQL, HBase, Mongo DB
o Tools & Software – Jira, Microsoft SQL server data tools, and Power

Education:
Bachelor's degree in - Computer Science, Computer Information Technology, Computer Engineering or equivalent.

Title: Invoicing Analyst
Description:
Who is RecycleSmart:

A National B2B managed services firm that provides outsourced management of waste, organics and recycling to a broad range of industries across Canada.

We do our part to ensure we make the world a better place!

We are a dynamic, fast-paced, fun, collaborative environment where we value innovation while helping our teammates and customers grow.

We get recognized for our successes (be sure to look at our company page).
What we need:

We are currently seeking an Invoicing Analyst, reporting to the Manager of Procurement & Vendor Partnerships. In this role, you will be responsible for supporting vendor invoice reconciliation and data integrity. You will investigate customer invoice challenges, identifying root cause, actioning resolution, and mitigating future issues. You quickly learn and adapt to new systems and are comfortable working with an ERP.

What People say about You:

You are well-organized and a self-starter who can work with minimal supervision. You have excellent problem-solving skills, strong communication skills, and intuitively learn and adapt to new systems quickly. Reconciling to the penny is your happy place and you thrive in details and information accuracy. You are proficient using Excel to sort, organize, and analyze a large volume of data, and can quickly enter and organize information in ERP’s. You excel in dynamic, fast-paced, team-oriented environments and believe strongly in collaboration, sustainability, and growth.


What you will be doing:

Vendor Invoice Reconciliation

Oversee the invoice discrepancy inbox and track all vendor invoice errors
Send standard communication to all Vendors detailing errors
Follow up to ensure all errors are corrected and credits are applied correctly
Prepare summary reports on vendor invoice issues, identifying root causes
Suggest and implement improved efforts and processes to avoid invoice discrepancies


Vendor Data Management & Maintenance

Assist in the maintenance of all vendor invoice data within the ERP
Update the ERP with updated/corrected data in a timely manner
Monitor missing and unresolved data issues
Accurate tracking of vendor responses and payment agreements


Reporting

Assist in generating periodic reports from various sources to provide summary information on Vendor invoice errors, improvements, and general information
Various reports on vendor information as required


Is This You?

“Must Have” Skills/Experience:

Education: Diploma, Degree, or Designation in accounting or supply chain management
Experience: At least 5 years in AP/AR, Purchasing, and/or invoice management
Experience: At least 2 years in Vendor Management – preferably in logistics/transportation
Technical: Advanced proficiency in Excel and data analysis
Technical: Proficiency with ERP systems
High attention to detail
Critical thinking, strong problem-solving skills, and good judgment
Comfortable multi-tasking and making schedule driven decisions and recommendations
Experience navigating a fast-paced, changing environment
Good time management, with ability to organize, prioritize and meet deadlines
Ability to work well with cross-functional teams and diverse groups of stakeholders
Demonstrated written and oral communication skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team


“Nice to Have” Skills/Experience

Experience in waste & recycling management industry
Experience with Microsoft NAV/Dynamics
Experience in Project planning, management, and execution
Strong customer service skills, including ability to build credibility and trust
Strong writing skills (procedures, specifications, contracts)
Demonstrated interpersonal skills establishing cooperative working relationships


Why join RecycleSmart:

Competitive Salary
Extended Medical and Dental Benefits + Health Spending Account
Professional Development Fund
GRSP program
Diverse and Inclusive team focused on supporting internal growth.
Focus on giving back to the community; paid volunteer hours


What to Expect:

We believe the recruiting process is a two-way street, this isn’t just about us getting to know you. We encourage you to ask questions about the company, work culture and the role. As you interview with RecycleSmart, we hope the growth and challenge excites you. #GetYourSmartOn!

You will chat with our talent acquisition team
Meet with the hiring manager and potential team
Meet with one of our leaders and learn more about your career at RecycleSmart.


Work Life

We offer it all. For team members that live in the Metro Vancouver area, we offer a hybrid model so you can mix up your week between your home office and mingling with colleagues at our head office. Not only do we have a cool, LEED Gold office that is dog friendly, we offer some pretty sweet perks too. In your first year, you’ll enjoy 4 weeks of personal paid leave and a dedicated professional development fund. By the end of year two, you will be eligible for a Health Spending Account, access to our Wellness Fun and 5 weeks of personal paid leave. We offer extended health and dental benefits, as well as professional and individual development programs.


RecycleSmart is an equal opportunity employer who embraces and values diversity in age, gender identity, race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, and physical/mental ability. RecycleSmart's team members are encouraged to be their whole authentic selves. People of diverse backgrounds and cultures are encouraged to apply.

Title: Commercial Operations Analyst
Description: **Posting Deadline: Please submit your application by 11:59 PM PST, April 16, 2022**Position Type:  TemporaryDuration: Approximately 6 monthsTogether, Let’s Do Great Things!We’re the largest financial institution based on Vancouver Island and the Gulf Islands, and we’ve got an opportunity for you. We are looking for a Commercial Operations Analyst to join our Commercial team, so if you’re passionate about systems data analysis and reporting, we’d like to hear from you.What’s the role?As the Commercial Operations Analyst you are responsible to provide administration and systems support to the Commercial division. You will assist the Senior Manager, Commercial Operations & Risk with delivery of government assistance programs for business, as well as reporting and data analysis required for regulatory and performance portfolios. As Commercial Operations Analyst you will aid with various system data analysis and reporting requirements and act as a main support for commercial technology maintenance and implementations.What are we looking for?Successful completion of a Bachelor's Degree or diploma in a related discipline (e.g. Commerce and Business Administration) requiring 3 - 4 years of full-time study or equivalent.Two (2) years of experience in business systems analysis and implementation, technology troubleshooting, system conversions, applications and maintenance and/or a combination of education and experienceIdeally, you are a flexible, collaborative team player with:Extensive knowledge and understanding of commercial lending operations, user procedures and workflows providing solid solutions for complex issuesKnowledge of business concepts and requirements that apply to a financial institutionKnowledge and understanding of banking operations, user procedures and workflowsKnowledge of credit union industryStrong technical knowledge of banking system and commercial loans origination systemStrong knowledge of Internet and Web Based applicationsProficient in Microsoft Office productsIf you’re an approachable problem solver who embraces self-development and life-long learning, you’ll be a great fit with us.What we offer you: Competitive salaryA comprehensive benefits package including MSP, dental, and extended healthcareEmployer paid RRSP benefitOngoing support for education and career developmentWho are we?Since first forming in 1946, Coastal Community has grown to become the largest financial services provider based on Vancouver Island. We’re proud of the legacy we’ve built and the things that make us who we are:We’re 100% member-owned, with all decisions made locally—right here on Vancouver Island.We’re a growing organization with over $4 billion in assets under management. Coastal Community helps improve the financial health of over 100,000 members and clients through our 24 branches, 16 insurance offices, 4 business centres, plus our wide range of online and digital services.We believe in making meaningful contributions to the communities we call home. Each year, we give over half a million to community organizations and programs.If you join us you’ll work hard, but have a lot of fun along the way. We offer a generous compensation package and a great work/life balance because we want you to spend your career here. Many people do!Job Type: Full-time

Title: Pharmacy Analyst, Pricing and Reporting
Description:
Requisition ID: 165800
Career Group: Corporate Office Careers
Job Category: Pharm Category Mgmt &Payer Relationships
Travel Requirements: 0 - 10%
Job Type: Full-Time

Country: Canada (CA)
Province: Alberta; Nova Scotia; Ontario; Québec
City: Dartmouth / Stellarton / Montreal / Mississauga / Calgary
Location: Dartmouth Office, Bureau de Montréal-Nord, Calgary Office, King St. Office, Tahoe Office
Postal Code:

Our family of 134,000 employees and franchise affiliates share a collective passion for delivering exceptional shopping experiences and amazing food to all our customers. Our mission is to nurture the things that make life better – great experiences, families, communities, and our employees. We are a family nurturing families.

A proudly Canadian company, we started in a small town in Nova Scotia but we are now in communities of all sizes across this great country. With over 1500 stores in all 10 provinces, you may know us as Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, Lawton’s Drug Stores or another of our great banners but we are all one extended family.

All career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting.

Overview

Sobeys is full of exciting opportunities and we are always looking for bright new talent to join our team! We currently have a full time opportunity for a Pharmacy Analyst, Pricing and Reporting to join our National Pharmacy team based out of our one of our main offices located in Dartmouth, NS, Stellarton, NS, Montreal, QC, Mississauga, ON, or Calgary, AB. This position will have the option to be Hybrid working two or more days in the office.

Job Description

In this fast paced role, you will:
Responsible for strengthening our pricing capabilities and financial resultsEnsure the execution and implementation of Pharmacy pricing is being optimizedComplete analysis and put forward suggestions to improve financial results, processes and business improvementsCompile and maintain vendor reporting related to pharmaceutical pricing and forecastingResponsible for maintaining accurate and timely Manufacture list pricing as well as third party and wholesale pricingResponsible for accuracy and collection of pharmacy data including provincial formulary listing status, Government and Private Reimbursement status, Provider numbers, Drug cost changes and Third Party Policy updatesStrong working relationship with stores, PDMs, Operations, Data Integrity and ITOther duties as required

Job Requirements

What your resume will include and demonstrate to us:
An Undergraduate Degree and a minimum of 2 years of relevant experience or a minimum of 4 years relevant experienceFront line pharmacy experience an assetKnowledge of pharmacy software (i.e. Kroll)Analytical training/experienceUnderstanding of pharmaceutical pricingProficient use of Excel, Outlook and WordAbility to think strategically and posses’ strong analytical skills

This is an outstanding opportunity to join a leading Canadian company with a clear vision and focus. If you feel that this describes the kind of work you want to do, and you are excited about what Sobeys has to offer, then we look forward to reviewing your application. Please ensure that you take the time to ensure your profile shows us why you’re the most qualified applicant for the role.

Sobeys offers our employees many valuable benefits such as:
Growing organization
Competitive salary
Pension plan
Flexible health and dental benefits plan (eligible employees)
Flexible working arrangements
Ongoing Training & Development
Opportunity for internal mobility to other departments and/or promotions (for employees who are strong performers)

#LI-Hybrid
Sobeys is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process and will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of this process.

While all responses are appreciated only those being considered for interviews will be acknowledged.
