Title: RFA MC - Business Reporting Analyst
Description:
At RFA Mortgage Corporation, we believe in the strength of our foundation.
We are a Canadian-owned mortgage finance company with over 25 years of Canadian real estate experience.
In an increasingly complex residential mortgage market, RFA is committed to solutions that work for our brokers and clients. Our financial strength combined with innovative technology and dedicated service gives us a competitive edge in the market. Brokers and clients can look forward to new products, and industry-leading rates and service.

The Opportunity
The Reporting Analyst will be responsible for the design, development, and support of business intelligence, analysis, and reporting solutions. The preferred candidate will possess a combination of reporting skills and business acumen, and will use these skills to create and maintain specialized reporting packages, dashboards, and scorecards, with the goal of pivoting the business toward more data-driven and analytically based decision making. The Reporting Analyst’s core responsibility will be to develop and implement reports and BI solutions across the entire business, including Sales, Credit Risk Management, Operations, and for other related Key Performance Indicators (KPI's). The Reporting Analyst will participate in the implementation and ongoing evolution of the company’s enterprise BI infrastructure (Power BI), including leading and/or supporting the creation of underlying databases and tables. The ability to interpret business requirements into reports and dashboards will be a critical component of this role.
Reporting, Data Management, and Business Unit Support
Participate in the implementation and ongoing development of the company’s BI platform and underlying data infrastructure
Develop and maintain specialized reporting packages, dashboards, PowerPivot reports, visualizations, and scorecards for users across the business (Sales, Underwriting, Quality Assurance, etc.) utilizing data infrastructure, localized datamarts and external data sources where required
Lead the development and implementation of portfolio reporting (e.g. acquisition, attrition, credit quality, etc.)
Work with Business Stakeholders on the identification of information needs and the development of analytical dashboards or reports in Power BI. Skills in rapid proto-typing are strongly preferred
Create tables or databases in support of information requirements from various areas of the business;
Manage report scheduler for reoccurring (Daily, Weekly) standardized reports
Validate the quality and integrity of the data included in all reporting
Maintain expert knowledge of all main data sources for the data used within the business unit and ability to effectively utilize these data sources for reporting purposes
Business Analysis Support
Conduct analysis to provide improved BI to inform management leadership team
Understand business drivers, definitions, and metrics in order to interpret findings, take action and provide relevant direction
Work with business partners to understand business objectives and develop valuable reporting and provide ad-hoc data extracts
Work independently as the reporting / BI expert and provide technical support to others
Recommend changes in design and development for continuous improvement
Provide documentation for design and development
Perform additional assignments per management’s direction
What you can bring to RFA:
5+ years designing and developing reports and dashboards
BI and reporting experience within the Mortgage or Financial Services industries strongly preferred
Advanced knowledge of Power BI, including DAX measures, and report automation and distribution
Experience developing dashboards and reports in Power BI Platform. Candidate should have experience using Dataflows, Power Automate, Power Query for data transformations, and be able to create and maintain complex DAX measures and calculations.
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS, Visual Studio
Experience designing, developing, updating, and optimizing Power BI dashboards, reports and scorecards to meet business requirements, including creating database tables and custom fields to support BI and reporting needs required
Hands-on experience building and deploying reports to either on-premises and/or cloud implementations of Power BI.
Strong SQL and Excel skills, including complex queries on relational databases, stored procedures, and automation tools, and working with and transforming large datasets
Experience in database concepts, data modeling, data integration including design and architecture.
Efficiently handle large sets of data and be able to confidently process them into required formats.
Benefits of Working at RFA:
Health & Dental Care
Vision Care
RRSP Match
Vacation & Personal Days
Home and Office work conditions
Are you the Right Candidate?
Excellent in analytical thinking for translating data into informative visuals and reports.
Ability to translate business needs into technical requirements
Analytical, creative, and innovative approach to solving problems, solution-minded and detail focused
Action-oriented
Good time management skills and work according to priorities assigned, commitment to deadlines and due dates
Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability

Title: Compensation Analyst - Business Intelligence
Description:
ABOUT CORPAY CROSS-BORDER 
 
 Global businesses trust Corpay Cross-Border to power their international payments, execute plans to manage their currency risk and support their growth around the world. We aim to deliver unmatched service and expertise with respect to moving money globally. Utilizing our proprietary payment automation technology and currency risk mitigation solutions, we take pride in connecting companies large and small with the global financial markets and businesses all over the world. Corpay is part of the FLEETCOR (NYSE: FLT) portfolio of brands. To learn more visit www.corpay.com. 
 
 ROLE FUNCTION AND PURPOSE 
 The Compensation Analyst works closely with the business leaders and the compensation manager to administer sales variable compensation calculations, modeling and ROI analysis, strategic partnership management, reporting deliverables including preparing management reports, presentations, and documenting business process. This is an exciting and the critical role in the organization as this team manages the variable compensation for 400+ HC which involves various levels of corporate strategies with the power of real time compensation analytics, business intelligence tools and the inhouse platforms. The need to comprehend business concepts and ensure these concepts are delivered as meaningful analytics. The analyst facilitates design and concept gathering and assist in the creation of new reports or analytics. Also the analyst should be experienced with problem-solving and conflict resolution to help identify, communicate and resolve issues. 
 
 KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES 
 

The primary responsibility of this position is to support the business leaders, compensation manager and the director of business intelligence in the areas of global variable compensation modelling, strategic plans, sales commissions, bonuses, incentives, financial business analysis and sales performance analysis with a view to deliver enhanced business performance.
Responsible to build sales compensation and incentive plans, review accuracy of the BI generated compensations statement, distribute timely Financial and Variable Compensation reports that enhance the decision-making abilities for the Senior Management and Executives.
Engage with the business leaders on the sales ROI and promote new incentives to motivate the sales team to support organization growth
Sales Variable Compensation: Review and validate monthly compensation for various roles across the different geo’s we operate in.
Management & Leadership Variable Compensation: Calculate monthly/quarterly incentives
Account Management: client classification updates and including sales group administration.
Sales Incentive Programs: administer and track individual performance under sales incentive programs.
Compensation Modeling: create competitive and pay for performance-based compensation plans to drive management goals.
Compensation Reporting: reporting on the effectiveness of sales programs.
Measuring sales performance against an established set of KPIs.
Responding to inquiries regarding compensation payout, partnership management, policies, and procedures.
To Identify and recommend improvements to current processes, with a focus on increased efficiencies and enhanced value-added analytics.
Introduce new analysis, reporting formats, etc. which provide insights to different areas of the business.
Prepare modeling to assess ROI & also conduct due diligence for partnership evaluation.
Support a variety of special compensation projects to improve internal business processes.
Maintain BI Documentation for all compensation Plans and processes.
Assist in implementing solutions for variable compensation reporting and modeling.
 KEY SKILLS 
 

Microsoft Office- Excel, Word, and PowerPoint
Compensation modeling and administration knowledge/experience
Financial analysis, reconciliations, and profitability analysis.
Business Intelligence tools (Tableau & Power BI)
Project Management
Basic Microsoft SQL & VBA/Macros (Not a key requirement)
Basic Knowledge on CRM (Salesforce)
 #LI-SM1 
 #LI-Corpay 
 

About the Company:
 FLEETCOR Technologies, Inc. (“FLEETCOR”) is a leading global provider of business payment solutions. We help companies of all sizes control, simplify and secure payment of various domestic and cross-border payables using specialized payment products. We serve businesses, partners, merchants, consumers and payment networks in North America, Latin America, Europe, and Asia Pacific. 
 

$2.4B Annual Revenue
600,000 Directly Served Business Clients
2.6B+ Transactions per Year
8,400+ Employees
 (as of December 31, 2020) 
 
 Our payment solutions provide our customers with a payment method designed to be superior to and more robust and effective than what they use currently, whether they use a competitor’s product or another alternative method such as cash or check. We group our payment solutions into five primary categories: Fuel, Lodging, Tolls, Corporate Payments and Gift. Each category is unique in its focus, customer base and target markets, but they also share a number of characteristics: customers are primarily businesses, have recurring revenue models, have specialized networks which create barriers to entry, have high margins, and have similar selling systems. 
 

FLEETCOR enjoys global recognition including:


Forbes Global Growth Champion – FLEETCOR is one of the 250 fastest growing companies in the world as determined by Forbes and Statista
Forbes World’s Most Innovative Companies – FLEETCOR has made this prestigious list of leading innovative companies 4 years in a row!
Fortune 1000 Company – FLEETCOR was one of the largest movers in the new rankings of the largest companies in America, ranking #872
S&P 500 – In 2018, FLEETCOR joined the S&P stock index comprised of the 500 leading US stocks based on market cap (company value)
 Our Vision 
 
 Despite many advances in our industry, the majority of business payments are still made with outdated and inferior payment methods, such as checks and cash. We envision a business world where every purchase is controlled, every payment is digital, and every payment-related decision is well-informed. In this future paperless state, payments will require little to no time to manage, leaving companies with more time for what matters most: activities that grow their businesses. 
 
 Our Mission 
 
 FLEETCOR’s mission is to provide businesses with a better way to pay, by replacing outdated payment methods such as checks and cash, and displacing the incumbent providers of those methods. Through the digitalization of payments, we create and support robust ecosystems which benefit all participating constituents: payment-making customers, payment-accepting merchants, tax-collecting governments, and FLEETCOR. 
 
 Our Strategy 
 
 FLEETCOR is a growth company, and we employ a simple three-prong strategy for growing our business: 
 

More Customers. We invest more than $200 million per year in sales and marketing, predominately focused on new customer acquisition. We continue to scale existing sales channels and headcount, enable our sales people with demand generation and other tools, and launch new distribution channels both internally and through partners such as ERP software providers, telematics companies, and banks. We will also grow our customer base inorganically through acquisitions.
More Spend. We seek to leverage our existing customer relationships and capture greater share of their business payment expenditures. As such, we have developed various “beyond” initiatives, where we extend the utility of an existing payment product without degrading the core value proposition of the original product. As such, a customer can “buy more stuff” without sacrificing the controls and reporting which attracted the customer to our product to begin with. For example:
Our Fuel card customers can enable their cards to allow non-fuel purchases relevant to their business, like allowing a painting crew to buy supplies at a home improvement store, so they can finish the paint job.
Our Toll tag customers can use their in-vehicle RFID tags to make other “on the go” purchases like parking, fuel and fast-food.
 For our customers, these product extensions reduce payment friction, saving them time and operational headaches. For FLEETCOR, these product extensions can increase our share of wallet with existing customers and can increase our products’ appeal and applicability to previously-unserved customer segments (e.g., non-toll urban dwellers). We also create new product offerings, developed internally or in conjunction with partners, to cross-sell to our existing customer base. 
 

More Geographies. We continue to seek attractive entry opportunities in major international markets, which we intend to pursue through acquisitions and partnerships.
 Our Commitment to Diversity, Equality, Inclusion, Belonging 
 
 Together we can foster true belonging. We know different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds lead to better innovation and results. We are therefore committed to building and nurturing a culture of diversity, inclusion, and belonging by: 
 

Welcoming people of different backgrounds, cultures, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations;
Empowering our people to share their experiences and ideas through open forums and individual conversations; and
Valuing each person’s unique perspectives and individual contributions.
 Embracing diversity enables our people to “make the difference” at FLEETCOR. 
 
 Our Values 
 
 FLEETCOR’s culture reflects our history of fast growth and our continued drive for results. Our entrepreneurial spirit remains strong across our global workforce, and we reinforce these principles in our five core values: 
 

Innovation: Figure out a better way
Execution: Get it done quickly
Integrity: Do the right thing
People: We make the difference
Collaboration: Accomplish more together
 These values guide all of our employees and are infused in all aspects of our Company. We are, as a team, united through these shared values and our mission to provide “a better way to pay.” 
 
 Our values foster an inclusive culture through the expectation that all employees will treat each other with respect and appreciate the diversity of identities, thoughts, backgrounds and styles. Our commitment to fostering an inclusive culture has never been more essential than in this moment of national reflection. We must always celebrate the diversity of our company and our communities. 
 
 We strongly believe that the quality and diversity of our workforce provide FLEETCOR with a competitive advantage, and that our problem-solving and solution-building efforts are greatly enhanced when we harness the collective thinking of a diverse group of people with unique experiences and perspectives. 
 

FLEETCOR’s COVID-19 Hiring Guidelines:
 Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are temporarily working from home. In addition, FLEETCOR implemented a virtual interviewing and hiring process, engaging with talent by phone or video and onboarding new employees remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together. 
 

Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer:
 FLEETCOR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. FLEETCOR provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, gender (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, language, ancestry, genetic information, veteran and/or military status or any other group status protected by federal or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation for the application and/or interview process, please notify a representative of the Human Resources Department. 
 
 For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity and pay transparency, please click the following links: EEO and Pay Transparency.

Title: Analyst, Digital Content and Channel Management
Description:
Category


     Data Analysis
    




City


     Ottawa, Toronto, Ontario, Canada
    







Job Description


     Analyst, Digital Content and Channel Management 
     
 Who we are
     
We are an organization comprised of industry thought leaders who are passionate about health data and want to make a difference in the health care field. We are an independent, not-for-profit organization and together with our partners we provide essential information on Canada's health systems, enabling decisions that lead to healthier Canadians. As a valued member of the CIHI team, you and your work will have a pivotal role in the evolution of Canada's health care systems.
 CIHI is recognized as an exceptional place to work that embraces diversity, respect, integrity, collaboration and innovation.
 At CIHI, we recognize what matters to our employees. Some of the benefits of working at CIHI include

 HOOPP Pension Plan (Defined Pension)
 Retirement Planning Program
 Generous vacation days for permanent and long-term contracts
 Work-life balance
 Career Planning Program
 Learning and Professional Development Program
 Flexible benefits program from your first day on the job for permanent and long-term contracts



 Why is this role important?
      The Analyst maintains CIHI’s secure online analytic tools (i.e. Portal and Insight) as well as support internal and external clients with using our digital tools for analysis and reporting. The Analyst implements digital standards and governance to support and maintain CIHI’s websites. The Analyst is a key member of a multi-disciplinary, matrix team that spans responsibilities for education/training, technical development and testing, documentation, reporting design, client focused support, digital content publishing, accessibility compliance and digital content management. This role works closely with the Digital Experience and Creative and Language Services teams. 
     
 What you'll do
      1. Completes regular user acceptance testing, quality assurance testing and maintenance activities for CIHI Websites, Portal and Insight, to ensure continuous quality improvement and adherence to digital standards including digital content publishing, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) standards, User Experience (Ux) Design Standards, archiving, Redundant Outdated and Trivial Content Policy (ROT) and Search Engine Optimization (SEO) – tagging, HTML/CSS.
     
 2. Supports internal and external use of Portal and Insight by responding to queries, participating in web conferences, developing and delivering user education, assisting in the development of reporting templates, GIS reporting, dashboard design and the creation of new analytical content in collaboration with program areas.
     
 3. Develops and maintains knowledge of CIHI's data holdings, methodologies, health master data assets, analytical reports, corporate data standards and digital governance standards, to maintain and support CIHI’s digital products.
     
 4. Performs the day-to-day tasks needed to edit and publish content within a CMS/template driven site environment (Drupal). Assists Senior Analyst with managing content and completing work requests efficiently.
     
 5. Supports CIHI’s accessibility implementation strategy. Performs full accessibility assessment for products development and enhancements. Assists Senior Analyst with providing guidance and support on accessibility design, implementation, and testing.
     
 6. Assists Ux team and designers with translating business requirements into meaningful and consistent experiences; conducting user research and usability testing; and preparing and documenting findings.
     
 7. Other related duties as assigned. 
     
 What you'll bring to the table
     
Undergraduate degree in health sciences, health information, health economics, computer science, information technology, digital delivery/publishing, statistics or similar field, or equivalent combination of experience and education. 


Minimum one to three years’ experience working in a health care-related, information management/processing environment.


Experience with business intelligence tools such as MicroStrategy, Cognos, Tableau or Business Objects and with Web production or digital content management/systems (Drupal)

 Working knowledge of HTML and CSS with a strong focus on Web standards including digital content publishing, Ux, archiving, ROT, SEO, Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0 (A and AA) and AODA.
     

Programming experience with data manipulation and statistical software, including SAS and/or SQL and experience manipulating and analyzing large relational databases.


Proficiency with Microsoft Office, especially Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.


Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills including the ability to communicate complex ideas in simple terminology.


Strong organizational and time management skills and demonstrated attention to detail.


Experience in the development and delivery of educational activities and knowledge of the principles of adult learning is an asset.


Ability to work as part of a matrix team.


Fluency in both official languages is an asset. 

 Closing Statement
     
To find out more about this role and other exciting opportunities visit our website at www.cihi.ca and check out our 'Careers' section.
 We thank all those who apply, however, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
 Vaccination remains the most effective tool to reduce the risk of COVID-19. CIHI is committed to ensuring the health and safety of our employees in the workplace, and therefore CIHI requires proof of vaccination for all of our employees unless a valid accommodation under legislation exists.


 Employment Equity
     
At CIHI we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.





Analyste au sein de la Direction de l’innovation numérique 
     
 Notre organisation
     
Notre organisation regroupe des leaders d'opinion de l'industrie qui sont passionnés par les données et veulent faire bouger les choses dans le domaine de la santé. À titre d'organisme autonome et sans but lucratif, nous collaborons avec nos partenaires pour fournir de l'information essentielle sur les systèmes de santé au pays, favorisant la prise de décisions éclairées qui visent à améliorer la santé des Canadiens. À titre d'employé de l'ICIS, vous jouerez un rôle déterminant dans l'évolution du système de santé canadien.
 Nous offrons un milieu de travail exceptionnel qui favorise la diversité, le respect, l'intégrité, la collaboration et l'innovation.
 L'ICIS, sachant ce qui importe à ses employés, leur offre une gamme d'avantages, dont les suivants : 

une structure salariale concurrentielle
 un régime d'avantages sociaux flexible dès le premier jour de travail
 l'adhésion au régime de retraite HOOPP
 un programme de planification de la retraite
 un équilibre travail-vie personnelle
 un programme de planification de carrière
 des programmes d'apprentissage et de perfectionnement professionnel



 Pourquoi ce rôle est-il important ?
      L’analyste tient à jour les outils analytiques en ligne sécurisés de l’ICIS (Portail de l’ICIS et outil Votre système de santé : En profondeur) et offre un soutien aux clients internes et externes qui utilisent nos outils numériques aux fins d’analyse et de production de rapports. Il contribue à la mise en œuvre des normes numériques et de la gouvernance en vue du maintien des sites Web de l’ICIS. L’analyste occupe un poste clé au sein d’une équipe matricielle multidisciplinaire dont les responsabilités couvrent la formation, le développement technique, la mise à l’essai, la documentation, la conception de rapports, le soutien à la clientèle, la publication de contenu numérique, les exigences en matière d’accessibilité et la gestion du contenu numérique. Il travaille en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de l’expérience numérique et des services créatifs et langagiers. 
     
 Quelles seront vos responsabilités ?
     
Mener régulièrement des essais d’acceptation par l’utilisateur et des activités de maintenance et d’assurance de la qualité ayant trait aux sites Web et au Portail de l’ICIS, ainsi qu’à l’outil Web Votre système de santé (VSS) : En profondeur, en vue d’assurer l’amélioration continue de la qualité et la conformité aux normes numériques (publication de contenu numérique, référencement naturel, balisage, langages HTML/CSS, archivage), à la Loi sur l’accessibilité pour les personnes handicapées de l’Ontario (LAPHO), aux normes de conception liées à l’expérience utilisateur et à la politique sur les pages Web redondantes, désuètes ou non pertinentes.

Offrir un soutien pour l’utilisation, à l’interne et à l’externe, du Portail de l’ICIS et de l’outil Web VSS : En profondeur en répondant aux demandes, en participant à des conférences Web, en élaborant et en présentant des séances de formation à l’intention des utilisateurs, en aidant à la conception de modèles de rapports, à la déclaration de données au système d’information géographique (SIG), à la conception de tableaux de bord et à la création de nouveau contenu analytique en collaboration avec les sections de l’ICIS.

Acquérir et maintenir des connaissances sur les banques de données, les méthodologies, les données maîtres sur la santé, les rapports analytiques, et les normes en matière de données et de gouvernance numérique de l’ICIS afin de tenir à jour les produits numériques de l’ICIS.

Appuyer la stratégie de l’ICIS sur l’accessibilité, notamment en effectuant une évaluation complète de l’accessibilité en vue de l’élaboration et de l’amélioration des produits et en offrant conseils et soutien quant à la conception, la mise en œuvre et la mise à l’essai des solutions d’accessibilité.

Aider l’équipe et les concepteurs responsables de l’expérience utilisateur à convertir les exigences opérationnelles en expériences significatives et cohérentes, effectuer des recherches sur les utilisateurs ainsi que des tests de convivialité, et préparer et consigner par écrit les résultats.

Assumer d’autres tâches connexes, au besoin. 

 Que mettriez-vous à profit ? 
     
Diplôme universitaire de premier cycle en sciences de la santé, en information sur la santé, en économie de la santé, en informatique, en technologie de l’information, en publication de contenu numérique, en statistique ou dans un domaine connexe, ou une combinaison équivalente de formation et d’expérience. 

Minimum de 1 à 3 ans d’expérience de travail dans un environnement de gestion et de traitement de l’information en lien avec les soins de santé.

Expérience des outils d’exploitation de données, comme MicroStrategy, Cognos, Tableau ou Business Objects, et des systèmes de gestion du contenu numérique ou de production de contenu Web (Drupal).

Connaissance pratique de HTML et CSS, plus particulièrement des normes Web, ce qui comprend la publication de contenu numérique, l’expérience utilisateur, l’archivage, la politique sur les pages Web redondantes, désuètes ou non pertinentes, le référencement naturel, les Règles pour l’accessibilité des contenus Web (WCAG) 2.0 (niveaux A et AA) et la LAPHO.

Expérience de la manipulation de données et de l’utilisation de logiciels statistiques, y compris SAS ou SQL, et expérience de la manipulation et de l’analyse de bases de données relationnelles d’envergure.

Maîtrise de la suite Microsoft Office, particulièrement Word, Excel et PowerPoint.

Entregent et excellentes aptitudes pour la présentation, dont la capacité de vulgariser des concepts complexes.

Minutie et excellentes aptitudes pour l’organisation et la gestion du temps.

Expérience de l’élaboration et de la présentation d’activités de formation et connaissance des principes d’apprentissage des adultes, un atout.

Capacité à travailler au sein d’une équipe matricielle.

Maîtrise de l’anglais essentielle; maîtrise du français, un atout. 

 Declaration
     
Pour en savoir plus sur cette offre ou sur d'autres excellentes possibilités, visitez-nous au www.icis.ca et parcourez notre section Carrières.
 Nous remercions tous les participants, mais nous ne communiquerons qu'avec les candidats retenus.
 La vaccination reste l’outil le plus efficace pour réduire le risque de COVID-19. L’ICIS s’engage à assurer la santé et la sécurité de ses employés au lieu de travail. Par conséquent, l’ICIS exige une preuve de vaccination pour tous ses employés, à moins qu’une mesure d’adaptation ne s’applique en vertu de la loi.


 Équité en emploi
     
L'ICIS s'engage à offrir un milieu de travail inclusif, sans obstacle et accessible. Il s'engage entre autres à prendre les mesures d'adaptation nécessaires en vue de favoriser une participation équitable aux processus de recrutement et de sélection. Par conséquent, si vous avez des besoins spéciaux, nous nous efforcerons d'y répondre.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Our client, the international leader in animal pharmaceuticals is looking for a talented and experienced Business Analyst for its Canadian operations.
This person will partner with commercial sales teams and provide value added insights on sales performance metrics, contract profitability and sales discount analysis to help drive the achievement of business goals. He/she will leverage core analytic skills to deliver for company brands and Business Units tasks like evaluation of opportunities, risks, ROI and provide ad hoc analyses to drive strategic commercial decisions.
This is a 1.5 year contract position with possibility of permanency. In lieu of benefits there will be a contract completion bonus.

Responsibilities
Provide strategic consultation to uncover commercial drivers and define solutions to address business requirements.
Partners with the commercial teams in the negotiation of customer contracts, providing analytic insight and ensuring that all agreements align with corporate standards and support the achievement of the operating plan forecasts.
Analyze sales information to prepare and present ROI analysis for business promotions and business partnership agreements.
Disseminating market dynamics and key learnings to commercial teams (e.g., weekly-monthly reports, sub-committee meetings, monthly presentations).
Support commercial teams in the implementation of new products , customer contracts and price updates.
Support Monthly sales close and reconciliation for marketing promotions and credits for Distribution centre.
Manage calculations and implementation of accruals for sales discount structures and offers.
Work autonomously across different software’s and platforms for data mining , data preparation and data cleansing to deliver high quality reports .
Working on special projects, as needed.
Qualifications
University degree (BA, BSc, BBA) or equivalent work experience with Business and Finance
Minimum 5 years’ experience as an Analyst in sales or Finance
General understanding of mathematical, analytic, finance and related concepts.
Minimum 3 years’ experience with order to cash processes and or data with ERP platforms like SAP or Oracle etc.
Strong accounting skills
Strong computer skills (e.g., BI Platforms, SQL, Excel, Microsoft Word, Microsoft Outlook, Salesforce.com )
English and French bilingualism
Our Client offers a generous compensation package and asks that all employees go above and beyond throughout their efforts. TALENT 300 Inc. thanks all applicants for their interest in the position. Those who meet the minimum requirements will be contacted and considered for the position.
Location Montréal

 Your challenge
 Un(e) analyste d’affaires chez Transit… ça fait quoi? :

 Participer aux activités de contrôle de la qualité.
 Gérer et développer des relations avec les unités d’affaire puis travailler avec eux en vue d’optimiser et d’améliorer notre intégration.
 Aider à la conception, à la documentation et à la gestion des processus système.
 Signaler les points faisant régulièrement l’objet de problèmes/questions techniques et formuler des recommandations auprès de l’équipe chargée des produits.


 Our Corporate Culture

 Our values: respect, pride, collaboration, fun

Title: Business Analyst (1-Year Contract)
Description:
Reporting to the Manager, IT Projects, Portfolio & Program Delivery, the Business Analyst’s role is to employ a customer centered approach to provide consulting to internal business partners with a responsibility for facilitating technology solutions within the Corporation to meet established objectives. They will work with internal and external business partners, in consultation with other Information Technology (IT) division staff, to determine requirements and develop specifications for the evaluation, acquisition and implementation of information technology solutions that meet their needs, improve existing processes and are compatible with the corporate application, data and technology architecture. The Business Analyst will play a pivotal role in ensuring IT’s understanding of business requirements and will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of IT system investments within the Corporation.


Key Responsibilities

Operational Management

Works closely with internal and external business partners to provide pro-active professional services with regards to the effective use of applications and technology
Elicits, analyzes, models, defines, verifies, prioritizes, documents, and validates the business needs of stakeholders while working through technology- related initiatives
Develops, standardizes, and maintains new or improved processes based on findings and analysis
Liaise with various business groups in the organization to facilitate implementation of new or improved business processes and/or technology solutions
Evaluates the impact of new releases of applications, legislative changes and changes in technology infrastructure on business partners and their existing business processes
Communicates process changes, enhancements, and modifications – verbally or through written documentation – to management, peers, staff, and other employees so that issues and solutions are broadly understood
Configures and update end user application permissions to facilitate changes and streamline business processes
Creates and modify ad-hoc reports as required to support data-driven analysis and decision making
Creates testing templates/plans, facilitates testing from a business point of view and compiles all training material for necessary for process or technology changes; assist with training as required
Create process models, specifications, diagrams and charts to provide direction to system analyst staff and/or external vendors
Assists with the development of budgets and timeframes for technology projects or process changes in order to support company objectives
Develops and utilize standard templates to accurately and concisely write requirements specifications. Assist in building out the BA practice
Translates conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/analysts and the project team
Works collaboratively with technical staff to: maintain awareness of existing applications, their interfaces, data, functionality and strategic life cycle requirements to determine the impact on business partners

Acquisition and Deployment

Assists in conducting research on software and hardware products to meet agreed-upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts
Participates in the Quality Assurance of purchased solutions to ensure features and functions have been enabled and optimized
Collaborates in the planning, design, development, and deployment of new applications, and enhancements to existing applications

Strategy & Planning

Partners with the project manager to define and align, initiative, plan, execute, monitor & control, and release projects
Collaborates with project sponsors to determine project scope and vision and align products, projects, portfolios and programs to the overall organizational strategy
Identify and meet with stakeholders that includes decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business, financial and operations requirements and systems goals during new technology implementations or major upgrades
Conducts needs assessment to identify problem or opportunity, assesses current state, determines future state, determines viable options & provides recommendation and assembles business case
Researches, reviews, and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of existing processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes
Supports key performance indicator development, execution and continuous monitoring
Performs cost-benefit and return on investment (ROI) analyses for proposed changes to aid management in making implementation decisions
Researches, reviews, and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements-gathering processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes


Education and Experience

Post-secondary diploma or university degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or Business Administration
Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) certification is required
Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA) or equivalent certification is required
Minimum of 3-5 years of related work experience as a Business Analyst with a focus on Information Technology (IT) initiatives. Experience within a municipality is preferred
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification and methodology development
Proven track record in establishing and maintaining productive relationships with business partners, consultants, vendors and staff
Strong communication, interpersonal, negotiation and motivational skills; ability to communicate technological principles and information to team members in an audience-friendly manner
Strong conflict resolution and problem solving skills
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Proven ability in successfully shifting priorities, demands and timelines in a fast paced, high pressure environment through analytical and problem solving capabilities
Strong knowledge of system and software quality assurance best practices and methodologies
Highly self-motivated & directed, with a keen attention to detail
Exceptional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills with an emphasis on customer service
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is considered an asset
Certifications in Change Management (CCMP or equivalent) is considered an asset
Experience with software applications such as; AMANDA Citizen Portal and VtaxProven
Proven ability to work through multiple time-sensitive or high-profile initiatives simultaneously
Knowledge and experience with analysis, reporting and project management software is an asset


Salary Range: $75,883- $94,854 (based on a 35-hour work week)

Title: Database Analyst (TFT - One Year)
Company: Newfoundland and Labrador Centre for Health Information
Description:
Competition Number: 2022 DBA 015 (please quote in application)
Location: St. John’s, NL
Salary Scale: $70,561.40-$83,155.80 (CG 42) (Classification under Review)
Closing Date: April 21, 2022
About Us
At the Newfoundland and Labrador Centre for Health Information (the Centre) we provide quality information to health professionals, the public, researchers, and health system decision makers. Through collaboration with the health system, we support the development of data and technical standards, maintain key health databases, carry out analytics and evaluation and support health research. We support the regional health authorities, as well as the patients and communities they serve, in the delivery of information technology (IT) and eHealth services applied in the healthcare system to provide quality care. Our mandate also includes the development and implementation of a confidential and secure provincial electronic health record as well as other provincial clinical information programs, including the change management required to support adoption by end user clinicians.
About the Role
We are currently looking for a Database Analyst to join our Data and Information Services team. You will be responsible for:
Working with stakeholders to understand data and information requirements, serving as a subject matter expert, and providing consultation to those requiring record-level data to support health information development
Technical leadership for database design, development, maintenance, and administration which support the data and information requirements of external researchers and the decision-making needs of the regional health authorities, Department of Health and Community Services and other government departments
Data and quality management by conducting data quality assessments on specified data sets; developing and executing action plans to address identified data quality issues in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders
Supporting and maintaining various analytic, business intelligence and database extract/transform/load (ETL) software applications
Development and maintenance of system user guides, data user guides, and other relevant documentation related to data holdings to support system operations, sustainability, and end users of the data
Acquiring, importing, and processing of source files from external organizations, transforming files into alternate formats as required and/or loading files into the data warehouse, and developing relational and dimensional data for various uses
Performing data management functions and supporting metadata development
Preparing data files for use by internal use or external data users, including creation of linked datasets, record-level reports and the de-identification of record level data as required
Liaising with multiple stakeholders including federal/ provincial/regional levels of government, the academic community, and professional agencies.
About You
Your education and experience include:
Degree or diploma in Health Informatics, Computer programming, Computer Science, supplemented by Oracle and MS SQL Server specific training
Minimum of three years’ experience in a highly complex technical IT environment in database design, development, and implementation
Experience collaborating with stakeholders within the health system
You have the following skills and abilities:
Experience in querying data using SQL, creating database objects and modeling data in an Oracle or SQL server environment is required.
Experience in supporting analytics applications such as SAS and SPSS
Experience with business intelligence tools such SAP Lumira and Crystal Reports or IBM Cognos
Experience in data extraction, setting up ETL processes and performing data linkages
Experience with health-related data and information systems (Meditech, CRMS, EMR, pharmacy network, hospitalization data, etc.)
Experience working with health data users to understand data and information requirements
Ability to function in high pressure, diverse and changing environment
Ability to multi-task across several projects
Ability to adapt thinking in response to change and challenge
Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills
Exceptional attention to detail
Effective time management and organizational skills
Self-motivated and able to work independently as well in a team environment
Effective oral and written communication skills
It would be an asset if you have:
Knowledge and experience with the use of regional health information systems such as Meditech, EMT software, CRMS, and HER applications.
Experience in utilizing and/or supporting machine learning tools such as Python and R.
Knowledge of cloud services related to data management, analytics, and data visualization tools.
Demonstrated equivalencies may be considered.
Other Information
We can offer you a respectful and engaging workplace that provides:
Meaningful work
Medical and dental benefits
A defined benefit pension plan
Flexible work arrangements (flex time, compressed, remote work)
Work-life balance
A generous paid leave program (six weeks)
An active social club
An employee and family assistance program
An innovative, energetic, and forward-thinking workplace culture
If you are interested in this challenging and rewarding career opportunity, please apply through https://www.nlchi.nl.ca/index.php/careers.
Please note: We frequently post or see our job ads on job aggregators, which are essentially search engines for job postings. In most circumstances these aggregator sites ask you to apply for the posted job directly on their platform and we will not directly receive your application. To ensure your application is received and reviewed, we kindly ask that if you have an interest in applying with NLCHI that you do so by visiting https://www.nlchi.nl.ca/index.php/careers.
We thank all candidates for their interest; however only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
Any offer of employment will be conditional upon completion of required background checks including acceptable professional reference checks, provision of a satisfactory certificate of conduct, confirmation of educational credentials, verification of full vaccination or approved exemption for COVID-19, and validation of legal entitlement to work in Canada, if applicable.
For more information, please visit www.nlchi.nl.ca.
Applicants agree that by providing personal information in response to this ad, they consent to the collection, use and disclosure of personal information required for the purposes of recruitment. Personal information will be used solely for the purpose of recruitment considerations for a period of one year following closing date of this competition, unless otherwise noted by the applicant.

Title: Senior Technical Analyst, Global Business Payments - Scarborough, ON
Description:
Requisition ID: 147473  Cost Centre: IMPLEMENTATION CLIENT SUPPORT  Employee Referral Program – Potential Reward: $1,000.00  We are committed to investing in our employees and helping you continue your career at Scotiabank.

 Senior Technical Analyst, Global Business Payments - Scarborough, ON (147473)

 Purpose The Senior Technical Analyst provides all aspects of operational and technical support for GBP’s customized electronic cash management platform, CCXLATE. CCXLATE (File Translation Platform) is used to deliver payment and reporting services to Scotiabank’s commercial and corporate customer base.

 Is this role right for you?

 Support the CCXLATE platform in a secure and efficient manner by providing second and third-level operational support (from scheduling jobs to troubleshooting and resolving application errors and maintaining databases). On a rotational basis, provide afterhours and holiday on call pager support
 Assist with the ongoing work to modernize the operational support of the environment. This will include, both working independently and closely with Information Technology and Security teams to design test and implement new Intel server hardware and software upgrades to the CCXALTE environment and related monitoring, alerting and support mechanisms
 Manage and develop virtual Windows images and the supporting virtual server environment. Transform business requirements into technology and/or operational upgrades for products and services. These upgrades will directly impact customer service levels
 Ensure that system upgrades are documented and maintain audit, compliance, and ITIL best practices to ensure that hardware and software are maintained consistently and in a repeatable manner. Develop and refine support and operational documentation and procedures
 Be an advocate for customer’s issues from an operational and support perspective
 Provide customer feedback to the Sales, Product and Technical Integration groups as a means to continually improve the platforms and services provided by the bank
 Responsible for notifying customers and relationship managers when there is a disruption in service and for providing updates during the outage

 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:

 Strong communication skills, both spoken and written
 Understanding of Data Centre operational processes, and procedures within an ITIL framework
 Expert understanding of GBP's products and services (especially CCXLATE). This includes all technical aspects and business logic/processing
 Knowledge of GBP’s customized solution onboarding process, solutions, and support model
 High degree of organizational and prioritization skills based on business and client impact
 Excellent interpersonal skills to continuously keep up to date with product and technology enhancements by leveraging both internal and external contacts
 Through understanding various Operating Systems, Office productivity tools, internet protocols, networking, security and encryption technologies, computer hardware, alerting and monitoring, and Be able to provide oversight (and be the escalation point for the team) with troubleshooting technical configuration and setup issues with products and services
 Assist in troubleshooting GBP’s payment and reporting customization platform - CCXLATE, leveraging a strong knowledge of GBP’s back end applications
 Understanding networking technologies (local and wide area networking, operating systems (Windows desktop and server OS, AIX, Linux, Red Hat, etc.), transmission control, and internet protocols (TCP, IP, SMTP, SFTP, SSH, etc.), security and encryption technologies (PGP, IPSEC, 3DES, RSA, etc.), Intel server-class hardware, monitoring (What’s Up Gold, HP Enterprise Insight Manager, alerting and monitoring (Splunk, SNMP, etc.) and backup and recovery technologies (Paragon), Virtualization (VMware VSphere, Control Centre, etc.), software imaging techniques and application job schedulers (VisualCron) and administrating Windows Active Directory and Group Policies
 Knowledge of relational and embedded database technologies (SQL Server, Microsoft Access). Be familiar with front end development tools and programming languages (Visual Basic, .NET, C sharp, and DOS batch files)
 Familiar with CCXLATE application from an operational and technical support perspective, and strong working knowledge of other GBP’s technology applications – Payment Centre, GWA, GCM, EDGE, JIRA, FTM, PIAP, PICS, and more


 Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Scarborough  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.  Note: All postings in me@Scotiabank will remain live for a minimum of 5 days.

Title: Auto Service Marketing Analyst
Description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.
Reporting to the Manager, Auto Service Marketing, the Auto Service Marketing Analyst is responsible for supporting the development of all auto service campaigns and programs, focusing specifically on implementation of the programs as well as the reporting and analysis associated with them. The Marketing Analyst will oversee and build out all reporting requirements (KPIs, data, format, channels, etc.), forecast and conduct in-depth analysis leveraging Co-star data to support the Senior Leadership team and teams across the organization with data-driven insights. The position is fundamental in supporting the execution of the auto service strategy, as well as assisting in building a view of the auto service customer.
To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. The Auto Service Marketing Analyst position is categorized as a Roamer, which means that the incumbent can successfully complete their role objectives virtually and are not required to be present on a CTC campus unless they choose to do so.
What you’ll do
Support the development and lead all elements of implementation of auto service marketing campaigns and programs
Develop all reporting requirements to properly measure and develop data-driven insights to improve all auto service programs and campaigns
Query, extract and transform raw data from multiple data warehouses to conduct key insight and in-depth analysis of promo performance, customers, and overall auto service business
Oversee data extracts and reporting dashboards for auto service and customer insights teams to translate complex data into actionable insights
Be a subject matter expert (SME) of Costar data across the company to influence decision making with data
Work on ad-hoc projects that leverage multiple aspects of data and reporting requirements that will drive informed business decisions and sales
Who you are
We are looking for high performing individuals who:
Have a very good understanding of the auto industry, specifically auto service (DIFM), able to apply marketing principles, experienced data warehouse and Costar Operating System user
Strong business acumen, including manipulating/understanding data and business case development
Can solve for business problems by translating challenges into in-depth data analysis
Collaborative team player with superior influencing skills, who builds relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward
Out of box thinker that strives to “get the job done”
Ability to communicate with people at all levels of the organization in a professional and competent manner
What you bring
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of education and experience: degrees in disciplines such as Business or Marketing are preferred
5+ years experience in a Marketing setting, developing, and implementing campaigns across various channels
5+ years experience using Data Warehouse, interpreting, and manipulating data to provide insights driven business recommendations
3+ years experience using the Costar Operating System in a retail environment
Advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Office Excel (power pivots, macro programming, etc.)
Superior interpersonal and communication skills (both written and verbal)
About Canadian Tire Corporation
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . To learn more follow us on LinkedIn .
CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice.
#LI-GM1
 Canadian Tire is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. We recognize that our future success depends on the perspectives and contributions of all our employees - their diverse backgrounds, abilities and experiences make our business stronger. If you are contacted for a job opportunity, please advise us of any accommodations needed to ensure fair and equitable access throughout the recruitment and selection process. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience. Automotive

Work at CBC/Radio-Canada
At CBC/Radio-Canada, we create content that informs, entertains and connects Canadians on multiple platforms. Our successes and accomplishments are driven by embodying and upholding values, which include creativity, integrity, inclusiveness and relevance.
Do you think you have the ability and drive to keep up with this exciting, ever-changing industry? Whether it be in front of the camera, on air, online or behind the scenes, you would be joining a team that thrives on making connections and telling stories that are important to Canadians.

Your role

Software knowledge: PowerPoint, Excel, Word and Google Workspace; knowledge of Adobe Analytics, Instar, Comscore and Power BI a definite asset

Title: Business Analyst (1-Year Contract)
Description:
Reporting to the Manager, IT Projects, Portfolio & Program Delivery, the Business Analyst’s role is to employ a customer centered approach to provide consulting to internal business partners with a responsibility for facilitating technology solutions within the Corporation to meet established objectives. They will work with internal and external business partners, in consultation with other Information Technology (IT) division staff, to determine requirements and develop specifications for the evaluation, acquisition and implementation of information technology solutions that meet their needs, improve existing processes and are compatible with the corporate application, data and technology architecture. The Business Analyst will play a pivotal role in ensuring IT’s understanding of business requirements and will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of IT system investments within the Corporation.


Key Responsibilities

Operational Management

Works closely with internal and external business partners to provide pro-active professional services with regards to the effective use of applications and technology
Elicits, analyzes, models, defines, verifies, prioritizes, documents, and validates the business needs of stakeholders while working through technology- related initiatives
Develops, standardizes, and maintains new or improved processes based on findings and analysis
Liaise with various business groups in the organization to facilitate implementation of new or improved business processes and/or technology solutions
Evaluates the impact of new releases of applications, legislative changes and changes in technology infrastructure on business partners and their existing business processes
Communicates process changes, enhancements, and modifications – verbally or through written documentation – to management, peers, staff, and other employees so that issues and solutions are broadly understood
Configures and update end user application permissions to facilitate changes and streamline business processes
Creates and modify ad-hoc reports as required to support data-driven analysis and decision making
Creates testing templates/plans, facilitates testing from a business point of view and compiles all training material for necessary for process or technology changes; assist with training as required
Create process models, specifications, diagrams and charts to provide direction to system analyst staff and/or external vendors
Assists with the development of budgets and timeframes for technology projects or process changes in order to support company objectives
Develops and utilize standard templates to accurately and concisely write requirements specifications. Assist in building out the BA practice
Translates conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/analysts and the project team
Works collaboratively with technical staff to: maintain awareness of existing applications, their interfaces, data, functionality and strategic life cycle requirements to determine the impact on business partners

Acquisition and Deployment

Assists in conducting research on software and hardware products to meet agreed-upon requirements and to support purchasing efforts
Participates in the Quality Assurance of purchased solutions to ensure features and functions have been enabled and optimized
Collaborates in the planning, design, development, and deployment of new applications, and enhancements to existing applications

Strategy & Planning

Partners with the project manager to define and align, initiative, plan, execute, monitor & control, and release projects
Collaborates with project sponsors to determine project scope and vision and align products, projects, portfolios and programs to the overall organizational strategy
Identify and meet with stakeholders that includes decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business, financial and operations requirements and systems goals during new technology implementations or major upgrades
Conducts needs assessment to identify problem or opportunity, assesses current state, determines future state, determines viable options & provides recommendation and assembles business case
Researches, reviews, and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of existing processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes
Supports key performance indicator development, execution and continuous monitoring
Performs cost-benefit and return on investment (ROI) analyses for proposed changes to aid management in making implementation decisions
Researches, reviews, and analyzes the effectiveness and efficiency of existing requirements-gathering processes and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes


Education and Experience

Post-secondary diploma or university degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or Business Administration
Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) certification is required
Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA) or equivalent certification is required
Minimum of 3-5 years of related work experience as a Business Analyst with a focus on Information Technology (IT) initiatives. Experience within a municipality is preferred
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification and methodology development
Proven track record in establishing and maintaining productive relationships with business partners, consultants, vendors and staff
Strong communication, interpersonal, negotiation and motivational skills; ability to communicate technological principles and information to team members in an audience-friendly manner
Strong conflict resolution and problem solving skills
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Proven ability in successfully shifting priorities, demands and timelines in a fast paced, high pressure environment through analytical and problem solving capabilities
Strong knowledge of system and software quality assurance best practices and methodologies
Highly self-motivated & directed, with a keen attention to detail
Exceptional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills with an emphasis on customer service
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is considered an asset
Certifications in Change Management (CCMP or equivalent) is considered an asset
Experience with software applications such as; AMANDA Citizen Portal and VtaxProven
Proven ability to work through multiple time-sensitive or high-profile initiatives simultaneously
Knowledge and experience with analysis, reporting and project management software is an asset


Salary Range: $75,883- $94,854 (based on a 35-hour work week)

Title: Sr Security Business Analyst
Description:
Company Description
At ServiceNow, our technology makes the world work for everyone, and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can’t wait, and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow, you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents, so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together, supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours, and it starts with you.
With more than 7,400+ customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2021 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies®.
Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.
Job Description
About Digital Technology
We’re not yesterday’s IT department, we're Digital Technology. The world around us keeps changing and so do we. We’re redefining what it means to be IT with a mindset centered on transformation, experience, AI-driven automation, innovation, and growth. We’re all about delivering delightful, secure customer and employee experiences that accelerate ServiceNow’s journey to become the defining enterprise software company of the 21st century. And we love co-creating, using, and highlighting our own products to do it.
Ultimately, we strive to make the world work better for our employees and customers—when you work in ServiceNow Digital Technology, you work for them.
We are hiring a Business Analyst to join our Threat Defence and Response Team to support our maturity and growth. Working with the Head of Security Operations Enablement, your main tasks will include capturing, managing and driving maturity efforts, performing detailed requirements analysis, documenting processes, and updating stakeholders on the progress of our initiatives.
To succeed in this role, you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to understand and communicate technical concepts to all audiences. You’ll have experience and/or a strong interest in Cyber Security, have an appreciation for security compliance requirements and be passionate about continuous improvement, particularly around business process. Experience in application workflow creation and management would also be hugely advantageous.
Business Analyst Responsibilities:
Evaluating both new and existing processes, identifying new requirements, recommending areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Leading ongoing reviews of these processes to ensure their continued maturity.
Driving best-in-practice standards across all areas.
Leveraging the power of our platform wherever possible.
Identifying process automation opportunities and driving them forward.
Supporting the team in relation to compliance and audit requirements.
Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.
Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and capturing action items, driving them to resolution.
Documenting and effectively communicating progress to cross-functional team members and management.
Creating, managing and communicating appropriate success metrics.
Supporting user acceptance testing to ensure smooth transition.

Qualifications
To be successful in this role:
A bachelor’s degree in business, related field, or an MBA and/ or a minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis or aligned role.
Experience working with Security Incident Response, Threat Detection and/ or other Cybersecurity teams is highly desirable.
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
End-to-end process management experience.
A track record of following through on commitments.
Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.
Excellent documentation skills.
Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.
Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
US Citizenship required
JV20
Additional Information
ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.
All new employees hired in the United States are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, subject to such exceptions as required by law. If hired, you will be required to submit proof of full vaccination or have an approved accommodation, by your start date. Visit our Candidate FAQ page to learn more.
If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.
For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.
Please Note: Fraudulent job postings/job scams are increasingly common. Click here to learn what to watch out for and how to protect yourself. All genuine ServiceNow job postings can be found through the ServiceNow Careers site.
Work personas
Work personas are categories that are assigned to employees depending on the nature of their work. Employees will fall into one of three categories: Remote, Flexible or Required in Office.
Required in Office
A required in office work persona is defined as an employee who is contracted to work from or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office. This persona is required to work from their assigned workplace location 100% of the work week based on the business needs of their role.
Flexible
A flexible work persona is defined as an employee who is contracted to work from or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office and will work from their assigned workplace location roughly 3 days/week or less (generally around 40-60% of the work week). Flexible employees may choose to work the remaining working time from their workplace location or home. Flexible employees are required to work within their state, province, region, or country of employment.
Remote
A remote work persona is defined as an employee who performs their responsibilities exclusively outside of a ServiceNow workplace and is not contracted or aligned to a ServiceNow-affiliated office, including those whose place of work (pursuant to their terms and conditions of employment) is their home. Remote employees are required to work within their state, province, region, or country of employment.

Title: Developer Analyst
Description:
Our Digital & Technology team wakes up every day with one goal in mind – to connect Canadians to the people and things that matter most. Collectively, we’re proud to support 30 million Canadians each month.
We manage a robust portfolio that champions the leading edge of technology and media. We drive projects that expand connectivity to underserved communities from coast-to-coast-to-coast; build and enhance our fixed broadband network to provide high-speed Internet, TV and Smart Home Monitoring; and support our world class wireless network, offering our customers Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network. As the Digital & Technology team, we are building our tomorrow, today.
Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada, Let’s make your possible.
Do you enjoy working on high-scale, complex, and high visibility projects and programs? If yes, consider the following opportunity:
Imagine working for an exciting company where employees are committed to meeting big challenges and making a real difference. That's Rogers. A leading communications and media company where people come to do great work. Right now, we are looking for talented individuals to join our winning team where you will have a chance to innovate, grow and to do what really matters.
As a Developer Analyst in Analytics & Insights team, the successful candidate will be responsible for internal RAN tool development leveraging ML and AI techniques.
What you will be doing:
Develop new features and optimize the code base for existing in-house tools used by RAN network engineering.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build, and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs.
Develop tools to leverage different datasets, on-prem and from cloud to enable RAN engineering teams drive insights.
Apply an analytical mindset and an entrepreneurial spirit to identify new ways to innovate with data.
Collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production.
Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization.
What you have:
Undergraduate or Graduate degree in computer science or related field.
2 to 4 years of software development experience within telecommunications or related domain.
Solid development experience with Python or R using various data science libraries such as Scikit-learn, Pandas, Numpy as well as frameworks like TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras.
Strong understanding of machine learning and AI, including classification, clustering, time series analysis, NLP and demand forecasting.
Experience with agile methodology, code review process and version control.
Strong understanding of SQL and Apache Spark.
Familiar with cloud technology (Azure, Databricks).
Strong aptitude for development and data analysis.
Ability to operate autonomously, within general direction guidelines.
Personal Competencies: Problem Solving / Judgment; Customer Service Orientation; Teamwork and Collaboration; Initiative; Achievement Orientation.
Highly motivated individual with great organizational and analytical skills.
Come be part of the team that launched the 1st and largest 5G network in Canada! We are looking for talented individuals to join our RAN Engineering & Innovation team. Our team believes in data-driven decision making which is a crucial piece in building the next generation of network infrastructure that will power the wireless technologies of tomorrow.
As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.
Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.
Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
