Title: Analyst, FP&A
Description:
At Canada Drives, we believe the experience of buying a vehicle should be easy and satisfying. Since 2010, we have used technology to simplify the process of finding the right vehicle for any Canadian of all financial circumstances. Through our online application process today we connect nearly half a million Canadians per year with dealerships across Canada.
For our next decade, we are excited to continue offering 100% online vehicle purchasing with a wide selection, great deals, and speedy at-home delivery. Our vision is that buying and financing a vehicle should be fair, fast, simple and seamless for all Canadians.
We are looking to add the role of Analyst, FP&A to our growing team. As part of this role you will support the Finance leadership team in key projects ranging from financial planning and analysis, corporate development, treasury, enterprise resource planning integration and other strategic finance initiatives.
We are excited to be offering this role and we want you to join our expanding team!
Job Description:

Develop, enhance and maintain complex financial models to support Canada Drives’ strategic business decisions
Prepare and analyze financial results to generate executive-level reporting including monthly performance analysis reports, board presentations and KPI dashboards driving key insights, recommendations, and actionable next steps
Perform ad-hoc analysis collecting and collating relevant organizational data using systems such as Netsuite, Salesforce, Tableau etc. into clear analysis reportable in various tools like Excel, Powerpoint, Google Docs & Google Sheets
Support the analysis of department and operating segment results and compare to monthly, quarterly and yearly plans and budgets
Identify and lead initiatives to continuously improve, standardize and automate forecasting and reporting tools and processes
Develop and update presentations for both internal and external audiences.
Effectively communicate financial concepts in an easy-to-understand manner to all stakeholders
Participate in a range of projects across the Finance organization, providing support to senior management and other team members


Qualifications:

Minimum of 3 years of experience in a Finance or Accounting-related analytical role
Degree, diploma, or certificate in Finance, Commerce, Business Administration, or a related field
Designated CFA/CPA or actively working towards a designation
Strong financial modeling, data analytics and variance reporting skills with the ability to translate the impact of analysis to the business
Expert knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of employees, management, and outside parties to maximize performance, creativity, problem solving and results
Excellent verbal and oral communication skills and ability to produce high-level external reporting


What you will bring to the role:

Excellent verbal, written and collaboration skills
Demonstrated ability to respond and effectively prioritize multiple priorities and requests
Strong critical thinking skills to identify issues, seek information, and problem solve
Positive attitude with a readiness to learn and a passion for process improvement
Comfortable with ambiguity and have the perseverance to thrive in a dynamic work environment
Self-motivated and able to pre-emptively anticipate questions from stakeholders


In addition to a competitive salary, we provide:

Extended dental and medical benefits
Opportunities for advancement
Excellent on the job training and development, including financial modeling
Sponsorship to pursue the CFA, CPA or equivalent designation
Inclusive, fun, and vibrant work environment


Work Environment:

Hybrid - this position is remote with the opportunity to be in-office at our downtown location if desired

Title: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description:
Job Description:
This is a permanent position. This rolecan be based out of either Calgary or Sherwood Park.

You will bring:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology, Business or Equivalent.
Business process reengineering experience, Six Sigma certification etc. is a plus.
ITIL certification desired
5+ years experience work experience as a Business Analyst with business systems / ERPs, especially the following modules:
Financials
HR
Payroll
Projects
SCM
Security
What would you be doing?
Act as a liaison between Information Systems and business areas/subject matter experts in Accounting, Finance, Project Services, HR, Payroll, SCM, and other teams. Analyze and assess current business processes and underlying systems/applications. Plan, elicit, capture, analyze and validate business, functional and technical requirements. Identify business needs and design solutions within an enterprise framework.
Evaluate and lead changes and smaller projects that integrate across complex business applications; designing and documenting specifications for system changes, system integrations, and making application configurations.
Develop all testing criteria, scripts, and test plans required to ensure that system changes and enhancements function as designed, including system, integration and user acceptance testing.
Help develop, implement, and continually improve processes for the management of incidents, changes, data, projects, security, knowledge base, contracts, auditing, and any other internal business processes.
Produce timely and high-quality requirements-related work products, including requirement specifications, process flows, mock-ups and qualifications.
Proficient in both traditional Waterfall SDLC and Agile / Lean methodologies, Microsoft Project, Office and Visio.
Leverage use of business intelligence for enterprise data reporting, analytics and dashboards to meet or anticipate business and executive needs.
Perform other duties as required or assigned which are reasonably within the scope of role
Does this sound like you?
Experience with IFS and/or UKG software is an advantage
Demonstrated experience with full SDLC software and hardware projects from a Business Analyst perspective and proven adherence to Business Analyst standards and best practices
Strong relationship management skills with internal clients (e.g. management, peers and colleagues); proven ability to develop collaborative approaches
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a continually changing environment
Ability to understand how systems integrate and interrelate and resolve complex integration issues.
Project experience: conceptualization, planning, leading or managing, traditional and agile methodologies
Knowledge with programming languages and technical tools, especially SQL, is a plus
Experience as an IT/Systems Business Analyst in an ERP environment is preferred.
Outstanding written and verbal communications skills, including documentation and presentations, for business and technical audiences
Experience with data management, integrations, business intelligence and analytics is a plus
Perks of the job
Competitive compensation.
RRSP Matching
Paid vacation
Company supplied benefits for you and your family
Other important details
As a condition of employment, qualified applicants who are offered, and accept the role must complete a satisfactory pre-employment Background Check. This may consist of all or a combination of the following: Canadian Criminal Record check, an Employment Verification and/or an Education and Accreditation Verification.
Candidates shortlisted will require to complete the Profile People Survey.
The purpose of the Profile People Survey tool is to assist ClearStream in understanding the behaviors of individuals with the objective of supporting the best use of their strengths, abilities, and potential.
Why ClearStream
We are the clear choice for rewarding opportunities and challenging careers. Joining our team would mean you would contribute to the quality of work we do and to the success of ClearStream along with the values we share. If you are driven, dedicated and have a passion for helping our customers bring resources to our world, then ClearStream is the team to join.
We are committed to creating a culture of equity, diversity, and inclusion, including fostering a safe and respectful environment that allows for diverse perspectives—a work environment in which all employees are valued and have an equal opportunity to achieve success. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected factors.

Title: Category Analyst - Canada
Description:
Category Analyst - Canada

At our Company, we grow People, Brands, and Businesses! We are seeking adynamicCategory Analyst to support the development of customer and client sales growth strategies by providing insightful analytics and shopper insights that support a mutually beneficial growth plan. The Category Analyst interfaces with customers, various members of the category management and customer development teams. The Category Analyst works to develop category review, prepare new item presentations, provides assortment and promotion analysis, and handle ad hoc requests.

Take this opportunity to join North America’s leading business solutions provider and build your career working with amazing people in a growing industry! Apply today!

What we offer:

Full-Time Benefits (Health, Dental, Disability, Life, Lifeworks Program)
PerkSpot Discounts on Travel, Movies, Cell Phones and more
Training and Career Development
Generous Paid Time-Off

Responsibilities:

Source data from syndicated, customer-specific and/or market resources.
Quantify, analyze, and interpret data.
Evaluate the reliability of source information by weighting raw data and organizing results for analysis.
Maintain project schedule by monitoring project progress, coordinating activities, resolving problems and make adjustments as needed to meet deadlines.
Organize information into presentation format by studying, analyzing, interpreting and classifying data.
Assist the management team as needed by participating in presentations to answer any questions regarding the data and data analysis information.

Qualifications:

Associate's Degree or equivalent experience required; Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience preferred
Working knowledge of syndicated data and applications
Analytical and Research Skills
Understand legal regulations within category management and work within compliance guidelines
Well-organized, detail-oriented, and able to handle a fast-paced work environment
Ability to ensure a high level of service and quality is maintained

The Company is one of North America’s leading sales and marketing agencies specializing in outsourced sales, merchandising, category management and marketing services to manufacturers, suppliers, and producers of food products and consumer packaged goods.The Company services a variety of trade channels including grocery, mass merchandise, specialty, convenience, drug, dollar, club, hardware, consumer electronics and home centers. We bridge the gap between manufacturers and retailers, providing consumers access to the best products available in the marketplace today.

The Company welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. The Company will provide reasonable accommodations, accessible formats, and communication support upon request to persons with disabilities who take part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process. If you require accommodation in connection with the application process, please contact: Recruiter, Talent Acquisition, for external applicants, or, a Supervisor for internal applicants.

Title: analyste de la gestion et de la gouvernance des données maîtres/ Master Data Management Analyst
Description:
McKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by Health Canada, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.

English version following

McKesson touche la vie des patients en œuvrant dans pratiquement tous les secteurs des soins de santé dans le but d’améliorer la santé en général. Chez McKesson Canada, nous créons un impact dans la vie de 12 millions de Canadiens, chaque jour. Nous distribuons plus de 35 000 produits à partir de 17 centres de distribution à 6 300 pharmacies de détail, 1 350 hôpitaux, centres de santé longue durée, cliniques et établissements de santé partout au Canada. Toutefois, nous sommes beaucoup plus qu'une entreprise de distribution. Nous avons automatisé 2 500 pharmacies de détail et distribuons annuellement plus de 100 millions de doses de médicaments grâce à nos solutions d'automatisation. Les fabricants, les fournisseurs de soins de santé et les patients comptent sur nous pour une gamme complète de services qui contribuent à la qualité et l'intégrité des soins de santé pour le bénéfice de tous.

À McKesson, vous participerez à la création de produits et de solutions qui contribuent à la réalisation de la mission de l’entreprise, soit améliorer la qualité de vie et faire progresser les soins de santé. Travailler ici représente une occasion d’édifier une industrie qui est vitale pour nous tous.

Résumé des fonctions

L'Analyste de la Gestion et de la Gouvernance des Données Maîtres est chargé d’assurer l'exactitude, l'exhaustivité, la cohérence et la conformité des données en fonction des besoins de l'entreprise, et ce, tout en développant et en surveillant via des audits, des contrôles de données, ainsi que la production de manière ponctuelle de divers analyses et rapports. Le rôle consiste de plus à analyser les données et les processus d’affaires actuels, d'identifier les inefficacités, et de faire la proposition de solutions et de plans d’améliorations auprès des parties prenantes de l'entreprise pour des mesures correctives. Le rôle exige d’être en mesure de travailler de manière indépendante et créative pour collecter et analyser les données, évaluer les exigences et mettre en œuvre des solutions pour les problèmes critiques liés aux données de base, tout en assurant l'alignement au sein de toutes les unités d'affaires de McKesson Canada.

Section A – Responsabilités spécifiques

Les devoirs et responsabilités comprennent généralement, mais sans s’y limiter :

Responsable d’assurer la qualité des données de base et de développer de nouveaux moyens de contrôle. Analyser toute non-conformité relative aux objectifs de gouvernance des données maîtres et assurer des mesures correctives au besoin. Développer des rapports et une base de données en utilisant les données SAP et autres systèmes ERP, tout en assurant l’efficacité et l’analyse des processus pour identifier les problèmes nécessitants des correctifs. Élaborer, mettre en œuvre et maintenir une surveillance de la gouvernance et des KPI pour mesurer de manière adéquate les objectifs. Responsable de surveiller et d’assurer le respect des divers processus relatifs aux données maîtres et ce, en ligne avec la vision. Faire la recherche et l’analyse des résultats selon les besoins de l’entreprise. Effectuer diverses analyses et déterminer au besoin des recommandations pour l’amélioration des processus du département. Analyser les données et organiser les informations de manière structurée et significative, et diffuser les informations et les rapports aux parties prenantes concernées. Identifier les solutions commerciales liées aux problèmes de données, et agir à titre de contact clé pour les questions relatives à ces problèmes spécifiques. Orchestrer les différents suivis selon les besoins. Soutenir les efforts et les projets d’améliorations en fournissant des données pour évaluer les opportunités et les possibles ajouts aux bases de données maîtres. Publier les performances des KPI à l’équipe de travail et aux parties prenantes concernées. Soutenir les activités d’intégration de nouveau personnel, ainsi qu’assurer la formation des membres actifs de l’équipe sur les changements de systèmes et/ou de processus. Agir en tant qu’expert en la matière pour la gestion des données de base liées aux fonctions actuelles. Assister aux réunions interdépartementales clés et soutenir la nécessité et l’interprétation des besoins en matière de rapports. Assurer la liaison avec la direction pour informer et communiquer les résultats des initiatives clés. Faire des recommandations au Chef Principal Gestion des données Maîtres concernant les mesures à prendre pour l’amélioration continue des processus dans le cadre de la qualité des données de base. Effectuer toutes autres activités ad hoc au besoin.

Section B – Responsabilités générales

Jouer un rôle dans la résolution des problèmes qui nécessitent une solution inter-fonctionnelle; faciliter les meilleures pratiques d’affaires.
Posséder une autorité décisionnelle et une autonomie visant à résoudre de manière efficace tout problème possible lié à la production, aux processus, ainsi qu’aux problèmes techniques.
Établir des relations interdépartementales avec les autres parties prenantes pour obtenir leur soutien et maintenir des relations positives ayant un impact significatif sur le succès de MDM.
Assurez-vous de respecter et d’adhérer aux politiques et procédures de l’entreprise.
Trouver et mettre en œuvre des opportunités d’amélioration continue tout au long du mandat.
Communiquer efficacement avec les membres de l’équipe pour s’assurer que les besoins opérationnels des clients internes soient satisfaits.

Section C – Exigences du poste

Baccalauréat en commerce, science ou informatique ou expérience professionnelle pertinente.
5-7 ans d’expérience dans le domaine de la gestion et de l’analyse des données.
Compétence en leadership.
Compétence d’influence.
Capacité à travailler dans un environnement en rapide évolution.
Excellentes compétences relationnelles et interpersonnelles.
Excellentes compétences en communication verbale et écrite.
Connaissance de MS Office, Gestion de base de données, outils statistiques, y compris des compétences avancées dans Excel, MS Access, ainsi que SQL et VBA.
Connaissance de SAP / Vistex est considéré comme un atout.
Connaissance de AS400, MBA est considéré comme un atout.
Bilingue français et anglais.
McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. At McKesson Canada, we touch the lives of 12 million Canadians every day. We carry more than 35,000 products in 17 distribution centers and ultimately provide distribution to 6,300 retail pharmacies, 1,350 hospitals, long-term care centers, clinics and institutions all over Canada. But we're so much more than a distribution company. We've automated 2,500 retail pharmacies and dispense over 100 million doses a year through our automation solutions. Manufacturers, healthcare providers and patients count on us for a full range of services that contribute to the quality and safety of care for us all.

At McKesson Canada, you’ll help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.

Job Summary

The Master Data Management Analyst is responsible to ensure data accuracy, completeness, consistency and conformity according to business requirements, by developing and monitoring audits, data controls, as well as routine and ad-hoc delivery of analytics and reports. This includes performing business process and data analysis, identifying gaps and inefficiencies, and proposing solutions and plans to streamline, as well as following up with business stakeholders for corrective action. The role involves working independently and creatively to collect and analyze data, assess technical requirements, and designing and implementing solutions for critical issues related to master data, all the while ensuring alignment within all McKesson Canada business units.

Section A – Specific Responsibilities

Duties and responsibilities generally include but are not limited to:

Responsible to ensure master data quality and develop new means of data quality control. Analyse any non-compliance to data governance objectives and ensure corrective action is taken Develop reports and database, using data from SAP and other ERP systems, ensure process efficiency and analysis to identify issues requiring resolution Develop, implement and maintain governance oversight and KPI to successfully measure data governance objectives Responsible for monitoring and ensuring the adherence to the master data process vision Investigates and analyzes results from business data needs Perform analysis and propose recommendations for department process improvement Analyze data and organize information in a structured and meaningful way, and circulate information and reports to applicable business stakeholders Identify business solutions related to data issues, defect clarification, and act as key point of contact for application questions and orchestrate follow-up as required Support business improvement efforts and activities by providing data to evaluate opportunities and additions to master databases Publish KPI performance to work team and appropriate stakeholders Support on-boarding activities, as well as coaching team members on system and process changes Act as the subject matter expert for master data management related to current functions Attend key cross-functional meetings and support the establishment and interpretation of management reporting needs Liaise with management to inform and communicate outcome of key initiatives. Makes recommendations to Sr. MDM Manager regarding action towards continuous improvement of processes within the quality of master data Perform other ad-hoc activities as required

Section B – General Responsibilities

Play a role in resolving issues that require a cross-functional solution; facilitate sharing of best practices.
Has decision-making authority and autonomy to solve production, processes and technical issues and resolve conflicts in an effective manner.
Build cross-functional relationships with Internal Stakeholders to gain support and maintain positive relationships significantly impacting the success of MDM.
Ensure to respect and adhere to company policies and procedures.
Find and implement opportunities for continuous improvement throughout the assigned process
Communicate effectively with applicants to ensure that the operational needs of internal clients are met

Section C – Position Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Business, science or computer science or relevant professional experience.
5-7 years of experience in the field of data management and analysis.
Leadership competency.
Influencing skills.
Ability to work in a fast paced changing environment.
Excellent interpersonal relationship skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Knowledge of MS Office, database management, statistical tools including advanced skills in Excel and MS Access, as well as SQL and VBA
Knowledge of SAP/Vistex, are considered an asset.
Knowledge of AS400, MBA, are considered an asset.
Bilingual French – English.
Career Level – IC – Professional – P3

Worker Type
Regular

Join us at McKesson!

Title: ServiceNow Analyst
Description:
Our client is one of the largest renewable owners, operators and developers in the U.S., delivering innovative, renewable power solutions that accelerate the world towards a sustainable, low-carbon future. They provide an unparalleled opportunity to lead and manage one of the largest renewable energy businesses with decades of history while contributing to the global need for sustainable energy. Our client offers many career opportunities with current U.S. assets under management valued at $20 billion. They are currently looking for a ServiceNow Analyst to help with the configuration and implementation of ServiceNow within the organization.

As the ServiceNow Analyst, your role will be to assist with the set up, testing, and execution of ServiceNow within the organization. Reporting to the Business Applications Manager, your will part of the solutions team to help understand business requirements and ongoing needs. You will be expected to analyze user requirements, automate processes and workflows and address scheduling limitations throughout development and delivery of the ServiceNow roadmap. The Analyst will be responsible for the ongoing review of new ServiceNow modules and ensure tool are continuously up to date and the most current. The ServiceNow Analyst will take the lead on ensuring proper documentation and test cases are in place. You will create and configure Business Rules, Scripts, UP policies and actions and advanced scripting. You will be expected to configure Notifications, UI Pages, UI marcros etc. in ServiceNow. Ability to collaborate with vendors to ensure design accuracy and interface across the organization will be needed to collect and analyze data and maintain all documentation for processes. Finally, the ServiceNow Analyst will define all functional and non-functional requirements, create ServiceNow reports and dashboards, configure the current system, implement new modules as needed, and all system testing.

The Ideal Candidate will bring a minimum of 2 years of ServiceNow experience building, development and designing systems through to implementation. You will bring a thorough knowledge or ITIL and ITSM processes and a certification in ServiceNow or ITIL would be considered a huge asset. You will be able to demonstrate how you have engaged in a ServiceNow project from start to completion and bring the ability to work with stakeholders, vendors, customers and colleagues across the organization and help influence change. You will be able to explain how ITIL processes can be implemented within ServiceNow and discuss your experience with Incident Management, Change / Problem / Asset Management, Service Catalog, and Outage Modules. You will know how to work in a challenging environment that may be ambiguous at times but your strong communication and ability to work with cross functional units to work towards continuous improvements is expected. Extensive proficiency and experience with SDLC and ability to prioritize your tasks and work in a fast paced and pressured environment is required. Strong problem solving capability and capacity to learn on the job while applying past experiences is expected.

What will make you stand out :
2+ years of ServiceNow experience

5 years in software development

Ability to work with stakeholders and cross functional units

Experience working within a changing environment

Comfortable as a change agent

Please contact us a pboth@recruitinginmotion.ca if you love working within ServiceNow but feel you want a more progressive and dynamic environment to do it in. Come join this fantastic, growing organization and be part of something special and cutting edge.

Title: eCommerce BI Analyst
Description:
Our Data Science & Marketing Insights team is looking for a BI Analyst who is specialized in eCommerce and has experience in data analysis, reporting and visualization. We are looking for someone who is passionate about analysis and data, a well as curious and resourceful, to support our Marketing teams. Your sense of initiative and innovation will lead you to develop performance indicators, dashboards and tools to better understand purchase behaviors, current trends and campaign effectiveness. You will conduct further studies that you will have to present and explain. You will act as the SME for everything relating to the transactional aspect of the eCommerce section, and you will be able to make recommendations to the various teams based on your analyses and findings. You will also work together with the eCommerce web analyst to enhance your analyses.

As a BI Analyst, you will join the ranks of a young, dynamic, passionate and dedicated team. You will have the chance to benefit from a variety of expertise to support you in your work, improve your knowledge and develop your expertise. You will also be called upon from time to time by your colleagues to assist in the production of reports and analysis on other subjects, or to collaborate on other projects.

YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Measure and analyze the performance of the online commerce from different angles, such as the effectiveness of marketing campaigns, consumer behaviors and consumer purchase profiles (basket/category analysis)

Define performance indicators and develop a range of tools such as dashboards, visualizations and reports to make the information relevant to decisions accessible;

Conduct and present further analyses on more specialized subjects or business issues;

Collaborate with various teams, including the eCom and Omni Channel teams, and support them in the analysis and interpretation of data and results;

Interpret trends, synthesize information, identify and present insights, suggest areas for improvement;

Compile all documentation related to the tasks performed

Support the immediate team with any other analysis or project tasks;

YOUR QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS

2–3 years of relevant experience, preferably in a data analysis role;

Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (analytics, electronic commerce, marketing)

Knowledge of data science and programming languages (Python, R) is an asset

Great ease in working with Excel and the use of advanced functions

Experience in creating reports and visualizations (data import, modelling, visualization)

Knowledge of PowerBi or other visualization software (Tableau)

Knowledge of DAX language (asset)

Experience with SQL database environments

Ability to perform simple queries using the SQL language

Excellent communication skills (French and English)

WELCOME TO BRP

We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce of almost 20,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey. Yours.

#LI-EF1

Title: Corporate Development Analyst
Description:
The Ballard Strategy and Development team is seeking a Corporate Development Analyst. This professional will be a key business partner to senior leadership and will be highly visible at the most senior levels of Ballard. The ideal candidate enjoys diving deep into complex problems, works effectively with cross-functional teams and thrives in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Responsibilities:
Support the Strategy & Corporate Development team as they evaluate prospective strategic initiatives (M&A, direct investments, joint ventures, strategic partnerships, organic growth plans, and fund investments)
Screen prospective investments based on criteria such as strategic rationale, industry position, competitive differentiation, valuation and business plan
Perform valuation analysis on target companies utilizing multiple approaches
Create and manage financial models and valuations
Develop investment screening documents on acquisition targets and/or investments
Track and maintain virtual data rooms containing diligence materials
Responsible for managing and updating M&A related documents and trackers
Responsible for gathering market information and performing market research on the hydrogen landscape and analyzing industry trends
Perform financial/data analysis and evaluate the hypotheses/trends concerning market segments, geographies, products, etc.
Summarize market research, data, and strategic analysis in reports to Ballard’s senior leadership
Monitor and report on the financial performance of investments and acquisitions after closing
Support the annual corporate planning process as required
Collaborate with other Functional teams to develop analysis to support organic growth opportunities
Requirements:
The ideal candidate will have demonstrated competencies in business case and other financial analysis. They will possess solid interpersonal skills and have the aptitude to link detailed financial models with higher level strategic themes. It is expected the candidate can utilize a range of data and information sources to perform analysis and generate impactful management reports.
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, Science, Engineering or other related field
0-2 years corporate development, private equity, management consulting, investment banking, or investment research experience
Strong self-starter comfortable as a team player or working independently
Previous work experience in pertinent financial role and understanding of various valuation techniques such as DCF, precedent transactions and public market comparable analysis
Strong ability to develop driver-based free cash flow (FCF) models including net present value (NPV) & return on investment (ROI) analysis
Strong analytical, financial, and presentation skills
Ability to gather large amounts of data and information and synthesize findings into clear conclusions
Capable of using informal approaches for data gathering and willingness to search for hard-to-find data
Proficient with MS Office software complimented by advanced Excel and PowerPoint capability
Experience with excel add-in software or macros is an asset
Experience in industrial, automotive, clean tech, energy or manufacturing businesses is an asset
Progress towards or enrollment in a Professional business designation (CA, CBV, CPA, CFA) is an asset
Experience with Capital IQ, or similar data services also an asset

Our Values
Listen & Deliver | Quality. Always. | Inspire Excellent | Row Together | Own It
Ballard values diversity in the workplace and is committed to Employment Equity.
We encourage applications from all qualified candidates.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
At ICBC, it’s our job to make sure the car insurance system works for all British Columbians, today and in the future. If you want

to make the most of your skills and expertise while growing your career, we want you. A career at ICBC is an opportunity to be

part of a talented, diverse and inclusive team that is driven to serve its customers and community. You can expect a competitive

salary, comprehensive benefits and a collaborative work environment. If you are reliable and dependable, contact us today to be

part of our talented and diverse team as we work together to create an insurance system we can all be proud of.

We welcome applications from all qualified job seekers. If you are a job seeker with a disability, please let us know as

adjustments can be made to help support you in delivering your best performance.

Business Systems Analyst – Applications(Driver Licensing & Govt Bus Sol)

Job Title: Business Systems Analyst Reference Number: 115920

Location: Victoria Employment Type: Permanent Full Time

Hours of Work: 7.5 hr Day Shift (M-F) Posted Date: 2022/04/14

Position Highlights

ICBC is committed to delivering consistently high quality customer service to all British Columbians. If you are reliable and

dependable, we welcome you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

The Information Services Division is currently looking for Business Systems Analysts to join our applications teams. In this role,

you will assist the business in the analysis and remediation of issues.

Specifically, you will:

Document systems and acceptance criteria based on business requirements
Work collaboratively within a cross-functional team and facilitate business and technical discussions/ workshops and other

activities


Clearly articulate requirements, proactively collaborate with team, and facilitate development and testing activities to ensure the

solution meets the business need


Provide data to business stakeholders for investigation and remediation
Establish and maintain positive relationships with stakeholders
Identify root cause of defects/incidents and communicate resolution.

Position Requirements

This position will require someone who has 2+ years of hands-on experience in Business Systems Analysis or relevant

post-secondary education. The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications:


Experience in identifying and understanding client needs, validating with key stakeholders and evaluating alternative solutions
Hands-on experience in SQL/Oracle and process mapping tools (e.g. Visio)
Demonstrate basic knowledge of different requirement gathering techniques and basic understanding of UI and design

principles, functional and non-functional requirements


Hands on experience in following an Agile methodology
Ability to plan, prioritize and complete multiple concurrent tasks in an environment of changing deadlines, priorities and

requirements


Effective written and oral communication skills
Demonstrated critical thinking, problem solving and learning agility
Ability to work without supervision and in a cross-functional team environment
Exposure to Guidewire PolicyCenter, Guidewire ClaimCenter, JIRA, HPSM, and/or SharePoint is an asset
Understanding of basic testing techniques would be an asset.

Position Information

Please note only those legally entitled to work in Canada at present will be considered for this position

As announced by the Provincial government, all ICBC employees will be required to show proof of full Covid-19 vaccination.

Title: Data Engineer, Business Intelligence - Data & Analytics
Description:
At Equitable Life of Canada, we realize that your work life is not just about performing a job; it's about being part of a workplace that helps you grow and reach your full potential. Within our friendly and collaborative work environment, we recognize that the key to our growth and success is a dedicated, motivated and customer-responsive staff. Join Equitable Life today.

Reports To: AVP, Data & Analytics
Flexible Work Options Available: Temporary full-time remote working is available due to Covid-19. In the future, post-pandemic, this role will require some onsite work at Waterloo head office on a hybrid basis

Equitable Life is seeking a talented, data-driven Data Engineer, Business Intelligence to join our team. In this role, you will play a pivotal role for defining and deploying the data solutions to support business decisions. This includes defining the back-end systems for data persistence and usage, infrastructure for data presentation (dashboards, BI tooling, etc.), the infrastructure for data hygiene and to support the evolving data governance strategy.

You will be responsible for developing and maintaining data infrastructure for reporting and analytics, capable of interpreting complex data sets, performing data modeling and translating metrics into actionable recommendations. Strong communication skills and a familiarity working with data visualization tools, data warehouses, DevOps, data pipelines, web services and the ability to present complex information to multiple levels and roles within the organization, will be an asset.

Come join one of Waterloo Region’s Top Employers for 2022!

What you'll do:

Work closely with the business and technical teams to identify the definition and analysis of how information assets drive business outcomes
Apply detailed knowledge and hands-on experience of data structures, data pipelines, deployment pipelines, data modeling, and data warehousing strategies to contribute to the development and maintenance of business intelligence and reporting tools and solutions.
Own the documentation of how data is turned into knowledge to support business decisions and possess a keen understanding of the business environment
Create and manage data models in all their forms including conceptual models, relational database designs, and others.
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Create and manage deployment pipeline architecture and infrastructure related to Business Intelligence solutions.
Support enterprise solutions across various business teams.
Lead in the building and implementation of BI solutions.
Act on behalf of the team as a subject matter expert for business and technical projects.
Assist with team mentoring on project and operational processes

What you'll need:

3+ years of experience with SQL querying large data sets from multiple sources and developing automated reporting
5+ years of experience with building and/or administrating data warehouse or data system architecture and familiarity with ETL’s and scripting
3+ Experience building and optimizing data pipelines, data architectures and data sets.
3+ years of experience with BI software programs such as Birst, Tableau, Oracle, Cognos, or Microsoft Power BI
3+ years of experience with Advanced Excel for analyzing data
5+ Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C#, etc.
5+ Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
3+ Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
Post-secondary education in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Applied Math or related fields

To learn more about Equitable Life, we encourage you to explore our organization.

At Equitable Life, we are committed to providing equal access to employment opportunities across our organization. Please contact our HR team at careers@equitable.ca if you would like to receive our job postings in an alternative format or require an accommodation with the application process.

Title: Workforce Management Analyst (RFT 1.0)
Description:
Requisition Details:
Employment Status: Regular, Full Time (1.0 FTE)
Program Name: Workforce Management
Number of Hours Bi-Weekly: 75
Work Schedule: Days
Location: Central East
On Call: No
Job Summary:
The Workforce Management Analyst (WFMA) is responsible for forecasting workload requirements for their respective sites and developing staff rotations that align with the collective agreement and meet each site’s program needs. This position is responsible for supporting the Manager Workforce Management with implementing and maintaining the Workforce Management (WFM) framework and process within the province.
Key Responsibilities:
Responsible for following the WFM processes including forecasting, developing optimal rotations, and capacity planning for all Home Care Programs.
Facilitates site weekly and monthly WFM production meetings.
Promotes workforce management process to all stakeholders across the site and provides awareness of WFM framework.
Participates in process improvement with Manager Workforce Management and other stakeholders updating, documenting the WFM training manual.
Conducts Ad hoc and regular data analysis to identify opportunities to improve effectiveness & efficiencies, as part of defined projects.
Provides necessary notice/recommendation to site management related to hiring and training new service providers and CSA’s in order to maintain appropriate and cost efficient FTE counts.
Possesses in-depth understanding of KPI performance for all sites and provides recommendations for improvements.
Conducts analysis and develops rotational schedule and communication with the union groups and appropriate staff.
Ensures developed schedules are in compliance with the collective agreement specific to the program.
Provides support and input for future Collective Agreement negotiations.
Participates in site labor management meetings.
Trend visits volume patterns and adjusts staffing levels accordingly.
Monitors trends of turnover to use data for future forecasts.
Provides data and reports to support the annual budget preparation process and funder reports as required.
Other duties assigned by the Manager Workforce Management.
External and Internal Relationships:
Collaborates effectively with the workforce management, site staffing administrator and site management team.
Provides guidance to DED/SNR Manager and Nurse Managers in all areas relating to Workforce Management.
Facilitates discussions with relevant internal and external stakeholders to determine requirements of programs and projects.
Education, Designations and Experience:
Post-Secondary education in a Business Program.
3 years previous experience in workforce oversight including a minimum of 1 year experience creating and maintaining rotations and/or schedules.
Demonstrated experience in the health care system.
Experience with a unionized environment is considered an asset.
Skill Requirements:
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills.
Capable with Business Intelligence applications.
Knowledgeable of the WFM frame work and related tools such as Procura, Cognos, and WFM Excel Macros.
Excellent communication skills.
Strong attention to detail.
Other:
A current and original copy of a satisfactory Criminal Records Check.
A Vulnerable Sector Search and/or Child Abuse Registry Check may be required.
Ability to speak French is an asset in French Designated areas.
The use of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) may be required
Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities: fast-paced environment; attention to detail; lift and carry using appropriate lifting techniques; walk, sit, stand, and climb stairs; grip and fine hand movements.
VON Canada is committed to meeting the needs of persons with disabilities and to providing accessibility accommodations for candidates who require them. If you are in need of accessibility support, please visit our website at http://www.von.ca/en/accessibility for further details.

Title: Analyst – Raw Materials / Analyste de catégorie – Matières premières
Description:
(English follows)


Analyste de catégorie – Matières premières

Poste clé au sein d’une organisation d’approvisionnement mondiale et diversifiée;
Expérience antérieure auprès de multinationales
Poste situé à Montréal, au Québec

Au sujet du poste

Tout progrès commence avec des pionniers. Chez Rio Tinto, cela commence avec vous.

Nous sommes à la recherche d’un analyste de catégorie pour notre organisation d’approvisionnement, au sein de l’équipe des matières premières, basée à Montréal, au Québec.

Les principales responsabilités comprennent, sans s’y limiter, la gestion de la chaîne d’approvisionnement, des bons de commande, de l’expédition, de l’inventaire et des rapports sur le rendement. L’analyste devra structurer l’analyse des dépenses, être responsable de la gestion des données et participer aux prévisions de toutes les catégories relevant de l’équipe : électrodes de graphite, anthracite, cathodes, fluorure, réfractaires, acier et cuivre. Au sein de l’équipe des matières premières, l’analyste peut être amené à participer à toutes les étapes du cycle d’approvisionnement, de l’analyse de la base de données factuelle au lancement du processus d’appel d’offres, en passant par l’analyse et la participation à la gestion des contrats.

Ce rôle est une excellente occasion pour un professionnel de l’approvisionnement qui a une expérience crédible, a une volonté de relever des défis d’approvisionnement complexes, peut avoir une vue d’ensemble des choses et cherche à obtenir des résultats en procurant une valeur soutenue et tangible.

Pour réussir dans ce poste, vous devrez posséder ce qui suit :

Être capable d’établir un haut niveau de confiance et de travailler dans un environnement matriciel : développer de solides relations avec les parties prenantes internes afin de mieux soutenir les exigences commerciales;
Établir et gérer des relations de collaboration avec les utilisateurs finaux ainsi qu’avec les collègues de la logistique, de l’analyse du marché, des finances, des comptes fournisseurs, etc. au sein de l’organisation commerciale;
Permettre la mise en œuvre de la stratégie grâce à une communication efficace.
Participer à l’élaboration de stratégies de catégories inspirantes pour accroître la valeur qui permettra d’avoir un avantage concurrentiel et satisfaire les exigences en matière de gouvernance de Rio Tinto;
Soutenir ou gérer des activités de chaîne d’approvisionnement, dont le volume d’essai, le suivi de la qualité, la résolution de problème, l’entretien des bases de données pour planifier la demande, l’inventaire et le suivi du fonds de roulement;
Analyser les données du marché pour nourrir le modèle du coût total et présenter les dépenses prévues le plus exactement possible; Effectuer l’analyse des données menant à des analyses de rentabilisation exactes, à la prestation de prévisions mensuelles des dépenses et à des rapports sur les dépenses et les économies réalisées;
Gérer l’arrivée de nouveaux fournisseurs, émettre les bons de commande et accélérer l’arrivée des commandes des fournisseurs;
S’occuper des rapports de rendement et de la gestion des systèmes;
Gérer et régler les problèmes liés aux comptes fournisseurs;
Soutenir l’élaboration de la stratégie de catégorie et déterminer de nouvelles occasions de réaliser des économies et des améliorations en lien avec le coût total de la propriété, l’inventaire et le fonds de roulement de commerce.

Votre contribution


Pour que votre candidature soit considérée à ce poste, vous devrez remplir les exigences suivantes :

Baccalauréat en commerce, affaires, finances, génie ou l’équivalent;
Expérience antérieure au sein de multinationales dans l’industrie de l’exploitation minière, de la fabrication ou de l’automobile;
Au moins 5 années d’expérience en approvisionnement, en chaîne logistique et en commerce;
Maîtrise de SAP, d’Excel et d’Ariba;
Aptitudes marquées pour la gestion de projets, la résolution créative des problèmes, l’amélioration continue et la gestion des relations avec les clients et les fournisseurs;
Capacité d’obtenir des résultats grâce à des partenariats, à la collaboration et à une influence positive;
Grandes aptitudes analytiques et capacité de recueillir et de compiler des données avec efficacité;
Capacité à préparer des rapports clairs et concis en vue de la prise de décisions, notamment des analyses de scénarios et des compromis;
Capacité de communiquer avec concision, verbalement et par écrit, avec les intervenants internes et externes
Capacité de travailler sans supervision et de faire preuve d’initiative
Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais
Une expérience dans les activités opérationnelles est un atout.

Ce que nous offrons

Obtenez la reconnaissance de vos contributions, de votre capacité de réflexion et de votre travail acharné, et la satisfaction de savoir que vous avez aidé le monde à progresser.

Environnement de travail au sein duquel la sécurité est toujours la priorité absolue
Occasions de développement de carrière et aide à la formation pour réaliser vos aspirations sur le plan technique et du leadership
Salaire de base concurrentiel établi en fonction de vos compétences et de votre expérience, et programme incitatif annuel
Accès en tout temps à des programmes de santé/médicaux favorables à la famille, et à des régimes de retraite et d’épargne
Régime d’actionnariat intéressant
Congés pour divers motifs (vacances/annuels, congé parental payé, congés de maladie)
Rabais pour les employés

À propos de Rio Tinto

À l’origine de chaque idée, de chaque innovation, de chaque petite chose qu’on appelle « progrès », il y a une personne : un explorateur, un inventeur, un entrepreneur. Un pionnier.

Depuis près de 150 ans, Rio Tinto est une entreprise de pionniers – des générations d’employés audacieux partout dans le monde qui ont en commun la vision de produire des matières essentielles au progrès humain.

Notre minerai de fer façonne la silhouette des villes, de Shanghai à Sydney. Notre aluminium – premier métal certifié « responsable » au monde – allège les avions et les voitures. Notre cuivre aide les éoliennes à produire de l’énergie. Notre bore contribue à nourrir le monde et permet d’explorer l’univers. Nos diamants célèbrent les plus beaux moments de la vie.

Emplacement du poste

L’Approvisionnement mondial de Rio Tinto offre des services de chaîne d’approvisionnement qui créent de la valeur pour le Groupe Rio Tinto grâce au sourcing stratégique et à l’achat de produits et services destinés à tous les établissements. La valeur, qui joue un rôle fondamental, est réalisée à la faveur de partenariats efficaces avec les fournisseurs, de l’innovation, de processus simples et normalisés, de la technologie électronique, de la responsabilité sociale de l’entreprise et d’un avantage commercial accru.

Chaque voix compte
Chez Rio Tinto, nous accueillons favorablement et encourageons les candidatures d’Autochtones, de femmes, de membres de la communauté LGBTQ2S+, de travailleurs âgés, de personnes handicapées et de représentants d’origines diverses.

Nous sommes déterminés à créer un milieu inclusif où les employés se sentent à l’aise d’être eux-mêmes. Nous souhaitons de plus que chacun ait l’impression que sa voix compte, que toutes les cultures sont respectées et que les points de vue, aussi variés soient-ils, sont non seulement bienvenus, mais également essentiels à notre succès. Nous nous traitons mutuellement avec équité et dignité, sans égard à la race, au genre, à la nationalité, à l’origine ethnique, à la religion, à l’âge, à l’orientation sexuelle ou à tout autre aspect distinctif.


**************************************************************************


Category Analyst- Raw Materials

Key role in a diverse and global procurement organization;
Previous experience with multi-national companies
Role based in Montreal, Qc

About the role

All progress begins with pioneers. At Rio Tinto, it begins with you.

We are looking for a Category Analyst for our Procurement organization in the Raw Materials Team based in Montreal, Qc.

Main responsibilities include but not limited to the management of supply chain, purchase orders, expediting, inventory, and performance reporting. The analysist will structure the spend analysis, be accountable for data management, and participate in the forecasting for all the categories in the scope of the team: graphite electrodes, anthracite, cathodes, fluoride, refractories, steel and copper. Part of the raw materials team, the analyst may be involved in every stage of the sourcing cycle from the fact base analysis, launching bid process and analysis and participate in contract management.

This role is a great opportunity for a procurement professional, who has credible experience, has an appetite to resolve complex sourcing challenges, can visualize the ‘bigger picture’ and is results driven through the delivery of sustained and tangible value

To succeed in this role, you will have:

Be able to develop a high level of trust and work in a matrix environment: develop strong relationship with internal stakeholders in order to better support the business requirements
Develop and manage collaborative relationships with end users, logistics, market analysis finance, accounts payable and many other colleagues in the commercial organization
Drive strategy implementation with an efficient communication
Participate in the development of inspiring category strategies to maximize value that will drive competitive advantage and meet Rio Tinto governance requirements;
Support and/or Manage supply chain activities including trial volume, quality tracking and problem solving, maintain databases for demand planning, inventory and working capital tracking
Analyze market data to feed the total cost model and deliver most accurate forecasted spend Perform data analysis leading to accurate business cases, delivery of monthly spend forecasts and reporting on spend and realized savings
Manage the onboard of new suppliers, issue purchase orders, expedite arrival of orders with suppliers
Performance reporting and systems managements
Manage and solve accounts payable issues
Support the category strategy development and identify new opportunities for savings and improvements on total cost of ownership, inventory and trade working capital;

What you’ll bring


To be successfully considered for this role, you will need:

Bachelor Degree in Commerce / Business/Finance, Engineering or equivalent;
Previous experience with multi-national companies in Mining, Manufacturing or Automotive industries;
Minimum of 5 years of procurement, supply chain and or/commercial experience
Be fluent in SAP, Excel and Ariba
Strong project management, creative problem solving, continuous improvement and customer/supplier relationship management skills;
Ability to achieve outcomes through partnership, collaboration and positive influence;
Strong analytical capability and the ability to effectively collate and compile data;
Ability to develop clear and succinct reports for decision making including scenario analysis and trade offs
Ability to communicate succinctly verbally and in written form with both internal and external stakeholders;
An ability to work unsupervised and be a self-starter;
English and French proficiency
Experience in operations is an advantage

What we offer
Be recognized for your contribution, your thinking and your hard work, and go home knowing you’ve helped the world progress.

A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
Career development & education assistance to further your technical or leadership ambitions
A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with annual incentive program
Ongoing access to family-friendly health and medical programs, pension and savings plans
Attractive share ownership plan
Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation/annual, paid parental, sick leave)
Exclusive employee discounts

About Rio Tinto

Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers. For nearly 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers – generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress. Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium – the world’s first to be certified “responsible” – helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world, and explore the universe. Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.

Where you will be working


Rio Tinto Global Procurement ensures resilient supply chains that deliver value to the Rio Tinto Group through the strategic sourcing and buying of goods and services for our operations. Playing a fundamental role, value is achieved through effective supplier partnerships, innovation, easy and standardised processes, e-technology, corporate social responsibility and increased commercial advantage.

Every Voice Matters

At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous Peoples, women, the LGBTQIA2 community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.

We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.

Title: IT Commercial Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Job Description
Position: IT Commercial Business Systems Analyst
Department: Global IT Shared Services
Reports To: Manager, Commercial Systems
Summary:
The I.T Commercial Business Systems Analyst role is the primary liaison between the ATS global IT group and other ATS divisions / departments that utilize software information systems or data related to CRM and Field Service activities. In this role, the incumbent is responsible for providing operational support to system or data users, participating in the planning, design, development and deployment of information systems projects, and coordinating activities between IT management, business system users and information systems developers (internal and external). The incumbent, who must have strong technical skills coupled with information systems experience, is also responsible for understanding related industry best practices and ensuring that those practices are integrated in our systems at an appropriate level.
Responsibilities
Strategy & Planning:
Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.
Work with key stakeholders (system owners and data users) and other project team members to define, validate and prioritize system requirements.
Lead design sessions in prototyping new features or systems for the purpose of enhancing business processes, operations, and information process flow.
Participate in the preparation of project proposals.
Securing a business owner for a project affecting systems
Acquisition & Deployment:
Research software and hardware solutions to justify recommendations and to support purchasing efforts.
Collaborate in the planning, design, development and deployment of new applications and system enhancements.
Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team.
Build relationships with software development and business teams to gain an understanding of application architectures and required functionality.
Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to system programmers or implementation teams.
Coordinate and perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems, and other post-implementation support.
Provide orientation and training to system users for all modified and new systems.
Use Case and Test Case life cycle documentation.
Data staging to for test case execution.
Operational Management:
Field incoming problem tickets from end users to resolve system related problems.
Uphold SLA for all issues relates to supporting business system
Document all pertinent system user identification information, including name, department, contact information, and nature of problem or issue.
Prioritize, schedule, and administer all instances where enhancements and defect resolution are required.
Record, track, and document the problem-solving process, including all successful and unsuccessful decisions made, and actions taken, through to final resolution.
Communicate application problems and issues to key stakeholders (i.e. management, developers, and system users).
Test fixes and perform post-resolution follow-ups to ensure problems have been adequately resolved.
Coordinate with department heads to assess departmental application training needs and objectives.
Perform preventative maintenance, including the installation of service packs, patches and hot fixes.
Maintain currency, completeness and accuracy of all documentation.
Maintain an awareness of industry best practices for related information systems.
Perform operational tasks such as new project setup etc.

Requirements
Education & Certification:
University degree or college diploma in an IT discipline or related experience
Certifications such as ITIL, PMP, CBAP or Salesforce/Oracle Certified CRM admin are definite assets
Formal Business System or Business
Knowledge & Experience:
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, business process modeling and data modeling.
Proven experience with troubleshooting principles, methodologies, and issue resolution techniques.
Proven experience in the design, development, and implementation of software and hardware systems.
Must have strong technical skills coupled with information systems experience.
Working technical knowledge of scripting languages are an asset.
In depth understanding of assets, contacts, leads and opportunities.
Working knowledge of current network hardware, protocols, and standards.
Ability to apply statistical and other research methods into systems issues and products as required.
Demonstrated project management skills.
Strong knowledge of system and software quality assurance best practices and methodologies.
Demonstrated knowledge of Jira Server Software, Jira Cloud, SCRUM framework, Oracle CX, Salesforce, CPQ and ERP.
Hands-on technical writing and editing experience, with specific experience in documenting information technology software and systems.
Knowledge of trends in technology relating to software applications, especially Services Oriented Architecture, Enterprise Service Bus, XML, integration strategies, cloud computing, etc.
Demonstrated knowledge of sales process from lead to asset, from asset to service opportunity.
Understanding of Configure Price Quote (CPQ) and e-Commerce architectures.
#LI-PP1

Title: Senior Developer Analyst
Description:
Our Digital & Technology team wakes up every day with one goal in mind – to connect Canadians to the people and things that matter most. Collectively, we’re proud to support 30 million Canadians each month.
We manage a robust portfolio that champions the leading edge of technology and media. We drive projects that expand connectivity to underserved communities from coast-to-coast-to-coast; build and enhance our fixed broadband network to provide high-speed Internet, TV and Smart Home Monitoring; and support our world class wireless network, offering our customers Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network. As the Digital & Technology team, we are building our tomorrow, today.
Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada, Let’s make your possible.
Do you enjoy working on high-scale, complex, and high visibility projects and programs? If yes, consider the following opportunity:
As a software developer in Analytics and Insights team, the successful candidate will design, develop, and deploy the software products needed to improve the network engineering processes. The candidate will collaborate with a multi-disciplinary team of data-scientists, data-engineers, developers and subject matter experts on a wide range of problems.

What you will be doing:
Lead the Development of new features and optimize the codebase for existing in-house tools used by cross-functional teams within RAN network engineering.
Develop and automate reports, iteratively build, and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs.
Develop tools to leverage different datasets, on-prem and from cloud to enable RAN engineering teams drive insights.
Apply an analytical mindset to identify new ways to innovate with data.
Lead the iterative development, validation, and deployment of AI/ML models.
Collaborate on end-to-end automation efforts required to bring models to production.
Visualize and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provide insights to the organization.
Minimum qualifications:
Master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
3 years of experience with open source or developer technologies
3 years of experience with software development in one or more programming languages (e.g., Python, R, C/C++, JavaScript).
Preferred qualifications and skills:
Experience designing APIs and user-facing software.
Experience designing data products like dashboards, reports and providing data analysis.
Experience in the following programming languages: Python, R, Node.js and C#.
Experience designing APIS or developer tools.
Strong understanding of SQL and Apache Spark.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, be diplomatic, and influence technical practitioners and stakeholders.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the desire to share technical knowledge and information with others
Competencies:
Ability to operate autonomously, within general direction guidelines.
Personal Competencies: Problem Solving / Judgment; Customer Service Orientation; Teamwork and Collaboration; Initiative; Achievement Orientation.
Highly motivated individual with superior organizational and analytical skills.
Come be part of the team that launched the 1st and largest 5G network in Canada! We are looking for talented individuals to join our RAN Engineering & Innovation team. Our team believes in data-driven decision making which is a crucial piece in building the next generation of network infrastructure that will power the wireless technologies of tomorrow.
As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.
Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.
Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 8200 Dixie Road (101), Brampton, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
Posting Category/Function: Technology & Software Development
Requisition ID: 266551

At Rogers Digital, our team doesn’t shy away from big ideas – we bring them to life. We work tirelessly to deliver the best user experiences (period) and build amazing self-serve experiences that our customers want to use. We are customer-obsessed agents of change and are committed to innovation and creating effortless experiences for customers and frontline employees. We use cutting-edge tools and technologies to solve critical and complex problems with award-winning solutions. Our work impacts millions of customers everyday. At Rogers Digital, we’re looking for people who embrace change, take risks, and push boundaries. Learn more about our team and our work @ https://digital.rogers.com/

Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work:

Our people are at the heart of our success
Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do
We do what’s right, each and every day
We believe in the power of new ideas
We work as one team, with one vision
We give back to our communities and protect our environment

Description:

We are looking for a Business Systems Analyst that is passionate about providing useful, working software that will have a real impact on the way our bank does business. Title: Manager I, Business Intelligence and Reporting
Description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
This role is part of the Shared Services team in Operations and Delivery (O&D), which is within the COO for the Canadian Personal Bank.
Job Description
This role will report to the Manager of Planning, Insights, Reporting and Analysis (PIRA) and will primarily be responsible for leading out a Reporting POD. Leading a specialized team of professionals responsible for creation and maintenance of reporting and providing business insights for specific businesses within O&D.

Key Responsibilities:

§ Lead a team of reporting analysts to manage diverse portfolio of business reporting.
§ Contribute to the design/direction of key strategic reporting to ensure critical data and reporting elements are included and all business needs are met.
§ Support KPI's and business goals through:
Accurate and consistent reporting proceduresProviding easy access to business data and insights

§ Continuously enhance knowledge within area of expertise and keep current with industry trends and business direction.
§ Consistently monitor for process improvements through proactive engagement of partners and management.
§ Act as a data SME to support processes and reporting that will enhance the quality of business reporting.
§ Monitor data quality and identify opportunities for improvement.
§ Promote and support an environment that encourages inclusively, productivity, innovation, teamwork, and a high level of professionalism.
§ Management of a strong workback plan from all team builds on the roadmap.
§ Work closely with Manager on vision for existing and planned builds.
§ Ensure timely notification and escalation of possible issues/problems while assessing options and recommendations for prompt resolution
