Title: Total Rewards Compensation Analyst
Description: Great Canadian Gaming is looking for it's next Total Rewards Compensation Analyst to join it's team!As the Total Rewards Compensation Analyst you will report directly to the Senior Total Rewards Manager and will be responsible for leading the analysis, reconciliation and costing of Great Canadian's compensation programs. In addition, you will serve as a Total Rewards, Payroll and Human Resources HCMS subject matter expert related to compensation programs and will support the ongoing day-to-day functionality of HR Shared Services, by ensuring our Compensation programs align with the Company’s objectives.Your strong analytical and numerical analysis skills will be used to perform detailed research and data analysis, data consolidation and configuration, job evaluation and competitive market analysis, survey participation and general program coordination.Working with team members and management and collaborating with site Human Resources and Operations leads, you will support Total Rewards, Payroll and Human Resources activities and initiatives.As our next Total Rewards Compensation Analyst these will be some of your key accountabilities:Managing salaried pay plans and benchmarking activitiesManaging compression analysis related to minimum wage and market changes and proposing changes to pay structures – this entails analysis of rates, job mapping, costing, communication with stakeholders and change management activitiesManaging union pay scale changes – including keeping up to date on collective agreements, reviewing the competitive landscape, costing proposals and coordinating with stakeholdersPerforming job evaluation and job analysis and making pay recommendations - ensuring job functions, families and titles are consistent, aligned with the marketplace and support internal organizational structuresLeading the annual compensation survey process, including the submission of data and the analysis and application of resultsConducting analysis and research to ensure compliance with pay equity legislation and regulatory requirementsUpdating and maintaining job structures and Position Management in the company’s Human Capital Management System HCMS (branded as CONNECT) along with performing regular auditsUpdating and maintaining the company’s benchmarking platform, Payscale MarketpayAssisting with broad compensation projects as they come up throughout the organizationDeveloping tools and resources to drive integrated and consistent company-wide compensation processesEnabling and supporting a variety of initiatives through rigorous assessment of data, trends and program cost/benefit analysisThe right candidate will posses the following education and qualification requirements:Post-Secondary education in Business, Human Resources or Finance, along with a minimum of 3 years as a practicing Compensation Analyst at the professional level; Certified Compensation Professional (CCP) designation desiredStrong analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detail, including experience with modeling and costingHighly proficient in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint; advanced Excel skills requiredEffective verbal, written and presentation skills and ability to present complex ideas to diverse audiencesMust be able to work independently and as part of a diverse teamSelf-motivated individual who is able to handle multiple deliverables and priorities, with a focus on continuous process improvementsAbility to work with all levels throughout the organization and maintain highly confidential informationMust be a quick learner when facing new problems and be able to think with a short term and long-term focusRequires flexibility to work in situations where there is no unique, correct answer and in a dynamic business environmentIf this sounds like a GREAT opportunity for you, we invite you register your interest. If your skills and experience are a match for our position, our professional recruiters will be in contact with you. Thank you for your application and your interest in Great Canadian.Great Canadian Gaming Corporation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we welcome all qualified applicants to apply to join our team of unique contributors. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an accommodation is required. We thank all applicants for their interest, and will contact those qualified to continue in the recruitment process.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSchedule:8 hour shiftApplication deadline: 2022-04-25

Title: Senior System Business Analyst - Mining
Description:
Putting people first, every day:

BDO is a firm built on a foundation of positive relationships with our people and our clients. Each day, our professionals provide exceptional service, helping clients with advice and insight they can trust. In turn, we offer an award-winning environment that fosters a people-first culture with a high priority on your personal and professional growth.
Your opportunity:

BDO Lixar is looking for a Senior Business Analyst, with Mining and Resource Extraction related experience, to join our Technology Consulting Practice. This role would allow for a candidate to develop various aspects of their skill sets including: change & stakeholder management, business process modelling & optimization, requirement planning and management, solution assessment and validation.
As part of this role, you will act as a liaison between business units and technology teams to elicit, analyze, document, validate business requirements, user stories and process mapping. The individual will also be able to direct and monitor QA/QC activities to ensure that the solution will meet business needs.
Responsibilities will include:
Consult with business leaders to ensure understanding of requirements and their alignment to strategic direction of the business.
Interact with stakeholders to become a trusted advisor throughout the engagement.
Understand business strategy and objectives by studying the business function, gathering information, and evaluating output requirements and formats. Elicits and documents functional and non-functional requirements for services to meet business needs.
Possess advanced level understanding of Business Analysis, business processes, workflows, and methodologies.
Direct and monitor BA and QA/QC activities to ensure the traceability and optimum coverage of business requirements by defined test plans, test cases and test scripts.
Collaborate with application developers, designers, and architects to ensure a shared understanding of the business model and requirements.
Establish the estimation of analysis, documentation and testing efforts for various projects and initiatives.
Provide senior management/project management regular updates on deliverable timeline and project status.
Responsible for conducting workshops to gain insights into end user and customer needs.
Manage the Product Backlog for a solution, working with the greater delivery team to prioritize requirements, define and manage scope and sprints for a project.
Work with end users to plan and execute User Acceptance Testing.
Respond proactively to both business and project issues and escalate appropriately.
Perform other job-related duties as assigned.
How do we define success for your role?
You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect and Collaboration
You understand your client’s industry, challenges, and opportunities; client describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high-quality work
You identify, recommend, and are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
You share in an inclusive and engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
You grow your expertise through learning and professional development.
Your Qualifications
University Degree or College/CEGEP Diploma.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in Business Analyst or Business System Analyst role.
Mining or Resource Extraction related experience is preferred.
Solid understanding of SDLC, Software BA methodologies, tools and process with proven experience in Waterfall, Agile or Hybrid development environment.
Analytical thinking and using Business Analysis techniques to problem-solving, requirements elicitation and analysis, data modelling, business process modelling and requirements management.
Thorough understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into the solution and operational requirements.
Ability to produce requirements artifacts, such as Process Flow Diagrams, Wireframes, BRDs, SRS, User Stories, Use Cases and scenario, Data Migration Rules and Mapping, etc.
Proficient in establishing relationships, analyzing perspectives and managing stakeholders.
Ability to guide QA strategy, test plan and direct testing and quality assurance activities.
In-depth collaboration and team skills to work with a diverse working group.
Personal organization skills that can manage work effort to provide quality service in a productive and cost-effective manner.
Strong ability to manage competing priorities on multiple projects simultaneously to meet deadlines.
Must be self-sufficient and require limited assistance to perform duties.
In-depth verbal and written communication skills.
Optional qualifications:
Experience with business cases, RFPs and statements of work.
Experience with data, cloud.
Experience with writing SQL scripts.
ITIL v3, CMST, CMSQ, PMP, CBAP or CCBA certification.
Industry experience (insurance, mining, others).
Why BDO?
Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:
We enable you to engage with the firm's strategic plan, and be a key contributor to the success and growth of the firm.
We help you be the best professional you can be in our services, industries and markets.
Achieve your personal goals outside of the office and make an impact on your community.
Giving back, it adds up: Where company meets community. BDO is actively involved in our communities by supporting local charity initiatives. We support staff with local and national events where you will be given the opportunity to contribute to your community.

Total rewards that matter: We pay for performance with competitive total cash compensation that recognizes and rewards your contribution. We provide flexible benefits from day one, and a market leading personal time off policy. We are committed to supporting your overall wellness beyond working hours, and provide reimbursement for wellness initiatives that fit your lifestyle.

Everyone counts: We believe every employee should have the opportunity to participate and succeed. Through leadership by our Chief Inclusion and Diversity Officer, we are committed to a workplace culture of respect, inclusion, and diversity. We recognize and celebrate the valuable differences among each of us, including race, religious beliefs, physical or mental disabilities, age, place of origin, marital status, family status, gender or gender identity and sexual orientation. If you require accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us.


Ready to make your mark at BDO? Click “Apply now” to send your up-to-date resume to one of our Talent Acquisition Specialists.

To explore other opportunities at BDO, check out our careers page.
Thank you for applying! We look forward to meeting with the selected interview candidates.
To explore other opportunities at BDO, check out our careers page. #LI-KK

Technical Coordinator / Analyst

Interested in working in the music industry, developing solutions to be used by high-profile clients? LyricFind has an opening for a talented and driven candidate looking to be a part of this exciting sector.

You will be working with the leading players in the music tech space, providing the support and coordination needed to drive these products to market. Work with LyricFind clients and partners to bring LyricFind produts to market.
Write technical reports and documentation, as well as communicate technical requirements.

Strong working knowledge of RDBMs (MySQL preferred)
Experience working with various data formats (ex. JSON, XML)
Strong communication skills (both oral and written)
Self-motivated and able to work with minimal supervision

Offer

Trusted by clients like Google, YouTube, Amazon, Deezer, Pandora, Xperi and many more, LyricFind is proud to offer a range of lyric and data services used by millions of people.

Title: Senior Airport Analyst
Description:
Senior Airport Analyst - (167025)
Description
About Us
At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.

Watch our 'About Us' video

We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward.
HDR is seeking a Senior Airport Analyst for our Richmond Hill office. This individual will work with a dynamic team of transportation professionals on a variety of aviation projects including airport terminal development, airport master plans, landside and airside development, passenger flow simulation and capacity-demand analysis. The work will be centered in the Richmond Hill office; however, project delivery may be anywhere in Canada, the US or selected global locations, and focus on the planning, analysis, presentations and technical studies and reports.
Qualifications & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Planning or related field; Master’s degree preferred
Minimum of 7 years’ experience in airport analysis, passenger flow simulation, flight schedules development, data analysis and management, capacity-demand studies
In-depth understanding of airport operations and planning principles, including IATA guidelines and Level-of-Service standards
Experience with projects involving pedestrian analysis and simulation for transit stations and other public facilities is an asset
Experience working with airport stakeholders, including airport authorities, airlines and governmental agencies such as CATSA, CBP, CBSA, TSA, etc

Qualifications
Job Skills
A self-starter, comfortable working in a team environment
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Fluency with MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
Fluency in data analysis, data integration and development of complex templates for data manipulation
Fluency in 2 or more airport simulation software packages: Simio, MassMotion, CAST, AirTOP, ArcPort or similar
Working knowledge in Tableau/PowerBI or Adobe Creative Suite
Working knowledge with general transportation software like Paramics and Vissim
Working knowledge of movie maker/animation software required for preparation and manipulation of 3D visualization/animations of passenger flows modelling
Advanced programming skills in Phyton, C++, Visual Basic or similar
Progressive and innovative approach to problem solving

Why HDR
At HDR, we know work isn't only about who you work for; it's also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way.

Title: Manager I, Business Intelligence and Reporting
Description:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
This role is part of the Shared Services team in Operations and Delivery (O&D), which is within the COO for the Canadian Personal Bank.
Job Description
This role will report to the Manager of Planning, Insights, Reporting and Analysis (PIRA) and will primarily be responsible for leading out a Reporting POD. Leading a specialized team of professionals responsible for creation and maintenance of reporting and providing business insights for specific businesses within O&D.

Key Responsibilities:

§ Lead a team of reporting analysts to manage diverse portfolio of business reporting.
§ Contribute to the design/direction of key strategic reporting to ensure critical data and reporting elements are included and all business needs are met.
§ Support KPI's and business goals through:
Accurate and consistent reporting proceduresProviding easy access to business data and insights
§ Oversee delivery of quality reporting and provide direction/guidance to Reporting Analysts.
§ Review and enhancement of all reporting needs, this includes working with all business partners to understand and meet their requirements.
§ Develop executive communication for Business Leaders as required.
§ Participate in the planning, development, and launching of new solutions and continuously improve the operating model to drive a balance of efficiency and effectiveness while delivering on key metrics and targets.
§ Continuously enhance knowledge within area of expertise and keep current with industry trends and business direction.
§ Consistently monitor for process improvements through proactive engagement of partners and management.
§ Act as a data SME to support processes and reporting that will enhance the quality of business reporting.
§ Monitor data quality and identify opportunities for improvement.
§ Promote and support an environment that encourages inclusively, productivity, innovation, teamwork, and a high level of professionalism.
§ Management of a strong workback plan from all team builds on the roadmap.
§ Work closely with Manager on vision for existing and planned builds.
§ Ensure timely notification and escalation of possible issues/problems while assessing options and recommendations for prompt resolution
Job Requirements
Education/Accreditations:

Post-Secondary education or equivalent work experience is preferred
Other Qualification/Skills/Experience

Must have strong mathematical, analytical and problem-solving skills.Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and working knowledge of Tableau is preferred.Must have strong data mining and insight skills.Continually demonstrate leadership profile attributes.Good interpersonal skills, with the ability to obtain consensus among key stakeholders.Enthusiastic self-starter who can adapt and manage within a dynamic business environment.Ability to multi-task and work with minimal supervision.Robust organizational skills with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple deadlines and priorities.Flexibility to adapt to changing requirements.Excellent communication and analytical skills.Demonstrated ability to work effectively in teams including the ability to foster a cohesive team and promote a positive work environment
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Total Rewards Compensation Analyst
Description: Great Canadian Gaming is looking for it's next Total Rewards Compensation Analyst to join it's team!As the Total Rewards Compensation Analyst you will report directly to the Senior Total Rewards Manager and will be responsible for leading the analysis, reconciliation and costing of Great Canadian's compensation programs. In addition, you will serve as a Total Rewards, Payroll and Human Resources HCMS subject matter expert related to compensation programs and will support the ongoing day-to-day functionality of HR Shared Services, by ensuring our Compensation programs align with the Company’s objectives.Your strong analytical and numerical analysis skills will be used to perform detailed research and data analysis, data consolidation and configuration, job evaluation and competitive market analysis, survey participation and general program coordination.Working with team members and management and collaborating with site Human Resources and Operations leads, you will support Total Rewards, Payroll and Human Resources activities and initiatives.As our next Total Rewards Compensation Analyst these will be some of your key accountabilities:Managing salaried pay plans and benchmarking activitiesManaging compression analysis related to minimum wage and market changes and proposing changes to pay structures – this entails analysis of rates, job mapping, costing, communication with stakeholders and change management activitiesManaging union pay scale changes – including keeping up to date on collective agreements, reviewing the competitive landscape, costing proposals and coordinating with stakeholdersPerforming job evaluation and job analysis and making pay recommendations - ensuring job functions, families and titles are consistent, aligned with the marketplace and support internal organizational structuresLeading the annual compensation survey process, including the submission of data and the analysis and application of resultsConducting analysis and research to ensure compliance with pay equity legislation and regulatory requirementsUpdating and maintaining job structures and Position Management in the company’s Human Capital Management System HCMS (branded as CONNECT) along with performing regular auditsUpdating and maintaining the company’s benchmarking platform, Payscale MarketpayAssisting with broad compensation projects as they come up throughout the organizationDeveloping tools and resources to drive integrated and consistent company-wide compensation processesEnabling and supporting a variety of initiatives through rigorous assessment of data, trends and program cost/benefit analysisThe right candidate will posses the following education and qualification requirements:Post-Secondary education in Business, Human Resources or Finance, along with a minimum of 3 years as a practicing Compensation Analyst at the professional level; Certified Compensation Professional (CCP) designation desiredStrong analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detail, including experience with modeling and costingHighly proficient in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint; advanced Excel skills requiredEffective verbal, written and presentation skills and ability to present complex ideas to diverse audiencesMust be able to work independently and as part of a diverse teamSelf-motivated individual who is able to handle multiple deliverables and priorities, with a focus on continuous process improvementsAbility to work with all levels throughout the organization and maintain highly confidential informationMust be a quick learner when facing new problems and be able to think with a short term and long-term focusRequires flexibility to work in situations where there is no unique, correct answer and in a dynamic business environmentIf this sounds like a GREAT opportunity for you, we invite you register your interest. If your skills and experience are a match for our position, our professional recruiters will be in contact with you. Thank you for your application and your interest in Great Canadian.Great Canadian Gaming Corporation is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we welcome all qualified applicants to apply to join our team of unique contributors. We accommodate people with disabilities throughout the recruitment and selection process and applicants are encouraged to advise Human Resources in advance if an accommodation is required. We thank all applicants for their interest, and will contact those qualified to continue in the recruitment process.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSchedule:8 hour shiftApplication deadline: 2022-04-25

Title: Senior System Business Analyst - Mining
Description:
Putting people first, every day:

BDO is a firm built on a foundation of positive relationships with our people and our clients. Each day, our professionals provide exceptional service, helping clients with advice and insight they can trust. In turn, we offer an award-winning environment that fosters a people-first culture with a high priority on your personal and professional growth.
Your opportunity:

BDO Lixar is looking for a Senior Business Analyst, with Mining and Resource Extraction related experience, to join our Technology Consulting Practice. This role would allow for a candidate to develop various aspects of their skill sets including: change & stakeholder management, business process modelling & optimization, requirement planning and management, solution assessment and validation.
As part of this role, you will act as a liaison between business units and technology teams to elicit, analyze, document, validate business requirements, user stories and process mapping. The individual will also be able to direct and monitor QA/QC activities to ensure that the solution will meet business needs.
Responsibilities will include:
Consult with business leaders to ensure understanding of requirements and their alignment to strategic direction of the business.
Interact with stakeholders to become a trusted advisor throughout the engagement.
Understand business strategy and objectives by studying the business function, gathering information, and evaluating output requirements and formats. Elicits and documents functional and non-functional requirements for services to meet business needs.
Possess advanced level understanding of Business Analysis, business processes, workflows, and methodologies.
Direct and monitor BA and QA/QC activities to ensure the traceability and optimum coverage of business requirements by defined test plans, test cases and test scripts.
Collaborate with application developers, designers, and architects to ensure a shared understanding of the business model and requirements.
Establish the estimation of analysis, documentation and testing efforts for various projects and initiatives.
Provide senior management/project management regular updates on deliverable timeline and project status.
Responsible for conducting workshops to gain insights into end user and customer needs.
Manage the Product Backlog for a solution, working with the greater delivery team to prioritize requirements, define and manage scope and sprints for a project.
Work with end users to plan and execute User Acceptance Testing.
Respond proactively to both business and project issues and escalate appropriately.
Perform other job-related duties as assigned.
How do we define success for your role?
You demonstrate BDO's core values through all aspect of your work: Integrity, Respect and Collaboration
You understand your client’s industry, challenges, and opportunities; client describe you as positive, professional, and delivering high-quality work
You identify, recommend, and are focused on effective service delivery to your clients
You share in an inclusive and engaging work environment that develops, retains & attracts talent
You actively participate in the adoption of digital tools and strategies to drive an innovative workplace
You grow your expertise through learning and professional development.
Your Qualifications
University Degree or College/CEGEP Diploma.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in Business Analyst or Business System Analyst role.
Mining or Resource Extraction related experience is preferred.
Solid understanding of SDLC, Software BA methodologies, tools and process with proven experience in Waterfall, Agile or Hybrid development environment.
Analytical thinking and using Business Analysis techniques to problem-solving, requirements elicitation and analysis, data modelling, business process modelling and requirements management.
Thorough understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into the solution and operational requirements.
Ability to produce requirements artifacts, such as Process Flow Diagrams, Wireframes, BRDs, SRS, User Stories, Use Cases and scenario, Data Migration Rules and Mapping, etc.
Proficient in establishing relationships, analyzing perspectives and managing stakeholders.
Ability to guide QA strategy, test plan and direct testing and quality assurance activities.
In-depth collaboration and team skills to work with a diverse working group.
Personal organization skills that can manage work effort to provide quality service in a productive and cost-effective manner.
Strong ability to manage competing priorities on multiple projects simultaneously to meet deadlines.
Must be self-sufficient and require limited assistance to perform duties.
In-depth verbal and written communication skills.
Optional qualifications:
Experience with business cases, RFPs and statements of work.
Experience with data, cloud.
Experience with writing SQL scripts.
ITIL v3, CMST, CMSQ, PMP, CBAP or CCBA certification.
Industry experience (insurance, mining, others).
Why BDO?
Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:
We enable you to engage with the firm's strategic plan, and be a key contributor to the success and growth of the firm.
We help you be the best professional you can be in our services, industries and markets.
Achieve your personal goals outside of the office and make an impact on your community.
Giving back, it adds up: Where company meets community. BDO is actively involved in our communities by supporting local charity initiatives. We support staff with local and national events where you will be given the opportunity to contribute to your community.

Total rewards that matter: We pay for performance with competitive total cash compensation that recognizes and rewards your contribution. We provide flexible benefits from day one, and a market leading personal time off policy. We are committed to supporting your overall wellness beyond working hours, and provide reimbursement for wellness initiatives that fit your lifestyle.

Everyone counts: We believe every employee should have the opportunity to participate and succeed. Through leadership by our Chief Inclusion and Diversity Officer, we are committed to a workplace culture of respect, inclusion, and diversity. We recognize and celebrate the valuable differences among each of us, including race, religious beliefs, physical or mental disabilities, age, place of origin, marital status, family status, gender or gender identity and sexual orientation. If you require accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us.


Ready to make your mark at BDO? Click “Apply now” to send your up-to-date resume to one of our Talent Acquisition Specialists.

To explore other opportunities at BDO, check out our careers page.
Thank you for applying! We look forward to meeting with the selected interview candidates.
To explore other opportunities at BDO, check out our careers page. #LI-KK

Title: Senior Business Analyst, OHT- Decision Support- Full Time - Markham Site
Technical Coordinator / Analyst
Description:
Job Description:
 Interested in working in the music industry, developing solutions to be used by high-profile clients? LyricFind has an opening for a talented and driven candidate looking to be a part of this exciting sector. 
 
 You will be working with the leading players in the music tech space, providing the support and coordination needed to drive these products to market. In addition to be technical requirements (listed below), you will also need to be a strong communicator, self-motivated and quick on your feet. If this sounds like you, then this position may be for you. 
 

Responsibilities:


Work with LyricFind business units to analyze data, provide reporting, technical guidance and solutions.
Work with LyricFind clients and partners to bring LyricFind produts to market.
Write technical reports and documentation, as well as communicate technical requirements.

Experience:


At least 1 year of experience in a similar role

Required Skills:


Experience working with Python
Strong working knowledge of RDBMs (MySQL preferred)
Experience working with various data formats (ex. JSON, XML)
Strong communication skills (both oral and written)
Self-motivated and able to work with minimal supervision
Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent experience

"Nice-to-have" Skills:


Experience working with APIs and other data interfaces
Experience with other scripting languages and programming languages
Experience with Git

Hiring Process:


Phone interview
On-site or video interview
Possible second phone or video interview
Offer

Benefits:


Flexible working hours
Comprehensive benefits including extended health, dental, vision
RRSP matching
Three weeks vacation and bonus days like Christmas Eve and New Year’s Eve
A spacious and subway-accessible office at Yonge & Eglinton
All the coffee, mochaccino, cappuccino, and whatever-a-ccino you can drink

Salary:


$60,000 per year

About LyricFind:
 Over 17 years, LyricFind has built strong direct relationships with music publishers, performing rights organizations and aggregators around the world to license their lyric catalogs and legally power the digital music space with the highest quality lyrics and data. Trusted by clients like Google, YouTube, Amazon, Deezer, Pandora, Xperi and many more, LyricFind is proud to offer a range of lyric and data services used by millions of people. 
 
 --- 
 
 We thank all applicants for their interest in LyricFind however only those selected for an interview will be contacted. 
 
 LyricFind is committed to ensuring a barrier-free, accessible and inclusive work environment. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Upon individual request, we will endeavour to remove any barrier to the hiring process to accommodate candidates with disabilities. Please inform us should accommodation be required at any point during the selection process.

Title: Senior Airport Analyst
Description:
Senior Airport Analyst - (167025)
Description
About Us
At HDR, we specialize in engineering, architecture, environmental and construction services. While we are most well-known for adding beauty and structure to communities through high-performance buildings and smart infrastructure, we provide much more than that. We create an unshakable foundation for progress because our multidisciplinary teams also include scientists, economists, builders, analysts and artists. That's why we believe diversity is our greatest strength. HDR is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer.

Watch our 'About Us' video

We believe that the way we work can add meaning and value to the world. That ideas inspire positive change. That coloring outside the lines can illuminate fresh perspectives. And that small details yield important realizations. Above all, we believe that collaboration is the best way forward.
HDR is seeking a Senior Airport Analyst for our Richmond Hill office. This individual will work with a dynamic team of transportation professionals on a variety of aviation projects including airport terminal development, airport master plans, landside and airside development, passenger flow simulation and capacity-demand analysis. The work will be centered in the Richmond Hill office; however, project delivery may be anywhere in Canada, the US or selected global locations, and focus on the planning, analysis, presentations and technical studies and reports.
Qualifications & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Planning or related field; Master’s degree preferred
Minimum of 7 years’ experience in airport analysis, passenger flow simulation, flight schedules development, data analysis and management, capacity-demand studies
In-depth understanding of airport operations and planning principles, including IATA guidelines and Level-of-Service standards
Experience with projects involving pedestrian analysis and simulation for transit stations and other public facilities is an asset
Experience working with airport stakeholders, including airport authorities, airlines and governmental agencies such as CATSA, CBP, CBSA, TSA, etc

Qualifications
Job Skills
A self-starter, comfortable working in a team environment
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Fluency with MS Office Suite (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint)
Fluency in data analysis, data integration and development of complex templates for data manipulation
Fluency in 2 or more airport simulation software packages: Simio, MassMotion, CAST, AirTOP, ArcPort or similar
Working knowledge in Tableau/PowerBI or Adobe Creative Suite
Working knowledge with general transportation software like Paramics and Vissim
Working knowledge of movie maker/animation software required for preparation and manipulation of 3D visualization/animations of passenger flows modelling
Advanced programming skills in Phyton, C++, Visual Basic or similar
Progressive and innovative approach to problem solving

Why HDR
At HDR, we know work isn't only about who you work for; it's also about what you do and how you do it. Led by the strength of our values and a culture shaped by employee ownership, we network with each other, build on each other's contributions, and collaborate together to make great things possible. When you join HDR, we give you license to do the same. We help you take charge of your career, giving you multiple growth opportunities along the way.

Primary Location: Canada-Ontario-Richmond Hill
Industry: Aviation
Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Regular

Title: Senior IT Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Description: 
  

This is a permanent position. This rolecan be based out of either Calgary or Sherwood Park.






 You will bring:



 5 + years of work experience in business intelligence, data analysis and reporting.
 Three or more years of professional-level experience with business intelligence software, database/data warehouse software, and computer programming.
 University Degree or diploma in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Data Processing, or an equivalent combination of education, experience and training.





 What would you be doing?




 Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize overall efficiency and improve quality.
 Developing BI reporting environments supporting separation of duties, governance and security.
 Advance our Business Intelligence Strategy and Data Governance.
 Innovating with ideas and then building the architecture to better utilize existing data as well as sourcing new, actionable internal & external data (e.g., of our people, customers, and competition).
 Developing, integrating, and automating visualized reports and dashboards.
 Work with the Application Development team to implement data strategies, build and document data flows from source systems to target Data Warehouse(s).
 Implement Logical and Physical data models.
 Analyze data-related system integration challenges and propose appropriate solutions (Logic App).
 Elicit, document, analyze, propose solutions, and gain signoff on business requirements for our Enterprise Business Systems.
 Develop and implement data quality methodology to ensure accurate and timely data.
 Perform code reviews to identify basic technical and logical errors.
 Help with the creation of production and ad hoc reports from various backend databases using internal and external reporting tools.
 Coordinate with business groups to design and develop reports and dashboards through OLAP, Power BI, IFS Report Designer, Lobbies and SQL.
 Familiarity with BI tools including OLAP such as PowerBI or Report builder (SSRS) to design and develop end user reports.
 Building complex Power Pivot/SQL models.
 Other duties as required.





 Does this sound like you?




 Highly experienced in data modeling from structured and unstructured data sets to create optimization calculators and other tools.
 Strong experience in managing and delivering ERP, Database (SQL) and reports, with good experience in database concepts and design.
 Experience and knowledge in BI Technology specifically DW, SSAS, SSIS, MDS, and DQS.
 Experience with data pipelines and data visualizations required.
 Strong self-learner and demonstrated problem determination and resolution skills.
 Experience in design, development and implementation, collecting data and translating it for use in computer applications, i.e. for data warehousing, data conversions.
 Experience in Data Warehouse concepts and skills.
 Experience with ETL Tools like DataStage, Logic App, SSIS, Azure Data Factory, and Business Objects Data Integrator.
 Strong experience with SQL scripting skills.





 Perks of the job






        Competitive compensation.
      
 RRSP Matching
 Paid vacation
 Company supplied benefits for you and your family





 Other important details



 As a condition of employment, qualified applicants who are offered, and accept the role must complete a satisfactory pre-employment Background Check. This may consist of all or a combination of the following: Canadian Criminal Record check, an Employment Verification and/or an Education and Accreditation Verification.
  


 Candidates shortlisted will require to complete the Profile People Survey.
  


 The purpose of the Profile People Survey tool is to assist ClearStream in understanding the behaviors of individuals with the objective of supporting the best use of their strengths, abilities, and potential.
  


 Why ClearStream



 We are the clear choice for rewarding opportunities and challenging careers. Joining our team would mean you would contribute to the quality of work we do and to the success of ClearStream along with the values we share. If you are driven, dedicated and have a passion for helping our customers bring resources to our world, then ClearStream is the team to join.
  


 We are committed to creating a culture of equity, diversity, and inclusion, including fostering a safe and respectful environment that allows for diverse perspectives—a work environment in which all employees are valued and have an equal opportunity to achieve success. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected factors.

Title: Business Analyst I - DC IS
Description:
Benefit Plan including Health, Dental, Life Insurance and DisabilityAdditional Paid Time Off (floater days, volunteer days, outdoor day)Company Pension PlanRetirement Savings Plan (RSP)Annual bonus opportunityDEI and Employee Resource GroupsGenerous Employee Friends and Family discounts
OUTGROWN YOUR OWN BACKYARD? COME PLAY IN OURS.

At Columbia, we’re as passionate about the outdoors as you are. And while our gear is available worldwide, we’re proud to be founded and headquartered in the Pacific Northwest region of the United States, where natural wonders are our playground.

Every product we make and every task we undertake is inspired by the famous words of our founder Gert Boyle: “It’s perfect. Now make it better.” As pioneers of relentless improvement, we are constantly evolving.

We believe the outdoors is ours to protect and strive to keep our planet healthy. We believe in empowering people to experience the outdoors to the fullest.

And we believe in you.
ABOUT THE POSITION
The DC IS team is looking for a Business Analyst I to join the Columbia team at our Canada Distribution Centre located in London, Ontario.
This role is responsible for contributing to the smooth and efficient distribution of Columbia Sportswear product by providing Information Systems support for all hardware and software at the Distribution Center. This will include providing support and maintenance for computer hardware, desktop software, AS/400 (MANH Warehouse Management, Transportation Management systems), SQL and Crystal reporting and data mining, Office 365, Zebra devices, Touch Warehouse devices, and Warehouse Controls systems.
HOW YOU’LL MAKE A DIFFERENCE
Act as primary hardware and software support for DC Business Partners, ensuring system quality and performance, and assisting with projects as assigned.
Ensure that business goals and issues are considered when changes are made in programs and/or systems.
Work with DC Partners in gathering information and identifying their needs to analyze existing procedures, processes, and equipment or to develop and/or recommend new ones.
Maintain and support computer equipment, printers, RF equipment, and warehouse controls.
Work with Procurement department to ensure availability of supplies to the equipment supported.
Check, evaluate, and inventory computer equipment on a regular basis to reduce system downtime.
Maintain computer hardware by installing new components.
Test all changes and train end users on new computer hardware/software features.
Partner with other groups to maintain Distribution Center servers and provide on-site troubleshooting for Warehouse Controls issues.
Work with department personnel and other corporate staff to ensure adherence to Desktop and Operational policies and standards.
Providing support for and receiving direction from senior level analysts while continuously learning more advanced software and hardware skills.
Evaluate performance of new programs, communicating issues back to senior analysts and/or software vendors as assigned.
YOU ARE
A lifelong learner.
A curious person who loves a logical puzzle.
Someone who works equally well solo or on a team.
Detail-oriented.
Able to cope with a potentially stressful work environment while at the same time maintaining professionalism and contributing to a team environment.
YOU HAVE
A Bachelor’s degree, college diploma or equivalent, or 1-2 years of experience in Information Services or 3-5 years applicable experience in distribution operations.
Experience in a distribution environment is an asset.
Strong communication and organizational skills.
The ability to read, write, speak, and understand English.
The ability to speak to groups of varying sizes and levels in the role of instructor or trainer.
The ability to create and maintain accurate documentation of hardware maintenance records, hardware performance, and vendor contacts for repairs and services.
Experience working with Help Desk ticketing systems.
Experience providing technical support to non-technical partners.
Able to cope with a potentially stressful work environment while at the same time maintaining professionalism that contributing to a team environment.
Well-developed analytical/troubleshooting skills.
Moderate to advanced knowledge of data processing and general business practices.
The ability to work hours that exceed 8 hours per day and/or 40 hours per week to complete priority projects, availability to work our afternoon shift during peak season, and are available to be on-call when needed.
The physical ability to sit or stand for extended periods of time, lift/carry up to 40 pounds, walk, bend, stoop and kneel.
The ability to work on-site at our Distribution Centre in London, Ontario.
Columbia Sportswear Company and our portfolio of brands, including Columbia, SOREL, Mountain Hardwear and prAna, know a thing or two about adventures. After all, we've been on one since 1938, working to perfect the art of enjoying the outdoors. Behind everything we make is an employee who's found that the greatest adventure starts with joining a company that strives to do the right thing.
This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.
Columbia Sportswear Canada is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national or ethnic origin, disability, as well as any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial or local law. Columbia Sportswear Canada provides accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. If you require accommodations to complete an application, please contact Human Resources CA_HRColumbia@columbia.com or call 519-644-5000 and we will work with you to meet your accommodation needs.

Title: Senior Product Analyst TORONTO, ONPRODUCT – PRODUCT
Description:
Who We Are
Tonal is the smartest home gym and personal trainer. It has completely revolutionized the way people work out at home, with its sleek design and advanced A.I. technology. We’ve united a diverse team of experts and decades of research to reinvent strength training, making it more efficient, more effective and more engaging.
With this in mind, we want to bring that same innovative approach to the workplace. At Tonal, we continue our shift of emphasis by growing our instrumental team. We collectively weave our knowledge and creativity, as we redefine the future of fitness. We are passionate about building products that transform lives, and building teams that transform the status quo. Together, we can be our strongest.
Overview
Tonal is looking for a Senior Product Analyst to help us discover insights about our customers and how they’re using our products. You will collaborate with product managers, designers, engineers, and executive stakeholders to conduct research and share findings that impact our product roadmap and improve the customer experience.
What You Will Do
Understand the company’s business goals, figure out the right questions to ask, find the right ways to collect data, analyze it, and tell us what it means
Understand how customers are using Tonal products and how they’re engaging with Tonal
Access and make sense of raw data (using SQL), link separate data sources into usable formats, and perform data analysis to extract useful business insights
Talk to customers to layer in qualitative understanding with quantitative findings and hypotheses
Work closely with cross-functional teams to provide useful analysis
Develop reports that uncover patterns, and drivers of engagement and retention
Design and implement reporting dashboards that track key business metrics
Uncover and communicate insights to the product team and company leadership
Who You Are
3+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis, with a specialization in consumer-facing products
BA/BS in Business, Econ, Statistics, Math, or another technical field or professional experience equivalent
Highly proficient with SQL and BI tools such as Looker, Amplitude, etc.
Experience working with data pipelines
Strong understanding of statistics (e.g., hypothesis testing, regressions) and an ability to communicate about them with stakeholders
Ability to organize, visualize, and present complex data to technical and non-technical audiences
Thrive in a dynamic, fast-moving startup environment
Extra Credit
Experience examining data sets through statistical software (ex. R, SAS) or other methods
Development experience in Python
Enough javascript experience to make a useful data visualization in D3 or similar
Experience with ERP and CRM systems like Netsuite or Salesforce
Prior experience working on products related to strength training, exercise, or health and fitness
At Tonal, we believe that the unique and varied lived experiences of our teammates contribute to our overall strength. We don’t just appreciate differences, we celebrate them, and we always seek people that represent a wide variety of backgrounds. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and designing employee experiences that contribute to your growth as much as you do to ours. If your experience aligns with what we’re looking for (even if you don’t check every single box), send us your application. We would love to hear from you!

Tonal is committed to meeting the diverse needs of people with disabilities in a timely manner that is consistent with the principles of independence, dignity, integration and equality of opportunity. Should you have any accommodation requests, please reach out to us via our confidential email, accessibility@tonal.com. All requests will be addressed and responded to in accordance with Tonal’s Accessibility Policy and local legislation.

Title: Sr. Analyst, Production Application Support
Description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.
  


    At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.
  


    To learn more about CIBC, please visit 
   
    CIBC.com
   



    Job Description
  


    What you’ll be doing
  


    As a Sr. Analyst, Production Application Support you will be instrumental in eliciting requirements from the stakeholders identifying pain points or improvements, create UI documents, conduct UAT, Training & draft formal Communication to stakeholders and manage maintenance of our key Credit systems, and troubleshooting end users’ production issues.
  

    You will be accountable for the end to end delivery of new or enhancements of one or more credit systems providing you the opportunity to become the subject matter expert of those systems.
  

    The role is responsible for providing technical expertise to support application and infrastructure technologies and small to medium initiatives in a multi-platform environment in compliance with applicable methodologies, standards, policies, and processes. The role troubleshoots problems, evaluating service requests to identify inconsistencies, analyzing potential impact, and taking corrective action in accordance with documented service standards.
  

    The Senior Analyst, Production Application Support utilizes a solid understanding of business dynamics to identify root causes and resolves moderately complex application problems involving hardware, software and operational issues. The role uses judgement and autonomy on daily tasks, exercising considerable latitude to coordinate and execute implementation plans and summarize outcomes for small to medium application and maintenance updates. Additionally, the role monitors and analyzes supported services and operational processes to identify opportunities for improvement and recommend solutions. The role proactively addresses problems within the scope of responsibility and identifies areas for possible improvements.
  


    You may be required to support implementations on weekends 
   occasionally.
  


    At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.
  


    How You’ll Succeed
  

 Business Analysis - Lead and participate in the documentation of Business and/ or Solution Requirements, to influence the level of detail and clarity on the requirements, ensuring the business needs are documented instead of how the solution will be implemented.
 End User Support - Proactively manage and resolve requirement related issues and end user support related issues by understanding and articulating issues, working with all parties impacted to determine an acceptable solution and seeking management approval on recommended solution when required.
 Data Quality Management - Provide value to the clients by analyzing data to provide quality reports while ensuring that data quality is maintained at all times in the systems.
 Relationship Management – Manage relationships with Business Partners, Technology Partners and external Vendors. You will work closely with business leads and subject matter experts, to translate detailed Credit System related requirements into understandable business language and scope. You have a proven ability to develop good business relationships with internal partners and you are experienced in effective stakeholder management.



    Who you are
  

 You can demonstrate experience. In working with Credit Risk Systems for at least 3 years and have experience of working in the banking / Financial industry.
 You're digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
 You're driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.
 You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
 Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.



    What CIBC Offers
  

    At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.
  

 We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program
 Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients
 We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development



    What you need to know
  



      CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact 
     
      Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
     



      You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit
    


      CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

Title: BI Analyste / Developpeur-(H/F)
Description:
Vos missions au quotidien


Responsabilités
 Au sein du groupe Société Générale, vous rejoignez la direction des systèmes d’information de Global Banking & investors Solution. Cette dernière a pour responsabilité, sur le plan mondial, de fournir aux lignes métiers de la banque de financement et aux fonctions support, l'ensemble des moyens informatiques et SI nécessaires à leur fonctionnement, à des conditions compétitives en termes de standards technologiques, de qualité de service et de coûts
 Vous travaillerez au sein d’un Centre de Compétence en Business Intelligence. Vous serez chargé de développement d’application de reporting (data vizualization) et d’aider l’équipe sur toute tâche technique.
 Le travail quotidien se fait en très étroite collaboration avec les équipes dans toutes les régions où se trouvent nos partenaires : AMER, EMEA et ASIA.
 Au cours de votre mission de VIE, vous serez en charge des responsabilités suivantes :

Recueillir les besoins et spécifier les fonctionnalités à mettre en place;
Développer les outils de reporting / dashboarding nécessaires;
Mettre en place, tester et livrer les fonctionnalités en suivant nos standards;
Répondre aux besoins de nos utilisateurs;
Maintenir nos plates-formes BI (administration, mise à jour, monitoring et performances).

Dans le cadre de leurs activités quotidiennes, l’équipe du BI Center a en charge le développement de divers projets de BI, mais doit également assurer un support de production sur les plates-formes BI maintenus par l’équipe (Power BI, Tableau, MicroStrategy).
 Il pourra également être demandé au candidat d’analyser les contrôles et taches existants sur ce périmètre afin de les automatiser et/ou optimiser. 
De plus, des rapports de surveillance devront être conçus et implémenter, permettant de fournir des statuts automatisés au comité exécutif.
 Aussi, le VIE fera évoluer des outils existants et/ou créera de nouveaux outils pour la mise en place de ces indicateurs de performance et contrôles.
 Il aura aussi l’opportunité d’évoluer au sein d’un centre de compétence en BI, il pourra ainsi découvrir les métiers de la donnée.









Et si c’était vous ?


Profil
 Requises:

Très bonne connaissance des concepts et pratiques en Business Intelligence
Très bonne connaissance de l’outil « Tableau »
Bonne connaissance et expérience de travail avec les méthodes Agiles/Scrum
Bonne connaissance du langage SQL
Connaissance des techniques UX pour la création de dashboards
Connaissance des environnements Windows server, Linux
Être créatif et force de proposition
Forte autonomie et ownership sur son travail
Forte capacité d’adaptation et aimant travailler dans un environnement très dynamique (les priorités peuvent changer quelques fois).

Désirées :

Bonne connaissance des outils Microsoft (Office, Sharepoint, etc.)
Connaissance de « Power BI » ou « MicroStrategy » sera un plus
Connaissance des langages de programmation web (HTML, CSS, Javascript)
Connaissance des activités d'une banque d'investissement

Quelques mots sur le contrat VIE
 Ce VIE à Montréal est à pourvoir dès que possible mais il faut compter au minimum 3 mois entre votre acte de candidature et le début de votre contrat VIE. Sa durée est de 24 mois.
 Le VIE est un contrat particulier, réservé aux Ressortissants de l’Union Européenne, âgé(e)s de moins de 28 ans.
 Il est soumis aux conditions d’éligibilité Business France (pour toute information consultez le site candidat :http://www.civiweb.com/).
 Nous attirons votre attention sur le fait que votre mission de VIE peut potentiellement être reportée, en fonction de l'évolution de la crise sanitaire et sous réserve de la décision prise par le Centre de crise et de soutien du Ministère de l'Europe et des Affaires étrangères (MEAE). Par ailleurs, le candidat sélectionné ne sera payé qu'après confirmation de Business France et arrivée dans le pays d'affectation.
 Afin de faciliter l'examen de votre candidature par nos responsables anglophones, nous vous remercions de postuler en anglais.

Plus qu’un poste, un tremplin


Dès votre arrivée, vous serez intégré à nos équipes et apprendrez chaque jour aux côtés de nos experts, qui vous soutiendront dans vos tâches. Progressivement, vous deviendrez plus autonome dans vos projets, faisant de cette expérience un véritable accélérateur de carrière. Vous découvrirez également toute la diversité de nos métiers, dans un secteur qui évolue et innove en permanence.
 A l'issue de votre VIE, différentes opportunités pourront vous être proposées, en France et à l'étranger.

Pourquoi nous choisir ?


Chez Société Générale, nous sommes convaincus que les personnes sont les moteurs du changement, et que le monde de demain sera façonné par toutes leurs initiatives, des plus petites aux plus ambitieuses. Que vous nous rejoigniez pour quelques mois, quelques années ou pour toute votre carrière, ensemble nous pouvons avoir un impact positif sur l'avenir. Créer, oser, innover et agir font partie de notre ADN. Si vous aussi, vous souhaitez vous impliquer directement, évoluer dans un environnement stimulant et bienveillant, vous sentir utile au quotidien et développer ou renforcer votre expertise, vous vous sentirez chez vous chez nous !
 Vous hésitez encore ? Sachez que nos collaborateurs peuvent consacrer plusieurs jours par an à des actions de solidarité pendant leur temps de travail : parrainage de personnes en difficulté d'orientation ou d'insertion professionnelle, participation à l'éducation financière de jeunes apprentis, partage de leurs compétences avec des associations caritatives, etc. Il existe de nombreuses façons de s'engager.












        Nous sommes un 
        employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances et nous sommes fiers de faire de la diversité une force pour notre entreprise. Le groupe s’engage à reconnaître et à 
        promouvoir tous les talents, quels que soient leurs croyances, âge, handicap, parentalité, origine ethnique, nationalité, identité de genre, orientation sexuelle, appartenance à une organisation politique, religieuse, syndicale ou à une minorité, ou toute autre caractéristique qui pourrait faire l’objet d’une discrimination.

      22000CR3


      Entité: 
      SG CIB


      Date de début: 
      01/08/2022


      Date de publication: 
      12/04/2022

Title: Senior BI Developer
Description:
Senior BI Developer - ( 220001G6 )
Description
Grow with the best. Join a smart, creative, and inspired team that works behind the scenes to support operational excellence. Our functional services teams (FSTs) provide services to 22,000 employees in over 400 locations worldwide. Bringing together individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our FSTs are vital to making our Company stronger.
Your Opportunity
We are looking for a Senior BI Developer on our Integrated Business Applications team.
Your Key Responsibilities
Problem Solving
Work with Business Analysts, BI Development Team, and other systems analysts to analyze business requirements; and translate them into Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence (DW/BI) solutions
Consult on BI capabilities and recommend and execute solutions to address business needs and performance requirements
Extend the Data Warehouse with data from new sources, applying: data lineage analysis; PL/SQL schema DDL design; and OBIEE business model and content development
Technical
Design, develop, and implement DW/BI solutions using: Oracle Data Warehouse Data Model, OBIA/ODI, OBIEE RPD business models, and OBIEE dashboards
Define, design, document and implement required customizations and extensions to existing models. Analyze impact on DW/BI application before making any changes to the system
Perform peer design and code review
Communication
Effectively communicate highly technical information to functional, technical team members and management
Communicate issues and solutions in a clear and concise manner
Keep clients, peers and managers informed on progress and the status of issues
Interact with end user, peers, help desk, and management personnel to resolve issues
Effective in interacting with users when designing, documenting, completing, and testing assignments
Maintain a positive attitude when dealing with others in a pressured environment
Qualifications
Your Capabilities and Credentials
Database and application development experience using formal software development life cycle
Solid experience in designing, developing and implementing an enterprise DW/BI system using Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE) and Oracle Data Integrator (ODI).
The ideal candidate has demonstrated the ability to work with professionalism and confidentiality, and is able to work independently and adapt to change in a very dynamic environment
Experience with Oracle Business Intelligence Application (OBIA) architecture and pre-built data models
Experience with at least one OBIA Analytics module (Finance, Projects, HR)
Experience with extracting Oracle Cloud (SAAS) data and loading into on-premise OBIA
Experience with Oracle Analytics Server (OAS) or Oracle Analytics Cloud (OAC) is an advantage
Extensive knowledge of EBS application modules (Oracle EBS HRMS, Payroll and/or Time and Labor modules preferred) and their integration into the overall Oracle suite
Experience with Oracle HRMS E-Business Suite and integration with HCM Cloud is an asset.
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Applications Development or related field;
Minimum of 10 years of experience working in the Oracle Datawarehouse/Business Intelligence environment
This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.
