Title: Analyste, Initiatives stratégiques et BI / Analyst, Strategic Initiatives and BI
Description:
Analyste, Initiatives stratégiques et BI
Avec plus de 13 milliards de dollars d'actifs sous gestion et au service de plus de 150 000 investisseurs, le Groupe financier PEAK bénéficie de la confiance de plus de 1 500 conseillers et employés à travers le Canada. Le Groupe financier PEAK s'adresse aux conseillers financiers exerçant dans les domaines de la gestion de patrimoine, des fonds communs de placement, des valeurs mobilières, des assurances et de la planification financière.

Le Groupe financier PEAK est une entreprise privée dynamique et en pleine croissance, qui croit que son avenir réside dans le développement d'opportunités de croissance pour tous. Avec un esprit entrepreneurial, nous valorisons le leadership et le développement de nouvelles idées en équipe. Nous cultivons un esprit de famille et maintenons un environnement de travail ouvert et respectueux des différences. Nos valeurs sont celles de l'authenticité, du respect, de l'épanouissement personnel et de l'éthique.

En tant qu'analyste, Initiatives stratégiques et BI, vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec le développement des affaires, les produits et l'équipe de direction pour évaluer les opportunités de croissance et d'efficacité de PEAK. Ce rôle relève de Jean-Sébastien Chaussé D'arcy, directeur, Initiatives stratégiques et BI. L'ancienneté du poste sera basée sur l'expérience du candidat.
Résumé et principales responsabilités du poste
Ce que vous ferez :

Jouer un rôle majeur dans la réussite de projets à fort impact dans l'ensemble de l'organisation, en travaillant avec une grande variété de parties prenantes internes et externes
S'engager avec les parties prenantes et les dirigeants de l'ensemble de l'organisation pour les aider à résoudre leurs défis les plus complexes et les plus ambigus
Établissez-vous en tant qu'expert sur les données de PEAK et commencez à soutenir d'autres équipes dans l'analyse des données
Soutenir la direction dans une grande variété de recherches primaires et secondaires pour éclairer la prise de décision (y compris l'analyse concurrentielle, les nouveaux services de l'industrie, les produits, etc.)
Fournir des commentaires, des opinions et des suggestions à toutes les équipes
Développer des indicateurs de performance clés pour plusieurs des initiatives de l'équipe, puis produire des rapports automatisés pour suivre les résultats
Identifier et mettre en œuvre des améliorations aux processus dirigés par l'équipe des initiatives stratégiques en recueillant des commentaires et en analysant les données
S'associer avec des parties prenantes interfonctionnelles pour comprendre en profondeur les points faibles opérationnels afin de découvrir des informations et de concevoir des solutions qui stimuleront l'efficacité opérationnelle de l'organisation


Exigences clés :

Expérience : 2 à 5 ans d'expérience dans un rôle de conseil, de stratégie d'entreprise ou d'opérations commerciales (BizOps)
Formation : Baccalauréat requis. Les domaines d'études en gestion et en finance sont privilégiés.
Données et analytique : Solides compétences analytiques et de résolution de problèmes avec une attention particulière aux détails et une expérience démontrée dans l'exploitation des données pour générer un impact commercial. Une expérience avec SQL est requise.
La connaissance de PowerBI est un atout
Collaboration : excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et volonté de travailler en collaboration avec un large éventail de parties prenantes et d'équipes interfonctionnelles
Organisation et planification : planifie et organise de manière indépendante de manière proactive, en se concentrant sur les priorités clés et en s'adaptant si nécessaire


Si vous chérissez des valeurs similaires et que ce poste représente un défi à la mesure de votre talent et de vos aspirations, envoyez-nous votre curriculum vitae à cv@groupepeak.com. Il nous fera plaisir d'évaluer votre candidature.


Seuls les candidats sélectionnés seront contactés.

Pour plus d'informations sur le Groupe financier PEAK et d'autres opportunités de carrière actuellement disponibles chez PEAK, visitez notre site Web à: www.groupepeak.com


Analyst, Strategic Initiatives and BI
With more than $13 billion in assets under management and serving more than 150,000 investors, PEAK Financial Group is trusted by more than 1,500 advisors and employees across Canada. PEAK Financial Group is intended for financial advisors practicing in the areas of wealth management, mutual funds, securities, insurance and financial planning.

The PEAK Financial Group is a fast-growing and dynamic private company, which believes that its future lies in the development of growth opportunities for all. With an entrepreneurial spirit, we value leadership and the development of new ideas as a team. We cultivate a family spirit and maintain an open work environment that respects differences. Our values are those of authenticity, respect, personal growth and ethics.

As an Analyst, Strategic Initiatives and BI, you will be working closely with Business Development, Product, and the Executive team in assessing PEAK’s growth and efficiency opportunities. This role reports to Jean-Sebastien Chaussé D’arcy, Director, Strategic Initiatives and BI. Seniority of the role will be based on the applicant’s experience.

Summary and main responsibilities of the position
What you’ll be doing:

Play a major role in the successful delivery of high impact projects across the organization, working with a wide variety of internal and external stakeholders
Engage with stakeholders and leaders across the organization to help solve their most complex and ambiguous challenges
Establish yourself as an expert on PEAK’s data, and start supporting other teams in data analysis
Support management in a wide variety of primary and secondary research to inform decision-making (incl. competitive analysis, new industry services, products, etc.)
Provide feedback, opinions and suggestions up, down and across all teams
Develop key performance indicators for multiple of the team’s initiatives, then produce automated reports to track results
Identify and implement improvements to processes being led by Strategic Initiatives team by gathering feedback and analyzing data
Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to deeply understand operational pain points to uncover insights and design solutions that will drive operational efficiency for the organization


Key requirements:

Experience: 2-5 years of experience in a consulting, corporate strategy, or business operations (BizOps) role
Education: Bachelors degree required. Areas of study in management and finance are preferred.
Data & analytics: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with superior attention to detail and a demonstrated track record of leveraging data to drive business impact. Experience with SQL is required.
Familiarity with PowerBI is an asset
Collaboration: Excellent interpersonal skills and willingness to work in collaboration with a wide range of stakeholders and cross-functional teams
Organization & planning: Independently plans and organizes proactively, focusing on key priorities and adapting when required


If you cherish similar values and this position represents a challenge commensurate with your talent and aspirations, send us your curriculum vitae at cv@groupepeak.com. It will be our pleasure to evaluate your application.


Only selected candidates will be contacted.


For additional information on the PEAK Financial Group and other career opportunities currently available at PEAK, visit our website at: www.groupepeak.com

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Business Intelligence Engineer
Location

Toronto , Canada
The responsibility of the Business Intelligence (BI) Engineer is to build and implement automated reporting and dashboards leveraging efficient technology and agile development principles with a focus on innovation, operational efficiency, unique competitive advantages for Munich Re Specialty Insurance (MRSI).

MRSI is putting in place the tools to make us an agile company that is powered by data and tools that provide: 1) the ability of our business leaders to spot trends and move quickly 2) our clients and partners a competitive, modern, and differentiated experience; 3) our colleagues a hassle free and collaborative workplace; 4) our regulators a compliant entity with a great reputation.

This role reports to the AVP of MRSI Canada and will be part of the global MRSI Data Operations Team. You will be accountable and responsible for the reliable delivery of solutions that the business needs to understand performance, adjust strategy, and operate smoothly in the face of ambitious growth and changing technology. Primary responsibility will be to support data and reporting for the commercial programs (MGA’s portfolio) MRSI Canada / Temple business unit, with secondary support for all other MRSI units globally.
Your job
A successful individual will have a strong technical background as well as business acumens, ability to conceptualize new ways of doing things and enjoy rolling their sleeves to execute with their team. They will be passionate about eliminating manual/repetitive processes and driving digital transformation but also able to rise above the hype and focus on value and practical application.

Responsibilities:

Work with business leaders to analyze data issues, perform root cause analysis, distill problems and solutions to make them easy to understand, and drive actions to resolve.
Develop dashboards, automated reporting and interactive data visualizations using BI software and other tools, ensure reliable and efficient delivery across the company
Analyzes, designs, codes, and tests tools and provides technical troubleshooting, support and resolution to applications problems
Creates and maintains documentation, including: business requirements, functional design, technical design, implementation plans, and user guides
Define and implement best practices for clean, extensible code, agile development and establish design principles and frameworks, and toolkits used to build and maintain the product
Lead and drive large and small scale initiatives, demonstrating short development cycles, high quality work and sustainable benefits; and deliver timely against commitments.
Work closely with Underwriting, Actuarial, and Finance teams to understand the business strategy and operating model, and provide appropriate thought leadership on digital solutions that can improve efficiency and outcomes
As a member of the MRSI Data Operations global team, maintain a close working relationship with Analytics and IT teams within Munich RE to understand existing solutions and resources available.

Your profile
This position requires sound technical skills, analytical abilities, good judgement, strong operational focus and ability to organize and manage workflow in fast paced environment with focus on service and business value. Successful candidates will possess the following skills/capabilities:

Commercial Insurance background desirable
Technical: business application or software development experience and strong knowledge and understanding of data architecture concepts, API design and consumption, and third-party software integration
Commercial : passionate about solving problems, enjoys connecting the dots between data, strategy and analytics, obsess with generating tangible business value and sustain solutions
Organization: able to co-ordinate multiple tasks and operate in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment with competing project priorities; strong track record of success with owning solutions from concept to completion
Communication: Advanced verbal and written communications skills, listening and teamwork skills, and effective presentation skills. Ability to communicate clearly, effectively, and concisely, both verbally and in written form.
Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline such as Computer Science, Finance, Economics, Engineering, Statistics or Advanced degree in Business
Expert level SQL, R, VBA or Stata. Phyton or similar preferred
3+ years of experience in an development role demonstrating practical application of technical skills
3+ years of experience leading successful project or development teams of technical experts, with or without direct reporting accountability
Knowledgeable with agile development methodologies and Technical savviness and a willingness to experiment with and learn new technologies
Strong communication skills with an ability to explain complex details and methodologies to both technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to introduce and drive innovative ideas and processes within established environments
Actuarial background desirable

About us
Together, we engage with everything we have and are, to help humankind act braver and better.

As the world’s leading reinsurance company with more than 40,000 employees in over 50 locations around the globe, Munich Re introduces a paradigm shift in the way you think about insurance. By turning uncertainty into manageable risk, we enable fundamental change. We recognize Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging as a key priority with a culture that welcomes different thoughts and opinions. We dare to think big and are continuously innovating on behalf of our clients.

Temple Insurance is a member of the Munich Re Group, one of the top providers of reinsurance, primary insurance, and insurance-related risk solutions in the world. Taking on risks worldwide of every type and complexity, the Munich Re Group and its business units are active in all lines of insurance. Our consistent risk management, financial stability, and client proximity make us a much sought-after trusted business partner. The Temple Insurance team is made of highly experienced individuals who possess professional backgrounds in both engineering and underwriting, and handle a portfolio of industrial and commercial accounts across Canada requiring dedicated placements for Property, Casualty, and Construction.
Please note that only candidates who are selected for interview will be contacted directly. We thank all candidates for their interest.

Apply now! Apply for this Job!
Munich Re Canada is committed to providing a work environment that is inclusive and free of employment barriers and discrimination. Accommodations will be made for qualified applicants with a disability throughout the recruitment process. If you receive a request for an interview and you have a disability which will require an accommodation to support your participation, please consult with Human Resources or contact AODARequestHR@munichre.ca as soon as practical so that suitable accommodations can be arranged.

Title: Expanded Product Offering Analyst
Description:
Welcome to Gordon Food Service! We are excited that you are thinking about opportunities with us, and we have an amazing story to share. Here's a quick glance of who we are and the impact you could have on the food service industry. There's a seat at our table for you...
                                       







































    Position Summary:
  

    Supports sourcing strategies, onboarding process of new vendors, and new product validation in alignment with Gordon Food Service Category merchandising strategies. Uses knowledge and resourcefulness to support daily business needs and ensure customers receive exceptional service and technical support. Provides performance analysis recommendations to support the Business Manager with category management decision-making and merchandising strategy development to maximize Gordon Food Service (GFS) sales and profits.
  


    Essential Functions:
  


     Communication & Relationship Building
   



       Develops communication of relevant product and vendor information to support Division needs, procurement, logistics, quality assurance, brands and other departments as appropriate.
     


       Build relationships and ensures vendor performance through regular communication and Vendor Business Reviews.
     


       Collaborates with Merchandising and Marketing Service Center (MMSC) to resolve issues and share ideas.
     


       Serves as a support person for team to help with questions and troubleshooting issues.
     


 Item & Vendor Management
   



       Provides support and recommendations for product sourcing and validation.
     


       Collaborates with the Business Manager and Category Teams to ensure that appropriate products are effectively prioritized, marketed, and merchandised.
     


       Negotiates cost with special order vendors and updates vendor cost in GFS’ cost system. Implements proper margin of special order(s) in the system.
     


       Collaborates with EPO vendors to expedite Customer Development Specialist’s (CDS) rush orders.
     


       Initiates, negotiates and executes the return of drop-ship products to special order vendors.
     


       Approves new product setup and executes introduction, conversion, and discontinuance.
     


       Executes all aspects product life-cycle management, from initial sourcing and market introduction to deletion.
     


       Effectively manages expenses associated with tools and promotions within budget.
     


       Works collaboratively with other peers towards continuous improvement of existing processes and development of new tools to drive greater business efficiencies
     


       Works with Quality Assurance to review compliance for product recalls and withdrawals for assigned product lines
     


       Develops and manages strategic relationships with select vendors through regular communications and Vendor Business Reviews.
     


       Represents NA Merchandising Operations on special projects or cross-functional teams.
     


       Collaborates with the divisional key customer stakeholders, regional merchandising teams, and Home Office teams to establish appropriate sales, brand, and margin on item/vendor portfolios.
     


       Assists with interviewing, onboarding, and training of new team members
     


     Business Analytics
   



       Collects, analyzes, summarizes and presents product sales and financial performance data to create recommendations and implement improvements in support of category analysis, business strategy, CMR preparation and vendor business reviews.
     


       Responsible for acquisition, accuracy, timeliness and relevance of core product data information.
     


       Assists the Project Manager in supporting the corporate marketing campaigns including campaign reporting.
     


       Performs other duties as assigned.
     



     Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
   




        Marketing / Product - knowledge of principles and methods for merchandising products and services. Knowledge of product and marketing segments.
      


        Project Management Skills - able to understand, follow and create processes in order to complete projects.
      


        Self-Management - Must have good time management and organizational skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously and to complete assign work on time and on budget. Must be results oriented and have excellent team skills.
      


        Customer Service — Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.
      


        Business Acumen - Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.
      


        Data Analysis / Analytics Skills - Proficiency in analyzing information; able to use analytics and associated tools (e.g., Excel, Access) in creative ways to tell the product story, garner buy-in, provide insights and to support decision-making.
      


        Active Listening — giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.
      


        Complex Problem Solving — identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.
      


        Critical Thinking — using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
      


        Judgment and Decision Making — Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.
      


        Speaking and Writing — Requires effective verbal, written, and presentation skills in order to support projects, convey findings, share strategies and implement product marketing/merchandising presentations, or to sell an idea in a variety of ways including written correspondence, face-to-face, or group meetings.
      


        Coordination — adjusting actions in relation to others' actions.
      


        Maintains a working knowledge of quality assurance requirements and vendor compliance.
      


        Maintains knowledge of industry trends and developments by reading appropriate books, journals and other literature and attending related conferences, seminars, etc. Maintains industry relationships to share issues and ideas.
      






     We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those selected for the next stage will be contacted. Gordon Food Service is an equal opportunity employer who strives to provide an inclusive work environment that involves everyone and embraces the diverse talent of its people. All qualified applicants and employees will receive consideration for employment, or in terms or conditions of employment, without regard to any enumerated or analogous grounds of discrimination, including race, religious beliefs, colour, gender, gender identity, gender expression, physical disability, mental disability, age, ancestry, place of origin, marital status, source of income, family status, sexual orientation or status as a qualified individual with disability.
     If you require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process due to a disability, please submit your request to talentcanada@gfs.com and use the words “Accommodation Request” in your subject line.

Title: Risk & Controls Analyst II, AWS Commerce Platform- Global Business Operations
Description:
Bachelor's or Master's degree
At least 3+ years of professional working experience in related occupations of Systems Analyst, Business Operations Engineer, Business Operations Program Manager, or related
At least 3+ years interacting with internal and external stakeholders at executive level
At least 3+ years with business analysis and functional experience with quantitative, analytical and organizational skills
At least 3+ years experience working with technical teams to build technology-based tools/solutions that will reduce costs and improve the overall program
At least 3+ years experience defining program requirements and using data and metrics to determine improvements
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Detail orientation and experience balancing multiple tasks and deadlines

Job summary
AWS has the most services and more features within those services, than any other provider–from infrastructure technologies like compute, storage, and databases–to emerging technologies, such as machine learning and artificial intelligence, data lakes and analytics, and Internet of Things. Platform is the glue that holds the ecosystem together. Whether its Identity features such as access management and sign on, cryptography, console, builder & developer tools, and even projects like automating all of our contractual billing systems, Platform is always innovating with the customer in mind. The Platform team sustains over 750 million transactions per second.

Do you get excited working on new challenges every day? Do you like to problem solve, drive solutions and influence what features should be launched for customers? Business Operations team is looking for a talented operations risk manager who can assess and manage risks for the BizOps team that drives programs/solutions across cross-functional teams across the company such as Accounts Receivable, Accounting, Operations, Customer Service, Development teams.


Key job responsibilities
As business operations risk & controls analyst, you will define, execute and effectively report on risks, audit programs, controls, issues and issue trends. You will create and provide risk metrics to senior leaders. The analyst contributes to the development, implementation and maintenance of the BizOps risk management and controls monitoring framework; contributes to process improvements; and provides a variety of risk mitigation-related services. In this position, you must be able to understand technologies used for managing complex business processes and identify the full range of risks related to processes that may include financial, regulatory compliance, operations, and organization policy. You should be comfortable interacting with highly technical software development engineers and business partners. Candidates must possess the ability to understand business requirements and processes to continue to create an accurate and efficient billing platform for both internal and external customers. Ingenuity, critical thinking, questioning assumptions and the ability to think outside the box will be a must in this highly ambiguous environment.

About the team
Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

We have a formal mentor search application that lets you find a mentor that works best for you based on location, job family, job level etc. Your manager can also help you find a mentor or two, because two is better than one. In addition to formal mentors, we work and train together so that we are always learning from one another, and we celebrate and support the career progression of our team members.

Our team is diverse! We drive towards an inclusive culture and work environment. We are intentional about attracting, developing, and retaining amazing talent from diverse backgrounds. Team members are active in Amazon’s 10+ affinity groups, sometimes known as employee resource groups, which bring employees together across businesses and locations around the world. These range from groups such as the Black Employee , Latinos at Amazon, Indigenous at Amazon, Families at Amazon, Amazon Women and Engineering, LGBTQ+, Warriors at Amazon (Military), Amazon People with Disabilities, and more.

Experience involving system performance analysis and optimization.
Experience in E-commerce payments processing
Strong background in business process improvement
An MS in Computer Science, Computer or Electrical Engineering, or a related field
Customer Service background
Great organizational skills and attention to detail; able to juggle and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to effectively communicate technical information to internal and external customers or vendors
Proactive and forward-thinking attitude and creative problem-solving ability
A motivated self-starter who can work independently in a fast paced, ambiguous environment
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Title: Senior Business Analytics Analyst
Description:
At ICBC, it’s our job to make sure the car insurance system works for all British Columbians, today and in the future. If you want

to make the most of your skills and expertise while growing your career, we want you. A career at ICBC is an opportunity to be

part of a talented, diverse and inclusive team that is driven to serve its customers and community. You can expect a competitive

salary, comprehensive benefits and a collaborative work environment. If you are reliable and dependable, contact us today to be

part of our talented and diverse team as we work together to create an insurance system we can all be proud of.

We welcome applications from all qualified job seekers. If you are a job seeker with a disability, please let us know as

adjustments can be made to help support you in delivering your best performance.

Senior Business Analytics Analyst

Job Title: Sr Bus Analytics Analyst Reference Number: 115899

Location: North Vancouver Employment Type: Permanent Full Time

Hours of Work: 7.5 hr Day Shift (M-F) Posted Date: 2022/04/14

Position Highlights

We currently have an opportunity for an experienced Senior Business Analytics Analyst to join our team in North Vancouver. As

part of the team, you will be expected to leverage your skills to provide consultative, advisory and analytical services to support

business initiative development and continuous improvement of business operations and outcomes.

The Evaluative Analytics team provides complex evaluation, measurement and analytical advice to support evidence-based

decision-making and enhance effectiveness of strategic corporate and divisional initiatives. Being successful in this role means

helping make ICBC the best it can be for its customers and for the population on British Columbia.

In this role, you will:

Conduct cost/benefit analysis, financial forecasting and analysis to identify issues and to develop valid solutions to complex

research, evaluation or analytics problems


Identify, extract and synthesize pertinent information obtained from large informational databases
Ensure methodological consistency in data collection and statistical analysis, and identify and resolve data, analysis or design

issues before they critically impede the success of a project


Prepare reports and presentations on evaluation and advanced analytic work for internal and external clients

What we offer


Competitive Salary & Benefits: We are committed to providing industry competitive salary and benefits.
Continuous Training: We offer continuous in-house development to ensure you are equipped with the knowledge to be

successful in your role.


Hybrid of On-site and Working from Home: We offer flexible working arrangements as we continue to support our employees

in balancing their career and family commitments.


COVID-19 safety protocols: We comply with WorkSafeBC and the health authorities of British Columbia to ensure your safety

and wellbeing.


Culture: We promote an inclusive and diverse work environment

Position Requirements

In order to be effective, fully qualified candidates will have a graduate degree in a relevant field (e.g. statistics, applied

mathematics, data science, actuarial science, economics, or psychology).

Your qualifications and capabilities will also include:

Several years of directly related experience in research, program evaluation and business analytics
Knowledge of statistical and other strategic research techniques and methodologies
Knowledge and experience with data extraction, exploration, analysis and statistical tools such as Python, Spark, R and SQL.

Position Information

As announced by the Provincial government, all ICBC employees will be required to show proof of full Covid-19 vaccination.

Please note only those legally entitled to work in Canada at present will be considered for this position.

Title: Analyst/Associate Consultant - US ABL Lender Consulting Group
Business Analyst, Talent Acquisition
Description:
As per the current Public Health Order, full vaccination against COVID-19 is a condition of employment with PHSA as of October 26, 2021.


Reporting to the Director, Talent Acquisition, the Business Analyst supports the strategic and operational decision-making process of the Talent Acquisition team. The Analyst is responsible for supporting initiated projects, managing audits, preparing financial /analytical reports, designing and developing policies and procedures and representing the designated team on committees and other work groups. The role collaborates with various stakeholders to develop solutions for the business and provides strategic and comprehensive advisory services which assist in improving accuracy, completeness and validity of data as well as improving reporting compliance. The Analyst contributes to creating a strong team environment by fostering trust and mutual respect, and supporting open dialogue on issues that allow for the optimization of projects and strategic goals. The role also supports the organization’s efforts to continually improve on the high quality of service provided to various partners.


What you’ll do

Act as a consultative partner by providing specialized expertise, analysis and advice to internal and external stakeholders to support the organization’s goals and objectives efficiently and effectively. Work closely with leaders to review and develop processes, redesign end-to-end activities (current and future state), drive project requirements, develop implementation, change and communications strategies and plans, identify non-value-added work, as well as assist with contract management.
Support the goals and objectives of the team with interventions such as change initiatives, strategy and planning facilitation, process re-design, role clarification, and restructuring. This includes leading or participating in initiatives and projects related to operations by defining project scope, developing project plans, supporting the work of project team members overseeing project implementation and evaluating results.
Provide support to the organization in recognizing current patterns across the system and partnering to develop and implement strategies to improve organizational effectiveness.
Proactively identify opportunities for process improvement that could result in added value, operational efficiencies or cost efficiencies and resolves complex issues, and make recommendations for new approaches to issue resolution.
Elicit business requirements by engaging program operation owners, key stakeholders and subject matter experts, and using methods such as interviews, environmental scanning, document reviews, business process descriptions, “use case” scenarios and workflow analysis.
Facilitate consensus on issues, including business design features, program changes, data requirements, privacy issues and reports. Prepare in depth business and analytical reports for executives.
Develop business requirements specifications, project proposals, business cases, change plans and other related documentation using standard templates.
Lead and manage multiple projects within the designated area and across functions including developing and setting milestones, project timelines and project plans in response to broader organizational priorities.
Provide structure and order to undefined problems and/or large scale problems, making them easier to solve, and uses systemic thinking in devising solution options.
Research, identify, develop and recommend best business practices for the department’s initiatives which support the broader scope of the department’s vision and strategic goals.
Gather and analyze information, anticipate and recognize problems and opportunities, create and evaluate alternatives, engage in continuous assessment and improvement to develop solutions, manage internal communications and make appropriate recommendations regarding processes and planning.
Facilitate implementation of business process changes, assist in the development of business cases and participates in special projects as required.
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.


What you bring


A level of education, training, and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Health Administration or a related discipline and a minimum of five (5) to seven (7) years of recent related experience, including experience in project/program management, and business case research and development, preferably in a large, multi-site healthcare environment.

Ability to apply critical thinking and analysis of issues and recommend solutions.
Knowledge and experience in project management and implementation, strategic planning, and change management.
Strong verbal and written communication skills and ability to operate in a complex stakeholder landscape.
Demonstrate ability in preparing professional reports and presentation materials.
Ability to work under high-pressure with critical deadlines and multi-task without supervision.
Ability to communicate complex and technical ideas in simple language.
Demonstrated ability to perform accurate, advanced data manipulation, analysis and information.
Demonstrated administrative, organizational, work planning skills.
Demonstrated superior customer service skills.


What we bring


Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.


Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan, and psychological health & safety programs and holistic wellness resources.
Annual statutory holidays (13) with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
Perks include access to fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.


Job Type: Temporary Full-Time (12 month contract)
Location: 1333 W. Broadway Vancouver, BC

Hours of Work: 08:30-16:30 Monday-Friday
Requisition #: 125318E


What we do


The Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) plans, manages and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to provide equitable and cost-effective health care for people throughout the province. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose.


Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services


PHSA is committed to employment equity, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, background and experience, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.

Title: Senior Business Analyst - Marketing Analytics
Description:
Angi® is transforming the home services industry, creating an environment for homeowners, service professions and employees to feel right at "home." For most home maintenance needs, our platform makes it easier than ever to find a qualified service professional for most indoor and outdoor jobs, home renovations (or anything in between!). We are on a mission to become the home for everything home by helping small businesses thrive and providing solutions to financing and booking home jobs with just a few clicks.

Over the last 25 years we have opened our doors to a network of over 200K service professionals and helped over 150 million homeowners love where they live. We believe home is the most important place on earth and are embarking on a journey to redefine how people care for their homes. Angi is an amazing place to build your dream career, join us—we cannot wait to welcome you home!
About the team

The marketing analytics team collaborates with marketing channel leads, internal data teams (BI, Data Engineering, and Data Science), and various internal stakeholders that are responsible for driving 750MM+ annually in revenue from consumer and service professional acquisition.

The analytics team is made up of data analysts that are strategic business partners. They work across Angi's portfolio of brands and all major marketing platforms, both Digital Marketing (SEM, Paid App, Display, Social, Affiliate, TV) and Brand Marketing (TV and Offline Media).

The goals of the marketing analytics team will be to:

Arm marketing teams with the tools, data, and reporting needed to make investment decisions.
Uncover actionable insights (through data analysis, modeling, statistical testing) that will maximize revenue, lower cost, and improve customer/pro retention.

About the role

Angi is looking for a Senior Business Analyst to join the Marketing Analytics team. This position will be a key part of a growing analytics team that supports an increasingly sophisticated marketing program. As a senior member of the team, you will partner closely with marketing leads to provide the analytical support that will help drive growth in consumer and service professional acquisition. You will be expected to write custom SQL and build models to help drive our marketing strategy, build reporting in Looker, provide recommendations for A/B testing, and interpret test results. Additionally, you will dive into any issues and provide recommendations as needed. You will be the subject matter expert for the marketing teams you support!

Some of the analytics and reporting challenges the team faces include:

How should we allocate budget across all channels (and within channels) to maximize return on ad spend (ROAS) and improve consumer lifetime value?
Can we systematically identify anomalies in performance to ensure we maximize ROI?
Can we use our internal supply and demand data to ensure we do not waste marketing dollars?
How can we leverage our TV marketing data to get an accurate ROI and drive growth?
What impact does TV and Offline Media have on other marketing channels?
How does marketing impact Angi brand health metrics like awareness, consideration and loyalty? What tactics can we use to improve these metrics?
What attribution methodologies should we explore to properly value investments?

What you'll do

Learn the complex Angi ecosystem and overall Angi marketing strategy in order to be a subject matter expert on all data analysis and modeling related to marketing.
Empower teams to make data-informed decisions by creating Looker dashboards and reports, writing custom SQL queries that provide insightful observations, and creating predictive models.
Mold 3rd party data from platforms where we buy media with internal data through SQL to provide insights and recommendations.
Collaborate closely with other data teams (data engineering, science, etc.) to build database tables in Snowflake and ensure there are no gaps in our infrastructure.
Prepare and present quantitative analyses in a digestible manner for the larger marketing organization (i.e. be the translator between the technical and non-technical).
Develop test plans to measure the performance of acquisition strategies and inform optimizations and future tests.
Own and lead analyses using data and insights to influence and support marketing strategy.
Conduct ad hoc investigations into anomalies as well as different drivers of channel performance.
Drive the move from Tableau to Looker: Partner with business owners to build, automate, and ensure the accuracy of business-critical reporting (i.e. ensure that key marketing metrics are visible for stakeholders).
Work with teams across the business to help find the optimal balance between consumer demand and supply-side inventory.
Analyze user behavior and build models to improve repeat usage and LTV.

What we're looking for

Bachelor's (or Master's) degree in a technical field such as Business Analytics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Stats, etc.
3+ years of professional experience in a business analysis or data analyst role
Advanced SQL knowledge, expertise in Excel, and Looker (or Tableau) experience
Strong grasp of statistics and statistical software (Python, and/or R experience is preferred to run tests and correlation/regression analysis)
Superior analytical, problem-structuring, and problem-solving skills; experience synthesizing data into information, and presenting concise analyses
Creative problem solver who can tackle large, nebulous questions (i.e. the ability to break questions into parts, to validate results of analyses by reconciling with data from other sources).
Strong communication skills, both oral and written
Experience in with Google Analytics and/or Adobe Analytics is a plus
Experience with a TV Analytics platform or Marketing Mix Modeling partner is a plus
Willingness to get hands dirty and do whatever it takes to ensure success
A passion for marketplaces, the sharing economy, and/or the on-demand services space
Willingness to adapt to a fast-paced work environment; hack, test and learn mentality; team player

We value diversity

We know that the best ideas come from teams where diverse points of view uncover new solutions to hard problems. We welcome and value individuals who bring diverse life experiences, educational backgrounds, cultures, and work experiences.

Compensation & Benefits

The salary band for this position ranges commensurate with experience and performance. Compensation may vary based on factors such as cost of living.
This position will be eligible for a competitive year end performance bonus & equity package
Full medical, dental, vision package to fit your needs
Flexible vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it
Pet discount plans & retirement plan with company match (401K)
The rare opportunity to work with sharp, motivated teammates solving some of the most unique challenges and changing the world

Title: Senior Business Analyst, TBS Sales Business Intelligence
Description:
Location:
Calgary, AB, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Ottawa, ON, CA Toronto, ON, CA
Req ID: 24401
Jobs by Category: Sales and Marketing
Job Function: Planning and Analysis
Status: Full Time
Schedule: Regular
Description
Join our team

We are the Business Intelligence team, an integral part of the TELUS Business Marketing (TBM) organization. We are a dynamic, entrepreneurial, and engaged team driven to rapidly respond and adapt to the changing needs of Canadian business customers including Small, Medium and Large segments.
We are the destination of choice for entrepreneurial team members that enjoy starting something from nothing and building it up.

Come join our team if you have a passion for data, marketing, to put customers first, embrace change and embody spirited teamwork to support stakeholders across a wide variety of teams. This role will report to the Sr. Manager of Market Intelligence, Sales & CRM Data team.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

You will build foundational data assets enabling sales teams across channels
You will drive cross segment sales channels’ performance through valuable insights

Here’s how

You will develop new analytical solutions to provide timely insights to the business
You will work on Salesforce (CRM) Customer data, business wireline productsYou will collaborate with cross functional teams: TBM Sales channel enablement team, Sales team, IT and other BI teams to develop foundational data assets that will drive sales’ performance, measurement, and finally compensation
You will coordinate with the product management team to ensure reporting readiness for new product launches
You will be part of a high performing team, celebrate wins, socialize learnings and progress to our leadership team
Qualifications
You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

You have an extraordinary ability to build relationships, collaborate, and influence across multiple teams
You are inherently curious to understand how things work, have ability to think outside-of-the-box and work around constraints
You focus on continuous learning and development across multiple domains including telecommunications industry, technology, and customer experience
You have advanced Structured Query Language (SQL) skills and hands-on experience working on Oracle and / or SQL server databases with more than 5 years of experience
You have intermediate to expert level proficiency in SAS with at least 5 years of hands on experience

Great to haves

Prior telecommunications or B2B marketing experience
University degree in Engineering or Commerce and/or equivalent combination of experience and education
Working knowledge on Google cloud platform (GCP) and BigQuery is an asset

Title: Analyste, Initiatives stratégiques et BI / Analyst, Strategic Initiatives and BI
Description:
Analyste, Initiatives stratégiques et BI

 Avec plus de 13 milliards de dollars d'actifs sous gestion et au service de plus de 150 000 investisseurs, le Groupe financier PEAK bénéficie de la confiance de plus de 1 500 conseillers et employés à travers le Canada. Le Groupe financier PEAK s'adresse aux conseillers financiers exerçant dans les domaines de la gestion de patrimoine, des fonds communs de placement, des valeurs mobilières, des assurances et de la planification financière.
 Le Groupe financier PEAK est une entreprise privée dynamique et en pleine croissance, qui croit que son avenir réside dans le développement d'opportunités de croissance pour tous. Avec un esprit entrepreneurial, nous valorisons le leadership et le développement de nouvelles idées en équipe. Nous cultivons un esprit de famille et maintenons un environnement de travail ouvert et respectueux des différences. Nos valeurs sont celles de l'authenticité, du respect, de l'épanouissement personnel et de l'éthique.
 En tant qu'analyste, Initiatives stratégiques et BI, vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec le développement des affaires, les produits et l'équipe de direction pour évaluer les opportunités de croissance et d'efficacité de PEAK. Ce rôle relève de Jean-Sébastien Chaussé D'arcy, directeur, Initiatives stratégiques et BI. L'ancienneté du poste sera basée sur l'expérience du candidat.

 Résumé et principales responsabilités du poste

 Ce que vous ferez :


 Jouer un rôle majeur dans la réussite de projets à fort impact dans l'ensemble de l'organisation, en travaillant avec une grande variété de parties prenantes internes et externes
S'engager avec les parties prenantes et les dirigeants de l'ensemble de l'organisation pour les aider à résoudre leurs défis les plus complexes et les plus ambigus
Établissez-vous en tant qu'expert sur les données de PEAK et commencez à soutenir d'autres équipes dans l'analyse des données
Soutenir la direction dans une grande variété de recherches primaires et secondaires pour éclairer la prise de décision (y compris l'analyse concurrentielle, les nouveaux services de l'industrie, les produits, etc.)
Fournir des commentaires, des opinions et des suggestions à toutes les équipes
Développer des indicateurs de performance clés pour plusieurs des initiatives de l'équipe, puis produire des rapports automatisés pour suivre les résultats
Identifier et mettre en œuvre des améliorations aux processus dirigés par l'équipe des initiatives stratégiques en recueillant des commentaires et en analysant les données
S'associer avec des parties prenantes interfonctionnelles pour comprendre en profondeur les points faibles opérationnels afin de découvrir des informations et de concevoir des solutions qui stimuleront l'efficacité opérationnelle de l'organisation



 Exigences clés :


 Expérience : 2 à 5 ans d'expérience dans un rôle de conseil, de stratégie d'entreprise ou d'opérations commerciales (BizOps)
Formation : Baccalauréat requis. Les domaines d'études en gestion et en finance sont privilégiés.
Données et analytique : Solides compétences analytiques et de résolution de problèmes avec une attention particulière aux détails et une expérience démontrée dans l'exploitation des données pour générer un impact commercial. Une expérience avec SQL est requise.
La connaissance de PowerBI est un atout
Collaboration : excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et volonté de travailler en collaboration avec un large éventail de parties prenantes et d'équipes interfonctionnelles
Organisation et planification : planifie et organise de manière indépendante de manière proactive, en se concentrant sur les priorités clés et en s'adaptant si nécessaire



 Si vous chérissez des valeurs similaires et que ce poste représente un défi à la mesure de votre talent et de vos aspirations, envoyez-nous votre curriculum vitae à cv@groupepeak.com. Il nous fera plaisir d'évaluer votre candidature.


 Seuls les candidats sélectionnés seront contactés.
 Pour plus d'informations sur le Groupe financier PEAK et d'autres opportunités de carrière actuellement disponibles chez PEAK, visitez notre site Web à: www.groupepeak.com


 Analyst, Strategic Initiatives and BI

 With more than $13 billion in assets under management and serving more than 150,000 investors, PEAK Financial Group is trusted by more than 1,500 advisors and employees across Canada. PEAK Financial Group is intended for financial advisors practicing in the areas of wealth management, mutual funds, securities, insurance and financial planning.
 The PEAK Financial Group is a fast-growing and dynamic private company, which believes that its future lies in the development of growth opportunities for all. With an entrepreneurial spirit, we value leadership and the development of new ideas as a team. We cultivate a family spirit and maintain an open work environment that respects differences. Our values are those of authenticity, respect, personal growth and ethics.
 As an Analyst, Strategic Initiatives and BI, you will be working closely with Business Development, Product, and the Executive team in assessing PEAK’s growth and efficiency opportunities. This role reports to Jean-Sebastien Chaussé D’arcy, Director, Strategic Initiatives and BI. Seniority of the role will be based on the applicant’s experience.

 
Summary and main responsibilities of the position

 What you’ll be doing:


 Play a major role in the successful delivery of high impact projects across the organization, working with a wide variety of internal and external stakeholders
Engage with stakeholders and leaders across the organization to help solve their most complex and ambiguous challenges
Establish yourself as an expert on PEAK’s data, and start supporting other teams in data analysis
Support management in a wide variety of primary and secondary research to inform decision-making (incl. competitive analysis, new industry services, products, etc.)
Provide feedback, opinions and suggestions up, down and across all teams
Develop key performance indicators for multiple of the team’s initiatives, then produce automated reports to track results
Identify and implement improvements to processes being led by Strategic Initiatives team by gathering feedback and analyzing data
Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to deeply understand operational pain points to uncover insights and design solutions that will drive operational efficiency for the organization



 Key requirements:


 Experience: 2-5 years of experience in a consulting, corporate strategy, or business operations (BizOps) role
Education: Bachelors degree required. Areas of study in management and finance are preferred.
Data & analytics: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with superior attention to detail and a demonstrated track record of leveraging data to drive business impact. Experience with SQL is required.
Familiarity with PowerBI is an asset
Collaboration: Excellent interpersonal skills and willingness to work in collaboration with a wide range of stakeholders and cross-functional teams
Organization & planning: Independently plans and organizes proactively, focusing on key priorities and adapting when required



 If you cherish similar values and this position represents a challenge commensurate with your talent and aspirations, send us your curriculum vitae at cv@groupepeak.com. It will be our pleasure to evaluate your application.


 Only selected candidates will be contacted.


 For additional information on the PEAK Financial Group and other career opportunities currently available at PEAK, visit our website at: www.groupepeak.com

Title: Senior Business Analytics Analyst
Description:
At ICBC, it’s our job to make sure the car insurance system works for all British Columbians, today and in the future. If you want 
 
 to make the most of your skills and expertise while growing your career, we want you. A career at ICBC is an opportunity to be 
 
 part of a talented, diverse and inclusive team that is driven to serve its customers and community. You can expect a competitive 
 
 salary, comprehensive benefits and a collaborative work environment. If you are reliable and dependable, contact us today to be 
 
 part of our talented and diverse team as we work together to create an insurance system we can all be proud of. 
 
 We welcome applications from all qualified job seekers. If you are a job seeker with a disability, please let us know as 
 
 adjustments can be made to help support you in delivering your best performance. 
 
 Senior Business Analytics Analyst 
 

Job Title: Sr Bus Analytics Analyst Reference Number: 115899 
 

Location: North Vancouver Employment Type: Permanent Full Time 
 

Hours of Work: 7.5 hr Day Shift (M-F) Posted Date: 2022/04/14 
 
 Position Highlights 
 
 We currently have an opportunity for an experienced Senior Business Analytics Analyst to join our team in North Vancouver. As 
 
 part of the team, you will be expected to leverage your skills to provide consultative, advisory and analytical services to support 
 
 business initiative development and continuous improvement of business operations and outcomes. 
 
 The Evaluative Analytics team provides complex evaluation, measurement and analytical advice to support evidence-based 
 
 decision-making and enhance effectiveness of strategic corporate and divisional initiatives. Being successful in this role means 
 
 helping make ICBC the best it can be for its customers and for the population on British Columbia. 
 

In this role, you will:


Conduct cost/benefit analysis, financial forecasting and analysis to identify issues and to develop valid solutions to complex
 research, evaluation or analytics problems 
 


Identify, extract and synthesize pertinent information obtained from large informational databases
Ensure methodological consistency in data collection and statistical analysis, and identify and resolve data, analysis or design
 issues before they critically impede the success of a project 
 


Prepare reports and presentations on evaluation and advanced analytic work for internal and external clients
 What we offer 
 


Competitive Salary & Benefits: We are committed to providing industry competitive salary and benefits.
Continuous Training: We offer continuous in-house development to ensure you are equipped with the knowledge to be
 successful in your role. 
 


Hybrid of On-site and Working from Home: We offer flexible working arrangements as we continue to support our employees
 in balancing their career and family commitments. 
 


COVID-19 safety protocols: We comply with WorkSafeBC and the health authorities of British Columbia to ensure your safety
 and wellbeing. 
 


Culture: We promote an inclusive and diverse work environment
 Position Requirements 
 
 In order to be effective, fully qualified candidates will have a graduate degree in a relevant field (e.g. statistics, applied 
 
 mathematics, data science, actuarial science, economics, or psychology). 
 

Your qualifications and capabilities will also include:


Several years of directly related experience in research, program evaluation and business analytics
Knowledge of statistical and other strategic research techniques and methodologies
Knowledge and experience with data extraction, exploration, analysis and statistical tools such as Python, Spark, R and SQL.
 Position Information 
 
 As announced by the Provincial government, all ICBC employees will be required to show proof of full Covid-19 vaccination. 
 
 Please note only those legally entitled to work in Canada at present will be considered for this position.

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Business Intelligence Engineer
Location

Toronto , Canada
The responsibility of the Business Intelligence (BI) Engineer is to build and implement automated reporting and dashboards leveraging efficient technology and agile development principles with a focus on innovation, operational efficiency, unique competitive advantages for Munich Re Specialty Insurance (MRSI).

MRSI is putting in place the tools to make us an agile company that is powered by data and tools that provide: 1) the ability of our business leaders to spot trends and move quickly 2) our clients and partners a competitive, modern, and differentiated experience; 3) our colleagues a hassle free and collaborative workplace; 4) our regulators a compliant entity with a great reputation.

This role reports to the AVP of MRSI Canada and will be part of the global MRSI Data Operations Team. You will be accountable and responsible for the reliable delivery of solutions that the business needs to understand performance, adjust strategy, and operate smoothly in the face of ambitious growth and changing technology. Primary responsibility will be to support data and reporting for the commercial programs (MGA’s portfolio) MRSI Canada / Temple business unit, with secondary support for all other MRSI units globally.
Your job
A successful individual will have a strong technical background as well as business acumens, ability to conceptualize new ways of doing things and enjoy rolling their sleeves to execute with their team. They will be passionate about eliminating manual/repetitive processes and driving digital transformation but also able to rise above the hype and focus on value and practical application.

Responsibilities:

Work with business leaders to analyze data issues, perform root cause analysis, distill problems and solutions to make them easy to understand, and drive actions to resolve.
Develop dashboards, automated reporting and interactive data visualizations using BI software and other tools, ensure reliable and efficient delivery across the company
Analyzes, designs, codes, and tests tools and provides technical troubleshooting, support and resolution to applications problems
Creates and maintains documentation, including: business requirements, functional design, technical design, implementation plans, and user guides
Define and implement best practices for clean, extensible code, agile development and establish design principles and frameworks, and toolkits used to build and maintain the product
Lead and drive large and small scale initiatives, demonstrating short development cycles, high quality work and sustainable benefits; and deliver timely against commitments.
Work closely with Underwriting, Actuarial, and Finance teams to understand the business strategy and operating model, and provide appropriate thought leadership on digital solutions that can improve efficiency and outcomes
As a member of the MRSI Data Operations global team, maintain a close working relationship with Analytics and IT teams within Munich RE to understand existing solutions and resources available.

Your profile
This position requires sound technical skills, analytical abilities, good judgement, strong operational focus and ability to organize and manage workflow in fast paced environment with focus on service and business value. Successful candidates will possess the following skills/capabilities:

Commercial Insurance background desirable
Technical: business application or software development experience and strong knowledge and understanding of data architecture concepts, API design and consumption, and third-party software integration
Commercial : passionate about solving problems, enjoys connecting the dots between data, strategy and analytics, obsess with generating tangible business value and sustain solutions
Organization: able to co-ordinate multiple tasks and operate in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment with competing project priorities; strong track record of success with owning solutions from concept to completion
Communication: Advanced verbal and written communications skills, listening and teamwork skills, and effective presentation skills. Ability to communicate clearly, effectively, and concisely, both verbally and in written form.
Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline such as Computer Science, Finance, Economics, Engineering, Statistics or Advanced degree in Business
Expert level SQL, R, VBA or Stata. Phyton or similar preferred
3+ years of experience in an development role demonstrating practical application of technical skills
3+ years of experience leading successful project or development teams of technical experts, with or without direct reporting accountability
Knowledgeable with agile development methodologies and Technical savviness and a willingness to experiment with and learn new technologies
Strong communication skills with an ability to explain complex details and methodologies to both technical and non-technical audiences
Ability to introduce and drive innovative ideas and processes within established environments
Actuarial background desirable

About us
Together, we engage with everything we have and are, to help humankind act braver and better.

As the world’s leading reinsurance company with more than 40,000 employees in over 50 locations around the globe, Munich Re introduces a paradigm shift in the way you think about insurance. By turning uncertainty into manageable risk, we enable fundamental change. We recognize Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging as a key priority with a culture that welcomes different thoughts and opinions. We dare to think big and are continuously innovating on behalf of our clients.

Temple Insurance is a member of the Munich Re Group, one of the top providers of reinsurance, primary insurance, and insurance-related risk solutions in the world. Taking on risks worldwide of every type and complexity, the Munich Re Group and its business units are active in all lines of insurance. Our consistent risk management, financial stability, and client proximity make us a much sought-after trusted business partner. The Temple Insurance team is made of highly experienced individuals who possess professional backgrounds in both engineering and underwriting, and handle a portfolio of industrial and commercial accounts across Canada requiring dedicated placements for Property, Casualty, and Construction.
Please note that only candidates who are selected for interview will be contacted directly. We thank all candidates for their interest.

Apply now! Apply for this Job!
Munich Re Canada is committed to providing a work environment that is inclusive and free of employment barriers and discrimination. Accommodations will be made for qualified applicants with a disability throughout the recruitment process. If you receive a request for an interview and you have a disability which will require an accommodation to support your participation, please consult with Human Resources or contact AODARequestHR@munichre.ca as soon as practical so that suitable accommodations can be arranged.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.
Job Description:
Role Summary:
Come be part of an exciting and challenging opportunity by helping to accelerate the growth and application of data analytics capabilities at Sun Life Canada. As part of the Sun Life Distribution Analytics team, you will have the opportunity to be at the forefront of applying data and analytics to tackle business problems. You will be helping Sun Life use analytics to deliver on our purpose of helping our Clients achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives.
Reporting to the Director, Distribution Analytics, the Senior Analyst is responsible for providing data and insights to our internal clients, developing innovative visual analytics solutions and enabling faster and better decision making for Sun Life.
The position will be located at the Sun Life office in Toronto or Waterloo.
What will you do?
Build out comprehensive business intelligence & reporting for Distribution leadership & sales org, keeping in mind the needs of varied audiences and the desire to drive action & sales.
Provide plans and estimates for reporting initiatives.
Maintain standards for analysis and reporting at all levels including best practice data visualization techniques.
Turn complex data into easy to understand visual insights that are aligned to business objectives.
Enable visual storytelling through Tableau and visual analytics tools.
Ensure that business and technical requirements are captured in proper documentation and maintained.
What will you need to succeed?
5+ years' experience in data analytics and business intelligence.
Experience in using data analysis tools such as Microsoft SQL server, SAS EG or similar.
Must be proficient in SQL coding to query and analyze data. Must have experience in creating dashboards and stories in Tableau.
Visual design expertise with a solid understanding of the best practices around dashboards and visual perception.
Experience in working in an agile development environment including rapid prototyping during sprints.
Degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering or equivalent is required.
Competencies:
Ability to work independently, manage engagements or parts of large engagements directly with business partners.
Solid understanding of how to consolidate and transform data to meaningful and actionable information
Ability to draw out meaningful business insights by synthesizing information from multiple sources
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation and storytelling with data
Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment.
What’s in it for you?
Great Place to Work® Certified in Canada and the US.
Named 2021 “Best Places to Work” by Glassdoor
Canada Award for Excellence for Mental Health at Work - 2021
Flexible hybrid work model including in-country work-from-home if you prefer.
Pension, stock and savings programs to help build and enhance your future financial security
Work and professional development that is united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives
A friendly, collaborative, and inclusive culture
Be part of our continuous improvement journey in developing the next greatest digital enterprise experience
#LI-Hybrid
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.
Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.
At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.
Sun Life is committed to the health and safety of all those in our workplaces and our communities. In accordance with Sun Life’s Vaccination Policy (Canada):
Employees permitted to work remotely are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location where activity related to Sun Life business occurs.
Employees whose job duties require them to attend a Sun Life office, Financial Centre or offsite location for Sun Life business must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 effective May 1st.
Employees whose regular workplace is a Financial Centre and SLFD field leaders must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or participate in Sun Life’s Rapid Screening Program to attend a Financial Centre or an offsite event.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
