68,400/68 400 - 111,700/111 700
Job Category:
Advanced Analytics
Posting End Date:
27/04/2022

Title: Expanded Product Offering Analyst
Description:
Welcome to Gordon Food Service! We are excited that you are thinking about opportunities with us, and we have an amazing story to share. Here's a quick glance of who we are and the impact you could have on the food service industry. There's a seat at our table for you...
Position Summary:
Supports sourcing strategies, onboarding process of new vendors, and new product validation in alignment with Gordon Food Service Category merchandising strategies. Uses knowledge and resourcefulness to support daily business needs and ensure customers receive exceptional service and technical support. Provides performance analysis recommendations to support the Business Manager with category management decision-making and merchandising strategy development to maximize Gordon Food Service (GFS) sales and profits.
Essential Functions:
Communication & Relationship Building
Develops communication of relevant product and vendor information to support Division needs, procurement, logistics, quality assurance, brands and other departments as appropriate.
Build relationships and ensures vendor performance through regular communication and Vendor Business Reviews.
Collaborates with Merchandising and Marketing Service Center (MMSC) to resolve issues and share ideas.
Serves as a support person for team to help with questions and troubleshooting issues.
Item & Vendor Management
Provides support and recommendations for product sourcing and validation.
Collaborates with the Business Manager and Category Teams to ensure that appropriate products are effectively prioritized, marketed, and merchandised.
Negotiates cost with special order vendors and updates vendor cost in GFS’ cost system. Implements proper margin of special order(s) in the system.
Collaborates with EPO vendors to expedite Customer Development Specialist’s (CDS) rush orders.
Initiates, negotiates and executes the return of drop-ship products to special order vendors.
Approves new product setup and executes introduction, conversion, and discontinuance.
Executes all aspects product life-cycle management, from initial sourcing and market introduction to deletion.
Effectively manages expenses associated with tools and promotions within budget.
Works collaboratively with other peers towards continuous improvement of existing processes and development of new tools to drive greater business efficiencies
Works with Quality Assurance to review compliance for product recalls and withdrawals for assigned product lines
Develops and manages strategic relationships with select vendors through regular communications and Vendor Business Reviews.
Represents NA Merchandising Operations on special projects or cross-functional teams.
Collaborates with the divisional key customer stakeholders, regional merchandising teams, and Home Office teams to establish appropriate sales, brand, and margin on item/vendor portfolios.
Assists with interviewing, onboarding, and training of new team members
Business Analytics
Collects, analyzes, summarizes and presents product sales and financial performance data to create recommendations and implement improvements in support of category analysis, business strategy, CMR preparation and vendor business reviews.
Responsible for acquisition, accuracy, timeliness and relevance of core product data information.
Assists the Project Manager in supporting the corporate marketing campaigns including campaign reporting.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Marketing / Product - knowledge of principles and methods for merchandising products and services. Knowledge of product and marketing segments.
Project Management Skills - able to understand, follow and create processes in order to complete projects.
Self-Management - Must have good time management and organizational skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously and to complete assign work on time and on budget. Must be results oriented and have excellent team skills.
Customer Service — Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.
Business Acumen - Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.
Data Analysis / Analytics Skills - Proficiency in analyzing information; able to use analytics and associated tools (e.g., Excel, Access) in creative ways to tell the product story, garner buy-in, provide insights and to support decision-making.
Active Listening — giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.
Complex Problem Solving — identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.
Critical Thinking — using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.
Judgment and Decision Making — Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.
Speaking and Writing — Requires effective verbal, written, and presentation skills in order to support projects, convey findings, share strategies and implement product marketing/merchandising presentations, or to sell an idea in a variety of ways including written correspondence, face-to-face, or group meetings.
Coordination — adjusting actions in relation to others' actions.
Maintains a working knowledge of quality assurance requirements and vendor compliance.
Maintains knowledge of industry trends and developments by reading appropriate books, journals and other literature and attending related conferences, seminars, etc. Maintains industry relationships to share issues and ideas.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those selected for the next stage will be contacted. Gordon Food Service is an equal opportunity employer who strives to provide an inclusive work environment that involves everyone and embraces the diverse talent of its people. All qualified applicants and employees will receive consideration for employment, or in terms or conditions of employment, without regard to any enumerated or analogous grounds of discrimination, including race, religious beliefs, colour, gender, gender identity, gender expression, physical disability, mental disability, age, ancestry, place of origin, marital status, source of income, family status, sexual orientation or status as a qualified individual with disability.
If you require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process due to a disability, please submit your request to talentcanada@gfs.com and use the words “Accommodation Request” in your subject line.

Title: Risk & Controls Analyst II, AWS Commerce Platform- Global Business Operations
Description:
Bachelor's or Master's degree
At least 3+ years of professional working experience in related occupations of Systems Analyst, Business Operations Engineer, Business Operations Program Manager, or related
At least 3+ years interacting with internal and external stakeholders at executive level
At least 3+ years with business analysis and functional experience with quantitative, analytical and organizational skills
At least 3+ years experience working with technical teams to build technology-based tools/solutions that will reduce costs and improve the overall program
At least 3+ years experience defining program requirements and using data and metrics to determine improvements
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Detail orientation and experience balancing multiple tasks and deadlines

Job summary
AWS has the most services and more features within those services, than any other provider–from infrastructure technologies like compute, storage, and databases–to emerging technologies, such as machine learning and artificial intelligence, data lakes and analytics, and Internet of Things. Platform is the glue that holds the ecosystem together. Whether its Identity features such as access management and sign on, cryptography, console, builder & developer tools, and even projects like automating all of our contractual billing systems, Platform is always innovating with the customer in mind. The Platform team sustains over 750 million transactions per second.

Do you get excited working on new challenges every day? Do you like to problem solve, drive solutions and influence what features should be launched for customers? Business Operations team is looking for a talented operations risk manager who can assess and manage risks for the BizOps team that drives programs/solutions across cross-functional teams across the company such as Accounts Receivable, Accounting, Operations, Customer Service, Development teams.


Key job responsibilities
As business operations risk & controls analyst, you will define, execute and effectively report on risks, audit programs, controls, issues and issue trends. You will create and provide risk metrics to senior leaders. The analyst contributes to the development, implementation and maintenance of the BizOps risk management and controls monitoring framework; contributes to process improvements; and provides a variety of risk mitigation-related services. In this position, you must be able to understand technologies used for managing complex business processes and identify the full range of risks related to processes that may include financial, regulatory compliance, operations, and organization policy. You should be comfortable interacting with highly technical software development engineers and business partners. Candidates must possess the ability to understand business requirements and processes to continue to create an accurate and efficient billing platform for both internal and external customers. Ingenuity, critical thinking, questioning assumptions and the ability to think outside the box will be a must in this highly ambiguous environment.

About the team
Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here, which is why we aren’t focused on how many hours you spend at work or online. Instead, we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.

We have a formal mentor search application that lets you find a mentor that works best for you based on location, job family, job level etc. Your manager can also help you find a mentor or two, because two is better than one. In addition to formal mentors, we work and train together so that we are always learning from one another, and we celebrate and support the career progression of our team members.

Our team is diverse! We drive towards an inclusive culture and work environment. We are intentional about attracting, developing, and retaining amazing talent from diverse backgrounds. Team members are active in Amazon’s 10+ affinity groups, sometimes known as employee resource groups, which bring employees together across businesses and locations around the world. These range from groups such as the Black Employee , Latinos at Amazon, Indigenous at Amazon, Families at Amazon, Amazon Women and Engineering, LGBTQ+, Warriors at Amazon (Military), Amazon People with Disabilities, and more.

Experience involving system performance analysis and optimization.
Experience in E-commerce payments processing
Strong background in business process improvement
An MS in Computer Science, Computer or Electrical Engineering, or a related field
Customer Service background
Great organizational skills and attention to detail; able to juggle and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to effectively communicate technical information to internal and external customers or vendors
Proactive and forward-thinking attitude and creative problem-solving ability
A motivated self-starter who can work independently in a fast paced, ambiguous environment
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer Intern / Stagiaire développeur(euse) en intelligence d'affaires
Description:
The opportunity

Inclusion at Unity is driven by one overarching framework: Empathy, Respect, and Opportunity.

At Unity, you'll make a difference. In a collaborative, fast-growing environment, we're democratizing development, solving hard problems, and enabling the success of our community. Our editor, game services, and monetization technologies are deployed in hundreds of thousands of apps used by hundreds of millions of users every day. This generates vast data sets that need to be mined for meaningful insights that drive this fast-growing business and support our developer community.

Unity is seeking a Business Intelligence Developer Intern to join as an integral member of our growing Operate BI Infrastructure team. You will be building data pipelines and reporting tools in Looker that serve as the backbone for product and business leaders across the company to make critical decisions.

If you are analytically minded, have a knack for optimizing anything and everything and have a passion or building scalable processes, we want to hear from you!. And above all - you ask questions and embark to answer them. Think you're ready?

Come join our journey!

What you'll be doing
Collecting requirements from business leaders and designing and delivering ETLs and Looker explores
Providing data documentation in an easily understood way to both technical and non-technical parts of the business
Understanding sophisticated business questions and challenges and relating them to the data
Monitoring and maintaining critical data infrastructure
Exploring our extensive data sets to identify and investigate new opportunities and efficiencies

What we're looking for
Current student pursuing a degree in computer science, data analytics, business intelligence, or equivalent and returning to the degree program after the completion of the internship for at least one semester.
Demonstrable understanding of SQL (BigQuery a plus)
Knowledge of ETL development and processes
Understanding of data visualization, dashboarding and analytical report building (Looker, Tableau or similar)
Ability to explain technical concepts and analysis clearly to a wide audience, as well as translate sometimes ambiguous data requests into clear action items and requirements.

You might also have

Experience with Python
Experience with LookML

What to expect from your internship at Unity

Duration: 13 weeks depending on your academic calendar. Start date May 29 2022
Mentorship: You'll be working simultaneously with a manager and a mentor to help you develop your skills throughout your internship.
Impact: Our interns are working right alongside full time team members on projects that have a lasting impact on our product and services.
Networking & Development: Learning activities, networking opportunities, and social events take place throughout the summer to enrich your internship experience.

Basic requirements - Canadian student cohort 2022

Current students pursuing a relevant university program, returning to their degree program for at least one semester, and graduating in December 2022 or in the year 2023.

Life at Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

Unity is at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than five billion times per month in 2020. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.


L'opportunité

Chez Unity, l'inclusion est régie par une infrastructure globale, l'empathie, le respect et les opportunités.

Chez Unity, vous ferez la différence. Dans un environnement collaboratif à croissance rapide, nous œuvrons à démystifier le développement, à résoudre des problèmes complexes et à favoriser la réussite de notre communauté. Nos technologies d'édition, de services de jeu et de monétisation sont déployées sur des centaines de milliers d'applications utilisées par des centaines de millions d'utilisateurs chaque jour. Cela génère un volume de données considérable, qui doit être exploité pour obtenir des informations significatives permettant d'alimenter cette activité en pleine croissance et de soutenir notre communauté de développeurs.

Unity est à la recherche d'un(e) stagiaire développeur(euse) en intelligence d'affaires qui rejoindra l'équipe d'infrastructure d'intelligence d'affaires en pleine croissance. Vous construirez des pipelines de données et des outils de génération de rapports dans Looker qui serviront d'épine dorsale aux chefs de produits et aux chefs d'entreprise de toute la société pour leur permettre de prendre des décisions cruciales.

Si vous possédez un sens de l'analyse, que vous avez un don pour optimiser tout ce qui vous entoure et que vous êtes passionné(e) par la mise en place de processus évolutifs, ce poste est fait pour vous! Et surtout, vous posez des questions et vous vous investissez pour y répondre. Vous pensez être prêt(e)?

Venez nous rejoindre!

Ce que vous allez faire

Recueillir les exigences des chefs d'entreprise, puis concevoir et livrer des processus d'ETC et des explorations Looker
Fournir de la documentation compréhensible par les services techniques et non techniques de l'entreprise
Comprendre les questions et les défis complexes relatifs aux affaires, et savoir les associer aux données
Surveiller et maintenir l'infrastructure des données critiques
Étudier nos vastes jeux de données afin de cibler et d'enquêter sur de nouvelles possibilités, notamment pour améliorer le rendement

Ce que nous recherchons

Étudiant en cours d'obtention d'un diplôme en informatique, analyse des données, veille stratégique ou équivalent et retournant à son programme d'études après l'achèvement de son stage pour au moins un semestre
Une compréhension avérée de SQL (BigQuery est un atout)
Une connaissance du développement et des processus ETC
La compréhension de la visualisation de données, ainsi que de la création de tableaux de bord et de rapports analytiques (Looker, Tableau ou système comparable)
La capacité d'expliquer des concepts et des analyses techniques à un public varié, mais aussi de traduire des requêtes de données parfois ambiguës en actions et en exigences concrètes

Vous avez peut-être également

Une expérience avec Python
Une expérience avec LookML

À quoi vous attendre pendant votre stage chez Unity?

Durée : 13 semaines en fonction de votre calendrier académique. Dates de début: 23 mai 2022
Mentorat : Vous travaillerez à la fois avec un(e) gestionnaire et un(e) mentor pour vous aider à développer vos compétences tout au long du stage
Impact : Nos stagiaires travaillent aux côtés des membres de l'équipe à temps plein sur des projets qui ont un impact durable sur nos produits et nos services
Réseautage et développement : Des activités d'apprentissage, des possibilités de réseautage et des événements sociaux ont lieu tout au long de l'été pour enrichir votre expérience de stage

Exigences de base – cohorte d'étudiants canadiens 2022

Tout étudiant en cours d'obtention d'un diplôme pertinent, retournant à son programme d'études pour au moins un semestre et qui obtiendra son diplôme en décembre 2022 ou en 2023

La vie chez Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) est la plateforme la plus utilisée au monde pour la création et l'exécution interactive de contenu 3D en temps réel (RT3D). Des créateurs, notamment des développeurs de jeux vidéo, des artistes, architectes, concepteurs automobiles et cinéastes, utilisent Unity pour donner vie à ce qu'ils ont imaginé. La plateforme de Unity offre un ensemble complet de solutions logicielles pour créer, exécuter et monétiser du contenu interactif 2D et 3D en temps réel pour les téléphones mobiles, les tablettes, les ordinateurs, les consoles et les appareils de réalité augmentée et de réalité virtuelle.

Unity est à l'avant-garde du développement. En collaborant avec nos partenaires, nous offrons un soutien optimal aux plus récentes technologies et plateformes. Les applications développées par les créateurs au sein de Unity ont été téléchargées plus de cinq milliards de fois par mois en 2020. Pour en savoir davantage, visitez le site www.unity.com.

Unity est un employeur axé sur l'égalité des chances qui s'engage à favoriser un environnement inclusif et innovateur avec les meilleurs employés. Par conséquent, nous fournissons des opportunités d'emploi sans tenir compte de l'âge, la race, la couleur, l'ascendance, l'origine nationale, la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l'identité sexuelle ou l'expression, l'orientation sexuelle ou tout autre statut protégé. S'il y a des préparatifs ou des ajustements que nous pouvons faire afin de vous aider à avoir une expérience d'entrevue confortable et positive, veuillez-nous le faire savoir.

Les chasseurs de têtes et les agences de recrutement ne peuvent pas soumettre résumes/CV par ce site Web ou directement aux superviseurs. Unity n'accepte pas des chasseurs de têtes non sollicités et des résumés (CV) d'agence. Unity ne payera pas d'honoraires à aucune agence tierce ou entreprise qui n'a pas signé d'ententes avec Unity.

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer II, Procurement
Description:
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
3+ years analyzing and interpreting data and experience with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc.
Experience in writing complex SQL queries
Experience with data modeling, data warehousing, and building ETL pipelines
Strong written and verbal communication skills are essential

Job summary
At Amazon, we work hard to make the products our customers want and love available for purchase on our website. Last year, we ordered more than 10 billion items from hundreds of thousands of vendors. More impressive than the numbers are the people behind the services. Procurement is a diverse, 2-pizza team which owns the software systems that create and process the purchase orders for all Amazon retail items. It's important that we reliably generate and convey purchase orders to thousands of vendors and then listen and act when vendors send back signals regarding their ability to fulfill those orders.
In your role as a Business Intelligence Engineer II (BIE II) on the Procurement team, you will collaborate with product and technical teams to develop and track key metrics, automate reporting and data processing solutions, and manage data pipelines and infrastructure. Your data-driven insights will help us recognize business opportunities, influence our product roadmap, diagnose system issues and defects, and make the best possible decisions regarding how we collaborate with vendors and suppliers.
To accomplish these tasks, you will need to be able to analyze and extract relevant information from large, complicated data sets of structured and unstructured data. You must be proficient at producing and maintaining scaled, automated, user-friendly reporting systems and dashboards. You will need to be confident presenting metrics to senior business leaders, providing valuable insights and making call-outs, tracking progress on team goals, and owning the management and prioritization of data deep-dives.
If this describes you, apply today to the Procurement team at Earth's most customer-centric company!

Quantitative modeling and statistical analysis skills
Experience leading large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including using AWS technologies – Redshift, S3, data-pipeline and other big-data technologies
Query performance tuning skills
Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language (Python, Java, Ruby, etc.)
Experience with Jupyter Notebooks
Experience providing technical leadership and mentoring others on best practices in the data engineering space
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Title: Senior Systems Analyst - SAP - 337107
Description:
Senior Systems Analyst - SAP
On behalf of our client in the Financial Services Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Senior Systems Analyst - SAP.
Senior Systems Analyst - SAP – Job Description
Works with business stakeholders to elicit business requirements
Defines and communicates systems requirements at the appropriate level of detail to ensure applications are flexible, open, scalable, available, testable and maintainable within a high-volume production environment
Authors business requirements documents and solution design specifications
Analyzes and conceptualizes the design of the solution, working with the Systems Architect, Vendors and Software Developer to achieve the client stakeholder objectives through effective deployment of technology.
Applies both in-depth business and technical knowledge, to successfully represent the business and technology community in arriving at technical solutions

Senior Systems Analyst - SAP – Mandatory Skills
Demonstrated ability to provide technology recommendations to the business
Experience working with developers to design and analyze alternative technical solutions, test completed code and complete a smooth implementation with business partners
Proficient analytical, troubleshooting, and debugging skills
Knowledge, experience, and understanding of architecture, application development, application systems design, and integration
SQL skills and experience performing data analysis
Demonstrated proficiency in a team environment with projects involving the integration of disparate types of technologies/platforms and agile development
Experienced in providing operational and sustainment services
Proven capabilities in establishing and maintaining effective partnerships and relationships
Strong communication skills (oral, written, facilitation, presentation) and facilitation skills
Demonstrated initiative and leadership abilities - comfortable managing issues in cross functional teams
Conflict and issue resolution and escalation
Positive attitude, keeping a constant watch on how to do things better
Adaptability and a willingness to take on new challenges
Post-secondary education in a related discipline

Senior Systems Analyst - SAP – Nice to Have Skills
Knowledge of the Wealth Management and the Financial Services industry
Experience with SAP, ECC, PA, OM, BW and HANA
Experience with SAP SuccessFactors

Senior Systems Analyst - SAP - Assignment Start Date
ASAP – 10 months to start
Senior Systems Analyst - SAP - Assignment Location
Toronto, ON – Work Remotely

Title: Senior Inventory Analyst
Description:
Are you ready for a taste of the one of Canada's Top Employers? Purdys Chocolatier is delighted to have been voted by our employees as one of the Canada's Best Employers. This esteemed award is a testament to the rich texture of our history and our more than 100 years of dedication to quality, trust, tradition, and innovation. The Purdys difference is that we truly recognize the value of our people. 
 
 We reward you with competitive compensation, recognition for your achievements, opportunities for ongoing training to grow professionally and personally, delicious perks, and much, much more. Purdys Chocolatier is looking for a Senior Inventory Analyst to join our Kingsway Office in Vancouver, BC! Under the direction of the Inventory & Scheduling Manager, the Senior Inventory Analyst is responsible for the inventory accuracy and inventory control processes within the organization. They are responsible for assisting in onboarding and training of the Inventory Management team members. 
 
 They are also responsible for overseeing ongoing inventory management projects in a senior capacity and making recommendations to management on industry best practices based upon their specialized expertise. As the Senior Inventory Analyst, primary responsibilities include but are not limited to: • Auditing and developing inventory control processes to drive continuous improvement in inventory accuracy while balancing the needs of each respective department impacted • Making recommendations to the business on industry best practices for inventory control • Aiding in the development and integration of ERP & WMS software upgrades to better fulfill inventory management needs • Maintains system data to ensure reports are accurate to forecast needs and delivery requirements for purchasing and production • Adjusts inventory based upon thorough analysis and understanding of cycle count results • Monitors work order completion and maintains planned orders to ensure MRP requirements remain accurate • Prepares reports that indicate production progress; communicates issues proactively • Determines and manages appropriate safety stock levels • Analyzes changes in forecasts and communicates ramifications/risks to stakeholders • Identifying and reporting on orphaned and excess inventory to minimize inventory obsolescence • Reviews and approves the periodic and annual cycle count schedules • Reviews and approves MRP frequency, trains staff on process • Provides guidance to Inventory Management team on transactions that require investigations and provides senior support for higher value or complex inventory variances • Oversees the management of short-dated materials to minimize inventory obsolescence • Leads team in fiscal year-end inventory counts, coordinating all cross functional activities leading up to and after the counts • Recommends, implements, trains staff on inventory control processes across company based upon industry best practices • Monitors and reports on inventory accuracy with target driven goals • Provides recommendations and communicates inventory management requirements for any ongoing system related or Master Data Management (MDM) projects All successful candidates must possess the following: • Experience in logistics, planning, scheduling, using MRP software or relevant education in Operations Management, with a focus on planning and scheduling • Experience supporting inventory management software implementation • Demonstrated problem solving abilities with excellent time management capabilities • Excellent communication, planning and organizational skills • Strong data analysis skills • Ability to do root cause analysis • Ability to lead and influence others and create a teamwork environment • Expertise in Microsoft Excel (required), Power BI, Syteline (ERP), WMS • Strong knowledge of GMP’s in a food environment • Ability to work flexible shift times • Candidates holding or working towards a professional supply chain certification will be an asset (APICS, SCMP) Purdys Chocolatier recognizes the value of skills and knowledge gained outside of formal education and paid employment. Applicants who present an equivalent combination of qualifications and experience will be considered and are encouraged to apply. We thank all applicants for their interest in Purdys Chocolatier, but due to the volume of applications received, we are only able to contact those applicants who have been selected for an interview. 
 
 No phone calls please. Purdys Chocolatier is committed to offering reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us via email at resumes@purdys.com

Title: Senior Business Analyst - Omnichannel contact center
Description:
Summary
DecisivEdge seeks a Business Analyst to join our growing Customer Experience Transformation team. The Business Analyst is the chief organizer of the project, and a resource for other team members when they need to know how something should work. As a Business Analyst, you will have substantial experience with a variety of tools, methodologies, and frameworks to document a project’s progress and structure the implementing team’s workflow. Our Business Analysts collaborate to ensure a complete enumeration of business objectives, define the scope of proposed solutions, and support stakeholders throughout every project's lifecycle, which are potentially large scale and always imbued with innovation.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Understand the client's omni channel contact center and be able to document opportunities to improve efficiency with operational or technical solutions. Understand the contact center process well enough to gather relevant information from the client by multiple means including: independent review of existing documentation, conducting interviews and workshops, system demonstrations, and side-by-side shadowing of personnel.
Organize the information and document the overall systems and their high-level functionality.
Discover and document business process flows, high-level system integrations, and data flows,
Communicate directly with stakeholders to clearly define and analyze business requirements to ensure user expectations and business requirements clearly meet the project objectives.
Document technical details of the systems - application and platform details, enterprise server and network diagrams, system architecture overview.
Identify and document key integration points with other systems internal and external

Meet with the development team to analyze project technical documentation ensuring that the business requirements and business logic is captured and delivered accurately.
Work with the Development team to prioritize open stories, tasks, and bugs and participate in sprint planning.
Work with the QA and UAT teams to ensure those teams have the information they need to create test cases and validate test coverage is appropriate.
Coordinate the setup of system integration, staging, and pre-production technical environments to ensure that configurations mirror production and identify risks if they do not
Drive internal and external meetings to achieve key milestones.
Assist project managers with tracking, delivery, and validation by customers for all deliverables

Identify and escalate project risks and effectively communicate to the project and account managers

Assist the client with proper issue communication and other customer or internal communication
Coordinate multiple teams within the client’s organization and other vendors to ensure proper issue resolution and production implementation activities
Create Jira tickets for development requests.

Leads functional teams or projects; provides task direction for more junior members of the team
Serves as best practice/quality resource within the discipline and/or as a technical expert on functional or cross-functional teams or projects


Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Technical and/or Domain Knowledge

To perform this job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the specialized depth and/or breadth of expertise with the following:

Must be able to demonstrate the ability and experience to understand the omnichannel contact center operational and business process so you can effectively document workflows, data flows and system diagrams. Experience with Five9 and Salesforce in a healthcare contact center environment is not mandatory but would be very helpful.
Strong technical understanding of multiple types of enterprise systems on various platforms including Contact Center/telephony platforms, agent desktops and data and reporting needs of a contact center.
Strong written and oral communication skills
Proven analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities required - tell us how you put your strengths to use
Confident enough to work individually and humble enough to be a part of a collaborative team
Microsoft Office Suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Teams)


Education and/or Experience

Bachelor’s Degree or 6-8 years of relevant professional experience; or the equivalent combination of education, technical training, and work experience.
Travel

Travel to client locations with periods of travel (up to 5% of the time) during project initiation and implementation activities.

Title: Director, Advanced Analytics & Business Intelligence
Description:
Position Overview:

CanadaHelps is looking for a problem-solving, self-starting Director, Advanced Analytics & Business Intelligence with a passion for social change to join our team.
This is an opportunity to join one of Canada’s first, and North America’s most successful, social enterprises. We have a growing, dedicated team of entrepreneurial-minded peers who have a passion for helping small and medium-sized charities succeed. We believe technology and data are transformational game-changers for creating a better, more just tomorrow. We democratize access to technology by providing affordable, online fundraising software and training to more than 25,000 registered charities across Canada (and the number of charities is rapidly growing). Over the past 20 years, we’ve helped over 3 million Canadians donate over $1.8 billion to Canadian charities.
Reporting to the Chief Operations Officer of CanadaHelps, the Director, Advanced Analytics & Business Intelligence is responsible for overall business analytics strategy at CanadaHelps, providing analytics, BI, & insights support throughout the organization. This role leads the Data & Analytics Team, and is responsible for evolving our business analytics service from reactionary analysis and report building to advanced analytics (predictive/prescriptive analytics, modeling, ML, etc.), including the development of client-facing data products.
Key Duties and Responsibilities

Contribute to CanadaHelps’ long-term business analytics and intelligence vision and roadmap
Develop a deep understanding of our business analytics and BI needs across the organization in order to identify opportunities for improvement and new services
Help the business explore potential applications for data science and machine learning to drive our understanding of business and marketing performance as well as improve and develop new client-facing data products
Oversee our data governance and retention policies and processes. ensuring data best practices
Play a role in building a data-driven culture throughout the entire organization
Develop, and lead the implementation of the yearly Business Plan for the Data & Analytics Team
Support the success of various functional teams via data-driven decision making and ensure alignment across teams based on their individual data needs
Work in a hands-on fashion to ensure successful execution of data initiatives
Nurture and grow a small team of data analysts and scientists and support their professional development

Represent the Advanced Analytics team in Management Team Meetings


Skills & Experience:

B.S. or Master’s in a quantitative field (e.g. computer science, statistics, economics, math) or equivalent
7+ years' experience working in the data analytics and data science field, preferably in a B2B services environment
Have managed a data team in a fast-moving, scaling business environment
Proficiency with SQL, Python, R, or similar analytics and programming languages
Familiarity with relational database modeling, database applications and integrations, ETL tools, client/server solutions, and modern query languages preferred
Familiarity with data visualization applications, particularly Tableau
Experience with statistical methods, machine learning techniques, and A/B testing in service of real-world business challenges
Have worked closely with marketing, product, technology and finance teams
Attention to detail and good problem-solving skills
Excellent interpersonal skills
Strong communication, project management and leadership skills
Meticulous and detailed work ethic
Critical thinking skills


You will excel in this role if you:

Are a true self-starter with a can-do attitude;
Are intrinsically motivated, and do your best work because you just have to;
Have a hunger to learn and contribute and are looking to grow - fast;
Are a true team player and take responsibility for your own success and the success of your team;
Love a challenge and work well independently or across teams to get the job done;
Are results oriented;
Have a service mindset and a desire to go above and beyond partner expectations;
Are perceptive in identifying and serving the needs of partners and have high emotional intelligence;
Are coachable;
Want to be in a stimulating and fast-paced environment; and
Are looking for meaningful work where you can make a positive social impact


Here’s what we have to offer:

A permanent position with a competitive salary, 100% employer-paid benefits, generous RRSP matching, generous time off, and flexible work policies.
A chance to make a difference and a unique opportunity to add major value as a key member of a growing team in a forward-thinking, technology-focused environment.
A “get things done”, open, collaborative and flexible environment.
Amazing co-workers with passion, intelligence, energy, and ideas.
A flexible schedule and work location policy. (Note: this role will need to attend our Toronto office in person at least two days per week)
Headspace membership


At CanadaHelps, we are deeply committed to upholding a culture of respect, equality, and inclusion. We offer competitive salaries and perform regular benchmark analyses to ensure the compensation of all team members is within market ranges. Core to our values, we regularly conduct internal pay audits to eliminate pay gaps and ensure pay equity. We believe these are effective measures to achieve change. Seeking to hire from a diverse pool of talent to pursue our ambitious mission, and understanding some individuals prefer a level of pay privacy and confidentiality, we share salary range information with the candidates we meet.


Accommodation:

CanadaHelps is an equal opportunity employer, and welcomes and encourages applications from all persons including those with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process, please contact accessibility@canadahelps.org so that appropriate accommodations can be made.

Title: Advisor - Business intelligence
Description:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.
Job Level
NV-08
As a business intelligence advisor, you help develop and use tools and methods to collect, compile, model and restore the organization’s physical and non-physical data to establish governance, help decisionmakers understand the big picture and inform decisions.

You advise and assist clients and partners and develop tools, methods and processes. Your projects and initiatives require extensive knowledge of your line of work.

You propose recommendations, solutions and action plans based on the organization’s objectives and priorities. You share ideas and help solve problems using your analytical skills and extensive knowledge of the line of business. You interact with stakeholders working in other fields. Interpersonal savvy is therefore essential.
General Information on the Position
Other working conditions
Workplace: Position located in Montreal or Lévis, depending on the applicant selected. The work arrangement for the position is hybrid work
Number of jobs available : 1
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a related field
A minimum of 2 years of relevant experience
Please note that other combinations of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst, Channel Applications
Description:
Senior Business Systems Analyst, Channel Applications
Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.
We are a fast-growing global company with 70+ consecutive quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of nearly 10,000 companies, including 1,800+ networks and 2,900+ cloud and IT service providers in over 26 countries spanning five continents.
A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.
Job Summary: Partners with the Channel business teams and peers in IT, Quote-to-Cash and Product to ensure delivery of applications aligned to the business and IT strategy, as well as the support of those applications. Works with Business groups to define their global IT requirements and to analyze appropriate solutions. Manages projects from inception to completion with matrix, global teams.

Responsibilities

Business Requirements Analysis

Partners with business stakeholders to analyze, define and document business requirements, within and across functional areas

Drives best practices during requirements gathering and modeling

Has a strong focus on gathering core requirements, beyond stated requirements and correctly places these within a broader context

Understands business environment and helps to connect/align relevant business stakeholders
Process Modeling and Design

Partners with business stakeholders to analyze, define and document business processes within and across functional areas

Drives best practices during requirements gathering and modeling

Understands business environment and helps to connect/align relevant business stakeholders
Stakeholder Management

Manages stakeholder expectations and communications within and beyond functional track

Knows business environment well enough to identify and proactively include the correct stakeholders

Interacts regularly with senior management level stakeholders, and demonstrates value from realized projects
Solution Design

Responsible to design and document cross-functional and global solutions, drawing on functional expertise of functional and technical team members or vendors, as appropriate

Advises on solutions prepared by peers or supporting team, and champions good design practices
Documentation

Documents and reviews broader team documentation

Supports team in identifying and defining relevant documentation templates pertaining to solution delivery

Is a champion for knowledge transfer to enable/empower other team members
Functional Design

Develops functional designs for applications, integrations and conversions

Ability to work on multiple functional areas and integrations with third party products

Keeps up to date with industry trends and vendor capabilities to produce robust functional designs

Reviews functional designs and obtains sign-offs with the cross functional business and IT teams

Provides inputs into business processes based on design capabilities

Champions sustainable, forward-looking functional designs
Architecture
N/A
Testing & Test Design

Coordinates integration testing, validates test cases with stakeholders for user acceptance testing and training, and obtains sign-offs

Coordinates defects clarification, triage and coordinate resolution with engineering teams
Project Management

Manages multiple application releases and projects

Manages stakeholder expectations

Designs release scope and schedule in line with business goal, prioritization and IT capacity
System Configurations

Configures applications in line with business goals

Designs forward looking configurations by recognizing future needs aligned with the business roadmap

Develops configuration standards
Day to Day Support (Production Support)

Supports and trains junior resources and oversees quality in triage and troubleshooting practices

Leads troubleshooting efforts on critical issues with cross functional teams through resolution

Identifies improvements to address repeat issues
Training and Change Management

Works with functional leadership teams to set expectations and conduct planning and execution of SME training activities

Defines, communicates, and implements support and engagement plans

Analyzes adoption rates and issues and assesses business case realization and proposes solutions to improve
Vendor Management

Manages/leads individual consulting resources as assigned

Participates in vendor advisory boards and user groups
Vendor & Application Technology Evaluation

Executes medium-scale vendor evaluations, pricing negotiations and software acquisitions

Prepares management communications and gets stakeholder input for recommendations

Qualifications

7+ years experience in analytics

Bachelor's in Information Systems, Business or related field

Equinix is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Title: Commercial Analytics Business Analyst
Description:
At Parkland, our purpose is to Power Journeys & Energize Communities. We are a prominent independent supplier and marketer of fuel and petroleum products and a leading convenience store operator. As One Parkland team, we proudly serve diverse retail, commercial and wholesale customers across Canada, the United States, the Caribbean region, and South America. We power a growing family of locally known brands including Fas Gas Plus, Pioneer, RaceTrac, Superpumper, Ultramar, Chevron, Esso, and ON the RUN.
We recognize that diversity gives us an edge and inclusion propels us forward. We’re also a passionate team of down-to-earth achievers, committed to getting our customers, colleagues and communities further, faster. As such, we welcome talented individuals that have a variety of perspectives, backgrounds, and industry experience who will contribute to the success of our One Parkland team.
Position Title: Commercial Analytics Business Analyst
Team and Location: ERM | Calgary, AB
Position Summary:
The Business Analyst will support our corporate Commercial and Logistics groups at Elbow River with responsibilities ranging from analytics, supply & demand modelling, report automation to deal entry. They are responsible the ongoing development and maintenance of the business intelligence (BI) reporting and analytics as well as supporting the Deal Entry Analyst. They will collaborate with the Manager, Commercial Analytics and to ensure data timeliness, completeness and accuracy aimed at optimizing our commercial processes and decisions. The Business Analyst will work on cross functional projects and be a mentor to other analysts to and team members.
Key Responsibilities:
Reporting & Development –
Develop reports, dashboards and KPI analytic packages that provide improved insight into our business and that of our Commercial teams
Leverage Power Platform skills to build solutions to replace complex excel based tasks and reports
Proactively identify opportunities to improve and enhance existing reporting solutions
Modify or integrate new data sources, calculations and report visuals and help integrate efficiencies into existing tools
Continuously improve processes for bringing data together from multiple sources to provide accurate and insightful information to our stakeholders
Analysis –
Pioneer new analytical methods, tools, and systems to continually drive the business forward
Improving and enhance operational efficiencies by building tools to automate and streamline processes; write complex SQL queries to extract and integrate to existing and new data models
Assist in the design and maintenance of reports, dashboards, portal pages, and scorecards utilized for management reporting
Analyze data to help determine insights to solve business problems and identify new opportunities.
Help maintain and populate our internal company valuation models
Performing market research and competitor analysis, industry benchmarking, and identifying & sizing market opportunities
Trade Deal Entry & Allegro–
Support the deal entry analyst role
Works to ensure report data sources are complete, accurate and updated as expect
Work with inhouse Allegro development team to troubleshoot process deficiencies and suggest optimization solutions
Support the Manager, Commercial Analytics and fulfill ad-hoc report building and analysis as required
Qualifications and Skills:
Post-secondary degree Data Science, Data Analytics would be an asset, however relevant experience or education would also be considered
Minimum 5 years of Business Analysis or equivalent experience
Demonstrated expert level Excel and experience with complex modelling
Experience in creating dashboards, report development and data modeling with Microsoft Power Platform (Apps, Bi and Automate)
Ability to query data and draft reports using tools like Power Query (M), DAX, and SQL
Possess strong business, analytical and critical thinking skills. Have the ability to work with a collaborative team in a fast-paced, multi-faceted environment, while maintaining professional communication and accurate analysis of the business
Self- Starter that can independently identify and manage tasks, time and competing priorities and meet critical deadlines
Strong written and verbal communication skills along with the ability to work well in cross-functional teams
Ability to adjust to changing and conflicting demands, responsibilities and issues
Good understanding of arbitrage, risk, hedging and position management
Preferred qualifications:
Basic knowledge of R, Python, or other statistical models
Experience in the oil and gas industry
Experience working with ETRM applications (Allegro)
We Offer:
Participation in Parkland Pledge, an employee-driven charitable giving program.
Our Performance-based Annual Incentive Plan, an annual bonus awarding your performance.
A share in our success through the Employee Share Purchase Plan and 100% company matching.
Flexible medical and dental packages, a Health Care Spending Account, along with a supportive Employee and Family Assistance Program.
In-house learning and development opportunities, leadership training, international opportunities.
An employee referral program – earn up to $2000 for your referral.
A focus on healthy living through wellness initiatives and an annual fitness reimbursement program.
Discount Programs and Educational Scholarship Programs for family members.
A safety focused work environment and ongoing safety training.
We thank all candidates in advance for their interest, however only those being considered will be contacted. Please note:
Candidates must be legally able to work in Canada at this time. Parkland regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas.
Parkland Corporation is committed to the principles of Employment Equity.We strive to provide accessibility in employment to ensure equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including persons with disabilities. Parkland Corporation will endeavour to provide accommodation to persons with disabilities in the recruitment process upon request. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to a disability, please notify us upon scheduling your interview.
Please note that final candidates for this position will be required to undergo a confidential pre-employment background check which may include but not be limited to educational, criminal, credit, drug and alcohol and/or Fitness for Duty testing.

Title: Senior Manager, Business Intelligence
Description:
Our Mission
 Higher Ground Education is the parent company of a global network of schools and programs operating under the brands Guidepost Montessori, Academy of Thought and Industry and Prepared Montessorian. Since 2016, our schools have spread the transformative power of Montessori education by opening high-fidelity brick and mortar, virtual schools, learning pods and teacher training worldwide.
 Overview
 We are looking for Senior Manager, Business Intelligence who can envision strategy and enjoys getting into the details to brilliantly execute it. You have a passion for analyzing data, finding trends, and using that data to make sound business recommendations.
 The candidate will be responsible for the defining pricing and go-to-market strategies for new school opens. The candidate will work closely with our Marketing, Expansion, and Talent teams to identify and drive strategic business opportunities. In this role, you'll operate as a business and cross-functional leader, guiding recommendations on where to open our new schools and what is needed to be successful in the market.
 This is a pivotal role on our team, and we're looking for an individual who is both a critical thinker to shape best-practices and a hands-on doer who enjoys executing go-to-market programs and initiatives to grow enrollment. If you're excited about working in an entrepreneurial environment and solving problems to drive widespread change in education, this role is for you.
 Responsibilities
 The Senior Manager, Business Intelligence will lead the new market development process by leveraging research and data to determine pricing and market assumptions that inform new school open decisions. This person will play a critical role on a cross-functional team to ensure the successful launch of 50+ new schools a year. This individual will be responsible for:

Build the market intelligence engine at Higher Ground that will enable stakeholders across Marketing, Expansion, Talent and Finance to make informed go/no-go decisions on new school open opportunities


Develops comprehensive strategic recommendations to inform pro forma assumptions


Leverage research and quantitative analysis to recommend tuition rates for new schools and programs based on profitability and market requirements


Develop an informed view of new markets and synthesize into market intelligence that can be deployed to go-to-market teams


Manage a team of contractors focused on data collection for market research needs and build the system that will house this data to enable go-to-market success

 Skills
 We'd love to talk to you if you have:

5+ year's professional experience in consulting, business analysis or market strategy


Advanced understanding of business strategy and strategic planning skills


Highly effective communication skills and ability to influence internal, cross-functional stakeholders


A love of data, constantly looking for trends or insights that will help improve the overall new market entry process


Ability to own projects and manage multiple priorities while delivering on timelines


Excellent communication skills, a sense of curiosity, and a good sense of humor

 We'd really love to talk to you if you have…

Experience in education or Montessori education, but not essential


A can-do attitude with a desire to "figure it out" and a passion to grow alongside our marketing team


A research-minded approach – you love diving deep into a new topic and enjoy learning

 About us
 At Higher Ground, we're driven by a deep desire to bring about widespread change in education today. Since our founding 5 years ago, we have opened 90+ beautiful schools across serving students from birth through high school. We're virtual and global.
 We offer:

A passionate and supportive team that is hungry to grow and become leaders in our industry


Fully remote work


A competitive salary


Health, dental, and vision insurance


Paid time off and paid holidays


100% tuition discount for two children at any school within our network


A network of supportive peers and mentors who regularly share best practices


Career growth and promotion opportunities

Title: Business Consultant, TBS Sales Business Intelligence
Description:
Location:
Calgary, AB, CA Ottawa, ON, CA Toronto, ON, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Edmonton, AB, CA
Req ID: 24402
Jobs by Category: Sales and Marketing
Job Function: Planning and Analysis
Status: Full Time
Schedule: Regular
Description
Join our team

We are the Business Intelligence team, an integral part of the TELUS Business Marketing (TBM) organization. We are a dynamic, entrepreneurial, and engaged team driven to rapidly respond and adapt to the changing needs of Canadian business customers including Small, Medium and Large segments.
We are the destination of choice of entrepreneurial team members that enjoy starting something from nothing and building it up.

Come join our team if you have a passion for data, marketing, to put customers first, embrace change and embody spirited teamwork to support stakeholders across a wide variety of teams. This role will report to the Sr. Manager of Market Intelligence, Sales & CRM Data team.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

You will build foundational data assets enabling sales teams across channels
You will drive cross segment sales channels’ performance through valuable insights
You will mentor other team member on various levels: processes, technical, and interpersonal skills

Here’s how

You will develop new analytical solutions to provide timely insights to the business
You will work on Salesforce (CRM) Customer data and business wireline products
You will collaborate with cross functional teams: TBM Sales channel enablement team, Sales team, IT and other BI teams to develop foundational data assets that will drive sales’ performance, measurement, and finally compensation
You will coordinate with the product management team to ensure reporting readiness for new product launches
You will be part of a high performing team, celebrate wins, socialize learnings and progress to our leadership team
Qualifications
You’re the missing piece of the puzzle

You possess a knack to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable way
You have an extraordinary ability to build relationships, collaborate, and influence across multiple teams
You keep big picture in mind even when you are working on the details
You are inherently curious to understand how things work, have ability to think outside-of-the-box and work around constraints
You focus on continuous learning and development across multiple domains including telco industry, technology, and customer experience
You are an expert at Structured Query Language (SQL) skills and Oracle and / or SQL server databases with more than 7 years of hands on experience
You have expert level proficiency in SAS with at least 7 of hands on experience
You possess strong planning, performance and business analysis skills

Great to haves

Prior telecommunications or B2B marketing experience
University degree in Engineering or Commerce and/or equivalent combination of experience and education
Proficiency with Salesforce or other CRMs
Working knowledge on Google cloud platform (GCP) and BigQuery is an asset
