Title: PA Level 9 - Solution Analyst - Information Technology Systems and Services
Description:
Working as part of the ITSS Team, the Solution Analyst will complement our campus wide, service-oriented department. The Solution Analyst will be a key contributor to enterprise IT system deployment, operation, and optimization. They will contribute to the development and on-going evolution of operational metrics by designing and supporting end user reporting and data analytics solutions. The Solution Analyst will work on the development of solutions that support continuous improvement, workflow management and data gathering needs.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Supporting operation of enterprise IT systems
Developing, documenting, and making operational solutions based on organizational needs and standards
Providing information that contributes to data-driven decision making by producing easy-to-understand, audience appropriate reports
Collaborating with analysts, designers, end users and business process owners in the testing of solutions related to administrative systems at UPEI
Liaising with network administrators and software engineers to assist with design specifications, program logic, and data conversions
Delivering training to end users
Maintaining existing portfolio of reports and analytical data products
Maintaining and developing datamarts and operational data stores to support reports and analytical data products. Maintaining data dictionaries for the control of new and/or additional data elements
Assisting in the evolution of data management policies and procedures
Gathering and analyzing user requirements to then design functional specifications for solutions
Production control activities with regards to data integration, data processing, job scheduling, setup, and background process reporting
Analyzing business risk and recommending mitigation strategies
Being an organizational change management champion for ITSS initiatives

QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Administration. An equivalent combination of education and work experience will be considered
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Administration, would be considered an asset
Knowledge of enterprise-level applications, including ERP, CRM, data warehouses, etc.
Proficiency with a variety reporting and ETL tools (e.g., Pentaho Suite) and extensive experience writing SQL queries
Experience in report writing and data analytics. With ability to use data visualization techniques to build operationally relevant presentations and dashboards
Proficiency with one or more programming languages and web-based solution development platforms (e.g. PHP, node, Vue.js)
Communication skills to clearly express ideas in an objective manner, and ability to adapt communication style to suit the situation and audience
Ability to develop relationships by interacting with people in a professional, respectful and diplomatic manner
Experience in the deployment and administration of Microsoft M365 would be considered an asset
Experience using Microsoft 365 tools such as Forms, Power BI, and Power Automate would be considered an asset
Experience using Ellucian systems such as Colleague and CRM Recruit would be considered an asset
Experience in data classification, privacy, and security would be considered an asset
Experience in requirements gathering and business process mapping would be considered an asset
Experience with project management practices would be considered an asset
Experience working in an academic institution would be considered and asset
Customer service skills are required

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Address:
100 King Street West
Job Family Group:
Technology
Liaises with stakeholders to understand problems and opportunities and, recommends solutions to enable the achievement of organizational goals. Builds exceptional relationships with business partners and internal stakeholders. Analyzes data and creates documents and plans in service of informing, advising, or updating stakeholders. Ensures the requirements map to a real business need, are approved by all relevant stakeholders, and meet essential quality standards. Participates in reviews or inspections, in collaboration with the project team, to ensure the quality of work products.
Understands and can explain to others the core processes, risks & mitigation techniques for designated areas.
Anticipates and reduces complexity for others.
Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues.
Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation and sustainment of initiatives.
Assists in the preparation of end-user materials.
Plans and conducts third-party software analysis as needed for inclusion in the project solution.
Gathers requirements and documents these requirements for use in various audits, reports, & projects.
Participates in the creation of use cases and user expected results to ensure that software is delivered to end users with zero Severity 1 or Severity 2 defects.
Works with project stakeholders to validate their requirements and analysis models via techniques such as reviews and walkthroughs.
Ensures system specifications meet expectations/requirements, and negotiates solutions.
Creates documentation to ensure the supportability of analyses.
Maintains existing requirements to ensure that current-state needs are known.
Develops and implements data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filters and “cleans” data, and reviews computer reports, printouts and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Remains alert to new techniques for insights, analytics, and data visualization, and devises new ways of applying them.
Interprets data, analyzes results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Recommends approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes in the organization to improve overall efficiency.
Facilitates discussions and follows a structured approach to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage requirements with stakeholders.
Provides analytical support and insights.
Identifies opportunities to strengthen business analysis capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks across BMO.
Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning.
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Possesses analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Demonstrates applied knowledge of one or more analysis and problem decomposition technique.
Understands complete Software Development Life Cycle and can apply the applicable portions of the ‘Feasibility,’ ‘Requirements,” and ‘Analysis’ phases.
Demonstrates writing and documentation skills.
Understands and can explain to others the core processes involved in their area of support.
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Title: Business Analyst, Product Support
Description:
ABOUT US





 Founded in 1995, CI Assante Wealth Management is a wholly owned subsidiary of CI Financial and one of Canada’s largest wealth management firms. Our 750 professional advisors, located in communities throughout the country, oversee approximately $39 billion in assets for more than 300,000 clients. CI Assante Wealth Management's services include investment management, retirement planning, tax planning, insurance and estate planning.
       


 POSITION: Business Analyst I/Analyst I

LOCATION: 15 York, 7th floor
        
STATUS: Full Time
       


 JOB OVERVIEW


 We are currently seeking a 
        Business Analyst I/Analyst I to join our 
        Centre of Business Initiatives team, specializing in the 
        Assante Private Portfolio line of business. Acting as a subject matter expert for the line of business, in this role the successful candidate is responsible for supporting the business needs on system applications and business processes; requirement activities on small enhancements and projects;
         conducts business analysis with minimal guidance
        ; collecting and organizing data; articulating the Business needs into requirements and deliverables through planning, elicitation, analysis and documentation for changes to Business Areas and Information Technology. A vital component of this role will be at the implementation of the new initiative, the candidate will become the subject matter expert as he/she has played a critical role in the delivery. Our team takes great pride in accomplishing and implementing the business needs with a high degree of excellence.
       


 WHAT YOU WILL DO


 Work collectively with the various stakeholders to implement initiatives determined by the project sponsor
 Conduct business analysis, understand and document business objectives and requirements, perform gap analysis and recommendation on functional design
 Play a vital part assisting in identifying project deliverables and developing milestones for project completion
 Work with internal and external partners to identify business needs and ensure these needs align to business goals and objectives
 Bring a high level of product knowledge and business expertise in order to analyze, identify, evaluate and recommend improvements to business functions and processes
 Effectively lead meetings and group discussions with project team members and stakeholders to ensure collaboration on project deliverables
 Create extensive test plans that confidently tests functionality being implemented against documented requirements
 Verify test output, report critical issues and coordinate with various resources for problem resolution



 WHAT YOU WILL BRING


 Minimum of 2 years related working experience in the Mutual Funds/Securities Industry
 An extensive knowledge of products offered and good working knowledge of business processes, procedures and practices
 Knowledge of User Acceptance testing (UAT); ability to create extensive test plans that confidently tests functionality being implemented against documented requirements
 Strong analytical capabilities are required along with a strong focus on attention to detail
 Solid communication skills including verbal, written and presentation skills
 Solid organizational skills, capable of multitasking and the ability to deliver high quality work under pressure
 Motivated person with the ability to work independently as well as a contributing member of the team
 Excellent business skills, information systems experience and exposure to project management processes an asset
 Sound knowledge/understanding of various Private Client systems (Triple A, PC Connect, Compass, PC SmartDox, D1g1t, etc.) will be an asset



 WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US


         Our dedication to the Employee Experience at CI is aimed at supporting, empowering and inspiring our talented team through:
       

 Recognition & Compensation
 Training & Development
 Health & Well-being
 Communication & Feedback


         If you are a passionate, committed and dynamic individual, please submit your resume in confidence by clicking “
        Apply”.
       

 Only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
       


 CI Financial Corp. and all of our affiliates (“CI”) are committed to fair and accessible employment practices and we are committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodations in order to apply for any job opportunities, or require this posting in an additional format, please contact us at accessible.recruitment@ci.com, or call 
        416-364-1145 ext. 4747. 
        If you are contacted by CI regarding a job opportunity or testing and require accommodation in any stage of the recruitment process, please use the above contact information. We will work with all applicants to determine appropriate accommodation for individual accessibility needs.

Title: Senior Operational Analyst
Description:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.
Working Arrangement
Hybrid
Job Description
At Manulife, we’re passionate about building software that solves problems. We count on our team to empower our users with a rich feature set, high availability, and stellar performance level to pursue their missions. The successful applicant will be involved with application support, application deployment, business requirement gathering and data analysis all in support of solutions that conform to Manulife standards. The candidate will need to have a breadth and depth of experience that will allow her/him to devise and support solutions that integrate appropriately within the organization and its application frameworks.
Objectives of this Role:
Run the production environment by monitoring availability and taking a holistic view of system health and Track and produce key metrics for the team and develop strategies to increase efficiency
Maintain software and systems to manage the applications
Improve reliability, quality, and time-to-market of our suite of software solutions
Measure and optimize system performance, with an eye toward pushing our capabilities forward, getting ahead of customer needs, and innovating to continually improve
Provide primary operational support for multiple large, distributed software applications
Work with business clients, internal and external teams to debug or troubleshoot applications
Daily and Monthly Responsibilities:
Gather and analyze metrics from both operating systems and applications to assist in performance tuning and fault finding
Partner with development teams to improve services through rigorous testing and release procedures
Participate in system design consulting, platform management, and capacity planning
Create sustainable systems and services through automation and uplifts
Balance feature development speed and reliability with well-defined service level objectives
Required Skills and Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or other highly technical, scientific discipline
Knowledge to program (structured and OO) with one or more high level languages, such as, Java, JavaScript or similar
Experience with one or more of the following: Scheduling (CA, CA WLA), SQL queries and scripting, Excel, Informatica development (or related ETL tools), Shell Scripting/ Power Shell/UNIX, Windows/ Bat Scripting.
Experience with distributed storage technologies like NFS, HDFS, Ceph, S3 as well as dynamic resource management frameworks (Mesos, Kubernetes, Yarn)
Experience with Agile (Scrum or Kanban), Jira and ServiceNow.
A proactive approach to spotting problems, areas for improvement, and performance bottlenecks
Knowledge of financial services, specifically investment management
Preferred Qualifications:
Previous success in technical engineering or application support
Coding experience beyond simple scripts
Basic knowledge on site reliability engineers (SREs) concepts
Experience with monitoring and alerting applications such as Moogsoft, Dynatrace, New Relic or other similar tools.
Experience supporting web applications using Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)
Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.
About John Hancock and Manulife
John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.
One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.
Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer
At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.
It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.

Title: Senior Manager, Business Intelligence
Description:
Requisition ID: 140993  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 Purpose of Job:

 The Senior Manager, Business Intelligence, Retail Credit Risk, GRM will lead a team responsible for monitoring and report on retail lending portfolios. Much of this team’s responsibilities will include creating dashboards and ad-hoc data pulls. As well, you will provide actionable insight to the Risk Management teams [Acquisition and Account Management] and business line partners.
 The role is highly technical and requires expert SAS/Python, data analytics and BI tools skills. The incumbent will lead and coach a team of managers to deliver ongoing portfolio reporting and monitoring to senior management, as well as address ad-hoc data requests.
 Job Responsibilities:


 Accountability 1: Retail Credit Risk Portfolios Tracking & Data Management
   

Use a variety of Business Intelligence analytical and reporting tools (ex. SAS, Python, Tableau) to provide dynamic reporting on key performance metrics to various stakeholders in GRM and business lines. Lead new report creation and look for opportunities to optimize workstream.
Respond to adhoc requests from executives and key stakeholders with a sense of urgency. Perform required data pulls, reconciliations to answer questions. Prioritization and working on more than one request at a time is often required.
Provide actionable insights and meaningful messages from the reporting to drive credit risk decisions. Able to tell a story by synthesizing vast amounts of data into coherent messages.
Proactively provide strategic analysis that will assist in optimizing risk rewards ratios and grow the portfolios.
Collaborate with Acquisition, Account Management and Collections teams to provide measurement and reporting on strategic initiatives such as acquisition dynamics and quality, line optimization and collections effectiveness




 Accountability 2: Customer Focus
   

Champion a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Using our data, continually develop and refine a more holistic customer view.




 Accountability 3: Innovation
   

Explore opportunities for using latest innovative analytics and Business Intelligence tools to showcase portfolio dynamics, derive insights and streamline processes
Aim to move from descriptive to prescriptive analytics by focusing on key drivers of portfolio risk and profitability




 Accountability 4: Risk Appetite Framework alignment
   

Actively pursue effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.


 Job Requirements:


 Bachelor's Degree in Math, Engineering, Computer Science, Marketing, Economics or Statistics 
5+ years analytical experience required
 Must be proficient with MS Office, SAS, SQL, Python, Power BI, Tableau
 Strong communication skills essential with clients and management
 Strong prioritizing, planning, analytical, presentation, project management, people management and relationship building skills
 5+ years’ experience in Retail Products
 5+ years’ experience in Database Marketing and/or Risk Analytics


 
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst - Guidewire Claims Center
Description:
Senior Business Systems Analyst - Guidewire Claims Center
Job ID : 5624
Category : Technology Solutions
Brand : Definity
Regular/Temporary : Regular
Fulltime/Parttime : Full Time
Location : Toronto, Canada
Definity includes some of Canada’s most long-standing and innovative insurance brands, including Economical Insurance, Sonnet Insurance, Family Insurance Solutions, and Petline Insurance. With strong roots that date back to 1871, we’ve grown to become a digital leader in the insurance industry. We’re proud to help our clients and communities adapt and thrive in a world of constant change.

Our promise to you: It’s better here. Why? Because we CARE, and we provide an employee experience that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.

Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative P&C insurers. Come be a part of our journey, and love what you do.
What can you expect in this role?
Provide estimation of delivery work necessary to realize requirements through development lifecycle
Elicit, analyze, specify and communicate functional and non-functional business, system and implementation requirements
Write concise User Stories which include precise acceptance Criteria, accurate Specifications by Example and testable Functional Scenarios
Facilitate meetings / working sessions with stakeholders to document, review and approve requirements
Ensure the requirements are unambiguous and understandable by both business users and solution delivery teams
Validate the correctness of delivered requirements in advance of the active business owner reviewing completed work
Assist the testing team in defining testing scenarios (including data, acceptance criteria, rules, etc.) for each requirement that is going to be delivered during an iteration
Collaborate with Product Owner and Delivery Team to define and deliver the project vision
Collaborate with the Scrum Master/Project Manager and the team to develop and maintain the project Kanban/Product backlog, and develop the Iteration/Sprint Plan and Release plan
Facilitate meetings (e.g., Stand-ups, Retrospectives, Acceptance Review, etc.), as required
Supports the identification and resolution of Risks / Issues / Blockers in collaboration with the project team
Collaborate with Product Owner, Technical Lead, and Test Analyst on maintenance projects to identify sets of cohesive problems (improvement themes) for development
Support multiple concurrent projects
Collaborate with Scrum team on work prioritization
Perform Root Cause Analysis
What do you bring to the role?
Self-starter who can set own priorities and can work independently with little guidance
A willing and open attitude to learn and grow
Flexible in your work approach to meet the needs of a diverse and changing work environment
Strong written and verbal communication skills, presentation and facilitation skills
Ability to influence and effectively negotiate with stakeholders
Analytical skills to visualize, articulate, and solve problems and concepts
Post-secondary education or equivalent industry experience
5+ years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst or Business Analyst
Experience in P&C insurance
Strong experience with policy administration systems. Experience with Guidewire PolicyCenter is strongly preferred.
Strong Interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills – confidence and ability to work with internal team and external vendor partners seamlessly
Agile background – stories, elaboration, requirement methods
Jira/Confluence
Experience with the following systems is considered an asset: Guidewire ClaimCenter, Guidewire BillingCenter
Business analysis, Lean Six Sigma, Agile certifications are considered an asset: CCBA, IIBA-ACC, Lean SIx Sigma Yellow Belt or higher, CSM, CSPO
Proficiency with Microsoft Visio
Skills in data analysis with MS Excel or other analysis tools
We also take potential into consideration. If you don’t have this exact experience, but you know you have what it takes, be sure to give us more insight through your application and cover letter.
Go ahead and expect a lot — you deserve it, and we’ve got it:
Hybrid work schedule for most roles
Company share ownership program
Pension and savings programs, with company-matched RRSP contributions
Paid volunteer days and company matching on charitable donations
Educational resources, tuition assistance, and paid time off to study for exams
Focus on inclusion with employee groups, support for gender affirmation surgery, access to BIPOC counsellors, access to programs for working parents
Wellness and recognition programs
Discounts on products and services
Our inclusive work environment welcomes diversity and supports accessibility. If you require accommodation at any time during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting: [email protected]
Background checks
This role requires successful clearance of a background check (including criminal checks and leadership references).

Title: Spécialiste/Développeur en Intelligence D'Affaires/Business Intelligence Specialist/Developer
Description:
(English version follows)


Le Groupe de transport ENERGY connaît une croissance rapide et cherche actuellement à ajouter un Spécialiste/Développeur en Intelligence D'Affaires (BI) à son équipe de Montréal.

Quelles seront vos responsabilités?

En tant que Spécialiste/développeur en intelligence d'affaires, vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec l'équipe TI et les unités d'affaires afin d'évaluer et de répondre aux besoins en intelligence d'affaires et de proposer des solutions pour transformer les données en connaissances exploitables.


A propos de nous

Chez ENERGY, "Dynamisme à bord" n'est pas seulement un slogan, il fait partie de notre ADN. Nous défendons nos valeurs car elles sont ce qui nous unit. Si l'intégrité, la passion, la fiabilité, l'engagement, la transparence, l'ambition, l'innovation et la sécurité sont des mots qui résonnent fortement en vous, alors vous êtes le nouveau coéquipier que nous recherchons.


Responsabilités Principales/Exigences

Analyser et déterminer les besoins et les éléments d'information, les relations et les attributs des données, les exigences en matière de flux et de stockage des données, ainsi que les capacités de production de données et de rapports.
Coordonner le développement de nouvelles données, en assurant la cohérence et l'intégration avec la structure existante de l'entrepôt de données.
Créer et maintenir la documentation, y compris les spécifications, les exigences, la conception et les manuels d'utilisation
Identifier les possibilités d'améliorer les processus, les stratégies et les besoins de développement.
Développer et exécuter des requêtes de base de données et effectuer des analyses (DB2, Postgres et autres systèmes de gestion de bases de données objet-relationnelles).
Surveiller les résultats analytiques et métriques et les compiler, les construire et les développer dans des rapports d'état sur les initiatives d'optimisation des processus basés sur les KPI (Key Performance Metrics).
Plus de 3 ans d'expérience en tant qu'analyste d'affaires ou dans un domaine connexe.
Plus de 3 ans d'expérience dans un rôle spécifique d'analyse et de veille stratégique.
Connaissance des logiciels ETL tels qu'Alteryx.
Solides compétences en développement SQL souhaitées, rédaction de requêtes complexes, de vues et de procédures stockées avec SQL.
Capacité à contribuer de manière analytique à la fois de manière indépendante et en tant que membre d'une équipe.
Excellentes capacités d'écoute, de communication, de relations interpersonnelles et de présentation.
Capacité à créer des visualisations et des rapports dans Tableau avec une logique avancée et des ensembles de données disponibles.
Plus de 3 ans d'expérience avec Tableau Server, Tableau Desktop et Tableau Online de préférence.
Expérience en Python et R est un plus.
Avantages sociaux

Assurances collectives incluant couvertures médicale, occulaire et dentaire (en vigueur après une période de probation réussie)
Le genre masculin, utilisé pour alléger le texte, comprend aussi le genre féminin.

**Le Groupe de transport ENERGY est un employeur offrant l'égalité des chances. Nous célébrons la diversité et nous nous engageons à créer un environnement
 -
ENERGY Transportation Group is growing at a rapid rate and is currently seeking to add a Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist/Developer to our Montreal team.

What you will be responsible for?

As a BI Specialist/Developer, you will work closely with the IT and business units to assess and address BI needs and suggest solutions to turn data into actionable knowledge.


About us

At ENERGY, “Driven to be different” isn’t just a tagline, it’s part of our DNA. We stand by our values because they are what unites us. If Integrity, Passion, Reliability, Commitment, Transparency, Ambition, Innovation and Safety are words that resonate strongly in you, then you’re the new teammate we are looking for.


Core Responsibilities/Requirements

Analyzes and determines information needs and elements, data relationships and attributes, data flow and storage requirements and data output and reporting capabilities
Coordinates new data development, ensuring consistency and integration with the existing data warehouse structure
Create and maintain documentation including specifications, requirements, design, and user manuals
Identify opportunities to improve processes, strategies, and development needs
Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses (DB2, Postgres & other Object-relational database management systems)
Monitor analytics and metric results and compile, build, and expand them into status reports on process optimization initiatives based on KPIs (Key Performance Metrics)
3+ years of experience as a Business Analyst or related field
3+ years of experience in Business Intelligence and Analysis specific role
Knowledge in ETL software such as Alteryx
Strong SQL development skills desired, writing complex queries and views and stored procedures with SQL
Ability to contribute analytically both independently and as part of a team
Excellent listening, communication, interpersonal and presentational skills
Ability to build visualizations and reports within Tableau with advanced logic and available datasets.
3+ years of experience with Tableau Server, Tableau Desktop and Tableau Online preferred
Experience In Python and R is a plus


Benefits

 Medical & Dental Benefits: After successful completion of probationary period


**Energy Transportation Group is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.*

Title: Senior BI Developer
Senior Business Systems Analyst/Product Manager/Architect (Oracle Subscription Management/Billing)
Description:
Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 200+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.

 We are a fast-growing global company with 70+ consecutive quarters of growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of nearly 10,000 companies, including 1,800+ networks and 2,900+ cloud and IT service providers in over 26 countries spanning five continents.

 A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.

 Job Summary: Partners with Business Groups to ensure delivery of end-to-end business application solutions aligned to the business and IT strategy, as well as the support of those applications. Works with Business Groups to define their global technology roadmaps. Manages projects from inception to completion with matrix, global teams.  Responsibilities

 Capture, document and validate Billing-related business and user requirements, predominantly to support Billing System.
 Candidate with knowledge in Oracle Subscription Management. Oracle Integration Cloud, Revenue, Account receivables and Credit & Collections will have added advantage.
 Experience in understanding End to End Systems involving Quote to Cash.
 Experience in working Mergers and Acquisitions worked on reconciliation and analysis of data.
 Translate business requirements into functional solution design options and interface with the development teams to ensure all business requirements and functional designs are understood and delivered as desired.
 Work closely with team spread across globally and should possess excellent communication skill in the Billing domain.
 Create and manage application functional test plans and test cases from use cases for requirements traceability, systems testing and UAT testing.
 Application SIT Testing, defect tracking, defect resolution, ongoing status reporting.
 Assess the risks of various solutions and prioritizes competing business demands.
 Manage ongoing relationship with business partners to drive satisfaction with IT.
 Train the users and provide go-live support.
 Respond to and address user requests via ticketing process preferable to have experience in Service now, HP ALM, Conflunece, and Jira tools.

  Qualifications

 5+ years’ experience in Business System Analyst experience within Agile/Waterfall environment desired. 7+ years experience in analytics preferred.
 Bachelor's in Information Systems, Business or related field.
 Broad IT domain experience in two or more of the following areas IT areas: Billing (Mandatory) , Oracle Subscription Management (Mandatory) , Oracle Integration Cloud , Oracle Account receivable, Credit and collections, Taxation.
 5 + of hands-on Billing application knowledge and experience. Technical CRM background added advantage.
 2-3 years’ Experience with architectural design/Solution Design (will be more hands-on with the logical part).
 Ability to interface with business application users at all levels to ensure that proper customer requirements are captured and understood.
 Experience implementing projects for Billing in a global environment preferred
 Experience on Projects on Agile.
 Demonstrated ability to communicate in both verbal and written communication.
 Must have hands on experience in authoring functional Design document and possess high problem-solving skills.

 At Equinix, we’re tasked with leading in the communities we serve — and doing our part to help keep our communities and our teams safe. Our #IamSafeIBelongIMatter culture transcends and informs all we do. In alignment with our culture, Equinix has implemented a vaccine or test policy that requires employees to show proof of full vaccination or get tested regularly to work onsite in an IBX or office.

 Equinix is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disabilities.
 Visit our Career page here to understand about Equinix COVID-19 Vaccine Policy.

Title: Senior business intelligence advisor
Description:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.
Job Level
NV-10
As a senior business intelligence advisor, you help develop and use tools and methods to collect, compile, model and restore the organization’s physical and non-physical data to establish governance, help decisionmakers understand the big picture and inform decisions.

You lead development projects and strategic initiatives that are complex and innovative. Your initiatives require extensive knowledge of your specialty area.

You make recommendations on the planning and execution of operationally and conceptually complex projects and initiatives that require comprehensive analysis and understanding of the organization and line of business. Coordination is critical, so you interact with stakeholders working in many other fields. Interpersonal savvy is therefore essential.

You serve as specialist advisor and subject matter expert, as well as resource person and coach for decision-making bodies.
General Information on the Position
Other working conditions
Workplace : Position located in Lévis or Montreal, depending on the applicant selected. The work arrangement for the position is hybrid work
Number of jobs available : 1
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in a related field
A minimum of 6 years of relevant experience
Please note that other combinaisons of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered
For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required
Desjardins Cross-sector skills
Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning
Key competencies for the job
Interpersonal Savvy, Strategic mindset
Work Location
Complexe Desjardins Montréal
Trade Union
Non Syndiqué

2022-04-28
Job Family
Administration (FG)

Title: Analyste inventaire principal/ Senior Inventory Analyst (Bilingual FR + EN)
Description:
IPEX est l’un des principaux fournisseurs de systèmes intégrés de tuyauteries thermoplastiques en Amérique du Nord. Nous avons pour mission de bâtir un avenir meilleur en connectant les gens avec l’eau et l’énergie.


 Nous avons présentement une opportunité stimulante en tant qu’analyste d’inventaire principal. Ce rôle est basé à notre bureau de l’Île-des-Sœurs à Montréal et relève du contrôleur adjoint en établissement des coûts. 
Description du poste
IPEX est actuellement à la recherche d’une personne motivée, passionnée et dynamique pour occuper le poste d’analyste d’inventaire principal, relevant du contrôleur adjoint en établissement des coûts. En tant que membre de l’équipe de l’établissement des coûts, cette personne sera en partie responsable de la préparation de l’analyse et du contrôle de l’inventaire, y compris les stocks à rotation lente et l’obsolescence potentielle. Elle assumera la responsabilité générale de la formation et de la supervision d’un analyste d’inventaire pour IPEX Amérique du Nord et d’un principal partenaire d’affaires pour les centres de distribution partout en Amérique du Nord. Le contrôle d’inventaire relatif aux produits rebroyés, aux rebuts, aux réserves de stock et à l’inventaire physique annuel est un élément clé de ce poste. L’analyse relative à l’audit annuel, la fourniture de données et d’analyses pour les prévisions trimestrielles et la participation à des projets ad hoc sont également des activités majeures.

Activités principales 

Travailler en collaboration avec toutes les parties prenantes internes et externes pour faire en sorte que les attentes en matière de rapports soient clairement définies et comprises.
Former et superviser l’analyste d’inventaire assistant au contrôle et à la tenue du système de gestion des stocks.
Gérer le processus annuel d’inventaire physique et soutenir le processus de dénombrement périodique des stocks.
Analyser les différentes raisons d’obsolescence et établir et recommander des réserves de remplacement.
Procéder à l’ajustement de fin d’exercice des matières premières au coût moyen pondéré, conformément aux directives de la compagnie et aux normes IFRS.
Organiser et valider les données opérationnelles (finances, étendue, risque, rendement, qualité) et compiler des rapports réguliers.
Superviser les travaux et cerner et résoudre les écarts.
Recommander des mesures correctives pour résoudre les problèmes liés aux stocks.
Effectuer des mandats ad hoc pour soutenir les centres de distribution.
Effectuer les écritures au journal.
Aider les directeurs de centre de distribution à répondre à toute demande de renseignements. 
Participer périodiquement à des visites ou des séances de travail dans les centres de distribution.
Participer aux préparatifs de fin d’exercice.

Qualification et expérience

Baccalauréat en comptabilité. 
Titre de CPA-CMA, CPA ou MBA, ou sur le point de l’obtenir.
4 à 7 ans d’expérience en matière d’inventaire. 
Parfait bilinguisme (français et anglais).
Capacité à mener plusieurs tâches de front et à gérer plusieurs renseignements simultanément.
Esprit analytique, sens du détail.
Excellente connaissance de l’environnement logiciel Windows (Excel et Word requis).

Connaissances et compétences nécessaires


Bonne compréhension des procédures et concepts inhérents et connaissance de base des autres disciplines.
Capacité d’examiner et d’analyser de nouvelles situations sur la base de l’analyse des renseignements et des expériences précédentes.
Solides compétences en communication et en diplomatie.
Collaboration avec d’autres services de IPEX.

Principaux interlocuteurs 

Communication financière directe avec les gestionnaires de centre de distribution, le service interne de comptabilité et d’établissement des coûts, le service interne d’achats et d’approvisionnement, la chaîne d’approvisionnement et la haute direction. 
Collaboration avec toutes les parties prenantes internes et externes.

Conditions de travail


Travail presque toujours à l’intérieur, dans un environnement de bureau, en position assise durant de longues périodes.
Possibilité d’être exposé à l’occasion à des sons forts et à des niveaux de bruit gênants.
Possibilité de progression du nombre de facteurs qui interviennent dans le processus de travail, pouvant causer de la tension mentale ou de l’anxiété (priorités changeantes, échéances, précision, quotas, demandes contradictoires).
L’employé devra communiquer par Microsoft Teams, Zoom, téléphone et courriel et prendre part à des discussions en personne.
Possibilité de contacts sociaux importants.

IPEX fait tout son possible pour répondre aux besoins d’accommodement des personnes handicapées durant tout le processus d’entrevue et, sur demande, collaborera avec les candidats qualifiés pour leur offrir des mesures d’accommodement convenables de façon à prendre en compte leurs besoins en matière d’accessibilité découlant de leur handicap. Les candidats participant à toutes les étapes du processus de sélection en vue d’un emploi à IPEX peuvent demander des mesures d’accommodement. Pour faire une demande, veuillez communiquer avec les RH à HR@ipexna.com

 ______________________________________________________________________________________________
 IPEX is one of the North American leading providers of advanced plastic piping systems. Our mission is to shape a better tomorrow by connecting people with water and energy.




We currently have an exciting opportunityfor a Senior Inventory Analyst to be based in the Nuns Island Montreal and reports to the Assistant Controller – Costing.
 Job Summary

IPEX is currently looking for a motivated, passionate, and dynamic person to fill the position of Senior Inventory Analyst, reporting to the Assistant Controller - Costing. As part of the costing team, this person will have responsibilities in the preparation of inventory analysis and control including slow moving inventory and potential obsolescence. Overall responsibility for the training and supervision of 1 inventory analyst for IPEX NA and key business partner for DCs across NA. Inventory control as it pertains to regrind, scrap, inventory reserves, and annual physical inventory is key to this position. Analysis pertaining to the annual audit, providing data and analysis for the quarterly forecasts, and participation in ad hoc projects is also key.
 Principal Responsibilities 

Collaboratively work with all internal and external stakeholders to ensure the reporting expectations are clearly defined and understood.
Train and supervise the inventory analyst helping to control and maintain the inventory management system.
Manage the annual physical inventory process and support the inventory cycle counting process
Analysis of different obsolescence reasons and establish and recommendation of reserves for obsolescence.
Year-end adjustment of raw materials to Weighted Average Cost and according to Company guidelines and IFRS
Organize and validate operational information (financial, scope, risk, performance, quality) and compile regular reports
Oversee, identify, and resolve deviations.
Recommend corrective actions to resolve issues related to inventory.
Complete ad hoc assignments to support DCs.
Journal entry preparation
Assist DC managers with any inquiries 
Periodic visit and/or work sessions at the DCs
Participate in year-end preparations

Qualifications & Experience

Completed bachelor’s degree in accounting 
CPA-CMA, CPA, or MBA designation, or close to obtaining
4-7 years of Inventory experience 
Fully bilingual (French and English)
Able to handle multiple tasks and information
Analytical, detail oriented
Excellent knowledge of Windows software environment (Excel and Word compulsory

Skills & Knowledge:

Good understanding of own procedures and concepts and basic knowledge of other disciplines
Ability to review and analyze new situations based on the analysis of information and previous experiences
Possess strong communication and diplomacy skills
Collaborates with other departments within IPEX

Key Contacts: 

Offer direct financial communication with DC managers, internal accounting/costing department, internal purchasing/procurement, Supply Chain, and upper management 
Collaboratively work with all internal and external stakeholders

Working Conditions:

Nearly always work indoors in corporate office environment with long periods of sitting
May on occasion be exposed to loud sounds and distracting noise levels.
Employee may experience progressive degrees of factors in the work process which may cause mental tension or anxiety (changing work priorities, deadlines, accuracy, quotas, conflicting demands).
Employee is expected to communicate by Microsoft team, Zoom, telephone, e-mail, and in-person discussions.
May have a high level of social contact.

IPEX is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities throughout the recruitment process and, upon request, will work with qualified job applicants to provide suitable accommodation in a manner that takes into account the applicant’s accessibility needs due to disability. Accommodation requests are available to candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process for IPEX jobs. To request an accommodation, please contact HR at HR@ipexna.com

Title: Senior Business Process Solutions Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 126818

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
Purpose
The Sr. Business Process Solutions Analyst promotes operational efficiencies and risk mitigation by working with the Portfolio and Fund Administration units, and relevant project teams, to create and deliver optimal process solutions to businesses, through gathering, researching and analyzing business requirements.
S/he is required to take a leadership role in solution development and project management.
Accountabilities
Accountabilities for the role include support and development (coding, process changes) activities for applications/macros that are used by the Portfolio and Fund Administration (Fund Accounting, Reporting, Tax, Trust, Oversight) teams, as well as other internal departments within the Bank as required.Responsible for gathering, analyzing, identifying and documenting “current state” (As Is) where required, or validating and updating existing documentation, in an effort to provide solutions to business issues/needs; Analyzes requirements and their impact to the systemSupporting of IBOR system (SimCorp Dimension) and other technology solutions for the Business through:
1. Ensuring that requirements are effectively documented
2. Liaising with business area leaders in order to ensure that objectives are clear.
3. Provide guidance to business stakeholder groups and to vendors during requirements and design phases of project(s).
4. Ensure that solutions proposed meet business needs and user needs in terms of functionality and business process workflow.
5. Support testing phases as required.
6. Support end user training
Works with other team members to develop and enhance application software to satisfy business requirementsLead in coding, debugging and testing software enhancements within the business environment; completes code changes as necessary to meet the requirementsActively designs, builds, implements and supports process efficiency changes.Develops and communicates technical systems and application standards and ensures compliance with requirementsExecutes unit tests to ensure the accuracy of code changesAssist in troubleshooting application issues such as the applications used by the business usersTroubleshoot technical issues and identify modifications needed in existing applications to meet changing user requirements.Create design documents, conduct design and code reviews, write code, develop unit tests, debug defects, in an efficient processMaintain strong relationships with internal business partners to understand their business needs, manage expectations, and assist in gap analysis;Coordinate and conduct walk-throughs of business specification documents with the Business owners for sign off and acceptance;Participate in user acceptance test documentation, sample generation, planning and executions;Act as intermediary between business and systems groups, translating business objectives as well as functional and user requirements into business requirements and creating acceptable documentation;Responsible for ensuring final product meets the business needs as outlined in the requirements documents;Identify potential issues/problems, and act to resolve them in a timely fashion to mitigate financial and non-financial risks; knowledge of required internal controls and segregation of duty requirements;Identify process improvements in order to increase operational efficiencies and mitigate risk;Provide leadership, expertise and guidance on good development practicesProvide guidance and mentoring to less-experienced staff membersParticipate in conference calls, meetings and other communications with the other stakeholders for various projectsSupports the daily operations of the fund administration team and accounting systemsOther duties may be assigned, as necessary. Multi-task and manage your own time schedules.
Education/Work Experience
Minimum requirements include: Degree and/or Diploma, preferably with a specialization in Finance, Business or Computer Science, 3+ years of relevant securities industry experience, Canadian Securities Course (CSC) or actively pursuing, Derivatives Fundamentals Course (DFC) or actively pursuing.
General knowledge of financial investment principles, procedures and regulations;Minimum 3-5 years of experience gathering, defining and documenting business requirement deliverables for Portfolio and Fund Administration processes in an asset management back-office;Advanced skill level of MS Office programs - particularly Excel and AccessAdvanced experience in these tools: Microsoft Excel add in source code (VBA) with good working knowledge of SQL and SQL Server applications1-2 years of experience with Simcorp Dimension is requiredOracle database and data mining experience requiredExperience in effectively providing leadership to team on projects by setting performance expectations, monitoring performance, providing performance feedback including performance appraisals (as needed), and providing coaching.Ability to work independently and cooperatively within a team environment; Team-oriented and positive (can do) attitude is essential;Excellent analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills;Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment;Strong interpersonal and communication skills;Training and presentation experience preferred;Strong accounting skills preferred;Crystal Reports development experience is an assetUnderstanding of financial applications such as Charles River, MCH, IFAST, CRM is an asset; andCompletion of CSC or IFIC an asset.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Manager, Information Management (Evaluation & Business Intelligence)
Description:
It takes an outstanding team to deliver exceptional care.
Hello, we’re the South Calgary Primary Care Network. We are change makers, innovators and community builders. We are a uniquely Alberta approach to primary care delivery. We are a group of interprofessional teams and need you to be part of the movement to bring innovative primary health care programs and services to the residents of south Calgary. Our network of family doctors and allied health care professionals are some of the best around. Pair that with our top-notch administrative team and you have an unstoppable force leading the way in primary health care – a powerhouse for developing the inventive programs our population needs and deserves. Join us as we change the landscape of primary health care for generations to come.
COMPANY OVERVIEW
Established in February 2006, the South Calgary Primary Care Network (SCPCN) includes the areas south of Anderson Road to the southern, western, and eastern city limits. Our vision is to lead optimal personal and community wellness. And our commitment to south Calgary residents continues to be the building of a sustainable, patient-centred Medical Home. Located in the fastest growing area in Calgary, the SCPCN now has over 268 member doctors at 65 clinics.
POSITION OVERVIEW
The Manager, Information Management is responsible for the management and development of the Information Management teams which includes Evaluation, Business Intelligence, and Policy Management Services, ensuring analytical and change management best practices are applied. This person will work closely with clinical managers on the development of technical data warehouse and business intelligence solutions, identification and execution of quality improvement, and planning of evaluative and analytical initiatives. The Manager, Information Management will report to the Director of Analytics.
This is a full-time benefits eligible contract role ending May 26, 2023.
WHAT YOU WILL ACHIEVE IN THIS ROLE
Manage the Business Intelligence, Evaluation, and Policy teams consisting of technical, analytical, and policy and process experts
Review and analyzes literature relevant to evaluation, research and policy projects
Ensure evaluation frameworks for all organizational programs and projects are developed and adhered to Implements Information Management Strategy
Lead the data warehouse and evaluation teams in data collection, analysis, and visualization of data
which impacts organizational planning and decisions
Manage the teams in the timely delivery of all organizational reporting requirements
Support the team in preparing evaluation reports based on sound analytical and statistical methodologies
Evaluate data collection methods, identifying risks and barriers
Provide direction and context for research, evaluation and policy activities
Assist with knowledge transfer of the findings for the purpose of raising awareness, reporting, and changing practices in PCN programs
Work in partnership with other organizations to conduct research and evaluation (e.g., Alberta Health Services – Calgary Zone, Alberta Health, other PCNs)
Work closely with clinical teams to identify improvement opportunities based on evaluation findings
Adhere to all applicable privacy regulations
Attend all departmental and other relevant meetings
Comply with and participate in the continuous improvement of the Company’s Health and Safety programs and Quality Systems
In collaboration with the Manager, Information Technology, participate in both the development of and adherence to ITSM Processes as they relate to the Business Intelligence area.
Any other related responsibilities not detailed here but that could be reasonably expected
WHAT YOU BRING TO THIS ROLE
Education/Certification:
Master’s degree preferred, preference for those with a graduate degree in the health sciences and/or with a medical background
Equivalent combinations of education and experience may be considered
Minimum of 5 years experience in the field of business intelligence and/or data analysis
Canadian Evaluator accreditation would be an asset
Core Competencies:
Extensive experience in statistical data modelling, data analysis
Excellent organizational, time management, analytical and project management skills with strong attention to detail and accuracy
Experience in Change Management principles
Experience in managing a team of technical expert staff
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to work independently as well as in a team-oriented environment
Advanced knowledge of quantitative and qualitative research methods with strong proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Access and Power Point as well as other research software/statistical packages such as SAS or SPSS
Extensive experience using and interpreting primary care health data
Self-directed, with a demonstrated ability to work in a dynamic environment that requires flexibility and balancing of competing priorities
Excellent attention to detail
Demonstrated ability to problem solve
Experience with an electronic medical record (EMR) system would be an asset
Ability to deal with situations, people and problems ethically, with honesty and integrity
WORKING CONDITIONS
Onsite and Remote Workforce

Title: Sr. Business Analyst, Treasury Data Advisory & Solutions
Description:
Nous bâtissons une banque axée sur les relations pour un monde moderne. Nous recrutons des professionnels talentueux et passionnés qui ont à cœur de faire ce qu’il faut pour nos clients.
À la Banque CIBC, nous misons sur vos forces et vos ambitions pour vous donner le pouvoir d’agir. Les membres de notre équipe disposent de ce dont ils ont besoin pour apporter une contribution significative et être valorisés, à la fois pour ce qu’ils sont et ce qu’ils font.
Description d'emploi
Aucun renseignement au sujet de ce profil d’emploi n’est actuellement disponible. Pour en savoir davantage au sujet de ce profil d’emploi, n’hésitez pas à communiquer avec votre partenaire d’affaires, Ressources humaines.

Ce que vous devez savoir
La Banque CIBC s’est engagée à créer un milieu de travail intégrateur où tous les membres de l’équipe et les clients se sentent à leur place. Title: PA Level 9 - Solution Analyst - Information Technology Systems and Services
Description:
Working as part of the ITSS Team, the Solution Analyst will complement our campus wide, service-oriented department. The Solution Analyst will be a key contributor to enterprise IT system deployment, operation, and optimization. They will contribute to the development and on-going evolution of operational metrics by designing and supporting end user reporting and data analytics solutions. The Solution Analyst will work on the development of solutions that support continuous improvement, workflow management and data gathering needs. 
  
RESPONSIBILITIES:

Supporting operation of enterprise IT systems
Developing, documenting, and making operational solutions based on organizational needs and standards
Providing information that contributes to data-driven decision making by producing easy-to-understand, audience appropriate reports
Collaborating with analysts, designers, end users and business process owners in the testing of solutions related to administrative systems at UPEI
Liaising with network administrators and software engineers to assist with design specifications, program logic, and data conversions
Delivering training to end users
Maintaining existing portfolio of reports and analytical data products
Maintaining and developing datamarts and operational data stores to support reports and analytical data products. Maintaining data dictionaries for the control of new and/or additional data elements
Assisting in the evolution of data management policies and procedures
Gathering and analyzing user requirements to then design functional specifications for solutions
Production control activities with regards to data integration, data processing, job scheduling, setup, and background process reporting
Analyzing business risk and recommending mitigation strategies
Being an organizational change management champion for ITSS initiatives


QUALIFICATIONS:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Administration. An equivalent combination of education and work experience will be considered
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Administration, would be considered an asset
Knowledge of enterprise-level applications, including ERP, CRM, data warehouses, etc. 
Proficiency with a variety reporting and ETL tools (e.g., Pentaho Suite) and extensive experience writing SQL queries
Experience in report writing and data analytics. With ability to use data visualization techniques to build operationally relevant presentations and dashboards 
Proficiency with one or more programming languages and web-based solution development platforms (e.g. PHP, node, Vue.js)
Communication skills to clearly express ideas in an objective manner, and ability to adapt communication style to suit the situation and audience
Ability to develop relationships by interacting with people in a professional, respectful and diplomatic manner
Experience in the deployment and administration of Microsoft M365 would be considered an asset
Experience using Microsoft 365 tools such as Forms, Power BI, and Power Automate would be considered an asset
Experience using Ellucian systems such as Colleague and CRM Recruit would be considered an asset
Experience in data classification, privacy, and security would be considered an asset
Experience in requirements gathering and business process mapping would be considered an asset
Experience with project management practices would be considered an asset
Experience working in an academic institution would be considered and asset
Customer service skills are required

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Address:
100 King Street West
Job Family Group:
Technology
Liaises with stakeholders to understand problems and opportunities and, recommends solutions to enable the achievement of organizational goals. Builds exceptional relationships with business partners and internal stakeholders. Analyzes data and creates documents and plans in service of informing, advising, or updating stakeholders. Ensures the requirements map to a real business need, are approved by all relevant stakeholders, and meet essential quality standards. Participates in reviews or inspections, in collaboration with the project team, to ensure the quality of work products.
Understands and can explain to others the core processes, risks & mitigation techniques for designated areas.
Anticipates and reduces complexity for others.
Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues.
Builds change management plans of varying scope and type; leads or participates in a variety of change management activities including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation and sustainment of initiatives.
Assists in the preparation of end-user materials.
Plans and conducts third-party software analysis as needed for inclusion in the project solution.
Gathers requirements and documents these requirements for use in various audits, reports, & projects.
Participates in the creation of use cases and user expected results to ensure that software is delivered to end users with zero Severity 1 or Severity 2 defects.
Works with project stakeholders to validate their requirements and analysis models via techniques such as reviews and walkthroughs.
Ensures system specifications meet expectations/requirements, and negotiates solutions.
Creates documentation to ensure the supportability of analyses.
Maintains existing requirements to ensure that current-state needs are known.
Develops and implements data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filters and “cleans” data, and reviews computer reports, printouts and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Remains alert to new techniques for insights, analytics, and data visualization, and devises new ways of applying them.
Interprets data, analyzes results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
Recommends approaches to streamline and integrate technological processes in the organization to improve overall efficiency.
Facilitates discussions and follows a structured approach to plan, elicit, analyze, document, communicate and manage requirements with stakeholders.
Provides analytical support and insights.
Identifies opportunities to strengthen business analysis capability, such as: sharing expertise to promote technical development, mentoring employees, building communities of practice and networks across BMO.
Stays abreast of industry technical and business trends through participation in professional associations, practice communities & individual learning.
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Typically between 4 - 6 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Possesses analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Demonstrates applied knowledge of one or more analysis and problem decomposition technique.
Understands complete Software Development Life Cycle and can apply the applicable portions of the ‘Feasibility,’ ‘Requirements,” and ‘Analysis’ phases.
Demonstrates writing and documentation skills.
Understands and can explain to others the core processes involved in their area of support.
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Title: Business Analyst, Product Support
Description:
ABOUT US
Founded in 1995, CI Assante Wealth Management is a wholly owned subsidiary of CI Financial and one of Canada’s largest wealth management firms. Our 750 professional advisors, located in communities throughout the country, oversee approximately $39 billion in assets for more than 300,000 clients. CI Assante Wealth Management's services include investment management, retirement planning, tax planning, insurance and estate planning.
POSITION: Business Analyst I/Analyst I
LOCATION: 15 York, 7th floor
STATUS: Full Time
JOB OVERVIEW
We are currently seeking a Business Analyst I/Analyst I to join our Centre of Business Initiatives team, specializing in the Assante Private Portfolio line of business. Acting as a subject matter expert for the line of business, in this role the successful candidate is responsible for supporting the business needs on system applications and business processes; requirement activities on small enhancements and projects; conducts business analysis with minimal guidance; collecting and organizing data; articulating the Business needs into requirements and deliverables through planning, elicitation, analysis and documentation for changes to Business Areas and Information Technology. A vital component of this role will be at the implementation of the new initiative, the candidate will become the subject matter expert as he/she has played a critical role in the delivery. Our team takes great pride in accomplishing and implementing the business needs with a high degree of excellence.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Work collectively with the various stakeholders to implement initiatives determined by the project sponsor
Conduct business analysis, understand and document business objectives and requirements, perform gap analysis and recommendation on functional design
Play a vital part assisting in identifying project deliverables and developing milestones for project completion
Work with internal and external partners to identify business needs and ensure these needs align to business goals and objectives
Bring a high level of product knowledge and business expertise in order to analyze, identify, evaluate and recommend improvements to business functions and processes
Effectively lead meetings and group discussions with project team members and stakeholders to ensure collaboration on project deliverables
Create extensive test plans that confidently tests functionality being implemented against documented requirements
Verify test output, report critical issues and coordinate with various resources for problem resolution
WHAT YOU WILL BRING
Minimum of 2 years related working experience in the Mutual Funds/Securities Industry
An extensive knowledge of products offered and good working knowledge of business processes, procedures and practices
Knowledge of User Acceptance testing (UAT); ability to create extensive test plans that confidently tests functionality being implemented against documented requirements
Strong analytical capabilities are required along with a strong focus on attention to detail
Solid communication skills including verbal, written and presentation skills
Solid organizational skills, capable of multitasking and the ability to deliver high quality work under pressure
Motivated person with the ability to work independently as well as a contributing member of the team
Excellent business skills, information systems experience and exposure to project management processes an asset
Sound knowledge/understanding of various Private Client systems (Triple A, PC Connect, Compass, PC SmartDox, D1g1t, etc.) will be an asset
WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US
Our dedication to the Employee Experience at CI is aimed at supporting, empowering and inspiring our talented team through:
Recognition & Compensation
Training & Development
Health & Well-being
Communication & Feedback
If you are a passionate, committed and dynamic individual, please submit your resume in confidence by clicking “Apply”.
Only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
CI Financial Corp. and all of our affiliates (“CI”) are committed to fair and accessible employment practices and we are committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodations in order to apply for any job opportunities, or require this posting in an additional format, please contact us at accessible.recruitment@ci.com, or call 416-364-1145 ext. 4747. If you are contacted by CI regarding a job opportunity or testing and require accommodation in any stage of the recruitment process, please use the above contact information. We will work with all applicants to determine appropriate accommodation for individual accessibility needs.
